description:
This is definitely one of my top choices for pizzas in the city! If you enjoy neapolitan pizza then you definitely should come here! I got the Margarita here twice and both were amazing! The dough actually had a flavorful taste to it unlike most pizza spots. The ingredients were fresh and I did not feel guilty eating it! 

I always come in odd hours (3 or 4pm) so I never had to wait.. But I can imagine the lines for when it is busy!
author: Joyce S.

description:
Love the ambiance but the server was v rude and impatient. The rabbit meat is the best, spaghetti was good too

Their bread is phenomenal
author: Marina B.

description:
Dang, why'd it take be so long to get my butt here. What a great meal all around! Came on a Friday night and only waited around 20 minutes (for the pasta side). Our waiter was awesome and really knew his stuff! Great recommendations! 

We got the heirloom tomatoes with burrata (must get!)- it was soo flavorful- probably the best tomatoes I've had in my life, so juicy and delectable. The burrata of course was awesome, I could eat this dish forever! 

The crudo was good but unfortunately, not my fav. I didn't enjoy the avocado cream- I felt it was too overpowering for the dish. 

The pappardelle duck sugo was great! Pasta was very al dente, sauce was not too salty- just enough flavor, not too rich either. We also tried a shrimp pasta with red sauce. Was the chef's special, I thought it was OK, no complaints. Pasta also was al dente. 

For dessert, we tried the lemon ginger panna cotta- good (not too lemony or gingery as I was thinking) and the affogato. Overall everything from service to food to ambiance was great. Will definitely come back to try the spaghetti (best spaghetti west of the Mississippi?? We'll see!)
author: Vivian D.

description:
Eh 
Pizza was only okay 
Service was chilly. During our experience the sever had a completely different interaction with the table of guests next to us who were closer to her age. She even took her time to discuss the details of the menu with them and provide her personal recommendations. Quite interesting to observe.  
Would not come back, not likely to order for delivery.
author: Kim K.

description:
I will definitely come back to give Delfina another try, but after dining at Bestia twice, it's difficult to go any higher than 3 stars for this fine dining, Italian experience. Service was hit or miss last night. While our waitress was friendly and got to us quickly most of the time, there were parts of service that were forgotten, e.g. asking for water multiple times. They also normally source their bread from right next door (Tartine!), but Tartine didn't come through, so they had different bread, which came out cold and a little tough. The wine selection, however, is extensive and very user-friendly; though, I wish they had much lower prices for the rest of their drinks (almost $10 for a Peroni is highway robbery seeing as how Bestia can do Two-Hearted Ale for about $7).

The food itself is very decent, but again, for a restaurant without a Michelin, prices are really high for the portions you're getting. Calamari salad? Smattering of greens on top of a bed of beans and maybe 3 small, grilled squid. The calamari itself was tender, but the flavor was pure salt bath. Out of the hangar steak with fries, porchetta with polenta, and short rib tortelli, the tortelli wins out. Soft little pillows of savory tortelli await you in this primi, while the secondi of steak comes with a bed of soft, limp fries. The steak itself, while perfectly grilled, was bland and not dry-aged. The porchetta was large in portion size, but basically sat on soggy, overly salty lettuce. The polenta is not integrated into this dish and served as a side. The best part of the whole meal was probably the almond torte accompanied by gelato.
author: Danny C.

description:
Delfina is broken up into a pizzeria and a pasta restaurant, so this review is for their pasta side. This restaurant is definitely on the pricier side and the portions are pretty small.

This meal itself was 50/50 for me. I personally really liked their Papparadelle with Pork Sugo, which had a great chewy texture and a really yummy sauce. However, the Veal Casoncelli we also ordered was really salty and the buttery white sauce didn't do much for the dish. 

 Delfina hasn't fulfilled my need for a go-to pasta place in SF, but I would definitely recommend for a solid Italian restaurant.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Solid meal! Started with some Tartine bread and Shishito Peppers. Then shared the Veal Casoncelli & Pappardelle. The Luigi Maffini Fiano "Kratos" Paestum was delicious. My only two observations were that the pastas were a bit too salty, and the portions were very small.

-B
author: Brandon G.

description:
Had a reservation ahead of time for three people. 

Complimentary bread doesn't come with olive oil since it's apparently not traditional in Italy. 

Insalata di Campo was refreshing and light. Loved the long, thin slices of parmigiano. 

The rosemary tagliatelle with Liberty Duck ragu was excellent. Noodles are so el dente and made from scratch! Duck ragu packs a lot of flavor. 

Service here was patient and consistently checked up on us. 

Best tasting pasta I've had in SF!
author: Edward W.

description:
Our server had some knowledge but this restaurant is not offering complementary bread and our waiter didn't tell us. We ended up paying $6,75 + taxes and tip just for 4 small pieces of sourdough bread that is sold in Whole Foods per $1 the whole loaf. 
The food was testing fine. Not bad but not that delicious to be served Gourmet style and size. I did not like my experience in the restaurant at all. A lot of servers trying to run our cards at the same time but when we needed basic things for our dinner, it took us a long time to find someone able to help us. Very very very over priced, as usually in San Francisco. Just rating 3* here because the food quality was ok, but the rest....
Below, I'm attaching pictures of our $92 dinner. We were so hungry after it.
author: Damián A.

description:
Quail was completely under cooked and extremely salty.  I sent back to the kitchen and the second time it came back it was under cooked with blood running out of the meat

We had a gift card and the manager was like "oh the gift card machine is down and there's nothing we can do". Attitude was so bad and it was not our fault that their gift card machine is down 

All meals are very small size
author: XYZ Q.

description: My friend recommended we try this pizzeria. It was lovely the server was attentive and the food was great!
author: Tajha G.

description:
One of the best things about deciding to do a year-long food journey of SF is that I not only get exposed to new restaurants offering innovative dishes but also discover classic restaurants like Delfina. I came here for Memorial Day dinner and was treated to a great dining experience.  The menu can be overwhelming but the server helped me pick out a few great items:

(1).  Parmesan custard and porcini mushrooms (5/5) - really delicious way to start a meal.  This was not listed on the menu since they can only make a few dishes that night but I was one of the first diners for the evening and lucked out. 
(2).  Grilled calamari with white bean salad (5/5) - This item is always in the menu and I can taste why. The char on that grilled calamari was just perfect and really went well with the white beans and olives.  It's nice to have calamari grilled instead of breaded and fried.  It's rustic Italian at its absolute best. 
(3).  Hen and Pancetta Agnolotti (5/5) - fresh pasta perfectly cooked stuffed with ground chicken and pork.  Decadent little bites of heaven that I could eat all day long. 
(4).  Black Cod with saffron aioli and fennel broth (5/5) - perfectly cooked cod with crispy skin with that broth and the aioli.  I almost just drank the broth from the bowl. It's that good. 
(5).  Orange blossom panna cotta with apricots and honey (2/5) - it's good but not the best panna cotta I've had. Also, something was off with the texture (it's a bit softer/runnier than what I expected). 
(6).  Chocolate hazelnuts as small bites to end the meal was really nice and good recovery after that panna cotta.  

They also made a virgin Bellini for me which served as the non-alcoholic pairing for the meal.  Service was good and the restaurant itself is nice but a little outdated.  Including tax and tip, the above meal ended up being $125, which I think is a fair price for the level of food and service. Overall, I think this place is 4.5 stars but I'm rounding down due to the panna cotta.  This is definitely recommended for rustic Italian cuisine with a California twist.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Oh what a place! From the service to the quality of the food, this place is a dream. When we arrived 30 minutes early for our reservation and saw that the place was packed, we decided to stand in the busy bar area and have a drink. The bartender actually came to us with bottles of wine, allowing us to try a few tempting choices before deciding. Even though we were clearly in everyone's way, the staff was gracious.

The food was incredible. We got bread for the table with the most amazing butter I have ever tasted. We also decided on the cheese board, which came with a tasty poached pear and other little noshes.

I ordered the classic spaghetti, which was perfectly al dente, and everyone else absolutely loved their choices of pasta. 

For dessert we tried the poached pear with toasted hazelnuts and an espresso caramel sauce. Incredible! Overall a wonderful experience.
author: Hannah S.

description:
This place offered the perfect atmosphere for a last minute date night dinner in the city. Surprisingly, I was able to find a reservation just a few hours before dinner. Our server was very friendly and took the time to explain her favorite items on the menu to us. 
The wine list wasn't as extensive as I had expected but the homemade pasta itself lived up to my expectations. My husband and I ordered the grilled calamari which came on an earthy bed of warm white beans and a full order of the classic spaghetti marinara to share. I liked the bright lemon flavor of the calamari but could have used a little more salt and basil with the spaghetti. I would return again if I was looking for reliably good Italian food in the Mission district.
author: Marissa E.

description: Nice, but not great. Liked the squid & white beans & burrata was really good--not very generous with the mozzarella, but the tomatoes actually tasted like tomatoes--a vanishingly rare occurrence & something to treasure. Pork belly & sausage just didn't work--little slices of bread in between, too fatty, too salty & ordinary. Double clam pasta didn't seem to have more than the average # of clams. Nice, but not exceptional.
author: Harley M.

description: Yup this is the best pizza I have had in San Francisco. I'll be honest after being here for a year I started to lose hope that california had anything more to offer than weird salad fixings on bready, chewy, overly dry white dough in the pizza domain. Then I came here on Sunday afternoon. Finally, really thin crust, slightly crispy, but soft dough with garlic and delicious normal ingredients like mushrooms and fresh basil and sausage. We sat down outside which was lovely. They gave us free bread sticks like in Italy. They had a pretty decent wine list, which was reasonable quality for the price. Best of all the pizza, we ordered the 4 mushroom, was amazing. I almost never go back to the same place twice. This place is worth it though. And value for it was fantastic. Much cheaper than a lot of the other boujie pizza want to be Italian places in SF. If you want real pizza, come here!
author: Anne S.

description:
As a pasta enthusiast visiting from NYC I was really intrigued to try one of the "best" pasta places in SF. Overall, the experience was great though the spaghetti is a bit overhyped. 

We got two seats at the bar after a 15 min wait and the bartender was excellent and knowledgeable about the menu and wines. We ended up landing on the infamous spaghetti and the duck pasta. 

All in all they were both enjoyable, though not anything I'd recommend as a short list must try while visiting SF. But still a solid meal and experience
author: Pearce D.

description: The spaghetti is Ah-ma-zing!!!! There is so much bite and the sauce is made to perfection. Also highly recommend the steak and fries. We got the steak cooked medium but it was still a bit pink (which I prefer since I like my steak medium rare but my party preferred medium). It was still so so tender. Lastly, we got the chicken which was so moist and delicious. It comes with mashed potatoes which I didn't know could be made so well when not out of a box. :) Service was also really good. Delfina is a staple of SF. I would highly recommend trying and also bringing all visitors to this place. Afterwards, walk over for some bi-rite ice cream, also a local staple!
author: Megan L.

description:
I love all of the pasta here! It's seriously perfectly al dente and always flavored just right. I really don't fully understand how pasta can be so good but ... Delfina always does it well. 

I also particularly enjoy the panna cotta. It's sooooo creamy and the perfect texture (not too hard and not too soft/jiggly). It comes with different garnishes depending on the season. 

They also serve Tartine bread (which isn't a huge surprise, as Tartine bakery is right next door!), and are super kid-friendly. I've seen families eating here and the kids are given some cute coloring activities.

I highly recommend trying Delfina if you haven't been before, and if you like Italian food or pasta you should definitely drop by.
author: Theresa L.

description:
This used to be one of my favorite special destination restaurants, but boy oh boy, have they gone downhill.  There were 4 of us in in our party and we all were disappointed by the food and the inattentive service. 

We started with an order of  the Summer Vegetable Affettati and it was woody and flavorless - a compete dud. The Insalata di Campo was a boring salad- very unmemorable. 

The main meals (we ordered salmon and few pasta dishes) ranged from "mediocre" to "tasty but skimpy." 

Our server never checked-in with us and added nothing to our experience other than to take our orders. 

Overall, a lot of money for an uninspiring evening of dining.
author: Craig G.

description:
Wow...wow. One of my worst restaurant experiences ever. 
I have liked this restaurant very much, as well as Loconda, but this was really disgusting. Have these places been sold?! 

Home very late from work - long day -- and order Delfina from Caviar.
What stated about a 40 minute delivery, turned in to an hour and fifteen minutes. I try to cancel from Caviar and...you can't. 

10:11pm the food arrives. Ok, we laugh, stuff happens and at least the food will be good. It's not. We open two appetizer salads ($14.50 each!)
and they are filled with ROTTING lettuce that is extremely slimy and actually smells rotten. There is no way this could have "gotten by" anyone in a serious kitchen, which I always considered Delfina to be.
The rest of the food is cold and coagulated. The one star is that I hope someone replies to this; I tried calling Caviar, (you can't) emailed Caviar (no response) and called Delfina,  but a message says they don't answer after 10pm.

Caviar and restaurants need to be honest about delivery times and foods available.  If there is a real problem, they need to be reachable and respond. Tomorrow, I will call the credit card company and formally challenge the charge with receipts and pictures.

These pictures of the salad say it all. Disgusting. If they do not post, I have sent them to Caviar. Oh and ... Still no response from them.
author: Richard H.

description: This was one of the Italian best meals we have had. We loved the fresh Tartine bread and olives. Got a half order of pasta as an appetizer (great idea by a restaurant for indecisive guests!) which was plenty cause the sauce was rich...in a good way! We also really enjoyed our entrees, the half chicken and the double clam linguini. On top of everything else, the service was remarkable. We felt very well taken care of the whole night.
author: Rachel B.

description:
Arrived promptly on time for a Monday reservation with a large group of 7 and did have to wait about 15 minutes for our table which was not too bad as they were quite busy.

Nothing was incredible or particularly bad about the service, atmosphere or food.

The spaghetti, greens and brussel sprouts were all fairly bland and uninspired with embarrassingly stingy portions.  The brussel sprouts were particularly bad, under cooked and missing lemon or any real flavor.

The sorbet trio was forgettable except for the mango turmeric which was adventurous yet inedible and overpowered by the turmeric, maybe the mango wasn't ripe yet?

Our waiter was pleasant and pretty on par for SF level of service.

I would have expected a little more at $$$.
author: Ryder M.

description:
I came here for dinner on my birthday after years of having Delfina bookmarked, and it did NOT disappoint! 
Delfina, unlike its sister restaurant Pizzeria Delfina, accepts reservations, and I highly recommend making them - the space is small & was poppin' on a Sunday night. 
What I ordered: Tartine Bread, Cauliflower Soup, Spaghetti, Blood Orange Bellini, & Meyer Lemon Panna Cotta  
Rest of the table: Insalata Di Campo, Dry aged Bistecca alla Fiorentina (porterhouse for two), Roasted Mary's Chicken 

Verdict all-around: AMAZING. Everyone was raving about their orders, seriously every item that came to our table was delicious. The ingredients were fresh, service was great, & it made for an overall awesome experience.
author: Catherine S.

description:
Shout out to the hostess for providing one of the worst restaurant experiences I've ever experienced. Truly astonishing experience. I arrived around 7:40pm on a Monday evening and was told the wait would be 40 minutes. After a 40 minute wait, I went to inquire about the table, and was rudely told by the host that she initially said an hour, as if I were lying. (I even showed her the text message that said 40 minutes) We were finally seated at 9:15pm, an hour and thirty-five minutes later. 

Three words that summarize my experience: 
Discriminatory 
Pretentious
Disrespectful

The waiter was friendly and the food was decently bland.

Definitely wouldn't come back here again... there are many better alternatives in the city, especially if you are willing to wait more than 90 minutes.
author: Alvin S.

description:
Delfina is on many Best of SF lists, so I was expecting more. It's a good place for pasta, but not spectacular. Maybe they never aspired to be more than a decent neighborhood place, but found themselves on all the best-of lists and couldn't live up to it over time. I don't know. 

I do know that the spaghetti was good, as were the four other pasta dishes we tried, solidly good (I'm from a pasta-making family, so maybe a tough judge). The salads were good, nothing special, though. The side of sauteed chard was just fine, I could make much better at home. It was on the bland side. The side of olive oil mashed potatoes was excellent.

The buffalo milk gelato in the affogato was disappointing and I wouldn't get it again. It wasn't at all creamy, and not a great flavor, either. The blueberry almond torte was very nicely done, probably the best out of the desserts we tried.

We were seated right under the speakers in the front of the restaurant, by the windows. The music was so loud it was making me nauseous. If I went back, I'd go out of my way to avoid being seated towards the front.
author: Artemis K.

description: Nicely decorated and clean restaurant in Mission. They have some nice pizzas and great service. I've been there a couple times and had a lovely time with my friends. I've had their spaghetti pasta and it's simple yet tasty. Suggest you to try it if you are a spaghetti fan.
author: Julia J.

description:
Got the first reservation I could for a Saturday night at 530pm.  We were seated very quickly.

Our server gave us the rundown and the recommendations. We ended up ordering the steak and the classic pasta.  The steak was a bit cold but otherwise tasted very tender.  I'm guessing it was finished way before the pasta so they let it sit a while.  The pasta was a classic, this is what they're known for and was a perfect al dente.

I'll try to come back next time I'm in SF!
author: George C.

description: Are you frikking kidding me? $28 for risotto and the to-go tray is barely half full. $18 for spaghetti that's also barely half full. Jesus christ.. 1 star for flavor and for the outrageous (rape up the ass) prices and proportions.
author: Travis T.

description:
Love the spaghetti! You can really taste the noodles in addition to the tomato sauce. Also got the calamari salad, which was also good, but not as satisfying as the spaghetti.

The only thing I didn't like was that the wine is way too expensive and didn't provide more affordable wines. Like they have so many different kinds of wine but you only have like 2 out of 50 options to get a bottle under $50 (and if it is under, it's only a half).

There is the pizza delfina next door and am looking forward to trying it one day!
author: Stephanie K.

description:
I went on a date here yesterday and arrived to the restaurant frazzled. I'm usually right on time or early for dates but was 10-15 minutes late.   Not only was I late but I didn't know what I looked like when I arrived.  I had done my makeup in the car and attempted to do my hair while driving too (I had tried to preheat my curling iron at home and curl my hair in the car but it didn't work and I pretty much arrived with bedhead).  I also dressed once parked (a lady walking her dog noticed I had put my dress on wrong and helped me tie my dress while I put on my shoes).   

My date was an absolute gentleman, texting that he'll be waiting at the bar in response to my "running late" text.  When I arrived, he promptly walked over to the hostess and let her know that we were ready for our reservation who, in turn, swiftly brought us to our table.   The back wall was mirrored so I was able to sneak a peak at myself before sitting down.   Thank you, Delfina.  I needed a quick check or would have been wondering whether I remembered to put eyeliner on both eyes and not just one.   Luckily, both eyes had liner.  

At my request, my date ordered for us and we had a salad, bread and butter, spaghetti, and the rosemary chicken with mashed potatoes.  The salad was a perfect starter and my date mentioned that the restaurant made its own butter and that I should try it.   I normally don't butter my own bread but am always willing to give it a try if a place cultures its own butter.   It was good but my favorite butter is still Lazy Bear's.   The spaghetti was good but a few strands of the pasta was slightly undercooked.   The rosemary chicken was bathed in a rich and flavorful, savory sauce which went well with the delicious mashed potatoes.   Honestly, it was the sauce on the rosemary chicken that really stood out for me and I would have been happy with just the sauce and mashed potatoes, it was so good.  

The service at the restaurant was excellent.   Our waitress was thoughtful, professional, smooth and considerate.   

Both my date and I were full by the time we were served the rosemary chicken so we just halved a piece to sample it.   But, as stated above, I did find the sauce and mashed potatoes that the chicken was served with delicious and ate all the leftovers for lunch the next day.   

My date, still charming, offered dessert but there was just no way I could eat even a bite of that (I was stuffed).  And when I saw the wine menu at about $16 a glass, I refused that as well, asking that we go to a nearby bar (which we did), instead.   

Nice place.  Good food.  Excellent service.   All in all, although my date definitely gets 5 stars, Delfina earns only a 4 star rating from me.
author: Linda H.

description: The pizza here is sooooooooo freaking good! Oh my god that crust is just melt in your mouth. Really really have enjoyed all my visits. It's casual and fun but can get really packed. The Mission has blown up so tons of restaurants can be a bear to get into, but this place is super tasty. When I'm staying in the Mission, this becomes and easy repeat offender.
author: Alicia C.

description:
Not eating their food anytime soon. I ordered 5 large spaghetti and 3 pizza yesterday and whoever took my order at 5:43 p.m was as rude AF. She talked me to like I wasn't speaking English. She was demeaning and was
Talking down at me. Don't forget we have many choices where to eat. I've found their recipe online anyway. Just google Delfina spaghetti pomodoro.
author: Gloria T.

description: I love this place!! I always feel so fancy when I walk in through that door! I highly recommend getting the Seabass! It's sooo good! The cucumber salad is a great way to start as well!!
author: Daisy L.

description:
We went early on a Tuesday evening, which helped our cause--we got there when the restaurant opened, and it was full within about 30 minutes. First off, our server was fantastic. She was really friendly and had great suggestions on wine. She was patient with us when we decided to order a second bottle to serve as dessert, and she didn't rush us out even though it was crowded.

We started off with the bread and succulent butter (if you're going to pay for bread, you may as well get succulent butter with it) and the predictably amazing smothered chard. She had the Wolfe Ranch Quail, which was a larger portion than we've seen for quail at other restaurants. I had the hanger steak and french fries--the steak was just enough to leave me wishing for more.

The prices are not exorbitant, but they're not cheap.
author: Matt C.

description:
My friends and I came here around 6:30pm on a Monday.  There was a 3-hour wait for dining table seating, or immediate seating at the counter.  We decided to sit at the counter knowing it would be difficult to talk to each other.  There were a lot of people here so there was just enough seating for us at the counter. 

The menu was simple and had choices for everybody as far as I can tell.  I was tempted to order the Spaghetti ($11 or $16) because that was the only one where you could choose the size.  Instead, I ordered the Linguine ($22) because that sounded good to me.  The food took a while to come out because they were making the pasta based on what our waitress told us.  She also said the Mint Tagliatelle ($22) was the most popular item on the menu from what she has seen.

The Linguine tasted good to me and the portion was enough for one person.  I was still a little hungry afterwards though.  The other dishes my friends ordered looked good and I would have tried some, but it was already a small portion for each.

The food is good here!
author: Daniel H.

description: Food is extremely delicious, tomato salad is made with organic fresh tomato, homemade pasta is great! Portions are enough, I put 4 stars only because of staff. When u get a check - gratuity is not included, also they charge 5% for employer mandates fee. Also all waiters share their tips, so it's not fair when 1 waiter is trying to be nice and another doesn't care about your table. Our empty plates were on the table half an hour
author: ALina A.

description:
The good and the bad

Good: they take reservations. They were quite nice about us being 10m late. The food was very delicious - fresh, nicely seasoned, original without being completely out there, and nice portions, too. They are a proper restaurant where you can order an actual meal as opposed to "small plates to share". I had the trout with peas - really delicious. The artichoke side dish was very flavorful. My husbands pasta was delicious too - nice flavor from the nettles, not what I expected. 

Bad: the tables. They only have tables of 4. So you come with your date and they seat you with other couple. I'm sorry - no. If I wanted to eat at a cafeteria, I would do that. I'd like to have a conversation with my husband only and not with another couple also listening in. I was not fooled with the inch of space they put between us and the other couple. 

In conclusion, I would come back to enjoy the delicious food, but only with a party of 4.
author: Anne M.

description: Perfection. Came here for my birthday dinner and was not disappointed. The summer menu was effective and delightful. Get dessert.
author: Monica T.

description:
Easily my favorite Italian restaurant in the city.  

Pasta menu changes throughout the year, but you can't go wrong with any dish.  

This past meal, we had the mint tagliatelle, bigoli, and fazzoletti - all were delicious.
author: Christine A.

description:
This was well recommended and on our list for a while. A Sunday night dinner proved to be incredibly disappointing. It appears that the staff perhaps are resting in laurels formed long ago as the entire experience from service to food was below average. Our waiter was really slow to respond from the beginning and also between courses. Very aloof and haughty and prone to long conversations with "regulars" while ignoring other tables. When we sent a dish back he was only mildly apologetic.

We had asparagus, speidini, some straw/hay carbon-whatta pasta, and a sad duck. The asparagus was great and chilled with a delicious cream sauce. From there it just got worse and worse. Apparently anything that needed heating was a challenge. A chicken liver speidini came literally bloody and lukewarm with livers that were practically raw if not tasty. At this point in the meal, having followed the asparagus we just assumed this was how the dish was supposed to be and ate it cautiously... only afterwards we'd figure out that actually serving hot cooked food was an issue for Delfina.

Heating food as well as timing was an issue all night. Long waits between courses just accentuated the fact that our water bottle was empty after the first 15 minutes. A random assortment of staff would come and retrieve clean cutlery and replace plates and then the clock would tick and we just started to make jokes about it because we pretty much knew we were stuck.

By the time our straw/hay carbonara-themed pasta arrived, we were hoping for something amazing to appear and were sadly disappointed. This "highly recommended" meager portion of undercooked (yes we know what al dente pasta is - this was pasty and undercooked) and lukewarm pasta in green and tan arrived with an overly salted sauce that tasted like chicken soup from a packet. The temperature was so gross that after the waiter rather invasively leaned over and tossed the pasta at the table with a raw egg yolk it begged the question which of us was wanting to get salmonella tonight. Seriously gross pasta... course 2 that Delfina apparently didn't know how to cook and serve.

Then came the winner... three rubbery slices of duck breast that were literally red and raw. At first we were trying to figure out whether it was sous vide or not but trying to cut it with the serrated knife they supplied seemed to make that theory unlikely. We literally had to saw through gristle in and between red cold raw meat. In the end we placed all remaining chunks back on the silly sauerkraut they presented it on and gave up.

Again loud and punchy waiter showed back up with a cursory apology and again missing our lack of water, retrieved the duck. We ordered dessert to feel like we hadn't wasted our time but even the credibly made panna cotta couldn't fix it. And after all panna cotta is chilled so apparently that is what they are good at - cold uncooked food.

Delfina was recommended to me over four years ago as the best in the neighborhood. Perhaps it was my fault to wait so long to go... I had pizza at their counter next door before and it was wonderful... maybe I just thought it would always be there and always be good. Apparently something has gone wrong since I was first told to indulge there. There are many great places to eat in SF. Given my experience, I can't say this is one of them.
author: Michael P.

description:
I had dinner at Delfina last night and the whole experience was stellar: the food, the service, the restaurant.

I am happy to report I was at a table for six which meant I got to taste many different things - you know, for research. 

My favorites: the little gem salad, risi e bisi, the snapper and the granita. 

They also brought us at the end perfect, warm, crunchy chocolate covered hazelnuts. 

I would recommend Delfina without hesitation.
author: D Z.

description:
It can all be said in one delicious word SPAGHETTI!
We'll, maybe two - WINE. You can't go wrong with the duo of  wine and spaghetti! Don't forget to order Tartine bread to go with the glorious pasta.If you must deviate from plan A, the chicken is delightful. 
We've had the pleasure of eating there several times and it's always been outstanding. Not a fan of the gnocchi, but the rest makes up for it.
The desserts and french press coffee are also spot on.
author: JibJib N.

description: Problems with the food aside, the real problem is the lazy, combative and entitled attitude of the staff.   If you want to be spoken down to and jerked when you're trying to put on a celebration for your elderly mother, this is the place.
author: User N.

description:
I wanted to give this a higher grade.  I really did.  The space is nice and the reputation is impeccable.  However, our dinner here recently on a Friday night was good, but nothing really spectacular - the kind of dish that makes you want to rush back.  
We had 
- Shrimp and okra appetizer
- Two pastas
- Roasted chicken

The best of the bunch was the roasted chicken which was served in a large rimmed bowl with herbed jus/broth at the bottom to provide some extra flavor and moistness.  It was excellent.

Overall we had a nice dinner.  But we all agreed that we were not "wowed".
author: Lewis C.

description: Food was ok, service was terrible, must have been an off night, because before moving here i heard great things
author: Conor L.

description:
I adore the Delfina Pizzeria (next door) but felt that Delfina itself was just ok. My biggest gripe was the price. Dinner for two cost me over $90 with a tip! That just seems insane for food that was just good, but not mindblowing. In San Francisco, you can do better for your money (for example, their sister restaurant, the pizzeria next door).

We ordered:
- Bread and butter: Just normal bread and butter, nothing crazy.
- Risotto: Delicious. Served with wild boar (I think??). Most of the flavor seemed to come from the wild boar. This was the best thing we tried.
- Fava bean bucatini: Just ok. I guess I should have known better than to expect bean pasta to blow my pants off. But here we are.

My overall feeling: "mehhh." I likely won't go back, due to the price tag.
author: Fiona F.

description: I wish I could give 10 stars. This place was awesome from the service to the food. Even the simple starter salad was amazing. We did not have reservations since it was booked all night until late but we walked in and were sat immediately at the bar area. Great service, we even took the pasta to go and ate it the next day.
author: Elaine P.

description: I really, really wanted to like Delfina, I really did, but it was so difficult for me... My fiancé and I came to visit SF to celebrate his birthday and since I love Italian food, and specifically pasta, I found Delfina and made a reservation for a nice dinner. The space itself was very cute, like most places in SF, it was tiny, so you are VERY close to other tables, but that is just a product of being in the city. But you know its not good when the best part of the food was the cheese plate. Its not that the food was bad... I just didn't think it was all that great. And when you are paying top dollar for good pasta, you want the food to be something you cant make for yourself at home. I got the spaghetti with tomato sauce, and while the pasta itself was really good quality, the tomato sauce tasted like it had been poured from a jar. The duck ragu was the same way...It was just average. And really the folks sitting around us were so freaking pretentious! You know you SF has gotten bad cause the table next to us was two guys at a startup trying pitching a super wealthy couple for money. It was like listening in on a really, really bad date! I think I would have forgiven the pretentiousness if the food had been good, but it just felt very basic.
author: Karen G.

description:
Service was above average, spaghetti was very ordinary, didn't get the hype. I would skip it and ask for something with duck or ragu in it.

The duck sogu pappardelle was amaaaaazing! They are known for their chicken and it was pretty good. Panna cotta cream was great, the extra honey and fruit on the side was not necessary. 

Didn't like the mandatory extra 5% on the check (to support some workers group) without asking for my permission. Decided not to make a fuss about it, but minus 1 star for that.
author: Charlie Y.

description:
They really know how to use salt here.   Just the right amount.

The shishito peppers and warmed olives were delightful.  The octopus was prepared perfectly!  My companions liked the calamari more, but trust me, the octopus was the winner - it's hard to cook octopus right but they nailed it.

I had the sea bass which was the perfect entree for me.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
We enjoyed both the food and service at this upbeat, contemporary-styled Italian restaurant in the Mission District of San Francisco.
The bread from local Tartine bakery was crusty, soft and fragrant.  The butter, house-crafted, made the bread sing.
We loved the tender, juicy, perfectly cooked, medium-rare steak & herbed fries.
Our waitress was happy, knowledgeable, and on top of serving.
I would suggest this restaurant.  Reservations are necessary.
author: Dawn G.

description: Service was outstanding and our dinner was even better. Our server was attentive and recommended the spaghetti, which did not disappoint. I highly recommend ordering the squash as a side dish. Five stars for sure!
author: Phillip M.

description:
Loved it!

I made a reservation about four days in advance for this place for a Tuesday night (7:30 pm), and I'm so glad I did because who knows how long I'd be waiting otherwise! We arrived a little early for our reservation but were still seated within five minutes. Would definitely recommend this place for a nice dinner. Lovely service, lovely food. 

The menu changes often, as I've noticed that some of the menu items previously posted were not available when I was there. The two smaller items I will recommend are the gnocco fritto (like three pillows for your tastebuds, truly) and the olive oil mashed potatoes (from a former olive oil skeptic). They were so pleasant that I'd definitely go back and re-order them.

As for my entree, I had the tagliatelle nero with Mediterranean seppia and Mendocino uni. It was so delightful that I, again, would re-order this if I was to go back to the restaurant. 

Really, everything was wonderful here.
author: Jessica P.

description: I had high expectations for the spaghetti and can confidently say it well-exceeded them. A case in point of a simple dish with great ingredients that is executed well. Words are indescribable for this dish. A must order.
author: Brendan Edwin C.

description: We are regulars here, the consistency of the chewy pizzas and the excellent quality of ingredients does not disappoint me. We always order margarita + prosciutto pizza and the ever so famous Napoleon meatballs.
author: Lovetea C.

description:
Delfina is always at the top of mind whenever anyone asks me for a restaurant recommendation in SF. Good food, great vibe, and reasonably priced to boot!

One of the best pasta dishes I've ever had in my life was here in Delfina. Pappardelle with duck... Mmmm... On my recent trip to Italy, I also ordered a pappardelle with duck dish and I've got to say, Delfina does Italy justice!

As much as I love the pasta here, the true standout dish for me here that I recommend to everyone is the salad. Yes, I said it and I will say it again. The Insalata di Campo (field greens, pancetta, walnuts, parmigiano, balsamic) at Delfina is the BEST salad I have ever had. I highly recommend ordering one (or two!) for the table to share.

Honestly, almost everything I've had at Delfina was amazing. The best panna cotta I've ever had was also here at Delfina. I still remember that honey panna cotta... Yumm... From start to finish, Delfina knocks it out of the park. I always regret not coming here more.
author: Charles L.

description: We had a reservation at 6 PM but got there at 5:30 PM when they opened and were seated right away. Service was great. Spaghetti was a little salty, however, the pasta was cooked al dente which was perfect. This place gets busy very quickly, so I recommend reservations or arriving early enough to stand in line and wait.
author: Kat N.

description:
Seated at the bar with no wait on a busy evening, down-to-earth, non-pretentious, and knowledgeable staff, and delicious food to round it out. Wonderful date spot for gourmet without extravagant prices. 

Gnocchi al Ragu : light and fluffy Gnocchi, which was surprising for a potato pasta. The sauce was strong and meaty which paired with how light the pasta is well. 

Pork Arista : breathtaking. I was floored by how bouncy and juicy the meat was! Came with pickled watermelon rind which was really sweet and tart.
author: David X.

description: The food and service at Delfina is superb. The staff is very knowledgeable and helpful with selections for wine and food. The gnocchi melts in your mouth. I would love to visit their pizzeria next door the next time I'm in the area.
author: Jen K.

description: Visited SF in November. My friends took me here since he heard good things. Now I eat A LOT of pasta... Delfina blew my mind with their pasta with mussels. Best mussels I have ever had. My friend had a pasta special at the time which was exceptional. I'll be sure to make a visit back once I come back.
author: Paulina K.

description: The hen and pancetta agnolotti was out of this world - just the right amount of firmness to the pasta and a delicious, savory stuffing. The service was great, young but knowledgeable servers who are quick to drop by if you need anything. The place was pretty packed for a Monday night. Didn't love their desserts though.
author: Joanna L.

description:
Love the pizzeria, but was blown away by Delfina! Quickly became one of my SF Italiano favorites, and they do have alot of great competition here.

First of all, the anchovy appetizer is out of this world. If you love ceviche, you will love this.

THE PASTA , ESPECIALLY THE SPAGHETTI, IS SO GOOD.

SPAGHETTI IS PERFECTLY COOKED, A LITTLE TANGY, FRESH, SAVORY, SALTY, SO GOOD.

Papardelle is also SO DELICIOUS.

Everyone raves about the chicken, but I am very happy with just pasta,

MUST END DINNER WITH THE CHEESE PLATE. SO GOOD. CHEESE.
author: Kimia M.

description: Lovely every time! Friendly, knowledgeable service with no pretense. I've never had a bad meal here and I've been coming off and on for over 10 years. Excellent spot to take out-of-towners, visiting relatives or even a date night.
author: Nina N.

description: Outstanding just as I remember! Delfina has survived the test of time in the ever-evolving SF foodie culture. We had an excellent meal here last night--our server was incredibly knowledgeable and all three courses were superb. We'll definitely be back the next time we visit!
author: Olivia D.

description:
Every time I go here, I am surprised and impressed with the employees and the food.  

Great selection of wine. You need help picking one? The chatty servers are always happy to listen to my uninformed description of what I like in a wine and then recommend one. The steak melts in your mouth. The gnocchi are soft pillows of flavor swimming in a savory sauce. 

I want to clarify one thing. When I say chatty, I don't mean that in a bad way. When I go to a restaurant, I like engaging employees. I like to ask questions. I mean they should know the offerings better than anyone. Right? Every time I go here, I find the employees love to answer questions, make recommendations. But I also watch and they are just as comfortable offering a less conversational experience to others at different tables. In other words, they easily shift gears and provide the type of experience the customer wants. This should be easy for someone who loves their job and enjoys working with people. And they get it right every time!

I have never been here and had anything but a great meal. It is worth every penny the price for a casual but exceptional dining experience.
author: Russell J.

description: This place doesn't live up to the hype. They charge for bread which really bugs me for an Italian restaurant. The roasted Mary's chicken is really delicious and comes with creamy mashed potatoes but this place isn't worth the price or the hype. So in the end, it's just "ok".
author: Nasrin M.

description:
Finally came here! A date night :3
Delfina was packed as always, but we got reservation, yay! The seating was also a bit packed where you can spy on your neighbor's food; noise level pretty high, but not too bad to the point that you can't talk. 

Tartine Bread | Straus butter: We ordered this after we spied our neighboring diners! Good decision! (/pat myself on the back). I've had Tartine bread several times, so I'll just said the butter was delicious!

Grilled Monterey Bay Calamari | warm white bean salad: Pretty good.

Squid ink Corzetti with Octopus: First time having and hearing corzetti. Pretty interesting! Unfortunately I don't like olives and it had some flavors of olives.

Roasted Mary's Chicken with Olive Oil Mashed Potatoes: The potatoes was heavenly.

Overall pretty delicious meal, the portion is on the smaller size, so I can see why everyone ordered the bread!
author: Ya K.

description: I was dining out here.  Had to use the rest room and was in line behind another customer.  The white waiter nearby saw me and told me: "I'm sorry, but the restroom is for customers only!"  Of course, he totally did not say it to the white dude before me and decide to instead racially profile me because of my skin color.  Totally ruined the dinner experience.
author: Jack Z.

description:
Food was okay, we came as a family party of 6 for a birthday, ordered wine, appetizers, entrees, coffee, several desserts upon their recommendation and then they promptly asked us to leave upon completing our dessert so they could flip the table for another reservation.
Granted, they offered to buy us a drink at the bar, but really? You couldn't have waited 5 minutes for us to leave on our own accord?
Meanwhile the table for 6 behind us was already on their way out just 30 seconds before we were asked to leave.
It was rude and I wouldn't go back or suggest it for parties of more than 2 this reason.
author: Mrs C.

description:
Oh Delfina - How I adore you! 
Hands down best Italian in SF. There, I said it. No going back, no regrets. The ingredients, fresh. The staff, on point. The bread, Tartine. The flavors, rich lushness. The atmosphere, romantic. The wine pairings, perfect. The affogato, electric. My go to is the calamari, fresh and unexpected. I save all my most beautiful celebrations for Delfina :)
author: Jenny C.

description: Calamari tasted burned and portion size was tiny.  Artichoke hearts were little grease bombs.  Pasta arrived cold.  Hanger steak was mostly grizzle and was incredibly over salted, as were the fries.  The wait time between courses was way too long especially for sub-par food.  We were stuck in a dingy corner despite having reservations and not a busy night (we didn't ask to move though).  The waitress was great.
author: Robb K.

description:
This is the delicious, simple and fresh Italian/New American SF restaurant you have been looking for. Great for dates or with close friends when you want to have a fantastic meal with great service and not feel rushed. We have been a couple times and get the Tartine bread appetizer (delish sourdough), Brussels sprouts (lightly seasoned with garum which adds a very distinct umami flavor that is lightened by pine nuts; garum is basically fish sauce for anyone who is familiar with southeast asian cuisine), spaghetti (so simple but soo good), and the roasted chicken and mashed potato dish. We also got the lamb dish this time which was seasoned very well - most flavorful dish we ordered. They will separately plate the pasta dishes for you if you tell them you are splitting. Timing and service are impeccable! 

I will say if you are coming with a group larger than 4...it will be very tight. We were sitting next to a table of 6 who seemed like they were having a business meal and they looked squished. But seating is great for groups of 2-4!

Corkage fee $25. 

One of our favorite dinner spots in SF when we are entertaining guests from out of town. Then head down the street for delicious ice cream at Bi-Rite Creamery!!
author: Mai N.

description: So I ordered a margherita and got a cheese pizza with 3 basils. Not even 3 whole basils but one basil chopped up into 3 pieces. How is this acceptable?
author: Jeannine T.

description:
Since my first visit to Delfina, I've eaten here at least half a dozen more times. Each time is better than the last, and now it has become one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I feel like I've now tried everything on the menu and it all blows me away. The service here is incredible and makes Delfina such a classy experience. I would still recommend making a reservation if possible, since it gets incredibly busy. While you're waiting, you can have a drink at the bar.

Some of my favorite dishes are the Anchovies Nostrano, Spaghetti, and Bistecca. The Bistecca is so freaking delicious, but the menu rarely has it. I've only come here with groups of 5 or 6 to share the food family style, and now I'm convinced that's the best way to dine at Delfina. The waiters and waitresses also give great recommendations for wine pairings. I've always been too full for dessert here, but that will be a goal of mine next time. Thank you Delfina for such a memorable experience with each visit, and I'll definitely be recommending this to more friends in the future!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Pros: I liked the cheese on the prosciutto pizza. 

Cons: tiny table outside NOT built for four adults, heat lamp was way too hot and scorched our foreheads, breadsticks are dry and gross (why even give them?). White waiter in black beanie was super rude, he actually yelled at us "Work with me people!" because we had to make space on the tiny table to fit the second pizza and then he quite literally threw the pizza down overlapping the other pizza and walked away. That was some of the rudest service I've ever had, and I didn't see him treating the table next to us that way. Was it because we were a party of four Asians? I don't know but he should be fired. The food was mediocre, pizza was crispy but burnt enough I had to pull off charred parts (I can handle some char but not to that degree). The prosciutto pizza was pretty good but not something worth $18 to me, and the margherita pizza barely had any basil, it was a sad pizza way overpriced for the quality. Needless to say, I will never come back.
author: Ace C.

description:
Delfina's is a special place.  Everything I've ever tried has been delicious!   it's pricy and one can't always get a spot but otherwise simply yummy!  
I've never ordered anything I wasn't willing to eat the last crumb of.  The menu changes since dishes are offered based on what the chef picked up at the farmers market that week.  The pane cotta I had here for the very first time in my life and fell in love with it.
author: Mariaté G.

description:
***BREAD*** as delicious as it is... BE WARN- you pay for it $4 per serving so if you ask for seconds know you will charged another $4. They ask if you would like bread and most restaurants it's a free perk so, never thought to ask if there was a charge. Learning lesson but, They should at least let customers know there is a charge for it, if they are offering it. 

Food... very tasty, friends dish was a bit salty but over all everything we ordered was good.

Service.... I wish I got the fellows name- he was very nice, informative, joked with us and was tentative. Gave him extra tip for his kindness and professionalism
author: Connie L.

description:
Great service, great food, great ambience, and great wine. On the pricier side, definitely, but well worth it. Mary's roasted chicken and the carbonara
We're delicious! Also ordered the gnocchi and that was very filling too. Overall, yummmmmy goodness! Would love to come back!
author: Ue Y.

description:
Disappointing would be a euphemism for this establishment. 
Arrived on a Monday evening and was told that there would be a 30 minute wait which was fine. After the 30 minutes, I asked about the table, and the waiter called us liars and that she told us from the beginning that it would be an hour. Okay, fine... after the hour we came back and was told that we had to wait longer. We were finally seated after a 90 minute wait. Not only was this a totally disappointing experience, it was a discriminatory one. As we waited outside, over a dozen parties were seated before us. 
Very sad excuse for a business.  The food was expensive and horrible. I don't have enough bad things to say about this place. 

Come at your own risk.
author: Jacky C.

description:
Meh. That's the feeling both my friend and I had after finishing dinner. It's not bad, but we weren't wow-ed by it either. In this price range, there are many places where the food is worth going back for. Delfina isn't one of them. Their sister restaurant, Locanda, is. 

Service was excellent and the wine list was good. So, 3 stars.
author: Paawan K.

description:
I chose this place for my birthday dinner because I thought if pizzeria Delfina is that good, I'm sure Delfina will be at the same level, but unfortunately that was not the case. The restaurant is nice and service is impeccable, but I was just a tad bit disappointed by the food. I was able to make a reservation pretty easily a few weeks in advance. 

Funny enough, the best thing I had here was the butter that came with the tartine bread we ordered. I think the waiter said it was made from buffalo milk. Whatever it's made of, it's literally the best butter I have ever had!!! It's so creamy and the flavor is amazing. It was so good that we asked the waiter if we could take some of it home. Of course the tartine bread was also amazing. 

Monterey calamari: this appetizer was good, but I felt like it lacked something. I think the sauce could've been better. The calamari tasted fresh though.

Spaghetti: this was a simple classic dish. Good, but not amazing.

Bolognese: this was probably my favorite dish I had that night. Pasta was cooked perfectly and sauce was delicious.

Quail: tasted too salty for my liking. It was nice that they split it onto 2 plates for us though.

We passed on dessert since the food didn't impress us. I probably won't be coming back since I can get better Italian food at Flour+Water. I'll still be coming to Pizzeria Delfina next door though!
author: Mai Y.

description: I was hoping for better but the food was average and the pasta was not as fresh as I have tried at some of the other Italian restaurants around the city. I'm not sure I would come back here again as I was not impressed with the food, but I was happy with the service I received.
author: Rishika S.

description:
Wonderful place to eat. The food is really good and large portions. The chicken is incredible. 
Beef short ribs were as tender as pate'.
If I lived in the bay area, this would be my favorite.  We will try to visit next time we are in SF.
You need to give 1 hr notice for the chicken, so order on the way. Im looking forward to enjoying everything on the menu.
author: steve b.

description: Came here with reservations for a party of 3 on a Wednesday night at 5:30pm. We got seated right when we arrived and ordered our drinks of two Sorelle Bronca Particella 68 Prosecco by the glass and a Blood Orange Pellegrino. The Prosecco was light, which paired well with my heavy Dungeness crab risotto - which was bomb! I cleared it up quick and thoroughly. It was rich in crab flavor with lots of crab bits. Though i bit into a lot of crab shells, the flavor was all there. We also started with the pork rinds, which have a strong spice flavor and a kick of spicy to it - i recommend trying because it was super tasty. The other two appetizers we ordered: tartine bread (bomb as always with the butter) and Gnocco Frito, which looked like a ravioli pasta cooked crispy with a cheese-topping. Also tasty and worth trying, but it only came with 3 pieces. My friend had the Roasted Mary's Chicken, which was juicy with a beautifully tasty crisp for its thin skin. It came with a side of mash, which was also very yummy. For desserts we had the coconut panna cotta and the cantucci - the coconut panna cotta was delicious and i highly recommend ordering as a dessert. Strong coconut addictive flavor panna cotta and the sweet oranges and citrus balanced well with it. This dish came with a candle to celebrate my birthday which was sweet. We also had the Cantucci, which was super duper hard to bite into. It is tasty when you're able to break it down, but probably best with coffee because it can probably break teeth trying to eat it. Overall, $200 for 3 people, which is ok. Every part of the meal had a great option in each category: appetizer, entree and dessert. Solid spot!
author: Amanda C.

description: Soooooo I really really wanted to love this place. The grilled squid salad was bright, smoky, with nice flavors and halibut crudo was fresh, nicely balanced with the avocado and the acid but the duck oh the duck. I was hoping from the other reviews that it was a fluke or they didn't know what they were talking about. Unfortunately, it came without crispy skin, raw not rare in the middle, so there was no delicious melding of flavors and the sauerkraut was so overpowering I could have been eating a Costco dog for goodness sakes! I was so sad because I love duck and was looking forward to it.  The gnocchi was also a disappointment as they weren't soft and pillowy and more chewy. The Sugo accompaniment was delicious.  Also I am a salt lover but even I found it on the heavy handed side and can see how it could be too much for others. All in all just ok.
author: Alittle G.

description:
Deflina Restaurant is (IMO) so much better than Deflina Pizzeria! Order the hay and straw, skip the regular spaghetti.

- Tartine bread (5 stars): A must order. Ask for the thicker crust bread only. The baguette is good but not as good. 
- Spaghetti (2 stars): Famous item that remains on their menu 24/7. Too sour for me.
- Hay and Straw (4.5 stars): My favorite pasta of the night: mixed yellow and green spaghetti noodles, perfect texture and a raw yolk mixed in like carbonara. So rich and delicious with the perfect amount of chewiness. 
- Steak and fries (4.5 stars): Sounded kinda boring but it was so delicious and tender! The fries were also good - very flavorful, mixed with generous amounts of rosemary, crunchy on the outside and a bit soft on the inside (just the way I like it).  
- Budino (4 stars): Good but I have had better. It's like a wide flat flourless chocolate cake. Very decadent and topped with ice dream and raspberry purée.
author: Jess C.

description: Is this restaurant writing its own reviews? I am giving 2 stars, one for the service and one for the bread. The service was irreproachable and the bread was fresh and tasty. The food and wine however, were disappointing and overpriced. I had Tripe alla Fiorentina, and it was  bland and boring. My partner's spaghetti sauce was too acidulous. The wine was very disappointing as well. All in all not a good place if you know the Italian cuisine.
author: G. Nourdine B.

description:
Delfina is located off of Guerrero Street by Tartine in the Mission district. This is the only Delfina location- the other locations focus on pizza.

The first time I visited Delfina was a few years ago. My friend introduced me to their spaghetti and I loved it. The spaghetti is prepared al dente and paired with the most perfect tomato sauce. The sauce has ripe plum tomatoes, a touch of garlic, and pepperoncini for a nice kick. The server also comes by to add cheese on the pasta. This is hands down my favorite dish at Delfina and the dish that keeps me coming back. I have tried the gnocchi as well, but I also find myself gravitating towards the spaghetti. 

I also tried the Grilled Monterey Bay Calamari that comes on a bed of white bean salad. The calamari pieces were nothing special, but I was surprised by the white bean salad. Although it is simple, the white beans are extremely fresh and the combination of olive oil and other sauces made is really delicious!

They also serve Tartine bread here, but I prefer to buy my Country Loaf fresh at Tartine. 

Love that they incorporate local produce into their menu. Great atmosphere, but be prepared to wait a little.
author: Lydia H.

description: I had the whole fresh grilled striped bass with preserved lemons and the most incredible roasted creamer potatoes.  We also had the fresh Tartine bread that is the most fabulous bread I've ever tasted.  My favorite whole fish dish prior to this was at Babbo (Mario Batale) in NYC.  This fish was better!!!  A totally memorable meal... I'll be back asap.
author: Toby T.

description:
Delfina is an SF classic, and a very dependable option for high quality Italian food. I've always heard about disastrously long waits here - particularly on weekends. However I was able to snag an 8:30 pm reservation for Tuesday evening (albeit it being quite rainy for SF) a couple hours before. The restaurant wasn't very crowded when we arrived -- which made it all the more strange that we were seated almost next to the door, and adjacent to a table of 4. When most of the restaurant is empty, it doesn't seem to make a lot of sense to cluster all of the diners right near the entrance. Just my two cents, although it certainly wasn't a big enough deal to complain about.

We thoroughly enjoyed our meal at Delfina, and will certainly be back. We ordered the Tartine bread + house-cultured butter di bufala (SO creamy and just enough sweetness to perfectly complement the sourdough bread) to start, and the spaghetti and Roasted Mary's Organic Chicken to share. The chicken was extremely flavorful and juicy, and came with trumpet mushrooms and excellent olive oil mashed potatoes. Portion sizing was perfect. 

Check out Bi Rite ice cream across the street after dinner for dessert!
author: Quyen V.

description:
My partner and I were going to be customers, but the rude hostess (wearing a blue shirt) deterred us away on Saturday 6/24 at around 5pm during the Pride festival. We were looking for a place to dine at with a restroom. We wanted to make sure that the place we would give business to would provide access to a restroom and we all know how important that is in that area! 

I politely asked her, "If we were paying customers, can we use your restroom." She RUDELY told us to go use the porta potty on the corner. I was confused why she was so rude, so I clarified for her, "If we dined in here, is there a restroom here we can use?" She became more RUDE and said, "There's a porta potty on the corner! Go use it! We can't have people coming in here and clogging up our toilets!" I was so appalled! I asked nicely and was just looking for a restaurant to eat at with a restroom! 

Then my partner said, "I guess we're not eating here!" Then the rude hostess suddenly gained clarity and asked us if we wanted to eat pizza then use their restroom. NO THANKS! 

This could have been miscommunication or she was pissed from people trying to use their restroom without buying anything? I don't know, but she definitely could have handled herself better and more professionally. I usually don't write negative reviews because I empathize with hospitality employees (I know you deal with a lot of crap but my partner and I did not deserve that type of unkindness and disrespect esp during Pride!) I am very upset and will never eat or have my family, friends and colleagues eat there!

Advice to management, please train your staff to have better customer service even for potential customers.
author: Wendy S.

description: Delicious pastas here. Also loved the little pork puffs appetizer (was like a pork ritz cracker). Serving sizes are all perfect for sharing, loved all the pastas obviously. The calamari was good but I wished it was a larger serving size.
author: Jon H.

description:
A few of my favorite places in this part of the Mission are super close to Delfina, so we've passed by Delfina many times to and from such places.  Last time we were at Tartine, I told my husband that we really should try Delfina soon.  We finally did, and Delfina proved to be a good choice!

We were celebrating the end of the first semester at work, so I thought why not some bubbles to start off our meal! I was very happy to see a Blood Orange Bellini on the menu.  I love blood oranges, and they're in season right now.  The Bellini was a beautiful color and the flavor, even better.  If they have it when you dine, get it!  The hubby decided on a glass of Chianti which really opened up and got better the longer it sat on our table. 

We started with the Monterey Bay Calamari appetizer. The calamari was grilled and rested on a bed of a white bean salad which had frisée, arugula and olives mixed in it. The creaminess of the beans balanced out the bitterness of the frisée, the pepperiness of the arugula and the saltiness of the olives.  And of course the star of the dish was the calamari, which was perfectly cooked.  It had a hint of sweetness and just melted in your mouth.  Too bad there were only about 5 or 6 pieces of calamari on it!

If you have not had Tartine's famous country loaf, you can get an order of their bread here to start the meal. We saw Tartine staff deliver freshly-baked loaves to Delfina as we were waiting outside for the restaurant to open. The only reason why we didn't order the bread was because we actually bought a loaf and started eating it before dining at Delfina. As a result, we were not that hungry when we started eating!

For our mains, the hubby ordered the Spaghetti.  It was good, and it would be a great choice for a vegetarian.  I ordered the Grilled Swordfish which also came on a bed of beans. We ate a lot of swordfish when were in Greece, and it has become one of my favorites.  Like the calamari, the swordfish was perfectly cooked.  The gremolata and the peppered fennel wedges added a boost of flavor to the fish and beans.  The dish was a nice portion, so I was perfectly full after the main course.

Consequently, we declined to have dessert here. Plus, Bi-Rite Creamery was only a few steps away.  I just really needed a small scoop of ice cream to end the evening.

Service was great throughout the meal. The place is beautiful, but a little cramped.  Our table for two was next to a table for two, and we can hear everything they were talking about.  Kinda awkward.  2 drinks, 1 app and 2 mains added to about $95 without tip. If I come back here, I'd eat at the bar.
author: Hazel C.

description:
WONDERFUL - A MUST - went in Saturday nights guy for the first time - food was delicious.

Service was amazing - we had the most kind  wonderful server - tall built shaved head with beard and tats on his forearms - he really made our night - such a wonderful soul 

We will def be going back again soon
author: Phillip S.

description:
This is the 2nd time I've been to Delfina! I remember having no expectations the first time I was there and being very pleasantly surprised. My experience this time was just as great, and the food was delicious.

The two of us split a few things, but we had a little too much food. We added on the soup at the last minute as the waiter got to our table, and that was probably overkill.

1) Gnocco fritto & black truffle mortadella - I thought this would be similar to gnocci (I know.. probably not valid to assume that just because gnocco is one letter off, but I did), and was completely caught off guard when the dish actually came. The gnocco fritto are actually large and airy squares of dough that are completely empty on the inside (think empty, fried ravioli shell)! The gnocco is salty already, providing more flavor, so it isn't just mortadella on dough.

2) Brussels sprouts - I love brussels sprouts, and these were fantastic. The caramelized glaze was slightly sweet, and the brussels sprouts themselves were roasted to just the right level so that the outer leaves were browned but not burnt. Still undecided how I feel about the hazelnuts in this appetizer, but they weren't bad.

3) Chicken liver rustica - Mediocre. The chicken liver pate comes spread on pieces of toast already. The sometimes fishy taste of liver that turns people away was not overwhelming, but none of the other flavors in the pate were very strong either.

4) Celery root soup - Creamy and celery-y.

5) Dry-aged Liberty duck - With pomegranate and turnips, the duck was delicious!! It was cooked a little more than medium rare and so tender. I just wish they had plated it with just a touch more sauce though.

I also had a glass of montepulciano with my meal. No complaints there. And sidenote, their glass pours are actually pretty generous!
author: Tiffany P.

description: The Mary's chicken was too dry, the pasta was milky with too much oil. The service was not as good as before. Don't recommend people to come.
author: Shunyi Y.

description:
omgosh. it's been a few years since i've been to delfina, and i had the opportunity to dine here this past saturday to celebrate a friend's birthday, and this place is delicious! not sure why it took me so long to come back.. i distinctly remember having a great meal the first time at the bar when we dropped in for snacks and pastas - that tripe dish is so flavorful and comforting!

made a reservation for 6:30 for 2 a few weeks before, so i had been diligently studying the menu. the wine list is pretty limited, so i brought my own bottle of cab franc for the $25 corkage. started with an apertif with vemouth - quite light n refreshing and i enjoyed that. we ordered the following: octopus, spaghetti, squid ink pasta with uni, braised leg of lamb, and smothered chard with lemon. everything was delicious and so beautifully plated. i usually think octopus is good but can be lackluster, this one had great accompaniments and was tender and flavorful. the spaghetti has been on the menu for 15-20 years, and it is just WONDERFUL. i was so surprised, because im not a fan of simple items but rather gravitate to the (sometimes overly) complex, but boy, i think this is a contender for the spaghetti at scarpetta.  both pastas were perfectly al dente and the sauces coated the noodles just the right amount. that warm chewiness is hard to forget - ive been thinking about these for a solid 48 hours now and after other delicious meals this weekend.. the lamb was my least favorite dish of the night, but even so, it had good flavors and was presented beautifully. 

service was attentive and very comfortable.  homey but upscale. 

the restaurant was hopping when we started our meal as well as when it ended 2 hours later. the pizzeria next door was also hopping! overall, awesome experience. i would come back to try the other dishes (maybe no more mains) or just sit at the bar for that spaghetti!

$180 including tax n tip for the aforementioned items, including corkage. well worth it!
author: Christina L.

description: Delfina has some of the best tasting dishes in this area and I will be there any time for some great tasting food. This place reminds me of the Cheesecake Factory, the menu is huge and the food tastes authentic no matter what entree you order. You can never go wrong here with any of the wide variety of dishes and an excellent service that accompanies it. I usually get the classic spaghetti, sometimes the grilled calamari and the poached pear for dessert (whenever I am in a mood for dessert). They had lots of great food gems here to explore and your taste buds will always be left satisfied. Service could always be better during their peak hours but I figure most places go crazy sometimes. I come to Delfina for the food and I am sure that I will always be a happy customer.
author: Adam M.

description:
There was apparently a computer glitch that allowed us to make a reservation only 15 minutes ahead of time. Nonetheless, they still seated us as promised, so we definitely got lucky here as the regular wait time on a weekend is probably around 30 minutes.

It's a solid Italian restaurant in the mission. Good food, reasonably priced, and a nice intimate setting. The bar area is a bit rowdy, I'd recommend getting a table in the main dining area if possible. I enjoyed their appetizers (Tartine bread and Gnocchi) and pasta dishes (Gnocchi al Ragu & Prosciutto Agnolotti. All of which were good, but I guess there wasn't anything beyond "pretty decent".

If I'm in the area next time, I'd probably come back, though I don't see myself seeking this out actively.
author: Angel C.

description: Was at Delfina two weeks ago for the first time, we didn't have any reservations, I was put in the wait list for an hour and a half, it was worth the wait. We loved loved the food. Had their spaghetti, the pork thingy(super delish), paired some wine with our dish, and the server Kelly was super attentive and helpful. If you are looking for a good Italian restaurant in the city, I highly recommend Delfina.
author: Vida T.

description: Hands down the best Italian restaurant in town. The classic spaghetti is simple, honest, and wholesome. Brought my dad here and we loved it. Will 100% bring more loved ones to this restaurant!
author: Jessica T.

description:
I can't believe I haven't been back to Delfina in almost four years! Where did all the time go? 

I do digress, back to the food...I took a glance today at their menu and noticed they have made a lot of changes on the menu which makes me wish I could go back and try the new things they have because they sound delicious! 

Our menu selection was solid but didn't have the pork sugo with pappardelle so was bummed I couldn't relive that experience again. What we did have was pure in flavor, well executed and offered a great balance of texture. 

Some call-outs; only bottled beer and wine, reservations a must, portions vary by dish but you won't leave feeling hungry or overly stuffed

Overall Thoughts

Nostalgia aside, Delfina serves clean straightforward Italian fare that highlights the ingredients and captures the essence of pureness
author: Eddie W.

description: Decent Italian food. The dishes came out very quickly. Loved the atmosphere and the service was exceptional.
author: Felix M.

description:
Decor- comfortable

Service- solid

Food- Calamari, Spaghetti, and the chicken are menu standards for good reason, they are consistently delicious.
author: Pete G.

description: We made reservations for the Pizza restaurant.   There space was tight but plenty of room to eat and a great atmosphere watching the cooks.    Food was on point and service was polite and quick.   Price was reasonable and good valve.  Enjoy!
author: William C.

description: Great place to chill at and eat some great food. Wine list is very extensive too. We will continue to keep going back.
author: Wade W.

description:
Their salads were really good. Pasta was average though. Nest past was very salty, fungi pasta was good but too creamy, and Bolognese was good. 
Little over price for what i got
author: dr. s.

description: My husband and I went here for a celebratory dinner after eloping at City Hall. They knew that we were celebrating (thanks to Shana at Fox & Doll!) and we were treated like royalty. The hostess was gracious, wait staff was attentive and knowledgeable and food was delicious!  They made it a night to remember.
author: Erin L.

description: Got a little crowded and hard to accommodate our party, but the lamb and pasta and steak frites are worth the trip. Pretty good wine list and solid service.
author: Jakob D.

description:
A perfect dinner for two:
- Two glasses of wine
- Some prosciutto with persimmons and arugula to start
- Large Spaghetti, a little bit of freshly ground Parmesan
- Chicken with mushrooms and Mashed Potatoes
- Brussels Sprouts
- Bi-Rite Ice Cream across the street for dessert

One of the best restaurants in the city, especially for the price to quality ratio. Some of the best service I've ever received, including never needing to tell a waiter to do something twice, consistently having my wine glass topped off, and helpful recommendations on food and life.

If you're not looking to shell out a ton of money but want a fantastic Italian dinner, this is the place to go.
author: Albert C.

description:
I have to be honest: as an Italian, I had some great expectation for this restaurant, it surely has a famous name!
But I have to admit that I have to give 3 stars for this restaurant since I honestly had one of the worst services in U.S.! First we saw people eating pizza and then when we sit down and ask for it, they say that actually don't serve it, really?!
Then when we order, they serve wine from my region in italy, Piemonte and when I ask for more details, they say that I should just enjoy the wine. Well for paying 85$ for a one course meal I expect better than that!
author: Irina P.

description:
Four and a half stars! When I go out to eat I try not to order food that I could make at home, but trust me folks, order the spaghetti. Without a doubt the best spaghetti I have ever eaten in my entire life. How could something so simple taste so spectacular? We ordered the large and shared. They split it in half and brought out 2 plates, perfectly portioned.

You have the option here to make pretty much everything on the menu a half-order, so we did that to start with proscuitto and pears. Not the most amazing thing I've ever eaten, but tasty nonetheless. 

We also shared the chicken and mushrooms dish. I didn't know it was possible for chicken to be so tender. Literally fall off the bone amazing. And the mushrooms. Please. Feed. Me. More. Shrooms. 

Very extensive wine menu. We ordered red champagne (or something like that... clearly I'm no wino) and finished the bottle faster than I'd like to admit. 

I would recommend trying to get a reservation. I made one in the morning for the same evening and was glad I did because I only saw 1 other open table when we got there.
author: Steph D.

description: The girl and I sat down for a late dinner on a Saturday evening and the place was pretty full. Ambiance is really nice and romantic without too much noise. As other reviewers have mentioned, none of the place are extraordinary unique but really well executed.
