I was especially surprised by the spaghetti which was awesome - there wasn't anything crazy in there but the sauce was super fresh and noodles perfectly tender. The real start of the show was the Strawberry Semifreddo, which was simply devine. I'll be back hopefully soon!
author: Travis V.

description:
Dined out alone. Took them about 5 minutes to acknowledge me at the host stand, then 10 minutes to place a fork and knife around a napkin. Another 10 minutes to greet me and take the order after I was seated. Another 10 before "my" server approached the table, somewhere between 1st and 2nd course. About 15 minutes between 1st and 2nd course, and another 20-minute wait for dessert. When you're dining alone, time goes slower, especially when you're hungry. Something we take into account at Michelin two stars (I'm also in the industry.) When I asked for the check, it was in front of me a minute later. Think of the message you're sending? 

Food was delicious. I felt the bomboloni were a bit over. 
I'm having a hard time tipping well when you show zero interest in my experience. 3 small courses and a glass of wine for $80 is steep, and it should not take over an hour. It's a long time staring at yourself in the mirror...
author: Dee A.

description:
Nice pizza , the ambience is good. The place is clean and the service is friendly. 
Is hard to find good Italian pizza style ,but Delfina is good. Pizza is tasty
author: Maria s.

description:
Gnoccho with prosciutto - 4/5
Leeks with capers - 1/5 
Ragu tagliatelle - 3/5
Prosciutto ravioli - 5/5 - Great sauce, lemony. Ravioli filling was perfect.

Overall, Ravioli was "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description:
We finally get a reservation for 9:30 pm and in my opinion they should not take a reservation if they cannot serve items on their menu!  They were out of bread (luckily we have already tried Tartine's bread) and then another pasta which someone in our group ordered had to be rushed to their kitchen lest they ran out:(
Well, either reduce the menu prices by 1/2 or don't take reservations if you can't offer items on your menu that late!
Ambiance:  Not that great, a bit crowded!  If you are charging that much for your menu items, seat your clientele so they are not within ear shot of each other!!!
author: Chitra J.

description:
I came here with the GF in the afternoon on a not so busy day.  I asked the hostess for a table for 2.  She immediately responded by asking me if I was here for the pizzeria located next door.  First off, I was insulted because I am not an idiot.  If I were here for the pizza, I would have simply gone next door.  I can read after all.  I just wanted to go somewhere, which I thought would be nice for dinner.   No, I was not dressed in a suit or at the age of 40-50 years old.  Does that mean I can not dine here?  

Service was incredibly slow for it not being busy.  After being seated and given menus, it had to have been at least ten to fifteen minutes before our server came by to ask us how we were doing.  She apologized for the wait like she knew we were waiting for a long time.  We decided to order the corn soup, spaghetti, and roasted mary's chicken.  For dessert, we shared the butter-toasted olive oil cake.  The table next to us had been waiting even longer.  They were talking to each other, asking if this was normal.  

Food took quite a while to come out.  The soup was the best part of the meal.  I enjoyed the taste, and the creamy richness of every scoop.  The ingredients complimented each other in a harmonious way.  I also liked that it was green!  After the soup, I had high expectations for the spaghetti and chicken.  

The spaghetti was underwhelming.  It was not bad, nor was it something to brag about.  There was no wow factor.  It just tasted like spaghetti you or I would be able to make at home.  The chicken was okay.  For $24, I did expect more.  I appreciated how the mashed potatoes were served on a separate plate.  

The olive oil cake was good.  The sweet and bitterness of the strawberries paired well with the gelato and cake.  One must get a small bite of each simultaneously to thoroughly enjoy it.

One thing that I did notice was the final bill was not accurate.  The soup was advertised on the menu at $10, yet I was charged $12.  Our server apologized like she was not surprised of this error, or it was not the first time someone complained.  Needless to say, this is very bad on the restaurant's end.  For those who order the soup and do not really check their receipt, they would never know they are getting ripped off $2.  It may not sound like much, but it is the principle.  I doubt the Delfina will contact everyone that was affected of this extra charge because I highly doubt they even care.  But I do know this is unethical, if not illegal.  

Another thing I noticed was when an older couple asked for water, our same server asked them if they wanted sparkling or tap.  Whether age or race plays a factor into why she did not ask us if we wanted a choice in the matter, I won't ever know.  That is just something to think about if you come here.  As a benefit of the doubt, maybe she was tired and just forgot to ask us.  But, nevertheless, I still notice these little things.

TL;DR : Terrible service, average tasting food, possibly ageist, racist staff.  I was overcharged.  I won't be back.
author: Victor L.

description: Delfina is a wonderful treat in the heart of mission. Cozy and intimate setting with good selection of Italian wine, the experience is a delight. The service was awesome and the server made it a pleasure to find the gems of the food. They do serve bread from the neighbouring Tartine bakery and its delicious but no stars for that. I ordered a Calamari and it looked great. It was grilled prep but unfortunately it was charred underneath to an extent that it just left a strong bitter overtone that engulfed the mouth. The server promptly took it off the bill though. The spaghetti and ravioli though were incredibly delicious. Hen & Prosciutto Agnolotti | burro fuso was unique, fresh. The delicate gamy hen was prepared in a beautiful symphony with herbs and the perfectly cooked agnolotti brought the balance that made the tastes dance  on the palate. The spaghetti perfectly cooked with delicate, simple but fresh tomato sauce reminded me of the home cooked pasta in Italy. The sides of carrot was as delightful. We skipped the desert for the ice cream Next door but this place is a gem. On our quest for the best Italian restaurant in bay area that are Zagat rated, this is on the top 10 list.
author: Anushil K.

description: Our waiter Grant was spot on with great food and wine recommendations. The Salmon was served with a delicious coconut cream sauce and the spaghetti did not disappoint! The fresh mozzarella and heirloom tomato appetizer was a superstar with freshness and flavor beyond compare. After a great day exploring the Mission district and a people watching and a picnic in the park this was an ideal ending to a perfect afternoon in the city.
author: Raquelle Z.

description:
Delfina was astounding. The food was high quality and there were plenty of options on the menu. My table had the Grilled Calamari, the Spaghetti, and the Prosciutto-Mascarpone Francobolli. The Grilled-Calamari was subpar--it came with very few pieces of calamari and the beans in the dish were overwhelming. However the pasta was fantastic. 

I'm giving it a 4/5 because of two things. First, I had this reservation for a month and yet we were seated in the bar area which feels extremely cramped. The waitress had barely enough room to turn from table to table.  Second, the service was slow and I wish I had known how long the pasta would have taken because my table would have definitely ordered more food.
author: Ellie M.

description:
Best pasta I've had in SF! I've been wanting to try this place since I moved here 6 months ago. People keep telling me how good it is and I wanted to know what the hype was all about. 

The first time I went, my friend and I weren't very hungry so decided to just get two pastas to share. After we spoke to the server, he said they can do half portions for all the pastas! I love trying more things but in smaller portions.

We ended up getting 3 pastas, all half portions. One was their classic tomato spaghetti, second was the pulled pork pappardelle, and the last one was butternut squash tortellini with chestnuts. All 3 pastas were amazing, despite not being hungry we finished all 3 so fast and nothing was left on the plates. Our favorite was the tortellini (and I normally don't like stuffed pastas!) 

We went back again a week later (Delfina changes their menu almost daily!) and had the calamari app, the calamari was cooked perfectly. Pasta FOR SURE as our mains (this time no half sizes!) - again the classic spaghetti, another stuffed pasta and chitarra integrale. Hats off to the pasta chef - all 3 left us wanting to come back the next day. I'm so happy with the pastas that I'm not going to waste my time on the mains hah! Can't wait to go back again next week. :)
author: Rohenne L.

description:
I had only been to the Burlingame location prior to visiting, what I heard is, the flagship location on 18th St. Went there for a quick bite with my folks: margherita pie and brussel sprouts.

The margherita wasn't my choice; it's good, but nothing special, you guys do have awesome dough though. The crust was really good. The brussel sprouts came with some arugula and a bread with cottage cheese which was quite nice. To be honest, it was better than the pie (just my opinion).

All in all, I got the sense that Delfina is very much about the quality of ingredients and pairings throughout the dining experience. It's definitely worth a try, just isn't a place I would frequent for pizza.
author: Aaron C.

description:
I finally got to try the famous spaghetti! Shockingly, I was able to make a reservation just the week before. Granted, it was for the earliest seating at 5.30 pm, but I'll take what I can get, rather than having to wait hungrily outside on the sidewalk.

Our server was prompt to bring water, take our orders, and pour me a generous glass of wine. There was a slight mix-up with the wrong order, but she was quick to remedy that as well.

Butternut squash blossoms filled with ricotta - freshly fried, pillowy, and nicely accompanied by zucchini chips
Spaghetti with plum tomatoes - I appreciated them splitting it between two plates for us. Sure, it was small, but we were treating it as an appetizer... hm, we might be gross gluttons.
Tajarin pasta with duck sugo - We marveled at the simple but true quality of the pasta, and the duck was of course deliciously rich
Hen and prosciutto agnolotti - Italians will probably call sacrilege, but the best I can describe it is like small, tightly cornered ravioli. The sauce was so creamy, we didn't need much of it.
Affogato - I've never had it with amaro before, which I dislike in isolation, but enjoyed with this espresso and gelato. I loved that they gave enough espresso that I could sip on what was leftover/couldn't fit in the glass.

I want to visit once a season for their fresh menus! Oh final note, they do add coperto, which I've never seen in an Italian restaurant in the U.S. (it's 5%).
author: Cat N.

description:
We had such a beautiful, delicious experience last night at Delfina on 18th in SF.  They are total pros!  The service staff was so thoughtful and helpful in choosing wines that would pair with our menu choices and just all around great at their jobs.  The pastas were tender and yummy, especially the little striped raviolis...I wish I could have them again today!
Also, the coconut panna cotta dessert was the most delicate, flavorful custard we've had in recent memory.  The vibe is great in the room only made better by the professionalism of the staff.  They have mastered the art of exuding confidence while providing understated perfect service.  Great food, great service, great room.  What more could you ask for?  We can't wait to go back!
author: Susie D.

description:
Very good food, very very good service. We ordered everything that held interest for us. Place is well managed, well organized, a treat, and popular. Don't forget to make a reservation.

The bread is from Tartine, and it's worth the $4. The Delfina pizzeria is next door. Unless you want a delicious pizza, make sure you enter through the correct door. Dinner opens at 5:30. The line forms to the right. When you enter, you are matched with a server, who is also in line to meet you. It works very well and even though the line is long, you are seated quickly.

Recommendations...really superb:

* Corn Sformatino-gulf shrimp, cherry tomatoes, salsa verde
* Spaghetti...really!-plum tomatoes, garlic, lots of olive oil, pepperoncini
* Hanger Steak and French Fries-delicious...the fries were spectacular with the juicy and flavorful beef

We will be back often. Enjoy!
author: Reyn J.

description:
This is literally the best spaghetti that I have ever had in my life. I never order such a basic meal but it was so worth it. The sauce was thick, savory, and rich and you could totally taste the basil in it. 

Now beware, this place is pricey and requires log waits. We waited over an hour to get seated which was a lot but worth it. Also the wine is pricey so be aware.
author: Sarrah F.

description: This is the first Italian food I ate after Rome so it's definitely not a fair reviews. The foods were good but I still miss the pasta in Rome.
author: Valerie C.

description: Ugh... so disappointed. My boyfriend and I are visiting from Miami for his birthday and I heard amazing things about this restaurant so I made the reservation three weeks prior. We had no idea that we would be touching elbows with the couple's next to us, I mean you can hear each others conversations very clearly. When the waiter came over to take our order I asked him for some recommendations and he seemed annoyed, he told me one thing and didn't care to elaborate so I just ordered the simplest thing on the menu. I ordered a glass of wine and it was significantly less than what other people were getting and same goes for the food. We ordered the spaghetti which is supposed to be amazing and not only was the spaghetti hard but the sauce tasted straight out of a can. The funny thing is my boyfriend ordered the large portion and I ordered a small and they were the same size... the guy next to me got the large and it was twice as big as my boyfriends we were so confused! We said something to the waiter but it was shrugged off. What a terrible birthday dinner. To sum it up - terrible service, food wasn't even good, and small portions.
author: Becky M.

description: Expect a wait to be seated. This place is Always full. Great modern Italian fare. Delicious antipasti and primi plates. We enjoyed the salad, the salted cod, their delicious Tartine bread, the grilled calamari, and the bread with misto spreads. The main dishes delivered little less than expected. I got the pork belly which was just a tad on the dry side and skin could have been a little bit crisper. My friend got the trout that was a little overly buttery for her taste. This being said the service was impeccable and the buttermilk panna cotta was amazing.
author: Vivian T.

description: I had dinner here with a friend on New Year's Eve. I had made a reservation for 7 pm and my friend and I arrived a little late due to New Year's Eve traffic. We had called and said we were going to be a little late and they said they understood and they would hold our table because they understood that we had made a reservation a long time ago. Once my friend and I arrived to the restaurant the hostess said they had to let our table go. My friend and I were very unhappy about that as we had come from far away and made this reservation far in advance. Luckily, they were still able to seat us immediately but just at a table that was not in the best location. My friend and I ordered white wine, which was only alright for 10 dollars a glass. I also felt that our waiter was a tad rude. Again, luckily two other waiters served us as well and they were much friendlier. My friend and I both ordered the spaghetti and it was definitely tasty. We also ordered dessert to treat ourselves for the new year. We ordered the hazelnut caramel pear cake. This is what made my unhappy friend happy again. She said that the cake made her experience at the restaurant and I have to agree that it was fantastic. I recommend this place to anyone who can afford an expensive meal and I'd say they are very strict on time so if you make a reservation the lesson is be on time!
author: Sneha P.

description:
Dinner at Delfina for Mother's Day was an incredibly enjoyable, relaxed occasion. My father has always had an affinity for Italian food, and I hadn't made it past the pizzeria next door yet, so this seemed like the perfect choice for a nice family dinner. We booked reservations about a month in advance, although I'm not sure if that is necessary for non-holiday-ish weekends.

THE OVERVIEW.
+ Friendly, outgoing servers who skillfully navigate crowded a crowded dining room without a slip
+ A menu full of beautiful, simple, seasonal dishes with some classic (and lesser-known) Italian specials peppered throughout
+ They have a major focus on using local farms, vendors, bakers, and more (their bread is transported a whole whopping 30 feet down the street from Tartine!)
+ A location where it's easy to dress up or down and not feel out of place
+ It feels like a San Francisco institution (a James Beard award winner, no less!)

We had an entirely delightful shared dinner of:
+ WARM CASTELVETRANO OLIVES
+ FRESH CURED ANCHOVIES NOSTRANO
+ WILD RAMP SFORMATINO w/LOUISIANA GULF SHRIMP
+ CHICKEN AGNOLOTTI w/LEMON-CHIVE BURRO FUSO
+ ROASTED CHICKEN w/OLIVE OIL MASH
+ QUAIL w/WARM CHICORY BREAD SALAD
+ HANGER STEAK w/FRENCH FRIES

The wine flowed steadily, it was a delight to be able to try and share so many different dishes, and it was a lovely evening, completely. I need to make sure I come back here (with reservations) more often!
author: Claire S.

description:
You Delfinately must eat here! Delfina is one of four Holy Grails in San Francisco. I'm from out of town and always make it a point to eat here when visiting. Tonight was my fourth time I got to tantalize my tastebuds with the riches of Delfina's menu. Their menu is updated daily but they do have some staples which are always offered. For starters (literally) the bread from Tartine is served with homemade butter. Tartine is my jam, but it's also the bread to my butter whenever visiting Delfina. I don't think I've ever ordered one of their staples for the main course, but twice I've ordered an Agnolotti pasta which is basically an orgasm for your tastebuds. So, if they're offering Agnolotti when you dine, GET IT. For dessert I got the "Rome Apple Semifreddo" which I had no idea what it was but the description next to it "ginger quince granita, graham crunch" is what roped me in....."graham crunch" lol. Yes please. If you want a double tastebud orgasm then search no further for the perfect dessert. Thank you Delfina, for satisfying the fat kid in me.
P.S. The other three Holy Grails in SF are Tartine (for their morning buns), Kin Khao (for their pretty hot wings, caramelized pork belly, and sticky rice), and Wayfare Tavern (for their housemade doughnuts).
author: Emma N.

description: We enjoyed experience even more than expected. Delicious food. Yummy pasta. Also calamari salad. Great espresso. Across the board. Even better service. Noisy busy restaurant but that is just what it is. Definitely recommended.
author: Jow H.

description: A great spot to go if you're craving authentic Italian food with a Californian twist! Love the vibe and staff are so friendly. Our server Sara was great! Always smiling and well informed about they dishes on the menu. My favourite pasta had to be hands down the duck tagliatelle! The sauce is out of this world!! Their warm olives and Brussels sprouts is a must! For antipasti make sure you order the grilled calamari! Super fresh and flavourful! Great experience, will be back soon!
author: Ghazal S.

description:
This place can be quite busy on the weekends, so plan ahead.  One of the nice things I liked about the restaurant is that you can get half-size on the pasta dishes if you so choose.  That's not advertised on the menu, but you can make the request.  

We had three pastas: the tagliatelle, plain spaghetti, and the linguine with clam sauce.

The tagliatelle with meat sauce was the best of the three pastas I tried. The pasta was cooked at the right texture and the meat was tender and flavorful with the sauce.  The herbs actually made the dish quite balanced as well. 

The regular spaghetti had the al dente pasta, but the sauce combined with the pasta made the entire bite in my mouth mushy for some reason.  It was like the sauce overpowered the texture of the pasta.  The sauce tasted like it was missing something. It wasn't as balanced as I would expect from a relatively fancy restaurant.  It was a bit too tart.  Overall, I was disappointed in the dish considering it's supposed to be a classic Italian dish that a highly-rated Italian restaurant should have. 

The linguine with clam sauce was really salty. The clams came out fine and was probably the best of part of the dish.  I typically like salty food, however, even I thought this linguiine dish was too salty.  Other than that, it was pretty good.  

I might be willing to come back again and try some of of their other dishes.  May want to skip the pasta section all together.
author: Shirley C.

description:
I feel cheated because this is the second place I found on Yelp in San Francisco that had good ratings but I had a bad experience. To start off, we had 20 - 30 minutes wait and were seated accordingly. I think they gave us a makeshift table because it was in an awkward place.. We were in a regular height table next to the tall tables, making us sit literally next to someone's butt.. When we asked for another empty table in another section, the lady told us it was for reservations only. WHAT? Really? Ok. 

The food was terrible. We got the famous spaghetti and it was not even close to al-dente. I got the pansotti (walnut and marjoram ravioli) and it was so bland and so bad. I don't know how "vegetarians go nuts in this spot" but there was literally 2 vegetarian dishes and they were both terrible. I'm not even going to try this place again, I don't want to waste my money.
author: Nanditha G.

description: I cannot rave about this restaurant loudly enough.  Thank you Sabrina and Kelly for making our evening last night AMAZING.  These folks made room for our large party of 11 (I expanded it on them), created a special prix fixe menu, and served us like we were royalty.  The food was unbelievable.  The tomato and buratta salad -- OMG -- best tomatoes I have ever eaten, so sweet, great texture.  Some of us raved about the Black Sole.  Others gasped orgasmically about the Mary's chicken and olive oil mashed potatoes.  Yet more of us drooled over the hanger steak and rosemary fries.  And then the Panna Cotta - a hint of mint, so smooth and creamy, the weirdly delish melon and the orange!  Our experience was perfect in every way.  One of the best non-home-cooked meals I have ever eaten.  (BTW -- I do not know if we paid for the bread, but if we did, it was sooo worth it! Crusty outside, soft and airy inside, lots of texture. I will gladly pay for that bread.)
author: Helen D.

description: Excellent service and excellent food. Cant go wrong with anything you order here. I love the grilled squid w/ beans to start. All pastas are handmade and perfected. I had short ribs w polenta last night though. Really yum. I forgot to take pics cause it was so good.
author: Judy K.

description:
Limited menu for dinner with well priced offerings, especially given the quality of the food and its preparation. 

Down to the eats:

- pre -drink cocktails. 

- La Quercia Prosciutto Americano = warm, fluffy pastry puff with delicious prosciutto.

- Winter citrus = arugula, avocado (yummy!), fennel, and sea salt. Excellent! 

- Quail and polenta = the quail meat's flavor was perfect. The polenta was even better!

- Butternut squash tortellini = still lingers in my head. It was THAT tasty! 

- Panna cotta = vanilla rose rhubarb, blood orange, and jellies. Very light and refreshing.

- Almond dessert = the least favorite of the night. Simply too sweet for my taste. 

I enjoyed my dinner at Delfina. Beyond that, the staff was friendly and very helpful. They deserve your visit if you're in the hood. 

I hope you give this tasteful place a try. Cheers!

The simple things in life.
author: Owie N.

description:
This place is amazing. I would rate to Delfina a 4.5 only because we made a reservation for 8:30 and were not seated until a little after 9. What's the point of making a reservation if we still need to wait 30 minutes. However, the food was to die for. We ordered the tartine bread and we not dissapointed. The bread slices had to be about an inch thick. The were super fluffy with a perfect crust. We got complementary peppers in a slightly spicy sauce. They had a perfect amount of spice and slight bitterness to them. We also ordered the summer vegetables fritto misto. I've had squash blossoms before but not like this. Crispy on the inside and melty deliciousness oozing out! 
For the main, we got the spaghetti and chicken. Hands down, it was the best chicken I've had in my entire life. Super tender and moist and the sauce was finger licking good. My spaghetti was good as well not as good as the chicken but something you should still try if you get the chance. If you are in the area definitely try this place out!
author: Amy K.

description: This is, imo, the most overrated restaurant in SF. We waited for almost 45 minutes to be seated and find this out. What a disappointment: the clam pizza was not good. The sauce and the clams did not go well together (i love clams btw). We also had the burrata, which did not feel like burrata. It was served with 2 tiny toasts. Such an unnecessary skimpiness!
author: Adelle G.

description: I'm sure they are a lovely restaurant but I DON'T live in that area or state and I wish I would get emails from MY local area!  So please moderators please get me on the right email list!
author: Donna B.

description:
I was having one awful week (torn ACL and car accident) and it was showing bc when trying to pick a restaurant for a "cheer me up" dinner , I was struggling (that's when you know my week was off)  It was a Friday night but I was optimistic when I chose Delfina 20 mins before dinner and arrived at 7pm and got seated right away!! It could only be up hill from there :)

We started off with a bottle of Cab, the burrata, and the Tartine bread. The burrata is served with pickled leaks, and some type of grain which I thought was the perfect combination of flavors.
It was so good that we stuffed our selves on it. We split a the cauliflower soup and a large order of the much awaited Spaghetti. I think both were very good but not omg amazing which was okay with me. I wish we could've tried a few more dishes but our tummys wouldn't even allow for dessert!! 

The decor is crisp and clean which I like and the service was on point, especially as the girls at the front! All in all it was a pleasant experience!
author: Hetal P.

description: Had made last minute reservation for 4 seated promplty. Excellent is the description, we had the warm castelveltrano olives, Moroccan spiced carrots, olive oil mashed potatoes, spaghetti, pansotti, grilled sea bass,and there French fries with rosemary delicious!!! this is a must try establishment. The whole staff including our fabulous watier Kelly. Very attentive which is a must with me, everyone helped everybody. I'll be back, try the Delta asparagus brutti buoni!!!
author: Charlotte T.

description:
I never want to give out my best kept secrets in SF but I think the secret is already out on Delfina. I love this place so much, and it's probably the only place in SF I've frequented more than 5 times for dinner. 

The spaghetti is amazing. The tagliatelle is amazing, the date cake with coconut gelato is fantastic, everything is just superb and it never disappoints. The menu is always changing but the quality always remains the same. I love the pastas and the appetizers. The salad in which they've had on their menu for 17 years is delicious. The calamari is good. The wine selection is fantastic. I would say, this is a great date spot, low key dinner night, catch up night, or just an amazing Tuscany dinner spot. Any way possible, you should find an excuse to dine here and get the large spaghetti.  Yeah, it's pricy but it's amazing. I would say hands down, this is one of the best spots in SF.
author: Joanna S.

description:
I've had my fair share of Italian cuisine and I have to say,  Delfina has "decent" Italian food. Given how far I've driven to try Delfina, I am ashamed to even say this but, I think I'd prefer Pasta Pomodoro or gasp, The Cheesecake Factory if given the option for a second meal around.

I must say, the Burnt Honey Panna Cotta was mighty delicious. Some might be put off from the potent honey flavor but I for one, quite enjoyed this aspect of it. The panna cotta was ulta smooth and creamy. Delfina knows what's up when it comes to panna cotta.

On to the rest...
DO NOT order the Winter Citrus Salad. As evident with my picture, the photo alone looks unappealing. For 9-10 bucks, I expect at least one full citrus fruit, not slivers of a barely there medley of citruses. Oy! 

The Ragu was bland and unmemorable. You can definitely replicate this at home with a bottle of store bought Ragu. Get it?  Harhar.

The Chicken Agnolotti was interesting. I didn't love it,  but I also didn't hate it. It tasted like Chinese salted/preserved fish rather than chicken. Just interesting.

The Mary's Chicken is always a safe dish to order. You get the bang for your bucks here. The addition of mushrooms was a nice touch to the overall composition of the dish. I didn't personally try this dish but my friend thought it was only OK and she is the queen of ordering Mary's Chicken.
author: Lisa Z.

description: I went there with my friend and we had a nice time there. I have been wanting to go to Delfina for a long time since I keep hearing people talking about it. I definitely enjoyed my time there but the food is not as amazing as I expected. For some reason, most dishes we ordered were too salty. We had to drink water nonstop afterwards. However, overall, we like our time. The pasta itself was really good. We loved the texture and the chewiness. Not sure if I will go back anytime soon though
author: Clare L.

description:
Still a great neighborhood gem. 

This is what we ordered, ranked from favorite to least favorite:

Spaghetti - amazing red sauce with plum flavor, this was the standout and very tasty. Usually I think spaghetti is boring, but not this. 

Gnocchi al ragu - very tasty but I was too full to finish it, had a bechamel sauce. 

Calamari with white beans - good but not stand out. 

Celery soup - was fine, my wife liked it.  

Mint tagliatelle with black trumpet mushrooms - my least favorite; this was a review highlight and I usually love both tagliatelle and mushrooms, so I thought it was an easy win. The sauce was uninspired and I probably wouldn't order this again.
author: Mike G.

description: Found this on a list as a hotspot for SF dining. There are so many choices but decided why not. Our Waitress made us feel like we weren't welcomed to ask questions  about the menu. When we did, she was awful at explaining the items (while the table next to us had a wonderful waitress).   Once our food arrived, the ravioli order looked like half an order (12 small ones @$21 and nothing else. No pizazz/presentation). My stuffed hen and pancetta agnolotti  (also very small and $20+)was good but...  The chocolate Torrone Bar for dessert was good. Based on the experience and dining choices we would never go back. However, everyone raves about there pizza next door. That we would try.
author: Ryan N.

description: This restaurant is ridiculously overpriced. The chicken was delicious, however the pastas are overpriced in that they give you minimal pasta and meat for the price. We got the Ragu and it came with 9 pieces of pasta and one little bite of meat each. Very disappointed. Spent 115 dollars and still hungry.
author: Becca J.

description: So sad for what was a San Francisco institution. After dining here more times than I can remember last night was a disaster start to finish. Indifferent service at best and expensive but tasteless food is the opposite of what Delfina once was. Such a disappointment that was in no way remedied by management. With so many excellent SF restaurants to choose from its time to place Delfina in the "once was" category.
author: Bill G.

description:
In a neighborhood with its fair share of buzzworthy dining establishments, let alone Italian ones, Delfina remains a solid bet. You can't go wrong with just about anything on the menu here, like starting off with the "bread service" that might seem overpriced at first, but features quality, fresh-baked bread and is a meal in and of itself. Pasta dishes like the pappardelle and rosemary tagliatelle are solid and decently portioned, and who can resist scrumptious desserts like the panna cotta?

The wine offerings here are also extensive, and the California flight is a good way to sample several different white wines over the course of your meal. Service is also professional and on point. Deservedly a local favorite that continues to draw large crowds after all these years.
author: Vincent L.

description:
3.5 Stars

Delfina serves mostly great Italian food that will definitely satisfy any pasta cravings you have. I came here for dinner a few nights ago - we had an 8 PM reservation but showed up a bit early and they were able to seat us. Strangely, I felt as though our server kept rushing us through our meal even though we'd gotten there before our reservation time. Anyway, on to the food:

- Chilled California Asparagus
- Fennel Sausage
- Tripe alla Fiorentina
- Special of the Day: Black Squid Ink Corzetti with Octopus
- Berkshire Pork Saltimbocca

The asparagus was a light and refreshing start to the meal, though admittedly it didn't taste like much. The fennel sausage was very flavorful and prepared well. However, I was most excited about the tripe. I've been told that having tripe on the menu is a sign of old-school Italian cooking, and tripe is one of my guilty pleasures. I was really pleased with how it was prepared.

The Berkshire pork saltimbocca, sadly, fell short. The pork was very dry and not particularly flavorful. It was a disappointing conclusion to our meal but given that I mostly enjoyed the rest of our dishes, I'd be willing to come back and give Delfina another shot.
author: Kelly L.

description: Yum. Price is right. Pasta is perfect. Worth those incredibly long, hangry lines. Bread was good.
author: Dee N.

description: Had a few pasta dishes here. Everything was amazing. Had the spaghetti with a pomodoro sauce and the Ragu. Both were amazing. Looking forward to making it back there.  Service was also great. Ambiance is solid as well. Definitely recommend.
author: Matt L.

description:
Food: 3.5 stars
(potentially 4 stars)
Service: 3 stars

I'm rounding the whole experience up to 4 for the potential of my next visit! I got a glass of the Timorasso (~$10) and it was a delicious white that was not too bold nor too light. It had a slight carbonated bounce to my tongue, and enough aroma to call it 'character'. Chia L. had a glass of white too, it started with a V... but I can't remember :( If you're into Chardonnay and a little bit of spice, it's the choice for you. 

The seared veal special appetizer of the day ($14) was absolutely delicious. I love my meat medium rare, light and with some tangy pickled garnish on top.

We also ordered the cod linguini ($19) which wasn't worth it at all. Nothing special and definitely not worth the price. Wish I had ordered the chicken with truffle mash!

Between the two of us we ate $80 and neither of us was full. We did sit there for over two hours, so it was a great place to chat. I also really appreciate that they have small plates/ tapas choices for $5-$8. Our waitress was friendly and gave a great introduction to the wine-by-the-glass selection (cuz it was all half in Italian and I couldn't pronounce half the blend names) but her hospitality scattered after she took our wine orders and wandered off.

Tip - street parking is hard to find, but on Sundays it's free! We came in at 6pm on a Sunday and no wait.
author: Maggie G.

description: This is an amazing restaurant!  Everything is good from the soup, salad, wine, to the main course.  Every time we go to the city, we end up dining here before heading home.
author: Sotto V.

description: The epitome of what the tech industry did to SF: the pizza I got was something closer to bread with some ketchup on it; everything highly overpriced, and the waiters were very pushy trying to get us to buy more food even though we ordered plenty. Lastly, the waiter gave us this long speech about the wine.  Sadly, as people who know a little bit about wine, we knew what he said was just gibberish that would only fool a 20 year old nouveau-riche. The talent-less selling to the palete-less.
author: Norcloud S.

description:
Fantastic! Aaron M was our server and he was very personable and gave us space while continuing to check on us when needed. He gave great recommendations. If the tortelli with brown butter sauce is still there, be sure to get it! The sauce is like nothing I've had before. Great to dip the tartine bread appetizer into, as well. So sweet yet unbelievably savory at the same time. Menu items are changed daily, we learned. The spaghetti was also fabulous... Fresh tomato sauce with al dente noodles. 

There is a great hustle and bustle - such a fun, yet romantic, vibe. Bussers are on their game, too! Having worked in fine dining settings as both a hostess and a server, I'd say this is one of the best all-around places I've been to in the city so far (after living here for 6 months already)! Lastly, the panna cotta with passionfruit was delicious!! Can't wait to go back!!!!
author: Christie L.

description: I'm never disappointed when I have a meal here. The vibe is relaxed and easy and the staff is always friendly and on top of everything. The food....always so delicious and easy. That's what I love. simple and just darn good. They serve Tartine bread to start....Oh Em Gee and we pared with warm citrusy/spicy Castelvetrano Olives. A meal between the two all themselves. Shared a lovely pappardelle pasta dish with a rich sugo sauce, then I had the steak and frites. Everything perfectly cooked, never waited long for food. Such a relaxed vibe while enjoying good food and drink, what could be better? My mouth is watering just remembering how good everything tasted. reservations are recommended.
author: Susan D.

description:
First off, if you think this is good Italian food, I feel bad for you.  I wanted to like this place. The ambience is nice and the waitstaff is super friendly. 
However, it was just lackluster. 

I don't know why, but we waited a super long time for our appetizer of prosciutto. It's sliced meat and some fruit. It kind of went downhill from there. By the time we got our entree, we had been sitting for an hour and twenty minutes. Hour and twenty minutes for two plates of pasta. I'm not one to complain, but it was kinda awkward. 

The pasta was salty. Like really salty. If you want to pay $22 for a plate of pasta, have at it, but it's just not worth it. 

If you want some damn good pasta, head to Italian Homemade. I desperately wanted to like Delfina, but it honestly just wasn't that good.
author: Gus C.

description:
Delfina makes wonderful pizzas in the heart of the colorful mission district in San Francisco. They use local, fresh, and mostly organic ingredients in their pies. You really can't get much better than that. All their pizzas are great from the mozzarella-tomato-basil, to the spinach-garlic-cream, to the prosciutto-arugula-tomato. 

They don't take reservations, so you usually have to be prepared to wait in line (put your name on the chalkboard and take a stroll), or go at lunchtime on a weekday. Prices aren't expensive, but not cheap either. Their pizzas are totally worth it! I highly recommend coming here if you find yourself in San Francisco!
author: Steve N.

description:
I came here on Monday night with a few friends for a birthday dinner. We had to sit outside, but no wait around 8:30pm. 

We ordered the peas & shoots as appetizer (delish), and the funghi and carbonara pizza for our main dish. Funghi was too mushroomy, as anticipated; the carbonara was so delicious with juicy, fatty guanciale, which is essentially high-quality bacon. 

For dessert, we had the baba rum cake. I will probably never order this again; the cream was pretty good but the rest just tasted really dry and overly sweet. The waitress put a nice candle on it for us though. Great service overall!
author: Juliana P.

description:
Have never taken the time to review Delfina, but have had several amazing dinners here over the last 15 years. The food and wine are always fabulous and the service is never less than perfect. 

Worth the wait and my go-to place for special dinners or when I really want to make sure a guest of mine has an amazing time.
author: Alexander G.

description:
Italian   "NOT".
Just because you serve pasta you can not claim to be Italian. There are many types of Italian food as there are many regions from which they come. And there are not a lot of options and nothing that jumped out at me as that which I just had to have. I believe it is because nothing is recognizable, you have to read every item to get an idea of it. Call it - made up Italian dishes. 
The Calamari al forno was all about the smoke. Calamari is a light flavor that you need to coax out of the fish. This you could not recognize as calamari except for the texture. Four little squid on a plate of white bean for $18 is price gouging. 
The pasta was good and cooked properly - they selected the right provider. The sauce was thick with a heavy thick taste and textured not delicate at all and not served hot enough. once you put cheese on it the whole thing got pasty.
I asked for olive oil for my bread, so as not to destroy great bread with butter. I was old, heavy and tasteless. This is a really big miss. A decent Italian restaurant would always default to the best olive oil. Sadly this must be the oil they cook with.
The salad was fresh- very American and really good. Call the Place Delf's on 18th and claim to be American nuovo cuisine and you might have not been a disappointing.
Hard to find a reasonably priced wine and the beers are nearly Ball Park prices. 
The bread was great - it was from Tartines next door.
Bob
author: Bob D.

description:
He had me at tripe.

Came here on a Friday night and was seated right away.
Spaghetti- A little under cooked but apparently that's how they make it in Italy.  Could've used more cheese but overall still a good dish
Brussels sprouts- YUM.  Perfectly cooked.  
Tripe- The look on our faces when the server placed the dish on our table.. WTF, this does not look like tripe in pho.  Took one bite of the tender tripe in tomato sauce topped with crunchy bits and fell in love.

Great service, good food.
author: Linda N.

description: We came again last night and it was just as good as the first time. The dishes are a light Italian with just enough sauce and cheese to coat so you will not get a huge plate of red sauce with giant meatballs. Go somewhere else for that. The portions are small because you are expected to eat normal portions and order several courses to make the perfect meal... still I wanted to lick my plate of Mint Tagliatelle. I could have ordered 2 plates but instead I ordered dessert to round out my perfect meal.
author: Patty Y.

description: Came here with some friends for my birthday and I gotta say we were all underwhelmed. I ordered the spaghetti since that was their specialty but I thought it was good but not amazing. Like I wouldn't spend my money on it again. I've definitely had better pasta. My friends all tried a bite and they said the exact same thing. One of my friends ordered the calamari and she said it tasted super funky. She took 2 bites and couldn't finish it. The rest of the plates were not memorable and one of my friends got super annoyed about this "hyped up place". I really wanted to love it and I love pasta (seriously even frozen pasta could satisfy my needs). This was just average :(
author: Yvonne L.

description:
Delfina is one of my very favorite restaurants. I have dined here more times than I can count. I was thrilled that I scored a New Years Eve reservation this past weekend and was so looking forward to it. Things started out great. We ordered a nice bottle of Barbera, bread, a salad, brussels sprouts and a sformato (which was one of the best things I have ever eaten). Then the mains came and the wheels came off. My pasta was fine but my two companions got the traditional Delfina spaghetti, which we have gotten a hundred times. This time they were so salty as to be inedible. They were sent back with assurances that replacements would be out very soon. By time I finished my pasta replacements were nowhere in sight. My companions were now not interested and cancelled the order. We asked for a cappuccino and the bill. The manager brought the bill and announced that in compensation (for not receiving two main dishes on New Years Eve) he removed the brussels sprouts from the bill (the least expensive thing we ordered, save for the bread). Seriously?? I then noticed that the bottle of wine we ordered was charged at 75 dollars despite being listed on the menu at 65. I went to discuss this with the manager and pointed out that a free order of Brussels sprouts was hardly the correct response to two main dishes not being served and a mischarged bottle of wine (he had "no idea"how that happened and mumbled something about vintages). He then asked what I thought would be appropriate. I told him that was his job, but the idea that a 9 dollar side dish was sufficient for a messed up NYE dinner was ridiculous. He came back with the wine price corrected and my pasta also being comped. Whatever. We signed the bill and headed to the door. One the way out the manager grabbed me and gave me a $50 gift certificate. That is took so much drama and insistence on my part to get to this point was sort of outrageous for one of San Francisco's best restaurants on NYE. 

I'll definitely return, but this was not one of Delfina's finer moments.
author: Keith S.

description: Food is quite sophisticated.  However, you do get charged for it.   Located in one of my favorite neighborhoods in the city.  Great for a special occasion.
author: Jing C.

description:
Another great dinner at one of my fave Italian restaurants in the city! It was fairly easy to get an 8pm Thursday dinner reservation the day before online. They were still busy and bustling, and I liked the simple holiday decor of some white lights, a few long wreaths. The service was fantastic, the decor classy, romantic yet casual. I have always loved my meals here. 

MUST-HAVES: Fagioli all'Uccelletto for a filling starter, and if you're looking for a unique entree Tripe all Fiorentina (these 2 are similar though!). 

CONTORNI
* Fagioli all'Uccelletto | tomato, guanciale. $8 - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/delfina-san-francisco?select=ba12rWbT7Bku1EH3BQj0LA#ba12rWbT7Bku1EH3BQj0LA
This was wonderful! Definitely a heavy dish, definitely full of starches and carbs. But also definitely full of flavor, filling for a starter, and has beans cooked to the perfect texture with bits of crisp in there too. 

* Delicata Sqush | mint, balsamico. $8 - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/delfina-san-francisco?select=pzQK-6pmYK-m9anRtB5t9A#1IgDfNPdd0iSBQuPFoCOhg
This was a unique way of having squash - they were cut into very large pieces and were soft, almost like the texture of beans. You could see bits of black char which made me wish they were crisped, but alas they were not, and the texture was pretty uniform throughout. The balsamic wasn't very strong either - another slight disappointment. 

* Brussels Sprouts | pancetta, horseradish. $8 - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/delfina-san-francisco?select=pzQK-6pmYK-m9anRtB5t9A#e1C3ja_PErnpR2lOcCppSw
Always a solid choice for starter! The crispy, savory bacon bits are the perfect complement to the brussels sprouts. The sprouts themselves could be more crisp, though I know it's hard to get rid of that soft, soggy texture. 

ANTIPASTI
* Insalata di Campo | field greens, pancetta, walnuts, parmigiano, balsamic vinaigrette. $11 - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/delfina-san-francisco?select=ba12rWbT7Bku1EH3BQj0LA#-XDNBmlylJR58oIQU1kAmA
This was good, though nothing super special. My friend's on a no-carb diet and that was the only reason he didn't get a pasta.

PRIMI
* Pappardelle | Liberty duck sugo. $19 - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/delfina-san-francisco?select=ba12rWbT7Bku1EH3BQj0LA#aMU4ebuLW4IYGIL2-hgRKQ
Very delicious duck, wonderful flavors. The pappardelle itself was a bit thick, and Delfina definitely tends to cook its pasta al dente whereas I like it a bit softer. Still, very nicely done. I would rate this one higher, but it's such a small dish - my boyfriend was glad we got all those starters.

* Dungeness Crab Risotto | radicchio, basil. $23 - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/delfina-san-francisco?select=pzQK-6pmYK-m9anRtB5t9A#bgfsdimmW0a8hlKBOCcB6Q
Perfect creamy texture to the risotto! I love that I got to try a different type of pasta here. The crab flavor could stand out a bit more, though to be fair I only tried a bite of my friend's. 

* Tripe all Fiorentina. $11 - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/delfina-san-francisco?select=ba12rWbT7Bku1EH3BQj0LA#3VWVobpe16A--KCzGz4Hsg
Another new dish for me! This was really nice - the tripe was soft, none of that rubbery texture, yet bits of it were crisped, just enough to give each bite enough variety in texture. The flavors are strong, savory - actually kind of similar to the Fagioli all'Uccelletto (so don't just get these 2 dishes, you'll be getting something really similar). 

DOLCI: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/delfina-san-francisco?select=pzQK-6pmYK-m9anRtB5t9A#CeYh3S_E8giZNbP-daxeXw
* Cardamom Panna Cotta | candied Buddha's hand, burnt satsuma caramel. $9 - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/delfina-san-francisco?select=pzQK-6pmYK-m9anRtB5t9A#pzQK-6pmYK-m9anRtB5t9A
I always love Delfina's panna cotta. It has a rich creamy texture yet is somehow light - you can tell by how it jiggles just the right way on your plate. I wished the cardamom flavor was stronger. The satsuma was interesting - a bit of that slightly bitter orange rind-like flavor, mixed with very sweet caramel. 

* Chocolate Bonet | amaretti, sesame honeycomb, crema - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/delfina-san-francisco?select=ba12rWbT7Bku1EH3BQj0LA#Dw9QGsBbswuhq6k1_S4uPg
A great one to pair with the panna cotta, this one having heavier chocolate-y flavors. The crema had a nice consistent texture, only a slight sweetness too it, the crispy amaretti was great, and the chocolate intense and dark.

Dinner menu: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/delfina-san-francisco?select=ba12rWbT7Bku1EH3BQj0LA#anmo2lfTaoo9SKYPaTaGQw
author: Ziyan C.

description:
My friends and I chose this place for its high rating and the thousand reviews. We forgot to make a reservation beforehand, so when we tried to go in at around 10pm, they told us to wait for 25min for a table. 25min turned out to be 45min, but that was fine.
When we went in, the waitress seemed to be nice at first and she gave us two recommendations (Fregnacce and Risotto al Barolo), the two most expensive items in the Primi section of their menu. Fregnacce was supposedly a seafood pasta served with Louisiana Gulf Shrimp, and Risotto al Barolo was supposed to be pasta with bone marrow. So, 3 of us went for the Fregnacce and 3 for Risotto al Barolo, and the rest for Spaghetti. We wait another 20min that was supposed to be a mere 10 minutes.

Then, the "food" came. If I tell you I have not seen a smaller portion of food you would not believe me. In the Fregnacce that costs $22, I could seriously count the number of pastas in the food and I didn't even need to count the number of shrimp(s?!). There was only one shrimp cut into smaller pieces in the whole plate. Eating each piece of pasta was like stuffing a dollar bill down my throat. I don't know who she could dare to call that seafood.

Well, that was just the Fregnacce. In the Risotto al Barolo that was supposed to have bone marrow, I could not taste anything but the 20 or so shreds of rice.
At the end, it turned out their most cost-effective food was the spaghetti. Even that, had a portion that I doubt would fully serve a small child.

Now, after all of this nonsense from the charlatan waitress, when we asked for some bread and butter, they said that's an item on the menu and you would have to pay for them. We just couldn't comprehend waiting more than an hour, spending over $200 on 3 pieces of shrimp, less than an ounce of bone marrow, and small chunks of spaghetti and yet not getting any free sides.

Just a huge shoutout to that waitress with her offensive attitude and this fake Italian restaurant for one of the worst dinners of my life.

I know that this restaurant might be a local favorite, but I can't trust yelp reviews anymore, even though that might sound ironic for you reading this review.
author: Nader N.

description: Solid and reasonably priced Italian restaurant - came here on a Thursday evening with no reservation and got a table. It gets busy pretty quickly though so make a reservation or arrive earlier. I loved their brussel sprouts and bone marrow risotto. They have some sort of pastrami appetizer but it was really just smoked salmon so I don't recommend trying that. Their chocolate budino was delicious. Although the food and service was good, nothing really stood out and I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.
author: Valerie L.

description: I'm torn with this place. If I judge it on just the quail I had, it's a 5 star restaurant at a reasonable price. But given the mediocre two pasta dishes we had and the $4 fee for bread which was a bit excessive I have to give it a 3 unfortunately. The menu changes often, so you may get lucky!
author: Kartik S.

description: Amazing food, great experience!! The best pizza in The Bay Area!!! The price is really fair and the waitress were se helpful. Too bad I'm already leaving SF because I really fell in love with this place
author: Barbara D.

description:
Still one of the top restaurants in SF.

But Delfina deserves a lot more than credit for their house made pastas & fabulous red sauce.

Delfina is a pioneer.

This was the first culinarily inspired restaurant to open in the mission.  It was 1998.  What was out here?  Burritos, clubs, & bars.

You had Bruno's & Delfina.  
And Bruno's is long gone.

This was also the first real destination restaurant in this neighborhood.  Now, there are too many to count.  Delfina helped pave the way.

The owners, married couple Craig & Annie Stoll, are 2 industry leaders.  I remember when Annie worked as lead hostess at Moose's (early 90's, it's now Park Tavern).  She's always been a gem.  I think what's most impressive is that, in addition to running one of SF's most successful restaurant empires, they're also running a successful marriage & family.

You can be sure of 2 things at Delfina...
It will be packed.  
You'll have a great meal.

Order the spaghetti.  The full order.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: If this was my home, I'd be ashamed of serving this. Word of a born and raised in Italy.
author: Massimo C.

description: We had a wonderful dinner here last night.  Their service sets a standard where it should be everywhere, they know how to hire and train their hostesses and waiters/waitresses.   We didn't really understand everything on the menu but grabbed someone walking by and she dumbed it down for us, even recommended that we could have two type of pastas and just get half portions since we were indecisive.  She wasn't our waitress but took the time to explain everything to us, really love their teamwork.   Our favorite was their spaghetti, pasta super fresh and amazing perfectly al dente, sauce isn't too acidic, it was just perfect.  I love simple pastas like that when they know how to cook it like the real Italians.  I also had the quail which was real moist, perfect amount of salt, the mushrooms had a great kick to the flavor as well.  Nothing mind blowing but the food is really good and service is outstanding.
author: Cherrie L.

description:
I had been to this location in number of ocassions but last night was the worst.  As if no one listened or they did not hear me well.  We let the host know that we are going to theater and apparently it was totally ignored.  We came in on time at 5:30 and yet our main dinner were served 15minutes  before 7PM.  Our server seemed to be selective to who she should served better.  
We were four and all our dinner were dead cold when servced except for the Moroccan Spiced Carrots.  Obviously, if you dine that often, you can easily figure out what went wrong.  She waited for all our orders be served at the same time.... hanger steaks, pork and gnocchi were all cold when served.  

The acoustic is so loud that even our own server had to ask what our individual orders were two-three times.  It will be very kind of you (owner) if you can consider to at least do something as to the level of noice (music) so diners can carry conversation better.

Burligame is bit better.

Food - taste is good but got spoiled when it served COLD
Service - Poor
Noice - Very, Very and very loud
author: Jun d.

description:
This was my first visit to Delfina, although I've eaten at the pizzerias in Palo Alto and the Fillmore. My friends and I enjoyed a wonderful dinner to celebrate a birthday. While some lingering diners caused us to be seated later than our reservation time, the staff were exceedingly courteous and made up (many times over) for our having to wait. Aside from apologizing several times (and keeping us informed of what was happening with our table), they offered us complimentary glasses of Prosecco and a couple great appetizers: the spiced almonds and the gnocco fritto. It was a thoughtful gesture and the delectable appetizers and wine were a great start to our meal. We shared their regular house salad (Insalata di campo) and a new to the menu chilled Dungeness Crab Salad with fennel and star ruby grapefruit. We shared everything--the portions aren't obsequiously large but certainly lend themselves to sharing pretty easily. Both salads were refreshing but the crab was spectacular--in-season shellfish combined with the sweetly acidic grapefruit, fennel, and red oak lettuce in a delicious way. For our main meals, we thoroughly enjoyed the swordfish with Castelvetrano olives and marinated shallots  (on a bed of delicate lentils), the hanger steak, and sides of fluffy and smooth olive oil mashed potatoes and creamy polenta (substituted for the French fries). Some reviewers have mentioned a heavy hand with the salt but we didn't find that on any of the dishes. Everything was well seasoned and beautifully plated. 

At my request, the waitress recommended a perfect glass of red wine with nice body but not oaky--so nice since I wasn't familiar with some of the by the glass Italian wines. 

Dessert--we splurged and I'm so glad because this part of the meal I usually skip proved to be a treat. We ordered the dark chocolate budino with Bay laurel gelato, the Meyer lemon semiffreddo with gingerbread cake and dark ale caramel, and the maple panna cotta with pumpkin purée, pomegranate seeds and pumpkin seed brittle. Each was prepared and presented creatively, and the tastes transported our tastebuds to a pretty happy place.

The service was flawless without being pretentious. 

All in all, this was hands down one of the most enjoyable dining experience I've had recently. Delfina restaurant made for a great birthday dinner for my friend, and the experience there made it a place I'll be sure to return.
author: Sharon S.

description:
I've heard a lot about Pizzeria Delfina but Delfina the Restaurant blew me out of the waters with their pasta. Definitely my favourite Italian restaurant in the Bay Area (yet). The pasta is fresh made and cooked just right. We had the spaghetti, the daily special of the pappardelle and the beef cheek cappelletti. 

The spaghetti with red sauce seems so simple but it was flavourful, just a bit spicy and absolutely delicious. The pasta in the pappardelle was so so chewy (I'm a sucker for freshmade pasta) and they gave a lot of duck (although portion size is not big). The beef cheek cappelletti had this really awesome sauce (I couldn't figure out what it was but it was so good) and I would highly recommend. I only wish that I had thought to ask for bread (especially as it's right next to Tartine) so we could soak up the pasta sauce!

We only had the pasta dishes this time but would definitely return for the entrees.
author: Michelle Y.

description: Great pizza place near the Delores park.  The pizzas were really flavorful and the tomato dish was amazing.  We also had the meatballs which were great.   The service was fantastic and the manager went out of her way to make sure my son who has food allergies was ok with our special order.   I will definitely come back the next time I'm in San Fran.
author: Kobe K.

description:
I've had Deflina bookmarked for ages but never went.  Why?  Cause nothing pops out at me.
My friend managed to get a last minute reservation before the holidays.  Both of us were stuck staring at the menu and struggling with what to order.
We tried their signature Calamari, Risotto, Duck, and Panna Cotta.  Everything was pretty forgettable.  
Risotto and Panna Cotta are all acquired tastes.  Both got nasty as I ate more. 
A 4% service charge is added to support SF employer mandates?! What is this?!I still get into debates as to whether or not to count this as a tip....this bothers me....esp since dishes are already pricey and small portioned.
author: David W.

description:
Somehow managed to book a table on a Saturday night less than an hour in advance ... Based on the line at the door, we must've gotten extremely lucky.  We got:
- Tripe alla Fiorentina (3.5/5) - A pretty filling dish with lots of well cooked tripe, but definitely a little over salted.
- Tagliatelle with mint and mushrooms (3.5/5) - Perfectly cooked pasta with a nuanced sauce that was good but didn't excite.
- Linguine with sole (5/5) - My girlfriend ordered this, so I only had a bite, but the flavors of the tomato sauce and the fish combined really well for a really delicious dish.
Overall, the food was good, the atmosphere was lively, and the service was very attentive.  Will definitely be coming back here again.
author: Simon L.

description: Have returned here over and over again for more than ten years, most recently last night where we sat at the food counter and shared two pastas. It is consistently excellent, with lovely service and a great urban atmosphere. Highly recommend.
author: Paul T.

description:
My hips don't lie. They're ridiculously wide and accurately depict someone who loves carbs. I clearly shouldn't be eating pasta, so if if I'm going to have some, then it'd better be worth splitting my pants over.

Luckily, the spaghetti and papardelle with duck sugo were good enough to justify corpulent deformity. And I only say good enough because I have found slightly better versions of both elsewhere - Scarpetta for the former and Cotogna for the latter (with lamb ragu). Nonetheless, these were solid dishes that I'd order again.

If you're not in a pasta mood, you can do what all the reviews suggest and order the octopus. However, if you want a truly memorable meal, then try the quail and Brussels sprouts. The former was the juiciest I've ever had and the latter was cooked with hazelnuts, rosemary and honey for the most flavorful explosions in my mouth. I kept on eating this despite knowing that my hips were expanding with each mouthful. 

By the end of my meal, I was looking pretty obese and busted. I'll probably never get laid again but I don't mind because I can always come back to allow my lips to fornicate with al dente noodles and juicy meat.
author: Suany W.

description: These people know their food, and their wines. Top notch service and good quality food. A very romantic intimate vibe, too.
author: Tim B.

description: The food here is okay nothing amazing I had the Gnocchi and it was alright my friend had the rosemary chicken and that was pretty tasty but nothing special. Portion is quite small and overpriced plus it was just mediocre. I don't see myself coming back but maybe I'll try their pizza place next door. Customer service could be better we had hostess/host standing next to us talking but they didn't bother to check up or ask when to take our order until I tell them to.
author: Luna C.

description:
I'm having a difficult time understanding why this restaurant deserves 4 stars.. 

Let me start with the appetizer: Calamari and Tartine bread 
-Calamari: Salty
-Bread: Tartine Soggy  

Pasta: Spaghetti and Duck Pasta 
-Spaghetti: Sour AF
-Duck Pasta: Salty AF 

Main: Sea Bass and Chicken 
-Sea Bass: Under cooked AF. knife didn't go through the meat, Got refund.
-Chicken: Smelled, Looked, Felt good, BUT MEDIOCRE 

Dessert: Complimentary Little Jelly Things 
Tasted like artificial grape fruit 

Originally, we went in wanting to try their panna cotta (saw the picture on yelp). But after trying their dishes, we just didn't want anything else from this restaurant. So we just left.

1 star for their rose wine. not bad.
author: Clara C.

description: Waited an hour and forty five minutes for delivery after which the restaurant cancelled. Do not order delivery from here- you will never get your food and you waste your time fuming.
author: Tanu K.

description: Had a fun, delicious dinner at Delfina in our first night in San Francisco and the ambiance and food got us off on the right track for a great weekend .  We had lots of salads (all fantastic )--the mushrooms, de campo, and the squid.  Our main courses were pansotti,tagliatelle (special) and bass.  Dark Chocolate Bonet dessert! All great! Highly recommend Delfina.
author: Susan G.

description:
Came here for my Dad's Birthday and it was a wonderful time. From the hostess to the bartender and then to our waiter, excellent service. The food is AMAZING. Highly recommend the jam and cheese appetizer with a glass of rosé.
Looking forward to coming here again!
author: Kat S.

description:
I came here last Saturday with my sister and two of our friends. We called at 8:30pm and the wait was really long, but by the time we got there around 9:30pm, we only had to wait 20 minutes for our table. We went to the bar and each got a glass of wine- I got the Ganouche from Santa Barbara which I didn't love and wouldn't order again.

Atmosphere- very cute restaurant. The outdoor seating is only for the pizzaria, which is separate from the restaurant. Great service! We had the best waiter, Kyle, who was very friendly and chatted with us all night.

Drinks- When we sat down, we ordered a bottle of Chianti, which was delicious. I always love Chianti.

Food- We started with the warm olives, which we actually amazing. 5/5, I would definitely order them again. For the appetizers, we got the caprese salad at the Martin's Escarole salad. Both were very good, I would say 4/5. For our pastas, we REALLY wanted the prosciutto ravioli but they had run out which was so sad. We tried the mint tagliatelle and duck gnocchi (both 3/5. I could tell that the pastas were homemade, but I was a littler underwhelmed. Both were good, but the flavors were kind of weak. I was expecting strong flavors and an amazing taste, since i've heard so much hype about the restaurant. The mint tagiatelle had a good amount of mint, but needed a stronger sauce, like a lemon cream sauce. The gnocchi was pretty good, but the duck was too rubbery. 
After that, we were still hungry so we tried the Gnoccho with prosciutto, which was fried dough with prosciutto on top (3/5). It was okay, but the fried dough had air in it, and would have been so much better if there was a marscapone or something else inside. For dessert, we got the Chocolate Caramel Millefoglie, which was also 3/5.

Overall- Our meal was very expensive (since it's a nice restaurant) but I didn't feel like the food was worth the price. If someone really wanted to go there, I would go again, as long as I could order the prosciutto ravioli. On the flip side, I wouldn't pick it as a restaurant to take someone who was visiting.
author: Jenna G.

description:
Some of the best Italian food you'll get on the West Coast.

Delfina immediately teases you with its aroma of fresh bread, heavenly wine, and potent garlic.  It's hard to recommend anything on their menu because not only are all the menu items fantastic, but the restaurant changes their menu frequently, surprising their guests with new flavorful experiences.

On my first trip to Delfina, I sampled the prosciutto and calamari appetizers.   The prosciutto was combined with chestnuts to create a uniquely savory dish while the calamari was not coated in bread and fried like most Italian restaurants, but instead lightly grilled and served with greens for a much cleaner taste that brought out the flavors of the seafood.

My main coarse was the humble spaghetti.  But for its simplicity, Delfina made the dish with love and care, to the point where I was using the bread to scoop every last bit of sauce on my plate.

If you don't mind splurging on good food, then Delfina is a must for leaving with a full and happy belly.
author: Nadav P.

description:
Delfina was definitely one of my favorite places I ate at while in SF!! 

My boyfriend and I met up with a friend here while in the city. Delfina is located in the Mission District and appears to be very popular, as there as a 45 minute wait at 7pm on a Wednesday. Our wait was cut about 15 minutes shorter than expected as we opted to sit at the bar (which was honestly fine). It was well worth it though, as their food is very good. 

Both my boyfriend and I ordered their Spicy Spaghetti (which actually wasn't that spicy). If I remember right, our friend ordered some pasta and chicken dish. For an appetizer we ordered their bread and butter. The food here was delicious! You can't really go wrong with bread and butter and spaghetti, but this place puts it in a whole other league. The spaghetti had just the right amount of spices in it and it tasted wonderful. I'm drooling just thinking about it. The bread was fresh and tasty as well -- apparently the bread is made at a store just around the corner from Delfina, which is great that they buy locally. Everyone in my party seemed to love their food as well all cleaned our plates!

Service here was very good. Our server here was very friendly and knowledgeable. I liked her. Prices here are also on the higher side, as our three meals and the appetizer came to close to $100 (and no drinks were even ordered!). I guess you pay for service and ambiance!

Would I come back here?! Yes!! I would just make a reservation first!

Cheers!
author: Michelle M.

description:
HOLY. MOTHER OF SPAGHETTI. 
Delfina should guard its' spaghetti recipe in a safety deposit box. It is really that good. 
So simple, all the ingredients are fathomable and fresh as can be, the pasta seriously will blow your socks off.
Pretty much everything else we ordered also did not disappoint. The calamari on a bed of mini canellini beans were fanatasic as was the perfectly crusty, soft bread from tartine and the chianti wine! (this was soo sosoo sooo good) 
The dessert was also specatacular- it was a chocolate wafer creation with whiskey infused into the chocolate sauce. Just delicious. 
Delfina is the perfect blend of rustic, homemade italian food and contemporary, California cuisine freshness. 
Located right down the street from Dolores Park and Bi-Rite creamery and market, this gem in the Mission already has so much going for it, yet it still shines on its' own to provide an excellent dining experience for guests. Would return today if I could. Keep it up Delfina!
author: Kinjal N.

description:
Pasta was really good, good wine selection, nice atmosphere.  

We were allowed time to sit and enjoy our drinks and really enjoyed the meal.  The place continues to live up to expectations.
author: Erich B.

description:
This place is amazing. Stefanie C definitely loves the place and I had to choose a place for the new boyfriends birthday. Therefore, decided on something that was closeby to my place and walkable. This place is definitely a SOLID 4-4.5 stars. 

We ordered so much food - probably a bit too much, but it was his birthday and I wanted to make sure he ate to his hearts content (since he is a guy who loves to eat). We ordered: 
Calamari: Probably the least favorite dish of the night, but it was beautiful. I was expecting something fried, but it was pan seared and definitely felt light. 
Spaghetti: DEFINITELY order this. I thought it was just going to be some random spaghetti dish, with little flavor, but this is amazing. We just ordered a small dish of it. Next time, we're getting more of it. 
Tortellini: the english peas that came with this dish were a great light accompaniment to the dish. SO GOOD. 
Pappardelle: the small serving of this was definitely not enough for the two of us. Just a tasting which was enough. The pork sugo that came with it was delicious, but the portion just seemed tiny. 
Chicken: OMG SO GOOD. the mashed potatoes were delicious (especially the next day). The chicken was beautifully roasted and SO moist! 
Panna cotta: the blueberry basil topping was interesting, probably not my favorite thing of the night, but it was his pick (my pick obviously would have been chocolate related). They even put a candle on it since it was his birthday. 

Overall, the service was so on point. Our waitress suggested some great dishes and we ordered them all. Just FYI, I think you can order smaller sizes on all the pasta dishes if you'd like so you can try more things. Always try everything. 

protip: if it's your first time, definitely get the spaghetti and the chicken!
author: Nina Y.

description: This place is especially dear to me as this was my SO and I's first date. Service was wonderful (We had to wait an extra 15 minutes past our res time because a table was going over, but were offered free wine through the night), and waiters/tresses were super friendly and informative, and food was delectable. We've since come back on our anniversary, and intend to keep the tradition alive.
author: Michelle L.

description: Definitely my favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco! The food is absolutely delicious and the service is great as well! I highly recommend it!!
author: Marina K.

description: We were in SFO on vacation and I had one request - dinner at an Italian restaurant.  I googled San Francisco Chronicle Italian Restaurants - and scrolled throughout the $$$$$ and $$$$ and $$$ places and landed on Delfina.  Made a reservation on-line and the two of us headed there.  They opened promptly at 5:30 and those of us with reservations were waiting outside.  We were quickly seated and our server Salomon was a delight.  Blood Orange Bellini and calamari to start. Not the breaded ho-hum version, but delicate pieces on arugula with beans and olives.  For entrees we had the spaghetti and lamb osso bucco.  I asked for a suggestion for a white wine to go with my osso bucco and it was perfect.  This is a wonderful experience without pretense and a dedication to great service and great food.
author: Beth L.

description:
Ordered the meatballs as an app along with our Margherita pizza. The meatballs were very tasty. They were baked to perfection, not dry at all.

Being from NY I can be very critical when it comes to pizza and let me tell you the pizza was on point. I usually order the Margherita whenever I try new places so that I can compare apples to apples (for the most part). The crust was thin, had enough hold so that when you hold the slice it doesn't fold over. Also the crust had just enough crunch yet it was chewy at the same time. The crust is always a good foundation for a good pie! The sauce had just the right amount of sweetness and the cheese was melted to perfection. I would argue that the pie could have used a bit more cheese. That would be my only complaint if you call that a complaint.  

Overall a good dining experience. The staff was friendly, the atmosphere was pleasant, and the food was excellent. As mentioned above, this NY'r gives his thumb of approval!!
author: Scott L.

description: Strange, but some of the negative reviews make sense to me, though I found it superb.  Delfina is a unique experience and not everyone is looking for unique.  The flavor combinations are subtle and original.  English pea Sformatino is an eye-opener.  The chicken is as good as a chicken can get.  The cherry Crostini dessert is exceptional.  Our server did her job but didn't pretend to be our friend.
author: Mark M.

description:
LFlew out to San Fran tonight and asked my neighbor on the plane for some recommendations.   This was her 3rd choice, but the other two were closed on a Sun night. 

The menu andthe location looked promising.   The pictures of thelamb looked fantastic.   Luckily they had room for me at a 'bar'.

That unfortunately was the hilightv of the meal.   The service took forever, and not ordering wine, I guess I was to be forgotten/ignored.   Had it not been for the Husted clearing the plates next to me I might still be waiting to order 

A couple of cold pieces of bread were brought over as my steak arrived, I finally had to walk up to the bat to all for some olive oil and pepper (don't do butter) also...(No lamb, and none of the entrees were particularly appetizing).  The steak had fries with it but they brought no catsup (or ketchup)  

Fries wets McDonals, but smaller and saltier, and the steak had about 20% inedible gristle etc.   Yuck

I should have gone for pizza next door.

The food was 1 start, but the hostess made it 2.

OK.  Not going to be able to finish the steak, and I don't want to finish the Poor excuse for McDonald's fries, so I tried some bread.    The crust looked good and had the wood fire(or coal) taste.  But it had the "1HR of the microwave" texture. 

Bleccchhhh.   Will Never Be back.   Glad I have some granola in the car.
author: Dave W.

description:
Love! The boyfriend took me here to celebrate my birthday, and I would totally come back here for more occasions.
