He made reservations at 6pm, but showed up early because parking around this area can be difficult. Ended up being seated right when we walked in, so YAY for no waiting! Definitely a place you'd want to make reservations, looks like they can get pretty busy.

We had the calamari with bean salad which was interesting to try. The boyfriend ordered the duck entree which he enjoyed, and I had a peach bellini and the highlight of this place: SPAGHETTI! literally thee best I've ever had you guys, no joke. Super simple in the way it's prepared, and though I'm more of a protein-ordering type-of-girl, this did it for me. I had the single serving portion which was just enough for me.

The hostess and person serving us were very friendly. Overall, great experience and would definitely come back! :)
author: Crystal L.

description:
The waiter told us that the Spaghetti was the best we will ever have... Hmmm I said, "I will be the judge of that."
He was right! The best ithis side of Italy!!!!
Little Gem salad was so flavorful that I couldn't get enough.
author: Michelle B.

description: For the pasta and the size of platters that you get, Delfina was definitely a bit overpriced.  We got the big spaghetti, half of a green pasta pesto dish, paccheri w/ white bass - too hard, sauce too tangy., and an appetizer.  The big spaghetti for $15 wasn't all that big.  Normally, I don't mind paying for expensive meals when the ingredients and food reflect the price (hello steak :D).  However, with the small amount of portions of pasta we were getting, we definitely were still hungry at the end and our taste buds unsatisfied.  We had the paccheri w/ white bass., but there was four to five pieces of pasta, and the flavors didn't really compliment each other.  By no means do I claim to be a pasta connoisseur, but next time I come back, we'll probably just swing by the side pizzeria instead.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Bestill my heart, we walked into this bustling place on truffle night...we loved every bite! We sat up at the bar where we could see most of the tables, wish we could try more! We had the pizza, Crudo & Calamari. Everything was simple, not over done, and just good. Our waitress, 
Grace, was lovely and gave us some fantastic neighborhood spots to try too. We would definitely go back.
author: Jaime L.

description: Positive notes are great wine list, excellent wines. Salads great, brussel sprouts good, the mint flavored pasta quite good. But the pasta alla vongole was overcooked and missing the clams - tasteless. The gnocchi was sodden and in a bland tomato sauce. A side of carrots overdone. The waitperson who grated cheese over our pasta sprayed cheese all over the table. To sum up we found most of the dishes overcooked - not al dente at all. It was an odd experience as this restaurant gets rave reviews for the pasta. We put it down to being there on an insanely busy Friday night and the staff were rushed while trying to be helpful under pressure.
author: Tessie S.

description:
The only thing we liked was bread (not complimentary though), for this one they receive one star and another one for service, which was not bad, but their glasses of wine are much smaller than you usually expect.

Calamari was ok, but pasta with clams was so small and had no taste (24 dollars).

Overall disappointing experience.
author: Tat P.

description: Their pastas are among the best that I've tried in the Bay Area. Great service, atmosphere, and food. Definitely will return :-)
author: Eura C.

description: Updated review - after a bad experience last time that we complained about, the owner reached out, sent a gift card and invited us back. We went and it was a good experience. Good food (spaghetti, olives, chocolate tart) and attentive service.
author: Srini M.

description:
I like their changing menu. I like their variety of vegetarian dishes on their menus ans they are always thoughtful. Food is hearty and onolicious.

Any time any day Delfina is a tasty spot in dolores heights.
author: Romit P.

description: Delicious take-out meal! Was in town on a road trip and wanted something hot that felt home made. Had the spicy carrots, the mashed potatoes, and the small portion of the spaghetti. They treated me great over the phone and it was ready in less than half hour. Very happy vegetarian here!!!
author: Kayra S.

description:
Definitely make a reservation (generally ~2 weeks in advance) unless you're willing to either go right when it opens or wait an hour or so. Delfina sits in a nice corner next to Tartine and a whole array of shops nearby so waiting isn't the worst option.


My boyfriend and I got:

+Calamari: I'm not always a big fan of calamari but the dish was fresh and I'm a sucker for those white beans and sauce they serve it with. Delicious appetizer. Love the handmade pasta. 
+Hangar steak: Boyfriend enjoyed his cut and thought it was pretty tender.
+Shortrib Cappelletti: Resembled a tortellini kind of pasta. I loved my plate! The shortfib filling had a great meaty flavor with a soft puree sort of texture. Not the largest dish but was surprisingly filling.
+Panna Cotta: We've made it a tradition to always order panna cotta if it's on the dessert menu and Delfina's has been one of my favorite so far. Served in a flan-like shape, I thought it would be a lot more dense but the texture is super light and creamy. The flavors were rich and came with some rose rhubarb and candies. I think the fruit changes usually.


Delicious, satiisfying food at a price that won't break your wallet and super friendly and attentive service.
author: Audrey C.

description:
Ah, Delfina.  When Greg and I lived in Pac Heights, our last meal in the neighborhood was at Pizzeria Delfina, so naturally, we've always been a fan of their restaurants.  Neither of us had been to Delfina in quite some time, so we made reservations for an early Sunday dinner.  We were seated immediately and took some serious time to peruse the menu and come up with a game plan for dinner.  Here's what we came up with:

Appetizer:
La Quercia Prosciutto Americano, Mission Figs & Parmigiano Fricco: WOW this was absolutely amazing.  Both Greg and I are HUGE fans of prosciutto, especially quality selections like this.  Paired with the figs and parmesan, this was a beautiful dish!

Pastas:
Gnocchi & Ragu: Funny story about this, exactly the night before, Greg and I attempted to make gnocchi & ragu and it came out fairly mediocre (totally my fault, I burned the sauce).  Naturally, when we saw it on the menu at Delfina, we both sheepishly admitted that we needed a second go at tasting what the real deal is supposed to taste like.  I'm most definitely a hearty pasta kind of person, so this absolutely hit the spot!  The gnocchi were beautiful little pillows of pasta and topped with a rich and hearty ragu sauce.  Bellissimo!

Chicken Agnolotti: I couldn't pick a more contrasting pasta dish to the gnocchi than with this agnolotti dish.  The dish had hints of lemon and had a light sauce to go with the delicious pasta.  You could really taste the freshness of this pasta and made for a perfect warm weather dish.  This was one of Greg's favorites for the night.

Main:
Pork Saltimbocca wrapped in Prosciutto: By now we've had a fair amount of food, so in seeing how big this dish was, I was so glad we were sharing it.  The pork was wrapped in the same prosciutto that we had early on for the appetizer and was smothered in a rich sweet sauce.  The dish also came garnished with fried sage and with a side of beautiful and creamy polenta.  One thing we noticed about the dish was that the pork by itself was really salty.  However, when you paired it with the polenta, it balanced itself out.

Dessert:
Lemon Budino: One of my rules in going out to dinner is, always look at the dessert menu.  And in this case, I'm so glad we did.  We ordered the lemon budino based on the recommendation from our waitress.  It also came with a delicious side of ice cream, which was amazing!!  I highly recommend ordering dessert :)

Wine:
2011 Produttori del Barbaresco Langhe Nebbiolo: This was a recommendation from our waitress who did an outstanding job finding this based on or parameters (not overly pricey for a Nebbiolo).

After dinner, we were completely satisfied (and not uncomfortable).  We determined that even though the city has a ton of nouveau restaurants with complex flavors, Delfina can always be counted on for solid, straightforward and quality food.  We will most definitely be back!
author: Lisa I.

description:
We came on Thursday night and this places is packed ! 

We ordered
1. Tartine: not very impressive 1/5
2. Grill calamari:  calamari is fresh but the dish is too salty 2/5
3. Spegatti : simplicity at its best 5/5
4. Hey and straw: The pasta is too soft and didn't find it special. Again it is too salty 3/5

We probably didn't order the right dish. This experience is not wowing us in anyway.
author: Mrs. F.

description: Where do I even start? I've been wanting to come to Delfina for awhile, so when, by chance, I was in the mission area on a weekday evening, I persuaded my friends to go on a Italian food adventure with me. We got some bread to share, which was divine! Honestly, when it comes to food, few things in life beats freshly baked delicious bread. I got the pork ragu for entree. The pasta was AMAZING. Alot of places do their pasta "al dente", but really they're just undercooked. Delfina does al dente right! I usually love sharing my food with my boyfriend, but this time the pasta was sooooo delicious, I basically licked the plate to finish everything. I finished the meal with the honeydew ice dessert. Overall, the pasta was definitely the highlight. The change their menu from time to time. While I would love to eat that pasta again, I'm also looking forward to trying new dish next time I'm here. But seriously, it's now three days since I've gone there, I'm still thinking about that pasta!
author: Sharon L.

description: Coming from NY as a foodie, I was pleasantly surprised how consistently good the food and service is at Delfina. Everything is delicious but you must order their signature dish: Roasted Mary's Organic Chicken with King Trumpet mushrooms, olive oil mashed potatoes.
author: Julie W.

description:
Delfina is a neighborhood gem with a well deserved reputation for fantastic Italian food.

I've been here 3 times, each with a reservation (highly recommended! You don't want to be one of the scrublords hanging out on the sidewalk, do you?). Make sure you're going in the right door, as Pizzeria Delfina is right next door. 

The restaurant itself is tightly packed and has a modern vibe. This is definitely a prime spot for date night, but larger groups and families gather here as well. You'll see servers bustling around but don't expect to see much cooking. The kitchen is tucked away near the bathrooms, which are gender neutral.

The wine list is sizeable but I always stick with the recommended white. The servers are very knowledgeable so don't hesitate to ask questions. Start the meal with Tartine bread and the delicious house-made butter. I suppose you could save the bread for your meal but my companion and I never have the self-restraint. I've had a prosciutto platter with citrus that was quite tasty, but it seemed to be seasonal.

For main courses, I always get the spaghetti here. It's so good it seriously makes me angry. This is nothing like your memories of overcooked pasta dripping with jarred ragu. Delfina spaghetti is perfectly al dente and infused with rich tomato sauce. (Side note, I tried to make Delfina style spaghetti at home and ended up with an undercooked, sloppy plate of pasta. I guess that's why they're making the big bucks.) Save room for desert as well. Last night I had a dish called Pear Charlotte, but in the past I've had chocolate dishes and gelato and they were all yummy.

Overall, I highly recommend coming to Delfina. Make a reservation, bring a boo, and enjoy the delicious Italian fare.
author: Leah T.

description:
We were hanging around in Dolores Park and getting pretty damn hungry.  

That's when my friend exclaimed "I WANT PASTA" -- and he wasn't taking no for an answer.

So, pasta-hunting we went... and that's how we ended up at Delfina.

Delfina is a beautiful, upscale (but un-stuffy) restaurant right in the heart of the Mission.  It was Saturday evening, so there was a wait for a table (30 mins for us).  However, the weather was gorgeous and the people-watching was divine, so the 30 mins flew right by.  (Tip: If you're feeling impatient, try finding a seat at Pizzeria Delfina next door, where tables tend to turn over faster.)

After we were seated, we began with a round of wine for everyone.  Delfina's wine list is long and impressive, but I stuck to their house Chardonnay, which was excellent.

For my appetizer, I had the asparagus with poached egg and tonnato.  This was absolutely heavenly.  The asparagus was perfectly tender, and I loved the flavor and texture of runny yolk mixed with the creamy tonnato.  Home run of a dish over here.

For my main course, I opted for their famous spaghetti.  The pasta itself was cooked nicely, but I thought the sauce could've used some more flavor (maybe fresh herbs?). 

We were tempted to order dessert, but decided to save our collective sweet-teeth for Bi-Rite, which is mere steps away from Delfina.

Service was very friendly -- and hilariously flirty.  Love a waitstaff that lets loose.

Delfina is worth a return visit, for sure.
author: David G.

description: Best dinner I've had in a long time! The roasted chicken was cooked perfectly and the mashed potatoes were addictive. The chocolate dessert we had was not only creative (olive oil with chocolate truffle cake) but also amazingly good. Ambiance at this place was perfect.
author: Kate S.

description:
A few weeks ago we had a lovely dining experience at this little gem! We got the prossuito appetizer which was wonderful! I got the duck which was amazing and my boyfriend got the pasta which was delectable. The desert was out of this world and the drinks were strong and perfect. 

To top off our amazing experience we had an amazing waiter! He was just the right amount of friendly! 

I sincerely look forward to another dining experience at this wonderful little restaurant!
author: Monkeygirl L.

description:
So after alllllll the hype I figured I had to try Delfina. Not the pizza place but the actual actual restaurant. Deli films didn't disappoint the food was delicious. 

We ordered the tartine bread first because.. Bread. And dang was that some good freaking bread. I mean Tartine is famous and ok now I get it. I would like to eat that bread every single day of my life. Order it because who doesn't love doughy crispy delicious hot bread and butter. Unless you aren't a human then I dont get you. Or gluten intolerant than I'm sorry.

Anyway I digress. We ordered the insalata di campo to start. The crispy prosciutto was the star of the dish. I feel like I purely stole that off the plate and left my friends with the leaves. For entrees we ordered the gnocchi al Ragu and the ranch hanger steak with French fries. Both were DELICIOUS and huge portions. Pretty bomb not going to lie.

I do wish the gnocchi was a little lighter with a more pillow like texture but I'm not complaint. It was pretty good and I may or may not have eaten the entire plate. Ah man pasta is my kryptonite.
author: Shannon H.

description: This place is quite crowded even on Monday night. You might need to call for a reservation. Staffs are extremely nice and friendly. Great food and service! Btw dont forget to order their Pomegranate Bellini, I'm totally in love with this drink.
author: Dai P.

description:
Enjoyed a meal with friends here recently (Oct 16). Our friends brought wine, so can't comment on the drinks menu, but the food was excellent.

We shared olives and focaccia bread to start; olives were delicious. The focaccia bread was a little greasy, but the sweet grapes in it added a beautiful contrast to the natural flavourings.

For mains we split a few dishes; the butternut squash risotto (creamy, flavourful and delicious - quite rich though), the prosciutto ravioli (incredible, melt in the mouth pasta) and some of their famous spaghetti (tasty enough but as a side to another main for me).

The food was delicious and it's a great atmosphere. Our waitress also allowed one of our party to split dishes as she wasn't sure what she wanted and didn't want to miss out; a great gesture.

All in all a great evening with fantastic food. Would definitely recommend!
author: Tom H.

description: Excellent food. For appetizers we had the special which was buttered asparagus with cheese, let me tell you Omg so tasty!! We also had the cauliflower which was really small, but definitely worth trying. The Margherita pizza was top notch, what made it taste so good was the tomato sauce, extremely juicy and delicious. The wait time was long, but it seems this is typical in SF. Enjoy ~
author: Adrianna N.

description:
Excellent execution of simple Italian pastas. Their grilled calamari is perfection. 
The menu is always changing so it's nice to always have a variety when you go back to your favorite place.
author: Sana A.

description: First time at Delfina and I loved it.  The service was great and the food was wonderful.  DO IT!  GO THERE!
author: Krikkit F.

description:
Came here because all of a sudden I was craving pasta, and was surprised to find this place was COMPLETELY WORTH MY MONEY!

We got:

--- Tartine bread w/ butter: you can't go wrong with Tartine's bread (the bakery is just next door). It's crusty on the outside and soft on the side, pair it with butter, hmmmmmmm!!!!!

--- Celery Root Sformatino: I had no idea what this was. It's basically a soup made up of celery root, but in a flan like state. The flavor is very interesting, not too strong, but nicely paired with raisins and walnuts. You can dip the bread in the sauce too!

--- Spaghetti: It was all I was craving for! Freshly made, chewy, delicious paste with some damn good simple sauce. Nothing fancy, but the sauce was fresh and not overly seasoned.

--- Pork loin: This was their daily special and it BLEW MY MIND. It was subtly seasoned (again, I think this place wins by their perfect balance of seasoning so the ingredients shine) then roasted with the skin on. The skin was crusty, the inside juicy and savory. It was paired with moist fava beans and roasted candied fruits, which balances the savoriness of the pork. I'm not usually a pork fan and am often disappointed by fancy entrees that carry a higher price tag than their worth....but this one completely came through!

On top of the great food, the service was very good. The hostess was happy to put our stroller away, give us a high chair, and later crayons for coloring. Our waiter was more than happy to serve us and our toddler. At one point he even commented that he wished the restaurant had child care for patrons (who wouldn't wish for that!)

All in all, an awesome dining experience! Definitely recommend.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
6 of us came here on a Thursday night in September 2016.  They have a good Italian menu, and it is right next door to their pizzeria.  Tartine Bakery is almost next door, and they serve their bread here.

We started with the Castelveltrano olives, the fritto misto, and tripe alla fiorentina, all very good.  For my entree, I had the pappardelle with pork sugo which was very good.  Others had the linguine with petrale sole, and Bershire Pork with prosciutto and polenta.  Everyone enjoyed their entrees.  Nice beer menu with a few IPAs to choose from.

The service was friendly and helpful.  The place was very busy, and when we left at 9:00 PM, there were people still waiting to get in.  It's in a nice Mission neighborhood, and we even found parking right in front at 6PM.  

I would definitely come back with my family, two of whom are allergic to wheat.  All of their pastas can be made gluten-free.
author: Dan L.

description: This place is off the hook! The grilled calamari with the beans is like the best thing I've ever had in my life. The swordfish was amazing. Everything was very very good!!! I will definitely be back. This restaurant gave me life!
author: Anna S.

description:
This one has been on my list for quite awhile. The food was very good and the wine list was impressive. It didn't blow me away enough for a 5 star review but I would try it again. 
The calamari appetizer is awesome!
author: Sam A.

description:
Amazing pizza! I had the summer special Cherry Pie, which is like a margarita with cherry tomatoes on top. The only bad part was the heavy olive oil from the tomatoes made the pizza a little soggy. If you eat it fast enough it won't matter . 
Not impressed with the wine selection. They're either too dry or flavorless. Guess living near wine country has made me a bit of a wine snob.
Service was great, as we sat at the counter. Can't wait to go back here!
author: illy m.

description: Horrible service, uninspired food, small portions, and difficulty getting the check right - there's nothing to praise here.  I contacted the restaurant, and received no response.  My review stands.  My wife and I, and another couple had a 5:30 reservation, and we arrived early.  I guess they do this by 'seatings' rather than reservation times.  We were seated half way back in the restaurant (Farina's space).  So the waiter starts at the front of the restaurant and works his way down each table, taking orders, and it took him 1/2 hour to get to the four of us.  Other staff members are standing around, chatting disinterestedly.  So we ordered drinks and warm olives.  THe drinks came 'staggered' - and after another 1/2 hour we asked about the warm olives.  The server was ice cold "oh I'll check on that" and 15 minutes, later 8 cold olives appear.  (that's about $1 an olive).  THe guest sommelier came, and we ordered a $120 bottle of wine, and we asked that she send over our server so we could order food.  Ten minutes later, the dgaf server took our order, and mentioned that food comes when it comes.  Two entrees came together.  One came 10 minutes later.  One never arrived.  The topping for the pizza arrived after we finished the pizza.  By the way, the pizza is very skimpy - it's all dough, with about 1 tablespoon of sausage, 10 thin slices of red onion, and a few small pieces of red bell pepper.  Nothing special at all.  So after  2 hours we tried to get the check.  But they hadn't charged us for the wine.  So we politely asked  - and with no apolgies or thanks, she takes the credit card again - and another 1/2 hour goes by as we watch them fumble trying to figure out how to add a bottle of wine to the bill.  Here's the bottom line - dinner for 4, but only 3 entrees, (no apology for the forgotten entree) is $230.  Add the $120 bottle of wine and tax, and they want a 20% tip on a $360 bill - that's another $72 - for surley service.  The pork is way oversalted.  THe pizza is skimpy.  The staff really doesn't care.  Nothing at all to recommend here.
author: Abram M.

description:
This was my third visit to Delfina, but first time in three or so years and first time since moving to SF. Hard to believe, but I believe it was even better than I remember it. My friend and I shared three courses. 

Insalata di Campo - intensely flavorful with the cheese, nuts, pancetta and dressing. Delicious salad.

Spaghetti - they're famous for it and now I know why. I don't eat pasta any more but made an exception for this. The slightly-spicy tomato sauce coats each strand of pasta, so that every bite it full of flavor. Perfectly portioned and proportioned, this dish is a delight.

LIberty Duck - this was some of the best duck I've ever had. My friend and I remarked to each other that it tasted meatier than normal duck...almost like a steak! We asked our waitress, who told it was likely because they dry-age their duck for two and a half weeks. That explained it! Rich, concentrated flavor, big serving and just a perfect dish. Loves the sweetness of the pomegranate and slight bitterness of the greens.

This should be on everyone's must-do list.
author: David B.

description: Miserable. The spaghetti was over cooked. The sauce was extremely salty and not flavorful. DO NOT COME HERE.
author: Nam N.

description:
I'm wavering between 3.5 and 4 stars. Our food was great, like really really good, but not mind-blowing. Service was fine - the servers were present, but not especially friendly. The space is exactly as lovely as every other upscale Mission restaurant.

We started with Tartine bread and house-cultured butter. The bread was amazing, obviously, but the restaurant doesn't get any credit for that. We had the mint tagliatelle and spaghetti with plum tomatoes. Both were delicious - the tagliatelle was delicately flavored, fresh, and creamy, and the spaghetti was wonderfully made. I may be less excited about it than I normally would be because we just had life-changing spaghetti (seriously) at Scarpetta a few days ago. We also split the gingerbread torta with persimmon sorbet, vanilla gelato, and huckleberries. We absolutely loved the gingerbread, which was extra spicy and flavorful, but the persimmon sorbet wasn't our favorite.

The tagliatelle and spaghetti were the only two vegetarian options, which was kind of disappointing. I'd be happy to go back again if the menu rotates to try a new veggie pasta.
author: Rachel M.

description:
One of the best Italian restaurants in the city. Great food, decor, service, locale. Parking can be challenging, as is the noise level.

Definitely try the spaghetti with plum tomato, sea bream crudu and calamari. For dessert, try the panna cotta. 

For transportation, park elsewhere and Uber or hike there. You'll generate an appetite that will be well rewarded. Also, the staff is quite friendly even though it is rather busy.
author: Kathy L.

description: The food was great but the service was absolutely horrible! They forgot to put our pizza order in so we waited for 25 minutes and asked them about our order and they forgot to put it in. They didn't apologize at all. And actually ignored us the whole time because they have no regard for their customers. Then when we wanted be check they ignored us! I'm never going back because they were extremely rude and did not even apologize for their mistake and for the inconvenience. I'm insulted by their service.
author: Mari V.

description:
My fiance made a reservation here on the day he proposed - so please accept my Yelp apologies in advance that some of the details are a bit foggy! 

I had been dying to try Delfina, since I had heard such good things about it. The restaurant did not disappoint!  Despite the fact that we were about 15-20m late for our reservation, the staff did everything they could do accomodate us right away, and after explaining why we were late they even threw in a couple of free glasses of sparkling wine to help us celebrate.

The seating was intimate, but also slightly cramped. We didn't mind since we were in a halo of happiness, but I do remember the feeling of being so close to our neighbors that we could participate in their conversations if we wanted to, and we also had a really clear view of everything they ordered (not necessarily a bad thing). 

The menu changes daily, which I love because it ensures that everything is fresh. We started out with some of the smaller appetizers - the grilled squid over white beans was absolutely incredible, one of the best things I ate in San Francisco. We also tried an olive oil tasting, which was interesting and fun but I think could use some tweaking (we were given two different olive oils in extremely large quantities, which seemed wasteful - I'd much rather try smaller samples of 3-4 oils).

I am blanking on the specifics of our dinner, but we had a fish dish that was cooked perfectly and just slightly spicy, and a dish with I think quail or some other small poultry that came stuffed with a sausage mix and ultimately tasted like a really fancy, blow-your-mind thanksgiving dinner. (Sorry grandma, I might be a little diasppointed with YOUR Thanksgiving dinner this year...)

Really great date spot with amazing food - can't wait to see what they'll have the next time we can get a reservation!
author: Catie F.

description:
So what's the hype all about? My sister said, "You've got to try the spaghetti. It's just like the ones we ate in Italy." I secretly called her bluff on this, but dang it she was right. Perfectly cooked spaghetti with that simple tomato sauce, which tastes anything but simple.  It's $9 for a half portion and $13 for a full.  Don't be a fool. Order the full size.  Take it home for leftover if it lasts that long. 
 
We decided to order a bunch of dishes to share which is a very smart option if this is your first visit so you can try different items. Until you find THE dish that makes you wish you hadn't agreed to family-style dining, like the grilled half moon bay calamari with warm white bean salad ($11). It was so tender with a bit of crispness on the ends, and served with a creamy perfectly seasoned white bean salad. I thought all of the dishes we ate were exceptional, well-executed, and affordable, including the polenta which was divine and the BEST I've had. 

Delfina's is the epitome of delicious food using simple and fresh ingredients.  Plus, stellar service from a friendly and knowledgeable wait staff. That explains the hype, and I can't wait to go back!  Advanced reservations are recommended. This place fills up and folks are willing to wait over an hour for a spot, and will even order to go.
author: Cat B.

description:
* Delfina's white truffle menu was such a good deal that I regret not booking both nights.

I still dream about their special white truffle pie pizza. Our meal ended with their white truffle rice pudding which was on the house. I'm not usually a fan of rice pudding but found myself picking at this dessert non stop.

Delfina is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in SF and for good reason. They're just consistently good and you can feel the love they put into their food.
author: Amber S.

description: Very rude hostess declined request to make a reservation for 3 a 4. Just no. No attempt at any sort of accommodation. What has happened to SF?! Will never dine here.
author: Peggy T.

description:
Delfina is one of my favorite restaurants and each time I go, I leave with a smile on my face. My first time was about 6 years ago when my now-boyfriend took me as our first date (I guess it worked). To be honest, I don't recall anything we ate that visit but the last 2 times my boyfriend and I went, we got the Tripe alla Fiorentina. If you enjoy tripe, I recommend trying it. The flavor was wonderful and the tripe was super tender with a crunch from the bread crumbs. 

Last time we got the Prosciutto Ravioli and Duck Pappardelle. The dish was nicely done and it was delicious. The pasta was al dente which my boyfriend is all about that so he was a happy camper. We finished the meal off with a Panna Cotta which was refreshing and creamy. This visit was also very memorable because a kind person ended up surprising us and paying for our meal...what!? Thank you whoever you are!

This time I got Gnocchi and my boyfriend got the Mint Tagliatelle. While the dish I order was good, I found myself eating off of my boyfriends dish more...ops?

Although the portions are relatively small, it is quite filling. Definitely suggest making reservations in advance!
author: Linda H.

description: 5:30 reservation on a Saturday night, we got there at 5:33 and there was already a line to get in. By 6:30 the place was packed! Definitely get a reservation to get into this place. Ordered Tartine Bakery baguette, grilled squid bean and frisée salad, spaghetti with tomatoes and the cuttlefish uni pasta. Everything was on point. The baguette was to die for and totally worth the $4 since I couldn't wait in line for an hour to buy it myself at Tartine Bakery and the house made butter paired so well with it. The salad was doused in delicious olive oil and seasoned perfectly. Both pastas were cooked perfectly but the spaghetti with tomatoes was definitely the winner (and I love seafood pasta). The servers were so attentive and were accommodating of our time limit and had the kitchen rush all of our dishes so that we could make our flight in time.
author: Yukari L.

description:
Every time I go to one of these trendy restaurants, I leave disappointed and hungry. Somehow, the hype never measures up and the portions just keep getting smaller. Truth be told, I was expecting the same disappointment from Delfina. Except, wait for it, I actually loved the meal and the entire experience.

We started with the calamari and white bean salad. I can't believe that before this dish, I thought all calamari was breaded and deep fried until it became rubbery. No more. The calamari in this salad was tender and perfectly grilled. Heck, I even agreed to eat some of the random salad leaves just 'cause I was so happy.

On to mains. The wifey had the highly-rated spaghetti and I had the special of the day, fresh pasta in a fennel saffron broth with rock shrimp. We had such high expectations for the spaghetti since everyone and their grandma rave about it on Yelp. But sadly, the spaghetti was just meh when compared to the special of the day pasta. The fennel saffron broth was delicious, the shrimp were cooked perfectly and the roasted tomatoes in the broth were awesome. In fact, the fresh pasta was just a blank canvas for all these great flavors.

We ended the meal with the blood orange panna cotta. Do not skip the panna cotta because it was definitely the best dish of the meal.

And before I forget, our waiter was awesome. The wifey asked him a bunch of ridiculous foodie questions and he was able to answer each one graciously. Oh, and he referred to the calamari as "legit" so he was clearly a hip foodie at heart.
author: Nadeem A.

description: I decided to try this place because it was on the Bib Gourmand recommended list. I had the fresh bread, swordfish, spaghetti, and a raspberry sorbet/parfait for dessert. I don't normally have their spaghetti but decided to try it since it was one of their signatures. It was good but something felt missing. Same with the swordfish, it was definitely very tender and fresh but I think more herbs and flavor is needed to take the dish to the next level. My favorite of the night was the fresh hot bread appetizer and the raspberry sorbet/parfait for dessert. I was wanting seconds and thirds for both :).
author: Kristin Y.

description:
One of my favorite Italian places in town (I like the restaurant better than the walk-in pizzeria) - this is one of our regular hang- out spots.

My favorite dishes are:

- grilled calamari appetizer (very tender slightly scorched on the outside) with soft small white beans. 
- tajarin (a bit thinner than spaghetti) with duck giblet ragu - like in Italy, the giblet is a complement to the pasta, chopped small and the flavor is amazing with the aged balsamic vinegar. 
- insalata is campo - farm to table. Flavorful and light dressing. A stable here. Like the parmaggiano cheese on top too. 
- spaghetti with double clam sauce (pasta cooked al dente with plenty of clams in shell or mixed in) 
- spaghetti bolognese (the Delfina tomato sauce is legendary)
- mackerel in saor - beautifully put together. The fish not too fishy. And the combination of the ingredients on this one is divine. 
- the rice pudding (light desert, not too sweet with the slightly sour raspberry compote and nutty pistacio).

Solid dishes:
Fried artichokes - a bit greasy - I prefer the steamed version of artichoke 

Chicken liver crostini - pretty good. The bread has a bit too much olive oil for my taste. 

For red wine by the glass, valdigue from Sonoma is our favorite currently. Good balance and medium - to - full body. Solid pairing for many of the food here. The rose brut is also a great way to start!

Skip the eggplant al forno - too salty. 

The service is always amazing here - witty and fun staff who is super friendly, playful, and attentive.  - make the dinner a fantastic experience. 

I liked delfina better than locanda during my last run of the two restaurants on food, even though both are formidable. 

later times -- 8.30pm-9.30pm are my favorite times at these restaurant to avoid rush hour. If you want to proper table, book ahead. Or otherwise you can walk in to get one of the stool high bar seats overlooking the tables (which is where we usually end up).
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Came for my birthday dinner and was definitely not disappointed. Only complaint was that the server was really aggressively pushing each guest to order beverages. However, when my husband's octopus dish came out waaay too oversalter, she quickly replaced the order and brought out free bread for us as well. What great service! 

Ordered the spaghetti in the larger portion and it was excellent. Perfectly al dente. Cousin also ordered the bucatini and she really enjoyed it.
author: Jacklyn L.

description: Fantastic first experience on date night. They seated the entire restaurant at 5:30 and got all of our food out fairly quickly considering. Tartine bread with cultured butter was superb for the 'Oh God I could eat the table hangry pains'. Calamari on exquisite tiny white bChard smothered in lemony goodness, Brussels sprouts with hazelnuts, and Risotto with crab were both superb there and the day after in the doggie bag.
author: Tim K.

description: If I could, I would fly to San Francisco just to eat pizza at Delfina and then go back home. Weekly. It is hands down the best Margherita pizza I've ever eaten!!! The crust is perfect and the sauce is incredible. Fresh basil + mozzarella. {Delfina restaurant not the pizzeria!!} They have sourdough bread from the bakery down the street, Tartine (yum). We didn't get dessert but I'm sure they are delicious. We headed across the street to bi-rite creamery for dessert (highly recommended).
author: Janell S.

description:
Delfina will forever hold a special place in me heart.  When I visited SF in 1999, Delfina had just opened and my friend had become friends with the couple who owned and ran this new restaurant at the time.  They were a sweet couple, and the husband was the chef and the wife the manager.  It was a good combo.  They came and hung out with us and were super friendly. It made a lasting impression that really hasn't been altered after many visits since then, and by many visits I mean many, many since I've never lived more than a block away that entire time!

I was blown away by the quality of the food then as a visitor but more importantly, it has remained that good in my mind even as I adjusted to raised expectations after living here now for eleven years.  They pretty much started the nuevo Italian cuisine movement in SF that has been copycatted so much since then.  Everything, and I mean everything, is really really good.  My standbys have always been their chicken and steak entrees, but whenever I've been in the mood for pasta, their creations don't ever disappoint.

Service is nearly impeccable, it's hard for me to think back to a bad experience there.  They're knowledgable about the wines and food without sounding pretentious.  

It's great to see them continue to do well after all these years, the dining room always full of happy customers and management never lapsing on quality or coasting on their reputation.  This is one of the best of the best and set a bar for the Mission which has rarely been met by many comers and goers the past 15 years.
author: Saminda W.

description:
Shocked I've never written a review. Let's change that.

This is our "go to" NYE dinner tradition.. at least for the past 2 years and this year as long as I can get a reservation.

Back to back years without realizing it until later, we've ordered the lobster spaghetti and hangar steak. Can't go wrong. The chicken main is also very good.

They usually offer a champagne flight on NYE as well - yum! Cheers to the new year!

Everything here is delicious and it's fun to try lots of the appetizers.  The atmosphere is so romantic and warm in the restaurant, great to dine for a date or dinner with friends.  

Hands down it's one of my favorite restaurants in town.
author: Melody T.

description: Always amazing food and fantastic service.  I have eaten here so many times and it is always wonderful.  Try it, you won't be disappointed!
author: Chere D.

description: Several people highly recommended Delfina in the Mission district to my foodie family while visiting San Fran. It was excellent. Many dishes featured unique yet tasteful ingredients. Recommend duck sugo. Bustling atmosphere, professional vibe, attentive service. One con: Long wait for food but worth the wait. Better suited for teens due to tight space.
author: Elizabeth N.

description: Quick update -- We came back on a weekday night and arrived about 20 minutes early but were pleasantly surprised that they were able to seat us  given how hungry we were. The service was excellent overall, and a big shot out to Dallas K who graciously pointed out all the vegetarian options on the menu efficiently and who did a great job throughout the entire dinner. We started with the Pamigiano Sformatino with sonoma coast porcinis, which was a creamy, rich, parmigiano custard/flan middle surrounded by perfectly cooked, soft and chewy porcinis in a rich sauce -- it was delicious and paired well with the tartine bread we ordered. We kept our mains simple and straightforward: The spaghetti was a hit yet again with my wife (bringing back childhood memories... so good!) and the tagliatelle with mint and artichokes was wonderful. Overall we had another positive experience here. We would order the pamigiano sformatino again (as well as the bread) and a large serving of the spaghetti -- depending on the other rotating vegetarian pasta, we would probably get that too.
author: T K.

description:
My experience here can be summed up as: good food with stellar service.

I came here with a party of five. We had a reservation for 9:30, and the place was still hopping when we arrived at around 9:10. Lucky for us, our table was already open and we got seated right away.

We must have been a pretty annoying table, because we had a lot of trouble deciding on our orders, and my mom had a fair share of special requests to the kitchen. Our server, Molly, was amazing. She was attentive, knowledgeable, and took our dithering and requesting with grace.

For the price, I'd rate the food an average value, not an great one. Like, it's very good--no question--but nothing really blew me away. As far as the appetizers, I actually really enjoyed the gnoccho fritto and prosciutto: it's basically little puffs of fried dough topped with prosciutto, which doesn't sound that impressive, but it was definitely greater than the sum of its parts. My entree was the beef cheek cappellietti, which was flavorful, if a bit salty; I probably wouldn't get it again. The brussels sprouts were very good, and I don't even like brussels sprouts.

Before I finish, I'll just reiterate that I was really impressed by the quality of the service, and give one more shout out to Molly. Huzzah huzzah
author: Greg P.

description:
Food: Freshly made pasta & risotto definitely makes a difference. The squash risotto was cooked perfectly and the creaminess of the sauce and subtle puree of the squash made it very smooth and full of flavor. The spaghetti was cooked well however the tomato sauce was a little tart, but when adding some crushed red pepper it balanced out the flavors.  For starters the roasted brussel sprouts with a balsamic reduction & hazelnuts was executed really well; the sprouts still had some firmness and the reduction was very well balanced. The Mahi entrée with Meyer lemon sauté, roasted fennel and fava beans was a great sharing dish. The Mahi was very tender which is usually not expected for that type of fish. Though the Meyer lemons were a little too aggressive eating them in small portions with the fish was a good pairing. Not a big fan of fennel but the chef was able to temper the licorice flavor. The fava beans were the second best thing on that dish.

Service: Really good service and the timing of the dishes were perfect for the amount of food ordered.

Ambiance: Sat in the bar area and it was less hectic then the main dining room; views of the kitchen and bar made it more interesting but overall it was a very lively place. Really clean bathrooms which are always a good sign.
author: Irwan A.

description: Amazing pasta! My tip is to go with multiple people and order a bunch of different pastas to share.
author: Sara S.

description: Excellent restaurant! Having gluten-free pasta is a great thing. Price is reasonable, so if I'm in the area next time, I will sure come back. :)
author: Haley M.

description:
this was one of the restaurants that came up a lot on my search for "what to eat in SF". i came here with 2 of my friends and even though we were late for our reservation and they were closing soon  we were still able to be seated. the hostess and the waitress were amazing and sweet. 

the decor was pretty rustic but looked gorgeous with the christmas lights that they had up. we were told that their spaghetti was "a must have" which we were all pretty disappointed because it tasted like... regular spaghetti. there was no wow factor and nothing extremely special about it.

i had ordered the quail dish and it was amazing! -minus the fact that it was overly salted. other than that, it was great. my friend ordered a beef tripe dish that came in a cast iron pan. it was also pretty exceptional for a non-asian beef tripe dish that i've ever had.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
I'm a bit of a LATE bloomer.

I didn't have my first bf until after I graduated high school. I didn't wake up with my first hangover until I was 26. I didn't attend my first concert until I was 27. And, I didn't discover my passion for writing until I started Yelping.

And look at me now...I romance the bottle and name liquor after men. I wake up on the weekends to mysterious bruises and false eyelashes stuck to my forehead. I've even thought about becoming an egg donor to support my Yelp addiction. A bunch of Cherylynns running around? For those that know me, they will tell you that's one scary thought not to be reckoned with.

SO, naturally it took me a while to visit the wildly popular, James Beard award-winning Delfina. Four years to be exact.

On a rainy Friday night, the parking gods was amongst us as we scored rockstar parking in front of Delfina (otherwise allot an extra 20-30 minutes for parking). Reservations are an absolute must.

F O O D (daily changing menu)
*CHICKEN LIVER RUSTICO ($4) - 5 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YqvoyaNvtoC8N5dA8pD2JA?select=okS1JB0_xLqrjaBsSkLGXg
Small bite. Explosive rich buttery flavor and luxurious texture. Worthy enough of four orders each devoured within one minute of arriving. 

*GRILLED FRESH CALAMARI w/ Warm Bean Salad ($11) - 4 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YqvoyaNvtoC8N5dA8pD2JA?select=ZIgPKZsbaa4hvI7n255MJw
The smoky grilled calamari's soft toothsome chew against the nutty white bean salad and the crisp, bitter frisée was like the fresh ocean sea meeting a country vegetable garden with a ray of sunshine.

*TRIPE ALLA FIORENTINA ($10) - 3.5 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YqvoyaNvtoC8N5dA8pD2JA?select=h5VnRDZSZ16yDAZjWwBaLQ
Like an Italian rendition of menudo, the tender tomatoey tripe stew was rustic, warm, and comforting.

*PAPPARDELLE PORK SUGO ($17) - 3 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YqvoyaNvtoC8N5dA8pD2JA?select=0e_3sIqKzlbz0tvYxF_AEA
Surprisingly, the most anticipated dish of the night was also the most disappointing. The perfectly al-dente noodles were scantily dressed in the pork ragu leaving too much naked skin. With just two measly pieces of pork, it felt like Christmas morning after finding black coals in my stocking. It's no wonder this was featured on the whacked 7x7 Big Eat list.

*MEYER LEMON BUTTERMILK PANNA COTTA w/ Huckleberries & Young Ginger ($9) - 4 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YqvoyaNvtoC8N5dA8pD2JA?select=sfYJk8sxOfXF7Vp448j6LQ
The custardy panna cotta was like fresh cream being kissed by a citrus lemon tree; so rich yet so refreshing.

S E R V I C E
Professional and refined; everything you would expect from a well-established business.

A M B I A N C E / D E C O R
Candle flames flickering through the dark shadows and intimate seating makes it perfect for a casual foodies night out.

P A R K I N G
Cab it.

Fresh. Simple. Rustic. That's Delfina. 

Worth the hype? I suppose. Just do NOT trust that whacked, money swindling, ankle-grabbing list that I speak of.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Was really excited to try Delfina finally with my boyfriend. Made a reservation for 8pm on a Thursday and we were seated promptly. Too bad our waitress had no idea what she was doing. We ordered bread, 2 pasta dishes, and a steak to share. The bread took 30 minutes and me asking twice for it to come out (even though they have it sitting on a counter ready to serve). Call me old fashioned, but if I'm paying $4 for some bread (and also commenting on how hungry I am while ordering it), it should probably come out in less than 10 minutes.

The pasta was delicious. That part I thoroughly enjoyed. We ordered the spaghetti and gnocchi with ragu and both were outstanding. After we finished our pasta, we waited for the steak. And waited. And waited. Some of the servers kept giving us weird looks, and finally a different waitress gave us the dessert menu. I think they had changed shifts in the middle of our dinner but not given us any notice. Very unprofessional for what was a $50/person dinner.

We told the waitress we were expecting more food, had a waiter bring us food we didn't order, and waited again. Finally, around 9:45 (our dinner started at 8, mind you), we got our steak, except it was ultra rare, despite having ordered medium rare. Clearly it was forgotten, tossed on the grill and rushed to us in a hurry, basically inedible. By that time we were too tired to cause a fuss, and left the steak mostly uneaten.

Overall: amazing pasta; horrible experience with service.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Get the panna cotta.

Also - the service is really good.
author: Andrew K.

description: A must go to every time I come to San Francisco. The pasta is amazing and the service and ambiance always make me feel at home. My children live in the Bay Area now so this is where we always have our first meal when I visit and we are all back together.
author: Eric B.

description:
Book a table in advance to avoid disappointments. We didn't, but we were lucky enough to be seated at the bar. Pleasant atmosphere and decor, though the lighting was very dim as most of these dining areas usually are. Ordered the bread, grilled calamari, roasted quail and parpadelle with duck sugo. Everything was exquisitely made and there were always interesting textures and flavors on the dish. Bread was great, Parpadelle was nicely au dente and very rich. The Calamari was beautiful, Quail was awesome and juicy! 
Taking of one star for heavy handedness with the salt in most of the dishes.
author: Zeslyn L.

description:
Good Italian food in a fun setting.  My friends began with the sea bass conserva appetizer (poached sea bass pureed and spread on crostini) and the olive oil tasting (one type of olive oil from Sardinia and the other from Sicily).  Both were great.

I had the squid appetizer and the green salad (insalata di campo) as my entree, and enjoyed both.  Salad had pancetta and flavorful mixed greens.  My friends had the spaghetti and the chicken agnoletti (sp?) and enjoyed them too.  Good drinks too -- we had the bellini, prosecco, vermouth.  Interior is a bit loud, but definitely lively.
author: Amanda M.

description: Love the pasta here, especially the fact that you can have half order of any pasta. Perfect for people like me who always want to try different dishes in one meal. Therefore, I ended up tasting 2 pastas: simple tomato spaghetti and duck pappardelle. Both are great, and I like their pasta being a bit harder and more chewy than average. Plus the ambiance is great! Perfect for an intimate dinner date.
author: Yuhuan T.

description: Very authentic Italian pizza restaurant, I had the margarita pizza I wanted to play it safe on my first time being there. I really enjoyed and their fresh lemonade was also great.
author: Myles W.

description:
When my three best friends came to visit me in San Francisco, I knew where I had to take them and how right was I! We had 7 people in our party and everyone loved their food. Here is the breakdown of what my boyfriend and I had:

Warm olives - very mild flavor, won't offend those who normally dislike olives
Grilled calamari in bean salad - delicious every time, the texture of the calamari crossed with the soft, warmness of the bean salad is a match made in heaven
Scallops - WOW, by far the best dish I've had at Delfina to-date. The scallops are perfectly done, the sauce is rich and inviting and the mashed potatoes are creamy.
Spaghetti with lobster - the pasta was very fresh-tasting and the lobster was perfectly done
Panna cota with rhubarb - I don't normally order panna cotta, but the waitress highly recommended it. I'm glad I did - the flavor of the sweet (caramel?) panna cotta with the tangy/sour rhubarb was surprising yet familiar. 

I'd also like to comment on the service, which was wonderful. We called in about 3 hours before our reservation to add 2 people to our party. They told us that they will try and would let us know if that was possible. Lo-and-behold, 2 hours later, they called us and told us that we were all set. Once we arrived at the restaurant, we were promptly seated. Our server was very knowledgable and gave us excellent suggestions. 

Delfina has been one of my favorite SF restaurants for a while now and it looks like that's not about to change.
author: Liza K.

description:
Come here for the food! When the server first came to the table, he wasn't the most eloquent as he explained the restaurant doesn't have real specials since the menu changes every night. But just use the day's menu & ingredients to find what you want. 

Best dish: Spaghetti! I think this is a constant on their menu and it is absolutely delicious!! Other bright points: Grilled Monterey Bay Calamari (it has a layer of warm bean salad on the bottom with a tangy vinaigrette on greens in the middle) and Insalata di Campo. 

One thing I'm a stickler though for: an Italian restaurant that doesn't give your table bread. :( However, the Tartine bread that you can get for $4 is SO GOOD. Moist and warm on the inside. No wonder they charge. Definitely order it to accompany your meal. Overall the meal was delicious and very affordable, which is a great combo!
author: Jennifer K.

description: Delicious dinner and very attentive service. For a restaurant that has been open 18 years Delfina has not lost it spark. Stand out dish was the short rib cappelletti, followed by the beet salad. Atmosphere was lively and it was clear everyone in the room was having a great time. Sharing multiple dishes among friends is the way to go.
author: Alex M.

description: Great food and great atmosphere. Loved our waiter...he made the night.. Menu is hard to read in that without the waiters explanation I would not have known what to order. But our meals were delicious
author: R G.

description:
Delfina has a reputation in SF, and so I had set my expectations pretty high.  Last night I visited for the first time with a few friends.  We didn't have reservations, and we were expecting to wait a while, but we were sat immediately in the bar area at a table.  We ordered a number of plates to share, and followed the recommendations of our server, Sara.

Wine: bottles are a bit pricy, they start at about 60$, but the wine list has some really nice choices.  we settled on a grenache, it was lovely.  Really romantic huge wine glasses, too.  Love those.

Service:  Perfect.  Server was really knowledgable and all of her recommendations were spot on.  Other servers were always around to pick up an empty plate,too.  We were sat right next to the kitchen and it was interesting to watch all the chefs working.  We got the feeling that this is an extremely efficient and professional staff.

Food:  I am not a huge italian food fan, but I was really impressed with the dishes.  Chicken liver skewers were one of my faves, as well as the calamari.  Every other small plate we had was very balanced, well designed, and perfectly prepared.  The star of the show was obviously the pasta, though.  The gnocchi were AMAZING, like delicious little pillows in a crazy good meat sauce.

Thanks for the amazing dinner, Delfina!  Your reputation for top notch italian food is well deserved!
author: CC C.

description: OMG this place is awesome!  In the middle of Mission, you definitely need reservations for this small restaurant establishment.  The spaghetti and sauce is flavorful and fresh.  I had the gluten free spaghetti which was amazing.  We also had salad and the roasted chicken- yum!  Finally, the coconut panacotta was INCREDIBLE!  I highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Amy C.

description: First of all, let me just say that their pasta is amazing. BUT we had to send back both the calamari and the pork ribs because they were WAY too salty. I would recommend the pastas but none of the meats or even the the veggie/bean sides because they were so salty that I couldn't even eat them.
author: Samantha J.

description: Excellent food for the value. Delfina certainly tops my list of one of the most favorite places to dine at. We started off with the Grilled Calamari, which was oh so good! It comes with a white bean salad that is equally as delicious. For dinner my GF and I ordered the classic spaghetti. She was a pescatarian so we were very limited with our options. I am def looking forward to trying more of their pastas.
author: Shana B.

description:
I would give 5 stars for the food, 1 star for the service. 

Food for thought: We overheard the table next to us say "We can probably get better service at the Olive Garden"

I made reservations for a Saturday night for my boyfriend's birthday. We got there right on time, had a beautiful table right by the window, and the ambience and decor of Delfina are absolutely beautiful. When we checked in with the host, I made a quick note with her that it was my boyfriend birthday. I also mentioned it at the time I made the reservation. It was a bit annoying on my part, but it was a special day and I wanted it to go well.

Our server was super personable and gave great recommendations on what to order. We started with the tartine bread which was amazing. My boyfriend had the mint tagiatelle and I had the spaghetti. When the server asked if I wanted parmesan, I clearly said "none for me, thank you" and she proceeded to put cheese on my plate! I was so confused and shocked. I don't eat dairy, and when my boyfriend asked if I could get a new plate, she said it would take another 20 minutes. So my boyfriend scooped up the top portion of my spaghetti and ate it. It was just a mess, and clearly a mistake that could have been so easily avoided. However, the spaghetti was the best spaghetti I have ever had in my entire life. The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente, the sauce had the perfect amount of richness and tartness.

Furthermore, during our entire dinner, our server was nowhere to be seen. He never once came to check how we were going or if we needed anything else. On top of that, no one ever came to clear off the plates. Our plates and utensils from our appetizer crowded the table even when our entrees came out. Nothing was cleared until we were finished with our dinner. We ordered our desserts, and as I mentioned twice already that we had a birthday, when our desserts came out, there was no inclination of birthdays. Yes, I understand that this is an upscale restaurant and I'm not asking for anything free or with a blaring candle on top, but I have never been to a place that doesn't even do something a little extra? Plus I had read reviews that this place was so accommodating for birthdays and really made people feel special with dessert and service. When the host walked by she realized this, and I saw her speak to our server while looking at our table and in half-assed effort, he brought out this disgusting drink for us as a "birthday treat" after we were already finished with our entire meals and our dessert. We couldn't even swallow the drink it was horrible.

All in all, we tried our best to enjoy our time here. It was a beautiful evening and the food was great, but the service was upsetting.
author: Angie S.

description:
Remains one of my favorite restaurants in the country.  And as I've said before: awe-inspiringly consistent.  On this visit, a main of duck breast was one of the best things I have ever eaten.

Service, which has always been scattershot, seems to have gotten a bit worse.  Like we felt other tables were getting things we didn't: like bread, for instance, or a bit of something that looked like homemade nougat with dessert.  They also used to do better with their beer and wine by the glass menu.
author: Mike B.

description:
Just had dinner there this Saturday and it was the worst experience ever!  
1 - once seated, the first statement/question was - are you going to want bread because we're almost out?!!!  WHAT?
2 - 20 minutes before our order was taken - not only were they almost out of bread, but they were out of quite a bit- my 1st and then 2nd choice were out(the root vegetable soup and the little gem salad)  I ordered the spaghetti.
3- others that arrived and ordered long after we did were served first(maybe the waitress forgot to place our order, but she never thought to check on us either)
4- Spaghetti was horrible -Chef Boyardee would have been better - after leaving, we next door for the pizza- which is fantastic - could have saved time and money by just going there
author: Marie S.

description:
After hearing about Delfina for months on end, I was finally able to try it last night. It was a rainy day so we lucked out in getting a table immediately without a reservation. We got a high-top table seated next to the bar which seemed fine at first but I honestly wish we waited to get a normal table. After a while the area got crowded and I started feeling uncomfortable when people were obviously waiting for a table to be seated at so just staring at us eating...

Decor: It was soo nice inside. Definitely classy without being uptight. The lighting is on the dimmer side which makes for a nice romantic date setting. There was some interesting artwork that I had a good laugh with a waitress about.

Service: Everyone there is reallyy friendly but service could be faster. When ordering we asked our waitress for a couple more minutes to decide but she disappeared for a bit and didn't end up coming back for at least another 10 minutes. I suppose it's better than constantly being pestered if we were ready to order. Another thing that bugged me was that the girl at the front door in charge of seating kept looking around at the tables to see how far along people were/when they would leave. Maybe since we were closer to her I noticed it more but still she could have been more subtle about it. 

Food: 
[Antipasti]
~Grilled Monterey Bay Calamari: Served on a bed of white bean and only a few leaves. Wasn't much of a "salad". The white bean was a good offset to the calamari which was good...but lacked much flavor. I also didn't enjoy that it felt kind of charred and bitter. 

[Primi]
~Spaghetti: Overall very simple dish with plum tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, and basil. It was tasty and felt like comfort food but didn't have anything special about it.
~Rosemary Tagliatelle: With a ground hen ragu. Very very good! It was a bit on the salty side but definitely tasty.

[Dessert]
~Crema di Chocolate: STOLE THE SHOW. It made up for any fault we had with the rest of the meal. It's hard to explain what it was but it felt like a mix of mousse and fudge. The chocolate was such a smooth consistency topped with a cream and served with espresso gelato on the side. Definitely save room to try this!

Not really sure I would keep coming back but overall a good experience. Wish they have the option to order pizza from next door though!
author: Alysha F.

description: The spaghetti stole the show by far.  We also had the ravioli that we loved, but felt the thick noodle dish with pork was too salty.  Great service and wine selection.
author: Camille C.

description:
Always without fail, very delicious. Duck Sugo pappardelle deserves a mention!

My best tip is, if you're like me and am very impromptu about things, get there by 5;10, and wait in line til they open at 5:30. We've always been able to get the first seating, and there's time left after dinner to run across the street and get some bi-rite ice-cream. Two birds with one stone!
author: rebecca c.

description:
Delfina. You are delicious are lively with knowledgable wait staff, fantastic food, and a buzzing and authentic SF ambience. I can't believe it took me 4.5 years of living here to enjoy your perfection.  

We went with a group of 6 last weekend for a wedding anniversary. Definitely make reservations in advance, especially if you have a big group. 

The location is just a block from the renowned Delores park. This area is about as legit as it gets in the city. 

Bread comes from the best bakery in the world, tartine, which is just a few stores down. Eat it. Just not too much that you can't indulge on everything else - because you'll want to. 

There's a great wine list with a range of prices and our waiter was both passionate and knowledgable about the selection. We picked a Pinot that was great. I can never remember wine!

For apps we did a peach, prosciutto and toasted Parmesan plate. The combination was filled with items we had observed earlier at the farmer's market and was super fresh and a refreshing mash of flavors. We also got calamari which came with some type of fava bean salad - also good. 

For pasta we picked the gnocchi with a meat sauce. I'd never had this convo before but it was perfect. Every flavor and every bite. 

The entrees were equally brilliant. The chicken is prepped for days and you can feel the love that has gone into it. The pork was juicy and huge. Side of mashed potatoes - I could eat this every day. We also got some sort of steak that I didn't get to but heard it was also fab. Even the fries were perfectly elevated from the norm with crispness and fresh herbs. 

For dessert we got a sampling: rice pudding with fried quinoa and berries, lemon panna cotta, and three types of gelato in an ice cream cake type form. The rice pudding was my favorite but they were all good. 

Expensive, but we went all out since it was a celebration and it was worth every penny. 

Can't wait to come back soon.
author: Aggie N.

description:
I was very excited to visit Delfina on a recent Saturday evening. My guest and I arrived a few minutes before 9:30pm (our reservation time) and were immediately seated. However, we were not greeted by a server for 15 minutes. 

We were told about a couple of specials, but not given much more advice. When it came time to order, we did, and I ordered bread with my Italian meal. I was told - for real - that they were "out of bread." I asked the server to double check on that. She ultimately returned with 1/9 of a loaf of bread (3 tiny pieces) and some butter.

 Our waitress was very curt with us, and dare I say it, both rude and cocky.

The two pastas we ordered didn't taste homemade, and had very little flavor. Specifically, my pasta, with duck, had two tiny pieces of the bird in it and was in a brown flavorless sauce. My dining partner's pasta had a little bit of mint flavor and that was it - no sauce at all. 

We couldn't bear ourselves to stick around for dessert after such a horrid exerience.

When the waitress presented our check, she said, "Don't worry, I only charged you for the butter." #facepalm #sheesh #CustomerService101

This was by far the WORST meal I have ever eaten in San Francisco. Either our waitress was a "startup founder" who thought she was too good to be serving us, or SF customer service has seriously declined in recent years, because this experience was horrid. 

Next time, I'll eat at a food truck.
author: Stephen M.

description: Every time I came to San Francisco I need go eat in Delfina...everything is wonderful,the food was very tasting,I was seated at the bar and the weather always so nice,always smiling I don't remember the name but I love the place,I love the food!!!I'm Italian and I love pasta....and in Delfina the Pasta is the Top!!!!!I will came again and again. ...'!!!
author: Anna D.

description: My favorite Italian restaurant in SF! Wait staff is great at helping choose a wine and explain the different dishes. The tomato sauce is perfect, and be sure to get the calamari appetizer.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Went back after some times, definitely lost his magic.
Food was just ok, kind of tasteless, service was nice, pleasant
author: Mina O.

description:
OMG!!!! The pasta in this restaurant was so amazingly delicious that my husband and I went for seconds and then came back one more time during our trip to San Fran. After eating such good pasta here, it's difficult to go to other places where usually the pasta is sub par even if they advertise their pasta as being 'home made' and 'al dente'. After eating at Delfina it has been certainly difficult to eat pasta anywhere else!

There was a bit of a wait, but understandable since the food in this place is totally worth it!!! 

Can't wait to go back to San Fran just to eat there!!!
author: Carla D.

description:
What happened to this place? It used to be so good.....  Terrible meal last night very salty, gummy pasta....blah,blah, blah.
The best part of the meal was the bread, and that's from Tartine.....
Hopefully it will get back to what it used to be, otherwise to many other good options to choose from.
author: Roberto B.

description:
Delfina is one of my favorite spots in SF. Been coming here on & off for 15 years, and it never disappoints. I've celebrated birthdays, anniversaries, or solo grub. It's a great location, away from the hustle and bustle of Mission Street and the ambiance is chill. 

Arrived on a Friday with a party of 4, was seated immediately by the friendly hostess. Our table was along the street window near the side door so we caught the breeze (lovely). Our serve Katey was on point: friendly, upbeat, provided recommendations, and attentive when needed. Even the other servers and food runners were friendly when they came to our table and provided food description each time (nice touch, I notice things like that). I could elaborate on each dish we had, but the list would be too long. Suffice to say, we ate like kings & queens with bellies full & happy, and the wine... woah, thanks Katey for the recommendation: Fumin 2010 from Liguria region was outstanding & complimented our 3rd course perfectly. Thanks Delfina, looking forward to the next visit.
author: chennie c.

description: Took my mom here for Mother's Day and Delfina totally took care of her! On top of an already spectacular meal, they presented my mom with a free Bellini and sent her home with some shortbread cookies. Thanks for being awesome Delfina!
author: Marissa B.

description:
Fortunate to nab their last (Saturday eve) 5:30p reservation online, as we arrived just minutes before their open. 

I enjoyed my main dish (the quail) and my husband the spaghetti. My salmon belly appetizer and his salad were just OK, "nothing to write home about" as my mother would say. 

Our waiter was very thorough in running down the vegetarian options with my husband. Attentive service.

The atmosphere is fun, festive, and light, and reminds you that you are in a very special place.
author: Camille L.

description: The best Italian food I've had in the US. The wait was shorter for two people than they told us so we just hung out at tarting. Best spaghetti I've ever had. Their bread and butter you have to pay for but worth it, was awesome. Tripe fish amazing. Calamari cooked to perfect tenderness, prob was my favorite. Need to go place
author: Linn L.

description:
I'm gonna have dreams about that spaghetti pomodoro... 

It was silky perfection with its bright red sauce that featured the tomatoes-oh-just-taste-these-tomatoes. The best part was probably the good-quality olive oil that coated the pasta and left a beautiful sheen on my plate. It was the most simple, yet delicious spaghetti I have ever had. I hope I'll be able to re-create it at home. 

We were seated right away because we had reservations. However, our server took forever to greet us. Actually, she took forever with everything (getting our waters, taking our orders, etc). I am not sure if it was because she was busy or spacey, but she could've been more attentive. I can't bring myself to dock a star, however, because that spaghetti was just so darn amazing. Did I mention the perfect amount of basil? The sheen of olive oil? Oh, well, even if I did, there it is again. It. Was. Just. That. Delightful. 

The grilled calamari, Tartine bread, and bellini weren't half bad either ;)
author: Christine N.

description: The pasta at Delfina is wonderful, as always. However, the service has gone far downhill from its glory days.  The waiter who took our order managed to insult both my guest (when she asked a question about the beer list) and me (when I asked a question about the bread).  The only good thing the waiter did was to never return to our table after we ordered.  Delfina--you could be so much better if you hired back all of your old waiters...they were so much better than the current lot.  Until then, two stars.  It's good pasta, but not worth dealing with the bad service.
author: Ryan L.

description: Both my boyfriend and I got terrible food poisoning after eating the roast chicken from this establishment. Didn't figure out it was the chicken until he ate my left overs the next day and we were able to narrow down what got us both sick. Will never eat here again and plan on telling every one else I know the same thing.
author: Lily G.

description: Delfina I wanted to like you so much! The servers were very nice but our entree came out an hour and a half after we sat down. When dinner finally arrived it was so salty it was barely edible. Definitely not worth the price.
author: Nicole T.

description:
This might be one of the easiest 5 star reviews I have ever written. Ever. 

My boyfriend and I came in on a Monday night and there was a wait of about 25 minutes, which was not as bad as I thought it would be.  The service was outstanding and our waitress, Katie, was extremely helpful to help us decipher the menu.  Now, on to my favorite part of the night - the food...

Starters:
  * Warm olives: simply delicious
  * Brentwood corn sformatino, with mussels, cherry tomatoes, and chilis: This was a recommendation of our waitress and it was very delicious and unique.  The corn sformatino is similar to a souffle or mousse and tasted divine along with the mussels.

Mains:
  * Spaghetti, with plum tomatoes, garlic, extra virgin olive oil, and peperoncini: Simple, yet absolutely amazing. They make their spaghetti in-house and you will definitely be able to taste its freshness.
  * Grilled Bodega Bay Albacore, with peperonata and olivada: This fish was tender and tasted great with the olivada (olive tapenade).    

Sides (Contorni):
  * Zucchini Ripieno, with ricotta and squash blossoms: Out of this world. Enough said.

Dessert:
  * Panna Cotta, chamomile infused, with pluots:  Creamy and delicate, as expected.
  * Chocolate Marquise, chocolate mousse, tuaca (vanilla/citrus liqueur), flourless chocolate cake, espresso, granita:  One of the servers, Jay, recommended this dessert for us to try, and I am SO happy we took his recommendation.  Don't get me wrong, the panna cotta was great, but this chocolate dessert easily takes the cake.  My taste buds could not even fathom how delicious it was.  

Overall, definitely order:
 - the spaghetti
 - the zucchini side
 - the chocolate dessert

Can't wait to go back!

Tip: Delfina is constantly changing their menu, so these dishes might not be served exactly how I describe them.  For example, I think they are now serving the sformatino with shrimp instead of mussels - but I'm sure everything is delicious no matter how they serve it!
author: Juliana K.

description: The ahi tuna was incredible. The whit beans and spices that accompanied the fish were incredible. I also loved the prosciutto and spiced carrots.
author: Bryson W.

description:
Finally came here to eat, but left a little disappointed as I wasn't too impressed.  I'd say it's overrated.

Made reservations a few weeks in advance.  Apparently, they only take reservations for up to 6 people and since we had 6 adults + 1 toddler, the staff advised that they needed manager approval.  A couple days later, she called me back to inform me that the manager approved.  I hoped so as it's only an extra toddler!  

We had an early dinner seating for 5PM.  The place was very casual and not very big.  For starters, we had the Grilled Calamari Salad along with a salad with porcini mushrooms.  The grilled calamari with white bean ragout was tasty, but the salad with porcini mushrooms was simple, nothing fancy.

For dinner, most of us ended up ordering pasta.  I decided to try their famous spaghetti.  It was perfect portion for me although quite small compared to other restaurants.  Since their spaghetti is cooked in the sauce, it reminded me of Japanese style spaghetti.  It was a simple dish as well as there was no protein, but it was good.  Pasta was cooked al dente.  Also, enjoyed the Barbera D'Alba red wine.  
My husband had the bigoli, which was pretty good.  

All in one, it was a decent meal, but not worth it to make another trip from SJ.  Next time, I'll have to go next door to their Pizzeria, which more people rave about.
author: Erica S.

description: We had been waiting for 45 min for a table at 8:30 in the night and the head maitre d refused to seat us because it was "company policy" that if we ordered some food, then kicked us out because she would rather see the table empty than give it to us! I felt like she was on a power trip rather than using basic common sense and being a normal person. The last time that my friends and I are ever going to eat here. Sucks because I genuinely like the food, it's ahole folks like her that give the restaurant a bad name!
author: Deepika Y.

description:
Beyond incredible!  I came with a group of 4 people this past Saturday.  EVERYTHING we had was outstanding.  The service was stellar and prompt.  I read the recent poor reviews and couldn't disagree more.  We had some of those same items others complained about.  All I can say is that those people that have poorly reviewed this spot don't know fine food and cuisine when it smacks them in the face. And to those that complained about portions....must not eat at restaurants of this caliber.
