Witness the nettle tagliatelle, with pine nuts and nettle puree. 

Some dishes are hearty, like the gremolta-topped short ribs, while others riff on lightness -such as the halibut with melted leeks and meyer lemon caper butter. 

I've been next door to the Pizzaria plenty of times, but this place is definitely amazing. Make reservations or be prepared for a long wait.
author: Ty T.

description: The spaghetti was al dente and perhaps undercooked. Nothing particularly flavorful about it. The mint pasta with mushrooms lacked any deep flavor. Appetizers were good but I prefer fried calamari . Great desserts - those were 5 star. Overall this place did not knock my socks off but was ok . I give it a good solid 3-4 stars.
author: Lynn E.

description:
Cute intimate spot found in the mission with a super long wait if you don't have reservations. Definitely recommend reseys before coming here. The food on the other hand was very good! I loved the variety of items on the menu. Not just your standard pastas
Cant wait to come back!
author: Natasha I.

description: Really really really good pizza. I forgot all my troubles when I chomped into one of their pizzas. I finished the pizza in one sitting by myself. Fresh ingredients, dough made in house from what I can tell. :) LOOOOve this place. One of these days, I might try their pasta but it would be hard to let go of another chance at their pizzas. :)
author: Brian P.

description:
Soooo delicious, if 4.5 stars were possible that's what I would give!

Started with castelvetrano olives and brussel sprouts. I would've preferred the olives more plain; they were in a yummy spicy lemon sauce but it overwhelmed the olives a bit. The brussel sprouts however were AMAZING! Flavorful and not bitter at all without being overcooked/burnt. 

For entrees we had the spaghetti and hay & straw pastas. The spaghetti was simple but incredibly flavorful- if you like more simple pastas this would be the one to get! The hay and straw was also delicious, more of a hearty spinachy garlicky flavor. 

The dessert was the best part - the apple spiced donuts were hands down the best dessert I've ever had!!! Sweet and cinnamony with a fluffy texture and an amazing creamy dip that I took a few sips of afterward :D
author: Jackie C.

description: A little loud and crowded but the amazing service and great food made up for it!   My husband did not like the beer he ordered and they immediately brought him another and took it off the bill.  This was above and beyond service because there was nothing wrong with the beer it was just not his taste.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
We have just returned from Italy and have been there eating for the past 10 years. So, to be fair, this was Californian-Italian and we can't compare apples to oranges. 

Delfina, after all its hype, was good. Not earth shattering but good. They do liken themselves to a true Italian place. Waitstaff don't waste any time correcting you should you mispronounce anything. ( obviously my 2 years of recent Italian lessons proved more helpful only in Italy!)

The minestrone pancake was only interesting hype. This was the contents of minestrone soup roughed chopped with stale bread, formed into a large patty and fried. Meh. A soggy mess of nothin'. Disappointing and didn't taste good even.

The pastas did shine. Their signature spaghetti was good. Sauce a tad sweet. Could have done without the lemon rind on top. The short rib cappelletti was delicious, tender and luscious sitting in its sticky sauce. The best dish. The Paccheri with rockfish was ok. The pasta itself was good. The sauce was ok. The small little bits of fish were tasteless and odd, in my opinion. 

The grilled Monterey squid served on fagioli was very good. The squid was grilled just right and tasted almost as sweet as the ones we just had in Venice. 

We liked the rose flight we had. Each pour varied in size depending on the server who came to pour! 

We skipped dessert and went to the Bi-Rite Creamery for ice cream. We might be back but not for awhile.
author: Natalie C.

description: Absolutely stunning, we went nuts here and tried the calamari and the octopus for starters. The octopus was gorgeously tender. For mains we tried the spaghetti which was delicious, the sauce was perfect. We also had the tripe for mains which had a good kick to it and was nothing like what we expected. Then rather than dessert we tried the quail with pork sausage and polenta which was really tasty and the bits of sausage and polenta helped make it such a memorable dish. For drinks we started of with prosecco and finish with a bottle of Pinot noir from Northern California. The service was attentive and gracious. We are quite young but we're not treated any differently which was a great change. All in all a wonderful dinner!
author: Audrey W.

description: Finally ate here, and this place definitely lives up to the hype.  They lose a star because our tomato burrata salad hardly had any burrata...about a quarter of a golf ball size.  It was as if they tried to remove it and then missed a piece.  It was disappointing considering that was the whole reason we ordered the dish!  Luckily the papperdelle was excellent.  The ribollito (I'm not spelling it right) thing which was an antipasti was also good...tastes like fall, if seasons had flavors.  And the panna cotta was very nice.
author: Debbie L.

description: Delicious as always, and very friendly and down-to-earth service.  Delfina is a personal favorite of ours for years now.  Their desserts are also so yummy!
author: Grace K.

description: I ate at Delfina with a group of friends on Sunday, September 12, 2016. My primary concern was the restaurant lost our reservation due to their own mistake, and they forced us to wait for an opening. For anyone interested in eating at Delfina's, please note the restaurant has a history of losing reservations. Additionally, their employees are unconcerned with their mistake.
author: Sean G.

description:
Absolutely adorable atmosphere with fantastic staff!

First time on the west coast and we went here after I landed and got to the mission.

Excellent wine selection in which the staff provided an excellent recommendation based on our taste preferences.

I personally had the Wolfe Ranch Quail which was phenomenal, highly recommended!
author: Sean M.

description:
Small. Intimate. Loud. No available parking spots.  Waited, with a reservation, for an additional 30 minutes. 

... Doesn't matter. 

The food is unbelievable. Having just spent a week in Paris, it had a lot to live up to. My wife and I shared a pasta plate for appetizer, plus the Duck and chicken entrees. Every bite was perfect. I will be going to here for years to come.
author: Christopher M.

description:
WOW, 

The calamari here is out of this world. Not the fried crap you get in bars. This was a whole squid that melted in your mouth with a great sauce. It was light, and not fishy at all.

The wine list was great, we had the wine flights which gave us a good sample of 3 great wines. Everyone's main dish was excellent and we shared everything. My favorite was the Pork Saltimbocca.

It can be a little challenging reading the menu, because everything is in Italian, so ask your server for help.

We barley got a 5:30 reservation here on a Saturday so book it early!
author: Mike H.

description:
Wow, an excellent restaurant.  I would place them in the top 5 among the casual 'affordable' dining places (excludes fine dining places like Gary Danko, The Dining Room at Ritz, etc.).

To new Yelpers: When a restaurant approaches 300 reviews, there is something special about that place, so don't mind the seemingly average 4 out of 5 Star average rating.  In Yelp, it is very difficult to maintain 4.5 or 5.0 Star average with over 300 reviews (with some exceptions like Little Star Pizza http://www.yelp.com/biz/__I9HmtBMV4dDkEgT22V4g , Kokkari http://www.yelp.com/biz/PsY5DMHxa5iNX_nX0T-qPA , and Gary Danko http://www.yelp.com/biz/WavvLdfdP6g8aZTtbBQHTw as of May 2007).  

* Of course, if you sell hotdogs on the street at 2 AM, you'll easily maintain 5 Star average. http://www.yelp.com/biz/89lcibUju_4PqUrZ10w71w

RESERVATION: This restaurant is HOT, HOT, HOT!  Maybe it will cool down, but as of spring 2007, reservations during reasonable dinner hours were fully booked for 1.5 weeks, even during weekdays.

SEATS:  A decent size restaurant.  The main dining area to the left had 20-25 tables and 8-10 counter seats.  These counter seats overlook the dining area.  The room to the right housed the bar (6-8 seats), food staging area, and 4 tables.  The heated and covered patio area had 8-10 tables.  Overall, tables were places fairly close together.

FOOD:  I found their dishes to be good for sharing.  Take for example, Roasted Fulton Valley chicken, an excellent dish I ordered thanks to Ed U.'s review.  Portion size was half of a chicken, which I could have eaten by myself, but I would have been chickened out.  It complemented well with a completely different flavor provided by Spaghetti with plum tomatoes.  Texture and elasticity of their spaghetti was so perfect.   

PRICE:  Considering the food quality, excellent service, and good atmosphere, I thought the bill was reasonable, around $40 per person with wine.
  
$12 Stretched mozzarella
$11 Spaghetti with plum tomatoes (large)
$18 Roasted Fulton Valley chicken
$23 Half bottle of wine
$17 Tip and taxes
------------------------------
$80 for two people
author: トモ T.

description: Are there more than five stars?  This place never disappoints. I have been coming here for over 15 years including the years before I even moved to San Francisco.  it is consistently serving delicious food from the freshest ingredients around. Service is always Stellar and the wine selections are amazing.  They know how to treat their regular customers and that is always appreciated. I have also had amazing experiences at the pizzeria and Locanda.
author: JEFF B.

description:
Delfina has been a bookmark of mine forever so I was really excited to finally eat here! I made reservations a week in advance but still the only two time slots available were 5:30 or 9:30. I took the 9:30 slot but when the day came the bf and I were way too hungry to wait til 9:30. We went to delfina expecting a huge wait at 8, but thankfully there wasn't a huge crowd. The wait was about 20-25 minutes. 

We ordered the insalata salad, the chicken, spaghetti and panna cotta. Bread is also offered, but only by request. The bread is really good so for sure ask for some! 

The salad was good. Dressing was light and also had huge pieces of shaved Parmesan. Very nice touch. The spaghetti was really fresh and nice texture. The chicken was juicy and soft. But the star of the meal was the panna cotta! It was a passion fruit, mango, coconut panna cotta and I devoured every last bite. It was delicious! Highly recommend saving room for dessert. 

Overall good first time and although their menu isn't the largest I would definitely come back again.
author: Jackie M.

description: Another fantastic supper at one of our favorites. Grilled Monterey Calamari with white beans, house cured smoked salmon, simple and elegant spaghetti, tagliatelle in a Liberty duck ragu, grilled swordfish with citrus. All perfect. This place has the best tuned in service too. Perfect timing and flawless.  Never disappoints.
author: Darryl K.

description: Just simply amazing place ! Food is so delicious ! Everything taste so good ! As good as it gets . Service , quality , great ambience .
author: Prayank J.

description: We were fans of this restaurant because of experience in Palo Alto but in trying to book a birthday dinner at the Mission, SF restaurant the receptionist lady on the phone was so RUDE, we'll never recommend this place to anyone.  Sounds like they are getting really full of themselves!  TOO many great choices in SF to put up with that!!
author: Myn D.

description: Lovely experience from the start. Host and server were very pleasant and helpful. We were celebrating 2 birthdays which they made special for our daughters. Everything was delicious the chicken, tuna, papardelle for entrees. Would definitely recommend.
author: Leslie H.

description: Super great service and food.  I would definitely return.  Came with my family.  Spaghetti is insane....just order it regardless.
author: Travis P.

description:
A delicious and emblematic San Francisco institution, and clearly the Yelp community/broader internet agrees. 

They are somehow missing the cool factor, though, as there was one too many tables with kids.  

We loved this place and I'd give it five stars if they could just ramp up the hipness a smidge.
author: Dan B.

description:
Two stars for attempts to make it right and adjusting our bill. Still, the food is what going to a restaurant is all about. 

Drinks:
Cocktails - decent selection. 
Beers - run of the mill crap. No craft beers. No surprises. 
Wine - if you like big full-bodied reds, you won't find them here by the glass. 

Appetizers:
Octopus - salty. Saltiness overwhelmed any other taste it may have had. Comes on a bed of what looks and tastes like mashed potatoes?!
Calamari - great

Mains:
Rabbit saddle - I came specifically for this dish. Everything else on their menu (pork chop, salmon, some vegetarian crap) is rather mundane. But I see rabbit on the menu so I'm excited. We place our drinks order, waiter comes back with our selections (which most people will want to match with food they plan to order) and as I'm placing my food order, THEN advises they ran out of rabbit. 
"Wagyu" Steak - I reluctantly order that instead of rabbit I can't have. I specifically ask our waiter to confirm that steak is flame grilled and not roasted, pan fried or cooked in some other "alternative" way. I get something which looks like a piece of meat which has been ironed from both sides. Instead of griddle marks, it has all signs of having been pan-fried or cooked on a flat top stove. All I can taste is butter in which it was cooked. There's not a hint of it having been grilled. On top of that, it comes cut into 3 pieces which means the meat is lukewarm by the time it reached our table. Needless to say, I sent it right back. 
Spaghetti with guinea hen - wife ordered that, but didn't finish or enjoy whatever she did eat over my shitty experience. 

Both left angry and hungry and ended up having another frustration-free dinner at LaLolinda same night.
author: Jeff S.

description:
One of the best hanger steaks of all time.  I can't wait to try their pizza.

Buona!!!
author: Anthony D.

description:
Delicious, simple Italian food. They have plenty of house made pasta, risottos & specialty dishes, but they've removed their delicious pizzas from the menu =( I guess this is to discourage those guys who just want pizza to walk next door to the restaurant, Delfina.

Antipastis are $10~$14, First Courses $14~$18, and Second Courses $20~$27.

Great for small groups or dates.
author: Veronica S.

description: Delicious food, fun atmosphere. Our waitress was really cool and attentive. She even let us sit our table way longer than we should have and was very nice about it. Fun atmosphere to relax and enjoy. The food was delicious. Portions are small, but that's actually a good thing because I am at risk of eating way too many carbs. Highly recommend.
author: Mikhal G.

description: We were a group of 6 and we decided to let the waiter choose the items for us, no one saw the menu. Everything that he got was interesting and tasty though I remember the spaghetti the clearest. I was really surprised! The desserts were the best. We ordered something that looked like a rainbow.
author: Ashutosh T.

description:
Food: 4/5
Pork pappardelle: 3.5/5. Pasta was great but way too salty
Lamb chops with fragula, artichoke, olive stuff: 4.5/5. yummy flavors
$67 for 2 (pretip with 1 alc drink)
author: Olivia Q.

description: Love the food at Delfina. I decided to go there for my early bday celebration yesterday and left very happy about the food. The restaurant was super busy yesterday and I got a little upset that out table (reservation for 9:30pm) wasn't ready for a little while. Well, after all we got to know from a waitress that the place isn't that crazy busy on a Thursday. There was something going on in SF and that's why they were very busy. Anyways. We enjoyed our meal. We got the green peppers as an appetizer and the red sauce that was on top of it was AMAZING! I could eat a bowl of just that sauce. I also got the escarole salad and I loved it! The dressing was delicious. My husband got the grilled calamari and I got a taste of the beans and greens and it was a very well made dish! I say you wouldn't even need the seafood on it. It's delicious just with the beans and greens. Very tasty! A friend got the anchovies and they enjoyed it too. For our entrees, I decided to go with something simple and got the spaghetti and it was incredible delicious! My husband got the black pasta with octopus and something wasn't ok with that dish. It had a very fishy taste and it was quite bad. Don't know if they overpower it with some fish stock or what it was. Our friends got the ravioli, which had a delicious sauce on it! Oh and we had the bread with the buffalo butter that was great. I was so happy with the food that decided to have dessert to try it out. I got the chocolate dessert (don't remember the name) and has a delicious chocolate sauce on it. I felt that I could have it all when I started eating it, but then it was too much chocolate. The salty nuts on top helped on the balance of the dish a little bit, but I felt that if it had a fresh whipped cream or some mascarpone cheese to go with it would be just great. Even some vanilla ice cream would have helped. My friend got the trio gelato and sorbet and I did put some of the mascarpone gelato on some of my dessert and it did tasted good :D overall we had a great experience and I would definitely go back to Delfina.
author: Flavia S.

description:
Sardines were fresh, simple and clean tasting.

The lasagna was very tiny and was 18 dollars. I don't care what was in it because all I tasted was the sauce. 

My girlriend's shortribs were just ok. Tasted like something I made in culinary school... when i didn't know what i was doing.

The best bet would probably be the pizza joint next door.
author: Cris S.

description:
Chicken Liver Crostini

- Delicious! 
- Taste: Gamey balanced with acidity from citrus--well-balanced flavor ratios!
- Texture: Creamy, thick spread consisting primarily of chicken liver lies atop a perfectly crisped crostini 
- You'll either love it or hate it type of dish; it's an acquired taste. Definitely reccommend for adventurous/non-picky eaters. 


Spaghetti

- Great dish for those who want something simple + not too heavy; it's a very mild, simple dish 
- Perfectly cooked fresh noodles
author: Kimberly ..

description:
WHEN: A Sunday night

OK first off, let me just say that I LOVE the Mission... It is probably my favorite district in the city. With that said....

I've been hearing a lot about this place from my friend so he finally took me to experience what Delfina has to offer. We always walked PAST Delfina but I never ate there until just recently. I wasn't aware that they change their menu every night. Not too many repeats if any. Wow... Kind of a downer if you really enjoyed a dish there and want to go back for it again. But... I'd definitely come back to try their constantly changing menu.

I can't really remember how much everything was (probably because I didn't pay lol), so I can't tell you if it was well worth the price or not. Sorry!

SERVICE
Apparently, they were not taking any reservations when I had called them before heading out. Bummer. BUT! We were able to enjoy a beer outside while we waited for our seats. We ended up at the bar right next to the kitchen. We LOVE seats with the view of the kitchen so that was a plus. Staff was all very nice and accommodating.

FOOD
* I love that they sell half-bottles of wine! Although I have no problem drinking a whole bottle haha!

Chicken Pate: I was a little skeptical because it was chicken and not duck, but the waitress highly recommended it for us. I'm SO glad we ordered it. It was buttery and you can taste the garlic that was cooked into it along with the brandy. Was probably the best pate I have ever had.

Little Gem Butter Lettuce Salad: Dressed with some kind of mustard/citrus dressing, this was not really my favorite appetizers, but it was refreshing to have a salad. The boiled eggs were sieved (went through a cheese grater so it was shaved).

Ox Tail Risotto: The bright yellow risotto filled my nose with the sent of saffron. The color was captivating and the risotto was legit. Cooked perfectly and the shredded oxtail was savory and went very well with the risotto.
author: Heidi C.

description:
Great pastas, great service. 

- Lamb sausage with lentils: yum. the sausage was so flavorful
- Chargrilled calamari with beans: the calamari were grilled perfectly; tender and flavorful. The beans on the other hand- i could definitely passed on those. they were cooked in a slimy sauce which was kinda off-putting
- Crab with squid ink pasta: loved the texture of the pasta; it wasn't as flavorful as other squid ink pasta i've tasted from other places
- Proscuitto Marscapone Ravioli: tasty but Extremely salty; i think the dish needed some acid or veggie to cut through the saltiness from the proscuitto, marscapone and the sauce. would not have been able to finish it if it was my main
- Chocolate Bone: creamy  chocolatey dessert, highly recommend
author: Jocelyn L.

description: We just came back from Italy and we were still hungry for good pasta, I forgot how fantastic this place is, 5 stars for everything : food, ambiance and service!!!! Loving it.
author: Yury R.

description:
I ordered food from a company that delivers food from restaurants.  

I ordered the steak despite being very expensive. 
Unfortunately for me the meat was too rare and had way too much salt on it including the fries.   I couldn't finish the meal due to how heavily salted both items were.  I can't comment about actually eating at the restaurant.   I won't order be ordering food from them in the future.
author: Eleanor L.

description:
Dined again at Delfina on 8/17/2012.
Food was good, but nothing like a year earlier.
Staff was completely indifferent and so uber cool it was annoying.
While we were still finishing our wine, manager came up to table and asked us why we didn't tip! We were planning on leaving a cash tip, which we did. In retrospect, I now wished we'd left nothing. 
If you read my review from 2011, I was so impressed with the polish of the food, staff, presentation. Now the polish is simply dull.
Overall, success may have gone to their heads and Delfina seems poser central as its primary reason for existence. Better food for a LOT less available many places.
author: Andreas M.

description: I just happened upon this place by accident. I was pleasantly surprised with the level of service, from the hostess to the bartender, everyone was knowledgeable and friendly. I enjoyed my meal and the price was fairly inexpensive. You should definitely check it out.
author: Chris D.

description:
The Food is AMAZE. 
The drinks are AMAZE

The hostess we had last night had no idea what she was talking about.  The reservations were also about 40 mins behind schedule, but knowing how popular this place is, we expected a wait. 

I would make sure the staff (Hostess) knows what she's talking about when it comes to the food.  When asking what certain dishes were as they were coming out, she told us the wrong stuff.  Luckily we checked with the folks sitting next to us before we ordered, a sweet Jewish family.    The hostess could stand to learn the menu, if that matters?
author: Best M.

description: The service was sublime - authentically friendly and buoyant, knowledgable and full of individualized suggestions. The fresh cured anchovies were absolutely blissful. Would have chosen the little gems salad over the field greens had I known more. The fresh peas were delicious. Glad they have a few California wines on their list, and did enjoy the Italians we tried.
author: TJ B.

description: Delfina lives up to the hype. Service was great, the food was fresh and came promptly. Fantastic, extensive Italian wine list, which our server helped us navigate. It's solid, good Italian with locally sourced ingredients. I'm glad we finally experienced this gem. It's expensive so we will probably not be back for a while, but a great place to take out of towners who want to splurge.
author: Audra S.

description: We went here last night for our anniversary dinner. We thought it would be quiet because it was a Monday night around 8:30, but the place was lively. Still, service and food were wonderful and fast. I tried the featured pomegranate bellini, which was extremely refreshing and not too sweet. We started with the prosciutto-mascarpone ravioli and the mint pasta with mushrooms and nettles. My husband who is from Italy wasn't too impressed with the ravioli, but I loved it; he preferred the mint dish. Overall, both were delicious though! We ordered the roasted chicken with mushrooms and swapped out the mashed potatoes for the cheesy polenta, which was truly amazing! We were pretty full after all this, but we still ordered the flourless chocolate cake to split. It's sort of dry, but the rice gelato that accompanies it is interesting. Our server was kind and informed, and she never lingered too long - it was our anniversary, after all. We will definitely be back to make our way through the entire menu!
author: Kacy C.

description:
It's hard to find better cooking than at Delfina.  The food is immaculately prepared and hits all the right notes. I've only been to Delfina a few times but the more I go the more I become a fan.

Dishes devoured on this trip were the Padrone Peppers Napoletana, Grilled Monterey Bay Calamari, Littleneck Clams al Forno and the Fresh Anchovy Puttanesca. 

The highlight by far was the Monterey Calamari - not quite beating the calamari served at Kokkari but coming close. The seasoning of the calamari was delicious and the salad had escarole and arugula with well cooked white beans.  Definitely a must try!

The clams are a miss. Well cooked but the sauce is quite ordinary and nothing to write home about. 

The staff are friendly, hip and fairly casual. 

On the downside - I can't say I like the metallic cafeteria style tables that are a little too close together, it's almost impossible to get a dinner reservation (I had dinner there at 5 pm which in some countries would be considered a late lunch), and for some weird reason they are not on open table but online reservations can be made through their website.
author: Abhi S.

description:
I think this is in the very top-tier of restaurants in San Francisco.  The food was fantastic, service first-class, nice space without being pretentious.  I though it might be more of an expense-account crowd but that wasn't the case at all.

It's difficult to get in for a reason, it's a small and manageable space and you don't feel rushed.  The server was incredibly knowledgeable about all the dishes and gave great advice.  It's much smaller inside than I imagined, which isn't to say that you feel confined, just that there aren't a lot of tables so there is a finite amount of people that can eat in there at any one time.  It's a warm and romantic place.

We already had drinks down the street before so just ordered wines by the glass, they have a decent assortment of stuff, I had a few glasses of a great syrah ($13) that they were johnny-on-the-spot with the refill when I finished a glass.

They have a bunch of "staples" that are always on the menu and a bunch of seasonal stuff.  Everything tasted super fresh and very balanced with seasoning and salt, cooked correctly.  Other reviews discuss the food in depth but rest assured the positive reviews are correct.

Acme and Tartine table bread by request too if you ask for it!

It's a first-class operation and worth the trouble to get in there.  I don't know how I haven't been there previously but it was a great experience all-around.  I found the price pretty reasonable for such a quality offering - two people barely broke much over $100.

Highly recommended.
author: Doug M.

description:
Popular Italian spot in the Mission. Great food, casual, friendly atmosphere, reasonably priced. 

The grilled calamari with white bean salad appetizer was excellent and enough to be a main course! Bucatini with fava bean sugo and guanciale was unusual and very tasty. Their desserts were superb and refreshing to complement the meal. The blood orange sorbet was incredibly intense and flavorful - one of the best we've ever sampled. (Have had so many bad versions!) the panna cotta was equally delicious, with just the right texture and amount of wiggle, accompanied by blood orange and rhubarb bits. 

A find!

I only wish that I could have eaten at their pizzeria next door - thin, bubbly-crusted pizzas looked so delish!!!!
author: Linnet T.

description:
We went to Delfina to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday.  I let the server know that we were dining out for a special occasion and she was great about it.  I said there was no need for anything free or a big to-do but I just wanted to make sure we were treated extra special.  We enjoyed a couple glasses of the Pinot Noir at the bar as they were running a little behind on reservations (there isn't much space so don't plan on relaxing while you wait for a table).

We started off with the Clams and were given a complimentary prosciutto and fava beans (totally not necessary but very much appreciated).  Both dishes were delish, I did not try the prosciutto because I only eat seafood, no meat.  The clams were great, very light and flavorful, just the right portion for an appetizer.  My BF thoroughly enjoyed the prosciutto.

For the 2nd course, we tried the house made spaghetti because you just must when dining at an italian restaurant.   The noodles were awesome, sauce was good.

3rd courses, I ordered the fish of the night (swordfish I think) and I was told it was the last piece.  The server went back and had them hold the fish for me.  My BF ordered the roasted chicken and mashed potatoes.  After waiting an extended period of time for our 3rd course we were informed by our server that a VIP guest came in and wanted the fish so they gave it to him instead.  I was a little disappointed but the restaurant was very accommodating.  They ran across the street to the sushi place and got a nice cut of yellowtail and prepared that special for me.  We were one of the last tables to leave the restaurant that night.  Our server, Angela, was amazing and if it weren't for her the fish fiasco would have made it a very poor experience.  The manager comp'ed my plate and apologized in person as well.  

The only downfall is, I have a hard time with a place that will let a "VIP" literally take a plate out from under another guest.    But the food was amazing, the server was great so we will definitely be back.
author: Nicole W.

description:
**GOOD ITALIAN FOOD BUT NOT WOW WOW**

I used to think Delfina was the shiz of all Italian restaurants in San Francisco. But that was many years ago. After my second trip, I found it to be slightly above average.

Service was solid and the front desk receptionist seated us within 45 minutes without proper reservations. 

However, kitchen service was spotty at times. We had a nice glass of refreshing white wine, but waited 15-20 minutes for our order and then an additional 15 minutes for our starters.

So, as a result, we requested pizza next door, but the manager and our waitress politely declined. Restaurant policies are so meh.

Cannot fault the management staff. They were good: friendly, efficient, and courteous.

I ordered the Little Gem Salad, with Point Reyes blue cheese, sieved egg and radishes which was fresh and tasty, but overall, not impressive.

The entree, gnocchi, however, was very good. Good flavors and consistency.

We did not order dessert, but the bill averaged out to be $50 pp with a glass of wine.

Definite fan of anything pasta-related at Delfina, but as far as everything else, I would say it to be so-so.

RECOMMEND  the gnocchi.
author: Betty N.

description: Delfina-- a long awaited stop on my culinary tour of SF. It is only 3 blocks from my apartment-- how has it taken me this long to eat here? Started with the belini- which I love. Then we had the grilled calamari and the liver appetizer. We split the Mary's chicken and the parpadelle. I thought the chicken was great- not as big of a fan of the pasta. Service was good and loved the ambiance of the restaurant. Worth the wait.
author: Nicole S.

description: Firstly we had a reservation and arrived immediately on time. After waiting about 20 minutes, we inquired further. They then offered us champagne which was a nice gesture but waiting 40 minutes was a tad too long and did not make a great impression. Luckily we had a nice window seat and the restaurant was convivial and bustling. The bread was delicious- from acme and tartine and I had a pretty good cauliflower soup to start. The best part of the experience was definitely my main course. I had the spaghetti with fresh tomato sauce and it was definitely delicious! Overall it was a good dinner. The pasta was awesome, ambiance was pleasant but the service wasn't up to standard. Next time- pizzeria Delfina!
author: Julia W.

description: I've been meaning to eat at Delfina since before they expanded and managed to get around to it yesterday.  I was a bit disappointed.  We ordered bread and olives to start, the bread was amazing, the olives were served hot, which I think is weird and not all that nice, they were finger burning hot!  Normally I eat every olive in sight, but I left a few of these.  I had linguini with petrale sole, I ate the whole thing and it was nice, but for $21 you kind of want something outstanding.
author: Emma C.

description:
Make it easier on yourself  and make a reservation on their website. I booked my Valentine's day weekend dinner 2 weeks in advanced, and I had no difficulty getting Saturday night reservations.

Love might have been in the air since everyone around us seemed to be celebrating the holiday - but our table was especially love struck. This place was great!

My boyfriend and I shared the following:

 - Insalata di campo: Too much frisee for my liking. A little flavorless. We saw a lot of tables around us ordering it though we couldn't figure out why.
-  Carbonara-like pasta: Fresh made pasta is amazing! Cooked perfectly and generous portions.
- Scallops: Special of the day. This was also extremely tasty although the portions are small.

The service was exceptional and attentive. It was busy, but there was never a push for us to rush our meal. With a glass of beer and wine, 3 courses, and 2 desserts - our bill came out to $100 which was a pleasant surprise! Not bad for all we ordered and a $$$ place.
author: May I.

description:
The service here is consistently wonderful.

The bread served here makes it worth the trip alone . . . Especially the Tartine loaf. I could eat that alllllll day long. The butter is also very high-quality.

The prosciutto-mascarpone ravioli was good. The lemon butter sauce was pretty heavy. I was slightly disappointed that the filling was meatball-like, and I couldn't taste the separate flavors.

The pappardelle with the duck ragu was actually not too great. Tasted like ground beef, kinda bland flavor.

Definitely worth a visit!
author: Madeline S.

description:
I've recently moved to the US, and living directly across of Delfina so I frequently go there

You will always be welcomed with a smile;  it has a very welcoming atmosphere but still very professional, it feels like the people enjoy working there.

The food is always spot, simple menu cooked well. 
The sauces they make are usually much richer than other italian places i've eaten here (someone there loves Muskat!) and everything is very fresh.

They will always try to accommodate requests such as "Half a portion" or removing an ingredient you dislike. And they don't make you uncomfortable when you ask.

I'm glad to have it across from my house. even that it is not helping me cook more at home.

-Try the Ribollita da Delfina, simple and addictive.
author: Dor L.

description:
Walked into the crowded Delfina at 10PM on a Friday night and we were immediately seated at the bar -- not too shabby!  Splitting everything but the main entrees was a great idea suggested by our friendly waitress. In fact, I have to give credit to ALL of Delfina's friendly wait staff we encountered at the bar. Great service, great food, great experience.

Insalata Di Campo - house salad was delicious. Have to commend Delfina for adding red cabbage in their salad -- it was a surprisingly amazing touch.

Chard Sauteed - I believe we had broccoli sauteed that night, not chard, but I could be wrong. It was good but a bit too salty.

Olive Oil Mashed Potatoes - Good, and even better taken in with an entree.

Spaghetti - The noodles were AMAZING - perfectly chewy and fresh. For the most boring-sounding item on the menu, the spaghetti may be what I will be going back to Delfina for!

Pork Shoulder - Very rich and solid, on a bed of barley, and would have still been a bit too much salty for the palate, if it had not been for the side of olive oil mashed potatoes to round things out.

Meyer lemon dessert with huckleberry sauce - Unique and delicious. 

Overall, the friendly ambiance amidst the high-quality food won out over sometimes over-salted or under-salted food, but I will definitely come again. 

Last Note: After reading other people's reviews here on Yelp, I just hope that over time, Delfina's cooking squad will learn to correctly salt each food consistently well, because this place is on its way up the top 100 lists.
author: Angie C.

description:
The service was not as good as the food, so they only get 3 stars from us. We arrived early for our 5:30 reservation and there was a long line of people very eager to eat there. Our waitperson was lovely and very well-meaning, but our drinks didn't arrive until  at least 20 minutes after we ordered them! We ordered the olives, one antipasti (Veal Sweetbreads, which my husband and mother said were excellent) and the drinks at the same time and expected the drinks first. 

It was a little while before she took our order for the rest of the meal. Oh, and she forgot the chard side dish with the main part of the meal, which I never mentioned since I no longer wanted it. For a Bay Area Top 100, I find this level of service to be disappointing.

 The other dishes we had were good but not outstanding - although both my husband (a former chef) and mom really enjoyed the tripe. I had gluten free pasta - the sauce was not what I expected, but was good. One plus was that although its a small menu, there were ample gluten free options for me.

I would consider going back to this restaurant - partly out of curiosity about whether the service we got is  typical of their service.
author: Mara K.

description:
This is one of my best friend's favorite restaurant (and he knows good food). I been to both the Delfina Pizzeria and the Restaurant (which is the more fancy/ gourmet half) and both of them are awesome. Everything on the menu is really good. The ambiance is a California causal but the food come out looking gourmet and just amazing. 

Amazing food, great ambiance, super nice service. This place is great for just a causal dinner with friends or celebrating something special. The atmosphere is great, people are friendly, but yet it's still very cozy and intimate. 

Reservation recommended (make try to make it a little bit in advances)
author: Anna W.

description: Overall fine experience. The interior is very warm and inviting, and the staff and our waitress were friendly, attentive and good at suggesting items. We ordered the gnoccho fritto and the grilled Monterey bay calamari for appetizers. The calamari was delicious and had a nice salty grilled flavor, and the white beans were a perfect addition. Well done. The gnoccho was a bit bland and unimpressive.  For main, I ordered the pancetta wrapped rabbit, which was tender and had good flavor. We shared pannacota for desert.  Overall good experience. Though I don't recall which wines we ordered, the waitress allowed us to sample a few different kinds before ordering.
author: Ronnie S.

description: Excellent food and services.  Never had a bad meal at Delfina all these years.  This is mostly because the food quality and taste have been consistent through the years.  No wonder it has never dropped off top 100 in the Bay Area.  My only complaint is over the years, it is harder to land a table for dinner at a reasonable hours, and more tourists are flooding to the place.  Other than that, buon appetito.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Fantastic pasta!  Just went for the spaghetti pomodoro and it blew my mind.  I didn't think such a simple dish could be so powerful, but it really was!  

My advice: go for it!
author: Kirsten P.

description: Excellent food. Lovely setting. Very good menu suited to a variety of dietary restrictions. The chicken agnolotti was perfect, the spaghetti is better than you'd think spaghetti could possibly be and the wine list is strong. Highly recommended.
author: K. B.

description: Picked this place randomly while in San Francisco and made a reservation.  Great dining experience and our server was very helpful with recommendations.  Calamari and spaghetti were amazing!
author: Blake F.

description:
At this rate, my review is like a pin drop in a sea of Yelpers and won't matter. But I'm SOOO glad I finally got to come here. 

One thing that has made my experience with Delfina miserable is that they never have availability for reservations on Friday/Saturday. So this time, when I called, they were still booked until 10pm, but decided to just make margaritas at home and wait the extra hours.

Really yummy - homemade pasta and delicious sauces. The beef brisket was additionally tender and flavorful, although was not what I expected as brisket form. We started with the entree, which I forgot what is called, but is made from yesterdays soup and served with rustic bread.

Good vibes overall for the restaurant side, will definitely make this a regular haunt.
author: Alita M.

description: Probably the best chicken dish I've ever had in a restaurant.  Flavorful, succulent, and came with the world's most scrumptious mashed potatoes.  We had the truffle mortadella with gnocco frito, the calamari with white bean salad, and the Tartine bread... everything was so delicious.  Minus one star because the atmosphere was a little hectic.  We had a seven PM reservation yet didn't get seated until 7:30 and when we did we weren't in the cozy main dining room but in the window of the bar, elbow to elbow with two other tables.  There wasn't a great place to wait for our table, so servers kept bumping into us while they were schlepping food and beverages over to the pizzeria (technically a separate space next door), which was distracting and a little bizarre.  Regardless our server was great and once we were seated, each plate was more decadent than the next. Glad we picked this spot for our Italian fix in San Francisco.  Next time will have to skip one of the apps to save room for dessert- portions are plentiful here !
author: Bessie C.

description:
Delfina is perhaps the pinnacle of California Italian food in San Francisco.  It has a casual feel, and a focus on the quality of its ingredients.  It's everything an SF foodie could want.  I suppose the only problem with it for me is that I'm just a little tired of California Italian by now  :) And it's not too cheap either, I suppose.

Regardless, the food here is undeniably very good.  We had the **carrots with mushrooms all'erbe** and the **rapini greens** for our vegetable contorni, which were both very tasty but nothing out of this world.

For pastas, the **spaghetti with plum tomatoes** and the **pansotti**.  The spaghetti with plum tomatoes were very basic, as they sound, but they were very tasty.  The amount of flavor they got out of the tomatoes was pretty surprising and delicious.  The pansotti are like triangular ravioli, filled with greens, and covered in a walnut-based cream sauce.

Lastly we had the **Fulton Valley Farms Roast Chicken** with mashed potatoes on the side.  Nothing particularly Italian about it, but the skin was tasty and the chicken was juicy and delicious.

I'm not over the top enthused about Delfina, but it was very reliably good food.  Whee.

Oh, Oh!  But one thing I can say I was really enthused about was the **Blood Orange Bellini** (picture: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YqvoyaNvtoC8N5dA8pD2JA?select=o0-g81gwrtJykoJjrrsrGA)  It brought a delicious new twist to the usually-peach classic.  Yum!
author: David W.

description:
Whatever people. It's not that good. Went for my birthday, sat on crappy uncomfortable chairs, and had pretty mediocre pasta.
Rather sit in my kitchen, have better pasta (yeah, I usually make better than what I had here) and sit on a comfortable chair.
I really don't understand the hype.
author: El B.

description:
I am very fond of italian cuisine, this place has great italian food.
The atmosphere is nice, and everyne is very friendly. Ask for specials and recommendations. Definetely a place I highly encourage people to go and everytime someone is visiting I take them to this place.
They have a great burratta with asparagus and farrow. One of my favourite dishes of all time, although is seasonal.
author: Lucia C.

description:
Had reservations here for Friday at 7pm. It looked super busy on the outside when we arrived. But it was also the crowd for Delfina Pizzeria next door. A little confused where to go but it's the wooden door if this is your first time.

Nice atmosphere, attentive service, everyone was nice. All very good.

We started out a peach bellinis which were yummy. We wanted the Gnoccho Fritto but they rejected their batch that day as not good enough. Darn! So we opted for the Polenta Taragna and Chicken Liver Spiedini. Both very good but the Spiedini was my favorite.. the combination of chicken liver and pork cheek on skewers was just heavenly. I decided to have the Spaghetti for main dish. It was supposed to be the large for $15, but the table next to mine had the smaller for $10 and I swear they looked the same size (his was on smaller plate). The spaghetti itself was OK. I would recommend you skip this dish. My partner had the Pork Saltimbocca which was delicious but super tiny for $26. They served it with polenta.. which is strange because the table next to us had the same dish and they got spinach maybe? Some sort of green. The server didn't ask us what side we wanted but c'mon we already ordered polenta as a starter. For dessert we had the Panna Cotta (yum) and Spumoni Coppa (also yum)

Anyway, with 2 glasses of wine the total for dinner was about $140.  Yup.. this place is way overpriced for what you get. The dishes were mostly tiny. I was really excited to try Delfina as it always came up as a must try for San Francisco. Their food is OK but the prices are not justifiable.
author: Vol T.

description:
I love the food at Delfina- the grilled calamari and beans were excellent last night. The bread, of course, if perfect- food for the body and soul (it comes from Tartine's). The roast chicken is simply what chicken always should taste like- perfection on a plate.

The salmon was excellent- tender, toothsome and tasty. 

My only criticism is that it is too noisy for a good dinner table conversation. I could barely hear my companions especially the soft-spoken friend across the table from me. and there is no nearby parking- finally found a place above Sanchez.
author: Linda B.

description: Definitely a 2 course place, so be prepared to spend a buck and have a glass of wine with each. You have to ask for bread. Everything being served looked delicious. Each course is medium sized, so 2 courses is a lot of food. Good food, good service, nice atmosphere.
author: Will D.

description: The food is delicious - no question about it, but I had a really hard time with the hostess. Arrived at 5:30 for my reservation for four - the second one inside the restaurant - and they insisted on seating me at a table in the window under a speaker. I asked to change tables and even though almost ALL of their four tops were empty, they wouldn't move my seat. I watched diner after diner (who got there after me) enter and be seated at four tops against the wall. Their explanation for why I couldn't switch tables was that I didn't understand their "seating system." I explained that I was with my elderly mother who wouldn't be able to hear if we sat under the speaker. They told me that I could wait a half an hour for a different table - when there were still empty tables! FINALLY a gentleman took pity on me and moved us to one of the many empty four tops. I will never understand why they insisted I  had to sit at the ONLY table in the room I didn't want to sit at. I think the reason is that they don't like to make accommodations. They have a way of doing things and if you question it they are unhappy. A power and control thing. Give certain people power and they run away with it. Our waitress, however, was delightful - couldn't have been better. I guess the next time I make a reservation I'll have to specify that I'll sit at any table in the restaurant except the one in the window.
author: KAte R.

description: After years of sidewalk access problems, Delfina redesigned their outside dining area and access is great!  Bicycle parking was moved to the street, table arrangement was changed, waiting space was changed, and the restaurant entry was altered!  Delfina stepped up to allow disabled persons to step past with ease.  Delfina is the most improved access in the Mission neighborhood - two canes up!
author: SF Disability Awareness N.

description:
I've heard the raves and reviews... not necessarily through Yelp though.  Through friends and family... word of mouth and such.  I must say, this place lived up to the hype. I seriously don't think even Flavor Flav could've hyped this place up any more. We were greeted by a smile. Simple. A smile. How warm is that? Not a smirk. Nothing forced. It was all warm and fuzzy when we entered this place. 

Our server was even awesome. She volunteered information along with some of her favorites in addition to answering all of our 100ish questions. I believe that even if the menu offered still water and plain noodles, I'd still feel fulfilled and happy. Such a delight that lady was. 

And the food... good lord, the food!  A good friend of mine is Italian and always encourages me on what wholesome and authentic Italian cuisine really tastes like. And if I had to pretend I took a cooking class, and laid out a delicious Italian dinner for her, there's no doubt that Delfina would be my accomplice! Nothing was too salty, or overwhelming, or saturated, or dull. But it was too darn good... for the taste buds and for the soul!

Keep doing what you're doing Delfina. Food is awesome. Your staff is stellar!
author: John K.

description:
food: love. favorite thing is the grilled squid salad. i never have a bad meal there. this is not traditional italian, just so you know.

atmosphere: warm, chill, and still have patrons over 45! what a breath of fresh air.
author: P L.

description:
Had takeout margherita pizza. After some friends say it wasn't as good as the hype my expectations were lowed. But the pizza was simply well-executed: The crust thickness, mozzarella, basil, and sauce were all very high quality and balanced. 

Plus takeout was ready in ten minutes, and reasonably priced.
author: Ben M.

description:
Delfina has always been one of our favorite restaurants and since we live walking distance away, we always take great pleasure in walking down with any guests staying with us. It is especially fun if our guest are from out of town. What could be a better intro to San Francisco? A world class restaurant walking distance from home! 

Sadly, Friday was a great disappointment. Our reservations were for 9:30pm, when we arrived a little early (our guest from London was young and a fast walker), we were asked to wait outside or at the bar (which was way too crowded.) 45 minutes later, we were finally seated. During the long wait, no one ever came out to reassure us we would eventually have a table. It was especially nerve making as we watched everyone else around us called into the restaurant.

When we were finally shown our table, our server gave us our menus, told us they were out of the saltimbocca but had a cut of pork "from the same pig" and then disappeared for who knows how long. She was very busy with the tables around us but more or less ignored us before finally arriving and taking our orders. 

For appetizers we ordered the warm olives and gnocco. The castelvetrano olives were tasty with a good olive oil but the gnocco were a total disappointment -- 3 squares of a dry, tastless "beignet-like" pastry, each with 3 paper thin slices of a  very ordinary salami. Dry, dry, dry -- thank goodness for the wine! We were so disappointed not to see the bakala we like so much gone from the menu.

Our entrees were 2 orders of the "same pig" and our guest ordered the roast chicken. The entrees arrived quickly but what a disappointment! The pork was dry, tough and tasteless! Could it have been the leftovers from the saltimbocca preparation? The beans were definitely the best part of the dish. Our guest picked at her chicken and was too polite to say anything other than "The mashed potatoes are quite tasty."

And the final sadness was to be told that the kitchen had run out of the panna cotta. This was especially bad since we had just tried to gloss over the whole bad experience for our guest with "The panna cotta will make it all worth while, hands down the best dessert in town!" As we groaned loudly at the news, the server, in a throwback to the old Delfina, offered us a "comped" dessert, and we selected a raspberry budino which was very nice and the reason for 2 stars rather than one. As we departed, the servers, busy in the bar having a glass of wine, waved goodbye and left us feeling, "Thank goodness they're finally going" 

Will we back? Probably not. In the past Delfina really stood out from the crowd. The service was outstanding, the food sublime. Today, it seems like a victim of its own success. You don't have to be excellent if the crowds keep coming. We only hope this "complacency disease " isn't catching and that Locanda doesn't fall into its parent's trap.  The neighborhood has many other excellent places to choose from so we will  plan on branching out.
author: junona j.

description:
Had a wonderful meal paired with some great wine! Our servers we very knowledgable. The  pasta dishes were to die for. The octopus was yummy and the pana cotta was a great ending to a great meal. 
The only thing was that we felt rushed. The servers kept wanting to take plates away while some of us were still eating.... Bad etiquette. If it had not happened once, I would have given 5 stars but it happened SEVERAL times!
Looking forward to going back and hitting up their pizza joint next door.
author: Baharak S.

description: Great place for Italian! My wife and I both were impressed with all dishes that we got (spaghetti, roasted chicken w/ potatoes and olive oil). The food was hot, the place was busy. And as previously mentioned, it opens at 5:30 pm - when we got there, a line of people were already waiting.
author: Scott R.

description:
Food was well-prepared, but there wasn't anything that was particularly noteworthy. Maybe it was a bad night? I will say that it was nice to walk right in and get a table. Granted we did show up shortly after opening.

Service was nice though.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Got the proscuitto pie with arugula, but honestly, I wasn't impressed. I suppose I'm a more traditional pizza gal--I like my pizza to have sauce. It was dry and lacked flavor. I've had the margherita pizza here before though which is pretty satisfying. Still, I don't think Delfina's worth the hype.

Points for accomodating orders quickly though--I ordered a pizza at 6:15 on the night of Film Night in the Park at Dolores and despite being swamped with orders (they had been advertising a Film Night in the Park picnic basket), they were able to accomodate my request to pick it up within an hour.
author: Steffi L.

description:
Not vegetarian friendly. 
- There is only ONE entree for vegetarians - Spaghetti 
- There are about 3 or 4 sides for vegetarians. 
That is it!

For what its worth, the Spaghetti was really good. Cooked al dente and was flavored perfectly.
author: Sri K.

description: We made reservations well in advance.  Our waiter recommended a bottle of cabernet that was perfect.  The spaghetti was the best I have ever had.   I also ordered the hangar steak and fries.  It was solid, but not great.  My wife raved and raved about the salmon.  Happy wife, happy life.
author: Bob B.

description:
There may be a better moderately priced Italian restaurant in the Mission, or SF in general, but I don't know of one. 

 **This would be a 5 star restaurant in my opinion except for the fact that their menu really isn't too vegetarian friendly.  **

I was shocked to see how intensely busy this restaurant was.  But, by the end of the night, I understood why.  The ambiance(even though busy) wasn't too crowded feeling.  It kind of added to the appeal of being in a really popular hot little spot.

The service was incredible.  I have found that being younger, tattooed, and with a person of color, you get really bad service(even in SF).  But, I have to say nothing was further from the truth.  They were incredible, set up a wonderful table that we asked for, were quite accommodating and friendly.  

The menu was quite creative.  Often I dislike Italian restaurants because I can make better pastas at home.  Here, they had a great creative menu(not extremely vegetarian friendly though).  

I took my ex girlfriend out here for her bday dinner.  I only wish that our relationship lasted longer than my memory of this restaurant.  Maybe another date night with another lucky lady in the future.  haha!
author: Sean M.

description:
My friends and I were very excited about eating here for the first time and had a reservation for 10:30 PM.  After we arrived, the restaurant was obviously very busy and before we had a chance to get over to the bar area to have a drink while waiting for a table, we overheard a few of the servers who were huddled together complaining that we were standing in their way.  

Then after we were in the bar, we were waited on by a bartender/waiter with an unkept beard.  He couldn't be bothered to remember our drink order because he was obviously drunk (slurred speech and could smell it on his breath) and spent more time socializing with his coworkers than doing his job.  Overall, the service was HORRIBLE and even though the food is good, be prepared to deal with bad service.  

For the price, there are much better options in San Francisco.
author: Christopher W.

description: Be our guest be our guest; put "delfinas service" to the TEST. The service was superb, the food was fantastic, the wine was Devine. I would highly recommend coming back next time I am in San Francisco for a long weekend!
author: Dan D.

description:
Great food!  Great service!  I am surprised to see the bad reviews.   I frequent Italians in North Beach and I know good when I say GOOD!
Didn't like my table though.   I felt cramped and the sun was beating down on me.   Luckily, the waitress lowered the shades.
The ribs were really flavorful,  and the plain old spaghetti is one of the best I've ever had.
author: Doris A.

description:
I don't recall where I heard of this place, but it had been on my list, so I figured, I'm in SF for an event, might as well check it out.  i expected a crowded restaurant (and it was), but I got seated right away.

I'd read that the mains were just okay but that the starters were fantastic, so I heeded that advice and started with the littleneck clams a forno and Monterey Calamari.  Both were amazing and paired really well with the Unti Syrah I'd ordered.  the clams came in a tomato sauce which was really good.  The calamari was grilled, not fried, and was served over white beans.  As the "main", i went with a very simple spaghetti with tomatos, basil and olive oil.  It was probably too much food, but definitely worth it.  

Overall, a fantastic experience
author: Marcus P.

description: Great italian food.  The tripe dish is really good and the pasta dishes perfect.  A friend of mine says the spaghetti is the best he has ever had anywhere hands down.  It's good, but it's still just spaghetti.  Try the other pastas, they're all delicious.
author: Aaron W.

description: I loved Delfina! I called the same day (Tuesday) and got a reservation for 7pm. We ordered the Insalata di Campo and the calamari for starters. They were both REALLY GOOD!  I ordered the Roasted Mary's Chicken. It was a very generous portion (lunch next day!) and it was delicious. The seasonal Panna Cotta with apricots was fantastic. Good environment, friendly people. I will be going back for sure!
author: Paola B.

description:
delfina's tomato basil pasta is the best or second best pasta i have ever had, with the only comparable pasta being one of many in rome. it is perfectly al dente, rich and deep in flavor yet still bright, perfectly seasoned.

this is my go to restaurant in san francisco to which i take any family and friends.

however, the other dishes are variable, and none live up to the spaghetti.

their common lemon ravioli are over-salted and a bit one dimensional. their recent pork spareribs that consist of 3 ribs for 30 dollars and a bit of salad are very over-salted and are hardly worth the price.

their staple chicken is quite delicious, moist, flavorful, and well seasoned.

bone marrow risotto, when on the menu, is fantastic.

the olive oil mashed potatoes are delicious

tartine bread is tartine bread... overpriced here but always great
author: N S.

description: Had a great experience at Delfina tonight! Had a reservation and was seated promptly. All of the staff were friendly, kind, and professional. Our server was very helpful with the menu and made excellent wine and food suggestions. We shared the Jerusalem artichokes, spaghetti, pappardelle, and swordfish between 2 people. Loved every bite and left full and happy. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Melissa B.

description:
Very torn between 2-3 stars here. I ate here a while ago so my memory is not totally fresh, but it's a review I've been meaning to write. 

I had high hopes for this place - the reviews were great, my boyfriend planned a nice romantic dinner out in the city (a rarity!), and it's in the Mission. Unfortunately, I was pretty disappointed.

First, parking was awful to find, but I'm not factoring that in to my rating (it's not the restaurant's fault that it sucks to find parking in the Mission), despite having trouble finding a spot, we arrived on time for our reservation, yet still had to wait, and weren't really properly acknowledged by the hostess, or anyone, really, when we arrived. 

We were finally seated, but at a table for two, that may as well have been at a table for 10 - the tables were so close together it was awkward and distracting, and really did not lend itself to a romantic, intimate dinner because the tables next to you could hear every single word you said! The restaurant was packed, which usually for me is a plus because I like bustling places on the weekend (it's usually a good sign!), but this place was just way too crowded and poorly laid out, and it was awkward and uncomfortable to move around (and I'm a normal sized person, so I usually don't have trouble getting around).

Although, it was so freaking loud from the crowd that even talking at a table for 2 may have been a bit difficult anyway. This place needs to get a sound engineer in there to figure out the acoustics - I've been to crowded places that don't sound super loud, I know it's possible.

The food was not memorable - it wasn't particularly bad, but for the price and the hype I just didn't really get it. I live in the east bay and I wouldn't trek back to SF for this place.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
The food was good, not great, and the service was lousy.

Just cause it's a popular restaurant is no excuse for a staff with an attitude. Skip this place and choose anywhere else in the Mission.
author: Lee R.

description:
The food here is amazing! Everything is really on point and as an SF institution i'd expect as much. Was there with a group and everyone really enjoyed their food.

Their entrees are surprisingly large given a Mission restaurant, so feel free to share.

Reason i deducted a star was we ordered the burrata as an appetizer. Not only did it not arrive with the other appetizers, but even after we mentioned it during the first course, it didn't arrive until mid-way through our entree course. The waitress didn't offer to comp the dish, which was offputting.

Would still recommend going for sure
author: Zach K.

description: I came here via Sosh for dinner last night. The offerings were flavorful and authentic; the service, top-notch; the atmosphere, classy. I absolutely would come here again for the food, service, and generous wine pours.
author: Amanda R.

description:
If I was just rating Delfina on food it would get a solid 4 - but the night we went was busy and we were packed in like sardines.  We could basically participate in the conversations happening at tables to our left and right.  The annoyance melted away when food arrived but in the gaps between..... lets just say it gives you an opportunity to meet new friends.  Also - our table was small and would often get overloaded with plates.

Food standout - Ravioli with walnuts
author: Michael S.

description:
Delfina feels like a classic San Francisco restaurant: carefully curated menu, quality ingredients, casual but classy ambiance, and a location in the heart of a super hip 'hood.

We made reservations for my birthday on a Sunday night and were seated quickly. One star off for service that was more than a bit slow. We ordered:

- Ribollita. Our server suggested this and it was the surprise star of the meal. If I'm remembering right, it's essentially bread soaked in vegetable soup and then sauteed. Super unique and flavor-packed.
- Chard with lemon and garlic. Refreshing but super simple. I think we could've done without it.
- Spaghetti. Perfectly al-dente-cooked noodles + sauce that was the purest, tastiest essence of tomatoes. The small portion was perfect as a shared app for two.
- Seared ahi tuna. Delicious, light but filling, and healthy -- would definitely order again.
- Steak and fries. Knowing that it's a hangar cut and that it was ordered medium-rare, it wasn't that surprising that it was a bit on the tough side. Still, my boyfriend enjoyed it. I loved the fries, though my boyfriend wasn't a fan.

We skipped dessert in favor of heading over to Bi-Rite's (old habits die hard, and I love their ice cream!). All in all, a great meal.
author: Julie D.

description: I had several dishes and they were all delicious! The grilled octopus, pillows of pasta filled with veal and prosciutto,  paperdelle with duck ragu, spaghetti,  and lots of wine and bellini. Ohh I can't forget the salmon croquettes. We were able to do half orders and split full orders of pasta. The best thing I had was the spaghetti!  It tasted like crack! What the hell do they put in it!? The waitress said there aren't any secret ingredients,  just the right amount of everything. I was so full and happy leaving.
author: Karen T.

description: Love this restaurant! They have two restaurants next to each other, one is the pizzeria and the other is an Italian restaurant. I have dined at both and am happy to report that both are amazing. Since they are great, so be prepared to wait. In the regular restaurant, the white bean and squid salad and quail were delicious. I am happy with every pizza I tried at the Pizzeria.
author: Ally W.

description:
I was recently reminded of a mediocre dinner I had here about a year ago when I vowed to write a review.  I was so disappointed.  The ridiculous crowd, the long wait even with reservations and the food which was about the 50th percentile of Italian food in SF.  

Our server had such an affected Valley Girl accent she was almost incomprehensible and her menu descriptions were so poor we actually started to laugh.  I have lived here for years and have never encountered this sort of thing.  The pasta was good but not great -- nothing to justify the hype.  

I don't know why this place is so packed.  Tourists?  I can think of so many places that are so much better -- Locanda, La Cicca, Incanto are each 10 times better with much better service and there are newer, better places opening all the time.  

Much ado about meh!
author: Rebecca P.

description:
We had a delicious meal at Delfina last night with a very gracious and attentive server Erica.  There were four of us so we sampled many things. The off-the-charts excellent dishes were the grilled calamari, seasonal anchovies, mint creamy pasta and spaghetti. All the entrees were good especially the quail and polenta. We also had the Liberty Duck, Salmon and Rosemary Chicken.  Service was quick and they allowed us to linger through shared desserts: lemon pana cotta and three scoops bitter almond ice cream.  What a great way to finish the meal.  

To avoid parking hassles, we took BART. It's a grimy walk up Mission but well worth it. This was my first visit to Delfina and it just knocked me out.
author: Eddie W.

description:
Very crowded but good food, to a point that you would think they were giving the food away.
But they are not! its good but a little to crowded for me.
All that being said I can not give them less than 4 stars.
author: Frank J.

description:
Delicious food and excellent service. We had pasta dishes, a small app and wine - all of which were excellent. (I highly recommend the Hay and Straw entrée. It tastes better than it sounds.)

The seating is a bit too cozy in the bar area; our table was an inch away from noisy neighbors. I think it's better in the dining area, so be sure to make a reservation.
author: Brett B.

description: I love Delfina. What's better than great food and a loyal customer base (over decades) to prove it? The service is always spectacular and the food is divine. Go and find out for yourself -- but I want you to know that I keep going back and I love it.
author: Kate M.

description: Still at the top of their game, after all these years. We had the warm chicories w/ poached farm egg, calamari and white beans, chicken agnolotti, "hay and straw" pasta, flatiron steak, and pork arista. Yep, lots of food for two, but we just felt the need to try as many dishes as we could. Service was very attentive-- overall, just an excellent meal and evening.
author: Michael S.

description:
I came here for girls night - Even on a monday night this place is packed. A good sign of things to come??

Everything we had was incredibly simple, but very flavorful. It reminded me of meals in Florence. 

We tried the calamari for our starter - It was very tender and perfectly seasoned. Then came the pastas - my girlfriend is obsessed with their spaghetti - so we had that. Its cooked perfectly. We then had one of their specials (I think it was called straw and hay?) - but it was their version of a carbonara. I personally preferred this to the spaghetti - but its only b/c the spaghetti tasted like my homemade spaghetti. 

anyhow, a fun place to try - make sure you have a res
author: Komal B.

description:
Great great wine list and relatively moderately priced...  Not as impressed with other Yelpers on here about the food.  The bread was decent and warm, the dishes which we sampled dozens were above average.  GREAT service, the waitress was knowledgeable, chill, and on point.  

Would visit again, but the dishes are simply ok, for Italian food, should be much higher in quality.
author: Michael R.

description: Location isn't the only 5-star-deserving aspect of this business.  Some of the best pizza around.  Start with those arancini delights, they are absolutely delicious.  The panna, clam pie, 4 formaggi, and margherita will leave you feeling deliciously satisfied.  There's a reason we keep returning to Delfina, and it isn't the proximity!
author: Carly D.

description:
Yay!! Finally... I can take it off my bookmark.My best friend took me here for my birthday and RSVP is like on point they open doors and start seating you immediately. 

My good friend kept telling me about a couple of the 'must gets' so of course we had to get it. Spaghetti and the chicken there was this anchovy appetizer but they didn't offer it that day. We got the duck liver, the pate of some sort, pork and something else. 
Idk about 'al dente' spaghetti but it was good once you get over the fact that it's not fully cooked. 
The chicken was good, and tender. The pate whatever it was, was super good but everything else is ok.
 I was excited about this spot, then it didn't seem to 'wow' me super let down. But at least i can take it off my list.
author: Zane T.

description:
Got a last minute reservation for dinner: solid food, friendly and professional service, good date spot. parking can be difficult.

Insalata di Campo: balanced. Not memorable, but well executed for what it is. would get it again.

Chittara Nero: good

Rabbit da Delfina: wow. get this.

Dry aged liberty duck: okay
author: Jeff K.

description:
Service is good.

Food, not so good.

Our dishes were too heavy without any complexity. We ordered about four dishes and took care to eat pretty diversely but we still left feeling like we had a lead weight in our stomachs.

Their servers were very knowledgeable and hospitable and that really saves this place in my book. I wouldn't fight anybody if they wanted to come to this place for dinner.
author: Lisa Q.

description:
Things to try:
Veal Pappardelle- Think beef bolognese but BETTER!
The bread- by request. Awesome butter with sprinkles of sea salt and two types of bread: rustic dark grain and white.
Hanger Steak: Tender, tasty, and plentiful with a mini potato and a nice cream sauce on the side.
Carrots (if they're in season): Yummy orange and yellow carrots with hedgehog mushrooms (I think these are now my favorite type of mushroom) marinated in some type of herby vinaigrette. Oh boy, I could make a meal out of just that!
Almonds: They were out, but if they're THAT good to be out, they MUST be good!

I saw a blood orange mimosa going around pretty frequently so I'm sure that is one of their most popular signature drinks. They hardly carried any beer but had a lot of wine to go around. 

Our waitress was plesant but not totally attentive. It took us awhile to get our bread (and I was starving so that didn't help). Although, The chef split up everything for us on separate plates without us even asking which was an added bonus.

The restaurant is pretty darn small, so book ahead and make sure to get there right on time! Their pizzeria is right next door and had lines OUT THE DOOR for what looked like blocks.
author: Susan F.

description: Loved the fresh salads, hardy soup, not overly seasoned.  Great spot to dine with friends.
author: Danielle W.

description:
My husband and I just moved to SF from TX 2 months ago. We have been to a lot of restaurants since we got here, but this is BY FAR the best. 

Their prosciutto is the best I have ever had. It melts in your mouth.

The hanger steak with fries is the best steak I have ever had, and the fries are fantastic with all the herbs... mmmmm.

The panna cotta is literally to die for. 

This restaurant has a FANTASTIC pastry chef. Seriously. The best desserts in the city, hands down.
author: Erin R.

description:
Wonderful food but the olive oil gelato was incredible

I had been recommended the Delfina by a friend and it took a could of times to get a reservation, but the meal was very nice. I was in a group of four and we dined on a Wednesday night. 

We started off with an order of grilled fresh calamari and special, minestrone reduced to a thick sauce and soaked into bread. The calamari is one of the popular items on the menu and both of the antipasti were very tasty. 

We shared a first course of the house made spaghetti with plum tomatoes. Again very tasty. 

For my main course I had the Roasted Fulton Valley Chicken which is a house specialty. The chicken was wonderfully done with a crispy skin and succulent meat. 

Dessert was where I really got something unique - Olive oil Gelato

I know, I know - it sounds weird. But it was a daily special and I was looking for something out of the ordinary. 
The gelato had just a hint of olive oil taste and was very sweet with a touch of salt - yes, salt that added a little different texture and a snap to the taste. 

Multi bene!
author: Jay K.

description: Absolutely delicious. I had the winter squash tortellini and my friend had the swordfish. I don't even like swordfish but this one was so good! The service was amazing and the ambiance is classy and cute all at the same time. And it's in the mission so it automatically has a special place in my heart :)
author: Ashwini B.

description:
Delfina is delicious!

It's in a super hip part of the Mission, right by Dolores Park and it's sooo good!

The last time I went we ordered a pizza with proscuitto and argula and a cream sauce and a salad with a citrus dressing and tuna hearts. And they were both so tasty!

Be prepared for the wait though. We waited a little more than thirty minutes for a table. Delfina is pretty small and really popular so I definitely recommend getting there early or not right at 12:00 for lunch, but definitely check it out!
author: Heather J.

description: This is a very 'in' place.  Excellent food and wine selection.  The service is excellent. Book early because it's hard to get in!  But it's a must on the list of restaurant to go to in San Francisco!
author: Daniel V.

description: This place is really good and loved the atmosphere.  We really enjoyed the cauliflower pasta and spaghetti and meatballs!! We literally wanted to lick the plate!!
author: Brittany C.

description: Probably one of the best service that I've  ever had.. The food was great!!and dessert was the best part!!! And I believe they have a good selection of wine!! My grüner flight really was a good option to start my dinner!! I will comeback for sure!!
author: Gloria T.

description: Sooo... let me start with saying that i do not like Italian food... well I do, but not as much as I like japanese food or something with a little more spice to it... with that said... the food here was AMAZING... I came here in a party of two and we're both foodies so we ordered 6 dishes for two people. I know, I know. The spaghetti in nero and their signature red spaghetti were both delicious.
