Duck thing/entree = 5 stars. I LOVE duck. I eat it all the time. And this was definitely one of the better ones. It was one of their substitute dishes because they ran out of the Quail, which was fine with me. 

Ravioli = 3.5 stars. Again, I forgot the name. Their menu changes every day so I wasn't able to look it up on their website. Ravioli was a bit too salty...don't remember much else.

Panna Cotta = 5 stars. Panna cotta almost always deserves 5 stars because it tastes like heaven. The end.

PS. You have to ask them for the free bread or they won't give it to you. Apparently, the bread's from Tartine.
author: Kate Y.

description:
Yes, I do believe this place lives up to its hype.  Excellent food and service.  It's casual and the prices are actually reasonable.  I would have given it 5 stars, but I only reserve that for absolute perfection and they kind of blew it on the desserts in my opinion.  Still excellent overall experience though!

Here's a run-down of what we ordered:
Cauliflower Soup - creamy perfection with a paprika oil drizzled over it.  

Spaghettini w/ Dungeness crab - this dish was outstanding and really let the crab flavor shine through.  (Crab is still in season of course).   Perfectly cooked pasta.

Gnocchi al Ragu - excellent pillows in a savory meat sauce.  I thought it was just ok and so did my friend (who is a Ragu expert)

Shortribs Stracotto w/ polenta - Delicious, fall off the bone goodness.  The sauce was fantastic and the polenta was good and creamy.  Although I did think the polenta was a bit bland for this dish and would have added some sort of nutty cheese or something if it were my kitchen :-)

Chocolate Torta - I can't remember the exact name of this dessert, but it was supposed to have orange in there that never came through.  It was basically a very moist chocolate pudding cake.  It was just ok, it needed something in my opinion.  Flour & Water has them beat on the desserts.

Profiteroles - totally blew it here (at least in my and my friend's opinion).  I make profiteroles at home, so I may be a bit of a harsh critic.  The espresso ice cream completely overpowered the profiteroles and what really turned both of us off was how heavy handed they were w/ the almonds.  It looks like they took a handful and dumped them on top.  The server actually noticed and removed the dish from our bill.  That was excellent service in my opinion.  

Overall terrific experience and would come again to try other items on the menu.  But I'll hit some other restaurants first :-)
author: Alison E.

description:
I am told that Delfina is perhaps one of the best italian restaurants in San Francisco.  Although it was good, I left a bit uninspired because the restaurant was unable to accomodate my food allergies.  Everything was premade and there was no fluctuation allowed.  So I ended up eating a steak with fries.  It was a good steak and fries but I had no opportunity to sample the brilliance of the chef.  My dining companions however, had a wonderful experience trying the food.  The wine was good and the service was prompt despite being extremely busy.

Why is it that they do not keep fresh tomatos in an italian restaurant?  Pre made sauces provide consistency, but leave no adjustments for food allergies.
author: Byron M.

description:
I liked the restaurant .  But I didn't love the restaurant.

I liked:
1. Nice modern and simple decor.
2. Nice wine by the ggass selections.
3. Nice tight menu selection with interesting ingredients such as wild boar sausage, salt cod, fresh-cured anchovies, and tripe.
4.  They use warmed plates
5. Pasta is al dente - very hard to find a restaurant serves al sente as a default.
6 delicious Dulci selections. 
7. I loved Moscato d'Asti "Sori Gramella" as my desert wine.
8. Nice Service

I couldn't give 5 stars because I didn't like their polenta (was too fatty) and pasta was cold.

Bottom Line - I like the restaurant but I will not put an effort to book a reservation a week in advance.
author: Chie J.

description:
What's not to love about Delfina?

Delfina has floated in and out of my top 5 for the last 5+ years.  If I'm being honest with myself, it has only left because I have failed to go with regularity.  Each return visit propels it back into the top end of my favorites.

I'm a self-described sucker for fresh pasta, and Delfina  has some of the best you can have.  On the most recent trip, we had an unbelievable preparation of al dente spaghetti with a mullet botarga (think dried fish roe) and dried peporcinies.   It was really unusual, but succeeded on every level.  Every visit there is a dish like this, that just blows me away.

If you haven't been, you are punishing yourself for no reason.  Get a reservation far in advance, and treat yourself.  The service is always great, the food (especially the pasta) is outstanding, and they have an excellent, well-priced list of italian wines.  Enjoy!
author: Andrew M.

description:
everytime i walk by this place its crowded.  we did manage to get an 830 reservation on a tues night for 4 of us so we went.  they had our table waiting even by 815 so that was nice.  they seated us early even though we were early and two of us were missing.

everything was delicious!  we started with the grilled calamari there was frisee and beans accompanying it.  so yummy.  even their bread was perfect.  crunchy outside, soft inside.  the butter was already room temp so it was spreadable.

for mains i had the pasta with farm fresh egg and peas.  also shared the chicken.  cooked and seasoned well.  yummy! 

we skipped dessert because we thought we could make it to birite but we missed that.  o well.
author: claudia y.

description: This was the worst service I've ever had in San Francisco.  The young host was incredibly rude, unprofessional and incompetent.  Their seating policy makes so sense and the food quality has really slipped.
author: David K.

description: Superb Italian menu--delicious food and good service. Have never been disappointed with any of the entrees  here.  It's a quick walk here from BART, but walking around the Mission at night might not be your thing.  Delfina is close to BI-RITE and Mission Dolores, so parking is usually an adventure.
author: Clyde V.

description:
Delicious food and a great atmosphere!!! Encourage sharing and trying as many things as possible cause it's all so good!!! 

Can feel a little cramped...not a huge place.
author: Aaron S.

description:
Won't be coming back here to dine, that's for sure. That wont matter at all, the restaurant is one of those way over rated San Francisco restaurants that people rave about and flock to. Our friends were in town for a long weekend so my girlfriend and I chose Delfina since neither of us have been there and I suppose I wanted to see whether the restaurants great reputation precedes itself. 
Well it didnt, not to me. 

The food was decent, really nothing special at all. You can't really go wrong with the appetizers. We ordered the beat salad, the calamari and the olives. All good, not great. The main dishes we ordered was the fish, the steak, and the chicken. The fish (which I ordered) was truly disappointing. It was served cold, the sauce was bland, it was over cooked and lacked anything exciting, interesting, or different from a $30 dish that you would expect. The steak was a steak, cooked just as it was ordered. The chicken was good, my girlfriend and another friend both ordered it and loved it. The wine list is extensive and of course expensive, something expected at a restaurant of this caliber, they were sold out of our two first choices, so we took the servers recommendation and I wish we hadn't. 

The owners of this restaurant opened Locanda not long ago which is FANTASTIC and of course one of the best in town, Pizzaria Delfina, both of which I would recommend to anyone, but in my book, Delfina fails.
author: Benny C.

description: Went here with my wife after a wonderful few days in San Francisco. The food was amazing and the atmosphere very vibrant. Tight quarters though, but that's to be expected in SF. I would definitely make this a stop if in town.
author: Brad J.

description:
BF took me here for my b-day =). It was a TH and we had no trouble getting a seat. Unfortunately he didn't know Delfina accepts reservations, we sat at a semi-booth table that stretches in the middle of the restaurant. I actually didn't mind it too much. The food is what I've always imagined it to be: deliciously and freshly made with the perfect portion. We started off with the grilled calamari on top of warm bean salad, Rosemary Tagliatelle (duck giblets and aged balsamic) very rich in flavor, also spaghettinini in Nero (squid ink pasta with uni on top) perfect balance of flavors. Ambiance is very soft and intimate but not too pretentious. Servers were very friendly and had their own character.  

Chowed down Tartine bread. That's always a plus.  Would love to come here again! 

Quick tip: Apparently reservations on the weeknights exist. Save room for desert either at Delfina or Bi-rite/Tartine!
author: Johanna P.

description:
I've been to Delfina often; the food is hit or miss. If they miss, you should probably demand something else. If they hit, you'll go over the park wall. 

On a recent trip, we had to send back the risotto with butternut squash because it was undercooked and oversalted (now there's a bad combination). The waitress was very apologetic and came back with a much better version. That night I had a duck leg that sucked, frankly, but by the time I made my final judgment, I had eaten enough of it that I didn't want to bother complaining. 

Other dishes to avoid: the reconstituted dried salt cod (bland as sand); some quail dish with greens that was too salty and oily. 

Here's what you must have. 
*Any pasta or risotto with nettle; they do this oh-so-well. 
*Shortribs stracatto: three mountainous shortribs in a complex sauce, perfectly accompanied by a side of cheesy polenta. 
*Bucatini "in Salsa": that salsa is an awesome combination of sardines and Calabrian chiles. A lovely flavor that is hard to come by in SF. 
*Quail egg ravioli in brown butter sage sauce. Had this on New Year's Eve 2005 or so. 

Last, beware that their olive oil sucks (bitter aftertaste) but their butter is excellent. Go figure that an Italian restaurant will get the olive oil wrong. But enjoy the bread and butter.
author: Nat C.

description:
My first review on Yelp has to be for Delfina. I love this place! I wish SF had more consistently satisfying restaurants. Ok to be fair, I used to get special treatment and last minute reservations when a friend worked here and they sent me extra desserts...easiest way to win me over. But the quality-price ratio here really is amazing. My lamb was perfectly tender and seasoned and we couldn't stop raving about our food. My vegetarian friend loved her food as well. We also splurged and added shaved white truffles to a simple pasta dish to share as an appetizer - best (and most expensive) pasta I've had outside of Italy. And did I mention they serve Tartine bread? Refills, please!

I did have one less than stellar experience with the ribs last time- a little dry for my tastes but the rest of the meal made up for it.

Also, the service is great here. Super friendly and hip. Sometimes a bit over enthusiastic but understandable when everything on the menu is that good. The walk-in table means a reasonable wait if you didn't reserve a month ahead. Not the best place for groups though - it's pretty crowded.

In a city filled with so much great food, it's rare to find a restaurant I'll always want to go back to. Delfina is one of them.
author: Lainy C.

description: Phenomenal pizza as you already know if you live in this city... But be aware of the lost abbey "inferno ale". It is a $17 beer!!!!!!!!
author: Neil S.

description: This is what every restaurant should inspire to be like.  The service was spot on.  Everyone had a smile on their face.  The food was fabulous.  It was the best dining experience I've had in a long time. The coed bathrooms were clean.
author: Jan F.

description:
HELLO DELICIOUSNESS!

I am still salivating over last night's dinner and am devising ways to make homemade pasta, because I definitely got my socks knocked off a bit last night.

Oh Delfina, you are on every list for great food, Italian, must try, etc. in my beautiful city of San Francisco.  So it was about time that my butt opted for a nice meal out with the hubby and friends and last night was the night.

Hype worries me.  Hell, even our server pointed out menu items that were acclaimed by Michael Bauers and 7x7... which leaves me skeptical and ready for my expectations to be high.  Yet, with all that, I truly had a really fabulous dinner.

The deliciousness:
Mint Tagliatelle- chanterelle mushrooms and wild nettles in a mint and cream sauce that was refreshing and absolutely yummy!  The homemade pasta is SO GREAT!

Lemon Buttermilk Panna Cotta- DEAR GOD, THIS IS PURE HEAVEN IN A LITTLE GELATINOUS FORM.  

Tasty, but not mindblowing:  Grilled Fresh Calamari with warm white bean salad and Brown Butter Finanziario.

I'm not a big fan of pate or tripe, but tried the Chicken Liver Crostini and Trippa alla Fiorentina.  Again I learned that I'm not a fan of either, but the flavors were pretty tasty... especially the sauce that the tripe was baked in.

Dishes are "moderately sized" for the pasta and they do half orders, so I would definitely suggest ordering appetizers and dessert... or share a pasta dish and order an entree and skip the apps.

DEFINITELY WORTH A VISIT!
author: Christine K.

description: The dinner was fantastic ! We had the blood orange Bellini , then we tried the beef carpaccio and the blood orange salad . Delicious . For main we had the skirt steak and the pork . For dessert we had the poppy seed torta . All the selections were amazing . The service was cordial and our waiter Jason  had great recommendations . The restaurant is beautiful . Great night out .
author: Jc Minion G.

description:
Considering the hype surrounding this place about months of advance booking required and so on, I wasn't too impressed to understand the hype.
Sure, the waiters have been trained to know the language of the menu and make connections, the food might very well be local, organic and all that, but I still can't understand a dinner for two costing $200 when mainly white beans and lentils were served.
Either it's become practically impossible to go out and be satisfied by a combination of factors such as food, service, ambiance, value for money, etc., or it is our fault for buying into any hype. 
One of my least favorite factors is the seating arrangements and the tables and chairs (it's as though they were purposefully designed to be uncomfortable so that you don't overstay your welcome). 
If I am going to charge $200 for a dinner for two, I am going to make damn sure the calamari are not burnt!
author: Nena G.

description: Enjoyed a wonderful dinner with my wife and daughter.  Very comfortable and friendly restaurant.  Wait staff are very welcoming and engaging.  Kitchen is visible from dining room allowing customers to watch the chefs at their best.  The chefs clearly take pride in the tasty and attractive dishes they prepare.  Be sure to order the Tartine bread.  The Tartine (bakery is three doors away) sourdough and house-cultured butter are the area's best.  The Corn Sformatino is a very tasty starter.  This corn and shrimp appetizer are not to be missed.  It literally melts in your mouth.  Be sure to share.  We also shared a side of spaghetti.  The pasta is not locally made, but you could have fooled us.  Genuine Italian spaghetti noodles tossed in a mild, but flavorful marinara.  For my entree, I had the quail and warm bread salad.  The quail was cooked perfectly - tender and most meat with outstanding flavor.  The warm bread salad paired well with the quail.  A combination of arugula and marinated jumbo croutons, the salad was a perfect complement to the meat.  My reasons for holding back on the 5 stars are that the wine list is limited (I recommend you bring your own bottle) and the restaurant is a bit pricey.  Nevertheless, I highly recommend Delfina and will be back to enjoy the food, the staff and the restaurant's good vibes.
author: Bob S.

description: The food here is good. Bottom line. I had the calamari, the artichokes, the short rib pasta, the papardelle and the quail and everything was excellent. Even my friend who write his own food blog thought it was good (and he's very picky).
author: Kerry K.

description:
This place  has the WOW factor!  Amazing service and food that makes you repeat over and over, "Oh my GOD!!!"  Our server explained poetically the process and ingredients of the dish when we ordered it.  That really added to the experience.  

The Boar Bolognese was something we had never experienced before.  It was complex and rich and it made you want to lick the plate.  My date who has eaten at many fine Italian restaurants all over the world said it was the best pasta dish he has ever had.  The simple spaghetti I ordered was full of fresh flavors and delicious.  

Their wine list was fun.  We ordered the Ryme Cellars 2007 Aglianico and it was a very exciting wine that was perfect with our meal.
author: Kara R.

description:
Like a bunch of the other reviewers, I was disappointed by the food at Delfina.  Ever since I moved to the city, I've heard how I HAVE to go to Delfina because the food is amazing. 

But alas, amazing it is not.  Ok is more like it.  It's pretty disappointing considering the pizza is so good:(  

We ordered the fried artichoke to start, then shared the salmon with white beans, the spaghetti with plum tomatoes, garlic, extra virgin olive oil and peperoncini and the Fregnacce with Louisiana white shrimp.  In a word, we were underwhelmed.  

Here is the breakdown:

Artichoke:  Pretty good!  I liked how the leaves are the texture of chips (but lighter) and the heart was delicious.  I would recommend it.  Squeeze lemon on it, but not too much!  The flavor can hold its own without all the lemon they give you.

The salmon: I hate salmon, so I can't, in good faith, review it, but even my salmon-loving companion thought it was just ok.

Fregnacce:  This came highly recommended by the waitress, which is a shame.  The texture of the pasta was AWESOME, don't get me wrong.  I really liked how it was al dente and thin like lasagna noodles (but smaller).  Had the sauce and shrimp had a better flavor, I would have loved this dish.  Alas, the sauce and shrimp were kind of... fishy.  Definitely not how you want your pasta to taste.  My dinner date seriously disliked this dish, I was merely indifferent.

Spaghetti:  This was admittedly pretty good, but VERY basic.  It doesn't scream high end restaurant because you could get the same spaghetti elsewhere for less.  I ended up eating this instead of my fregnacce because it was my favorite of the things we ordered.  That said, I think I make better spaghetti.

All in all, we liked Delfina's ambiance and service, but could definitely pass on the food, especially given the price (our meal cost us $100, pre-tip, with 1 glass of wine apiece).  Glad I can say I've been here, but I won't be back.
author: Julie S.

description:
Ah yes - a five because of the delicious Roasted Fulton Valley chicken. I never order chicken out but this one really makes my mouth water.

I liked the spaghetti for the most part. There's a little kick in the sauce and it's al dente if you're in to that. They had an appropriate device for the fresh ground parmesan. Quick, sanitary, and efficient!

Didn't wait long to be seated, sat at the bar, and had great service from the guy who just got married.

I liked their water canteen too because it made the water look so cool and refreshing. Details like that earned Delfina their top score.
author: Kelly T.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here to eat on a Sunday night.  We got there a little early for an 8 pm reservation and clearly it was packed because we had to wait at the bar until our table was ready.  The bar was pretty tiny, but once I got a glass of wine I didn't mind :)

We got two different salads to start.  One was an Asparagus with a Champagne, Black Pepper foam.  The other was a simple but delicious arugula salad with walnuts, pancetta, and balsamic vinaigrette.  I was a little bummed because they were out of the roasted beet appetizer that i wanted, but I guess that's what happens when your ingredients are fresh! I'm pretty sure the menu changes every day.

We both got pastas for our entree.  I got a REALLY tasty Whole Wheat Chittara that had a spicy cauliflower sauce and breadcrumbs on top.  Really outstanding.  My boyfriend is sort of a picky eater, so he went with the Spaghetti with Tomato sauce which was simple but looked like it was done really well.

The service was great too- our waiter was very friendly and attentive to our needs.  My only wish is that I had been a little more into the menu that night (because I might have ordered more), but that's definitely about personal taste.  

Overall, great Italian food in the Mission!
author: Jessica G.

description: We had to wait for our table for over 30 minutes and although they were apologetic we were not offered a complimentary drink. Personally I think it's overpriced for what you get. The pasta was delicious though.
author: Helena M.

description:
As good as everyone says it it.  

I had the "Insalata di Campo - bitter greens, pancetta, walnuts,Parmigiano and balsamic vinaigrette" great balance and not overly dressed.  Great start to a meal.  They know what less is more means, and follow it.

I had one of the pasta specials, tagliatelle with basil and mint and the mint was amazing touch.  Very unusual and I would recommend.

I followed with their famous 'Bay Laurel Buttermilk Panna Cotta' and it was divine.  So good. 

Great meal, wish we could get more decent hour reservations, this place is always packed.
author: ORLA L.

description: Perhaps we hit it on an off night, but it really boggles my mind that this place is so popular.  We found the food to be average and overpriced.  We spent around $200 on a meal that would have been $120 or so (and maybe tastier) at one of the many Italian places in North Beach.  The service was adequate, though, despite our reservation, we waited over 20 minutes for our table.  Our waitress was extremely friendly, but sadly inattentive.  If you're deciding between Delifina and their pizza joint next door, I'd recommend giving the pizza place a whirl.  I can't vouch for it, but it's definitely cheaper.
author: Joshua K.

description:
My friend and I had reservations at 9 but still had to wait since the staff was running behind. I checked out the online menu and had my eyes set on the mushroom risotto, but they were out of it. 

I had a house salad and split spaghetti with a friend, it was delicious! My friend really enjoyed the artichoke soup. Pasta was cooked perfectly.

Waitstaff comped a glass of wine and two desserts since they were out of the risotto. Nice!
author: Teri G.

description:
Delfina does have good food .

The place is small, noisy, and crowded but this is expected for a popular semi-high-end place in the mission. We actually kind of liked that.

Make sure you hit one of the taquerias near-by before coming or prepare your wallet for a two full-price entree meal per person. The portions here promote anorexia.
author: Jose S.

description: Wow. Its as good as it can be, the food is simple but perfect. We shared the simple pasta with red sauce that  they are known for and it doesn't disappoint. The grilled calamari atop white beans with a lettuce bed in also spectacular. The chicken is amazing as are all the desserts. Don't miss it, you will be thrilled you did !
author: Teri T.

description:
I've had some amazing dishes here, and I've had some okay dishes here, but the spaghetti is amazing.
And an amazing spaghetti is so, so satisfying.

The pastas overall are pretty reliable, so are the desserts.  I've had some great entrees and some okay ones, so mixed reviews there.

A rennovation would be nice, the restaurant seems a bit dated looking now, but honestly not a priority, no complaints... just a suggestion.
author: YJ P.

description: Solid italian food in the Mission. Service was fun, informative, and attentive. Great place to go with a group of friends to try out different dishes and have a fun time.
author: Carolyn F.

description: I thought the food was great. We got a good seat near the window which was fun. The waitress was very knowledgeable about wine and helped us pick out a good one. Everyone in my party commented that the food was great. My only critizim was that a couple times I was without drinks and it took some doing to flag someone down.
author: Marty W.

description:
We had another night out on the town with my sis + the boy and we were suppose to eat at Little Star, but my sis really wanted to eat here so on we went. 

We got rock star parking right out on front (good start!) then we walked in without reservations (because my sis said that every time she calls, the place is always booked, even if its two weeks in advance and so she got annoyed and thus, we were walk-in's!). When the sis called, the host said there was a table available at the bar, but unfortunately, they just seated them minutes before we walked in (what are the chances of that!?). She took our name + number down and she said about an hour or so more. 

I tried to force my sis to go somewhere b/c my tummy was grumbling, but she insisted that the wait is worth it. FINE. We had dessert first at Tartine (that's another review).

Tartine was closing so we went back to Delfina and the host was able to seat us right next to the kitchen and to the bar. First reaction: damn, this place is packed! This is what recession looks like? 

Anyway, we got seated and our server was really nice (though from previous Yelp reviews, some said service was bad, but I guess we got lucky last night and service was just awesome!)

My sis ordered a bottle of wine, she also started off with the beets salad, the boy and I shared the asparagus. We were also able to have half and half of the pasta! I was shocked to hear that's its doable, pretty cool. I forgot what my sis had (already tipsy from the wine) but I had half of the risotto and the other half is the spaghetti. The boy had the chicken something. 

We were given bread and the boy loved it. It really is good! Then my sis's nanny called her in the middle of our dinner and so she got worried. She called back and the nephew was sporting a 101.8 fever! Holy cow, all we could think about was the swine flu! GREAT!

So we rushed through our dinner. Our server was very accommodating of the situation and she boxed up my spaghetti and the boy's half eaten chicken. I inhaled my risotto! 

Though we were rushed, I was still able to enjoy the food to the fullest! It's just awesome. Service was great! Like my previous reviews, I'd go back here again only if my sis is paying...our total for the three of us was around $200 without tip but with all the food that we received, its about right. 

Thanks for a great night out!
author: Cath M.

description:
Last week end, my wife and I were thinking Italian for dinner.  Usually we hit Tommasos in North Beach for our fix, but we were too tired...   We stayed in the neighborhood and opted to give Delfina a try.  It's been a while since we were there and we are both huge fans of the Pizzeria.  Few phone clicks and we were able to make a last minute reservation for 5:30 PM.

From the first dish to the last one, everything was truly amazing...  The calamari appetizer left us speechless and took us back to Rome!   The Ragu was fresh and comforting .  The Brodetto Anconese was made in seafood heaven.   I am no wine connaisseur, but my Pinot was one of the best wines I'v ever had, subtle and mature .  The Plum Ricotta Desert was a delight!!!

The service was flawless.  I wish someone was following our waitress with a video camera for training purposes.

Thank you Delfina and see you soon!
author: Y B.

description:
Every time I go to the pizzeria next door, I always look longingly at the cute, dark restaurant next door. I finally made it to Delfina, and the bread alone was worth the trip. The menu states that the bread is available upon request, so request it immediately! There are two kinds of bread that are served with a square of butter with salt sprinkled over it- I think both are variations of sourdough, and both were delicious!  

The server highly recommended the calamari, which she claimed they were known for while showing us the Delfina logo that had a cute little calamari on it, and the corn basil soup. The calamari got mixed reviews at our table, but I have to say that I am a fan. It's fresh calamari- I believe it was roasted, not breaded and fried, which may have thrown some naysayers off- but it came in a herb-y sauce over some sort of legume with some greens and olives on the plate. The soup was an overall hit- a pureed green soup that had a bunch of flavor and sweetness from the corn. 

The real treat, however, was the short ribs. Super tender and flavorful- a good combo with the polenta that came with it. The portions are really tiny, so I would recommend getting at least one app or one pasta with a main dish. The gnocci was decent, but somewhat soggy, like it had been left out for a while. The spaghetti was a disappointment- it was bland and not worth the extra carbs. Although, the noodles were interestingly thick and perfectly al dente. 

The drinks menu is just wine and beer, but I loved the bellini! There was even a slice of nectarine in it, which tasted so good after being soaked in bubbly.
author: Janet H.

description:
We love this restaurant. 

First things first, please make a reservation early - otherwise, you have no chance of getting a table there. 

Second, parking is tricky, so go early.

Third, try everything on the menu. 

Ok, so here are some dishes we tried most recently:
1) calamari salad - it was fresh and crunchy  - but I would have preferred a stronger charcoal grill flavor to the squid.
2) Fried artichoke - it was very crispy but I couldn't really taste the sweetness of the artichoke.
3) Pasta Vongole - it was really really good, came with 3 types of clams, very sweet flavors, pasta was perfectly al dente, nice garlic punch - not overbearing. We shared 1 portion but I definitely could have had a whole plate of this. 
4) Braised pork cheek - had some smoky bbq flavors to it, strong reduction sauce, a little bit too salty, very tasty spring onions. 
5) Panna Cotta with candied kumquats. Loved the texture, it was gelatinous but still very soft and silky. 

See pictures :)
author: Emily L.

description:
Ok, I rated up a little bit because of one pasta dish I had but I think that 3.5 stars is probably a fairer assessment of the establishment.

So after all sorts of putting off and also failing to secure a table for 2 (30 min before I wanted to eat - I sheepishly admit) before 10 pm, I finally had the occasion to want to eat at 10 pm at Delfina.  I probably called around 9 pm and was given a table at 10 that night.

But on to food...this place is super hyped (obviously) but I wasn't really disappointed.  All around I found the place to be tasty, enjoyable, and friendly.  I would highly recommend doing appetizer, primi, secondi, and contorni (if you're up for it).  The kitchen is kind enough to do 1/2 portions on the bigger primi so that you can try more dishes.

-little gem lettuce salad w/ gorgonzola and sieved (yes, sieved!) egg: i was skeptical of both the "sieved" and the "gorgonzola" which I typically dislike.  however, i was quite surprised - i totally loved the flavor combo!
-chitarra integrale (square-ish spaghetti) and spicy cauliflower: this was the highlight of my dinner. sooo tasty, lightly flavored, great mingling of tastes, and the pasta was cooked perfectly and not overly olive oiled.
-roasted chicken: i hardly ever order chicken when dining out but this was pretty damn good.  juicy, tender, flavorful.
-jerusalem artichoke: my one mistake of the evening.  totally my fault though, i got overly excited about the word "artichoke" and forgot that jerusalem's are not artichokes...they're more like root vegetables.  i wasn't particularly pleased with the dish.  i would bet the swiss chard would've gone better with my chicken.

i think my bf ordered the plum tomato spaghetti but wasn't really thrilled with it...
author: Priscilla T.

description:
my friend helped us to get a table for four, and we got the best table..one of the two tables by the window.

Service was good.  Refill of olive, bread, water.  

We ordered from the apps, salad, and pasta, tripe.  Everything was tasty and we split everything between the four of us.  Each of us only got a small serving of each because the portions are pretty small.

Two unisex bathrooms and a outdoor patio.

Ten dishes and 4 glasses of wine: $161 or so.  Pricey but I'd go back if someone else is paying.
author: Ann L.

description: Had some fantastic pizza from here the other night, delivery. We had the prosciutto pie, fennel sausage, and 4 cheese w/pepperoni. The prosciutto was the crowd fav but they were all really good. I would definitely order it again.
author: Amanda S.

description: Always good!  We had a party of 6...and we were a bit crazy!  They were wonderful, accommodating and the food per usual was to DIE FOR!
author: Jen S.
Ali A.

description: Food was excellent. A little pricey but if you love good food it was well worth it. Service was excellent.
author: Mitchell P.

description: The homemade pastas here are unbelievable, particularly the mint tagliatelle with chanterelle mushrooms & wild nettles; the pasta is so soft it melts in your mouth and the mint is perfectly refreshing. My mouth is watering thinking about it! That being said, I do reserve Delfina for special occasions because you get what you pay for. I also had their orange wine flight when they offered it; it was spectacular.
author: SiliconValleyShoeGirl L.

description: Over-hyped! The food is okay, but definitely pricey for the small-ish portions. I was with a group of six and when we arrived at 8 for our reservation, we were kept waiting for another 15 minutes or so. That wouldn't be so bad, but there was nowhere to wait, so we kept getting asked to stand to the side while servers squeezed past us. It wasn't fun for us, and it couldn't have been fun for the people who's table we were practically pressed up against. Nice ambiance, nice server, but still not worth it.
author: K S.

description:
Finally came here to try it out, but I was disappointed :( After 45mins of finding a parking, I was ready for a glass of nice wine and good food.  My wine was not as impressive as I thought and the food was so so. We got tripe and sunchokes as our appetizers, and it was just ok. I had the Chitarra Integrale and what happened to the spicy?? I thought the food was a little on the salty side. 

Seatings was not great because we waited half an hour though we had reservations. Then, we were kicked out of table by an Italian lady because she claims that the table was hers. The service made us a little happier because the staff was very apologetic and gave us the mozzarella with Heirloom Tomatoes on the house. Overall, I didn't like the seatings at all because we were so close to the neighbors that we can hear every conversation.

Well, sorry but this place is definitely not my kind of Italian place...
author: Vivien L.

description: Everything is good here but the calamari and the crab are out of this world. An interesting wine menu and an ever changing menu make this a must on your to do list.
author: Colleen B.

description:
Eating here made me stop giving the top 100 resturant list of SF any attention.  Switched to word of mouth and Michelin list and had better luck.

Waited years to try this place, so many foodies have raved about it.  What a disappointment.  We ordered everything based on repeat recomendations  all of it was not tasty.
author: Surai J.

description:
I had to come back to the city to pick up my ID that I left at Bruno's the weekend before so my friend and I decided to try out Delfina. Might as well make the hour drive worth it. We got there at 8:45 pm without a reservation on Friday night and was told the wait was going to be 45 mins. They are really high tech. They take reservations with an IPad and call you when a table is ready. Walked to Brunos to get the ID. Come back after 30 mins. No table. Finally we get seated after a total wait of about an hour. 

We ordered the Raab, Risotto, and Chicken. I didn't care for the Raab. Was a bit salty for my taste but the Risotto and Chicken were really good. I wouldn't call it amazing because I'm not a foody and not sure what amazing food should taste like. The chicken was really juicy and tender. Definitely cooked really well. 

I would definitely come back but minus the hour wait. The service was also really slow and they got our orders mixed up with some other people. A reservation is a must if you are planning to go on a weekend.
author: Esther K.

description: Needed a small eat to get me by until a late dinner.  We ordered the salsiccia and green beans.  Food was good but I want to come back here and try the menu for thoroughly.  A little pricey but hey,  you can see, smell, and taste the difference.
author: Steven U.

description:
Came early on a rainy Tuesday evening with my family and was sat immediately by the hostess.  

Four words: rigatoni with duck ragu.  Seriously! It was delicious, hearty and rich.  Perfect for the cold night.  I was a bit hesitant to order the special, but am so glad I did. 

In addition, we started with the grilled calamari which was served over white beans and a salad.  It was a perfect, light and tasty first course.  We also ordered 2 desserts, the espresso profiteroles and the chocolate budino.  The chocolate budino was so decadent and perfect with the gelato that accompanied it.

Service was excellent and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their dinners!  Can't wait to return and try more food from the menu!  But because it changes, I better return quickly ;)
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
This is my 3rd visit to Delfina, it has become our tradition to celebrate my bf's b-day here. It is by far the best Italian food in San Francisco according to him. I like the innovative spin they put on the usual Italian fare - pasta with squid ink, copa di testa, pork belly or tripe. 

But i can only review what I had last night: 

Copa di testa - it was explained to us as cheese made out of pork (what?!). Turns out it's sausage like goodness, that's made out of pork pieces in pork broth and then set to jell-o style. It was served with marinated onions, which complemented the dish perfectly (only complaint is that there were 3 tiny pieces). 

Speck - cured ham, prosciutto-like served with shaved artichokes and arugula. This was very delicious, right combination of salty and peppery. 

Grilled fresh calamari - very well executed, the only problem was that we had it right after all these bold flavors and it seemed a little bland. 

For our entrees we chose pasta dishes: 

Spaghetti with plum tomatoes - nice sauce that has a kick, the only complaint was that the pasta was kind of gummy (that's why i took 1 star off) as if it was cooked in a little water or water that has a lot of starch in it (that's what happens when restaurant reuse water other pasta has been cooked in) 

Spaghetti con ragu - sauce was amazing!! we almost licked the plate:) 

Service - very good, although we had to ask for the bread ourselves. 

Bread - WOW! Fresh and crusty!

Thank you, Delfina! We will come back again next year or hopefully sooner! :)
author: Kate B.

description:
An exquisite meal from start to finish!

My wife and I recently ate here for the last meal of our honeymoon.  Our decision to eat here was kind of spontaneous so I wasn't sure if we would be able to get a table without a reservation.  We showed up at 5:30 (the beginning of their dinner service) and we were seated right away.  

The atmosphere of the restaurant was very nice and relaxed.  Our servers were very prompt, polite and pleasant. They were very helpful in suggesting wine to pair with our dinners and didn't seem in any rush to get our entree order so the table could be used again after us.  Neither of us frequent fine Italian restaurants and needed to ask about some of the items on the menu and our server was very nice in explaining what they were.

We started with an appetizer of whole grilled prawns which had a lemon butter sauce.  The prawns perfectly cooked and the sauce was amazingly flavorful.  

We then ordered the small spaghetti  to share.  The noodles were perfectly al dente and the sauce was a simple and wonderful fresh tomato and basil.  The portion was just enough to fully enjoy the flavors and the experience of eating the spaghetti without filling up too much before the entrees.  

The main course was grilled stake for my wife and I had the chicken.  Each was perfectly cooked and seasoned.

Desert was ecstasy.  It consisted of perfectly ripe and roasted peaches topped with creme fraiche between two amazing pistachio cookies.  It was so good that my wife almost started crying.

This is definitely one of the restaurants we will come back to around our anniversary.  Everything about the experience was great and the best part was we were only a block away from home.  Though the whole meal was a significant amount of money it was well worth it.
author: Eric Z.

description:
I like that they had some imaginative dishes on their menu.  So many pizzerias have the customary Caesar's salad (yawn) and little more.  We had: 

Chilled Tripe, with chili oil (that came in a repurposed bottle of bitters).  It was great, but the order was a bit lean

Octopus "Bay of Naples Style", a wonderful tentacle in a red wine broth with capers, fingerling potatoes and a fried slice of bread.  Fabulous.

The Salsiccia pizza.  It was perhaps the least impressive of the three.  The crust was perfect.  The sauce, a little thin and watery.  The sausage was very tasty.

The wait staff was very kind and polite.

If we're in the area, we will surely be stopping by again.
author: Lolailo Y.

description:
Aside from one dish that was ok, the rest was nothing short of amazing. I had their salad with fresh figs and walnuts to start. The figs were so ripe and perfect it was delicious. We also had their crostini with pork rillette (forgot their Italian name for this). At first we were like, these are kind of tiny. But once you ate it you knew why. The flavors were so fatty and rich, it was better off eating little of it so you can savor it without feeling overwhelmed by the pork fat. For the main entree, I had their Mint Tagliatelle with porcini mushrooms. This was AMAZING! The mint that was worked into the pasta was not overwhelming, but just right and cooked to perfection. The porcini mushrooms were so fresh and full of fragrance.  The sauce that it was cooked in wasn't too salty, everything was perfect. I highly recommend this dish. I haven't had anything like this.

The other amazing dish I had was my friend's Spaghetti. You'd think how much more special can you make spaghetti with tomatoes and garlic right? Well, this one was amazing. To be exact, it says on the menu that they put plum tomatoes, garlic, extra virgin olive oil and peperoncini in the dish. I felt like this when I first had Via Veneto's bolognese in Santa Monica. You took one fork full and you were like WOW. I don't know what they do to it to make it so exploding with flavor but Delfina did some magic to it. Don't shy away from this simple dish because there's nothing simple about the flavors. There's an amazing layering of perfect flavors in there, you HAVE to try it. 

The Bucatini was good but didn't blow me away. That's probably why I already forgot what was in it. 

To be honest, their desserts weren't really worth writing about. But I didn't care cuz their pasta dishes were amazing. Definitely coming back when I'm in SF again. I'm a fan just like the other thousands of fans out there.
author: Yokes F.

description: Finally, real steak and friets in San Francisco - and I had to go to an Italian restaurant to get it. Mind you, it was also the best duck pate, and the dinner was topped off with a Chocolate Zuppa and a quince tart! Bring it all together with TOP service, and I actually thought I was in Paris!
author: Gerald L.

description:
Came here twice for dinner during  a 3 night stay in San Francisco. Does that say alot? Everyone is super friendly and laid-back... starting from the hostess to the waitresses/ waiters and bartenders. Everything we had was delicious! 

The spaghetti was to die for! So simple, but really the best spaghetti Ive had. 
The Brussel sprouts were the best sides Ive had. 
For dessert- the Panna Cotta was out of this world. I have never had such good panaa cotta. 

The wine was great. Honestly. I HIGHLY recommend this restaurant. 
Our waitress was super nice and gave us a list of places to go have brunch at the next day including some wine bars. 

Not cheap, but very comparable to restaurants in NYC.
author: Glendaly S.

description: The best! You need to make reservations a month in advance but it is so worth it. The food is amazing. It's simply prepared but close to perfect. Prices are moderate - not cheap, but it is so worth it.
author: Laura D.

description:
The food here is quite tasty. Everything tasted fine and the service was very attentive. Heck, the waitress was flat-out super!

So, we tried the famous grilled calamari and frankly, it wasn't that spectacular. I must suggest y'all order up the salt cod mantecado to start. It's just so delish! The only downer: you get the spread in a tiny ramekin and you're left wanting more of this salty goodness.

To sum it up, the food really only earned 3 stars. It's the amazing welcome and service you get here that makes it a 4-star spot to dine.
author: Lisa R.

description:
Four of us ate here on Sunday Feb 23. The food was the same as always. 

But our server, a plump blonde, just made the experience awful. She was so miserable and unhappy. Ugh - ruined the meal for our family. Shouldn't be working here if she is so unhappy.
author: Maria E.

description: Tonight was the 2nd time in a row we've been under impressed.  For a restaurant that charges high dollar for it's meals, I expect to be astonished and, though service was good, the four antipasti and the three main dishes (risotto, tagliatelle, and hay and straw) didn't knock our socks off.  And on top of it all, their glasses if wine ranged from $9-$18.  After tax, tip, health care, the top half if the wine list was all well over $20 a glass.  I honestly walked away feeling gouged.
author: Stephen R.

description:
Waitress: "I just want to let you know that the meatballs aren't ready yet."
Me: "Oh bummer. When will they be ready?"
Waitress: "I don't know.  The kitchen doesn't really like it when I ask them. We'll just have to wait and if they become ready, I can tell you."

I suppose that's reasonable. I'm just a measly customer. Far be it from me to ask my waitress to disturb the kitchen staff.  I'm sure they have far bigger concerns than letting their patrons know what can and cannot be ordered.  Maybe next time I should just guess what's on the menu. Then the waitress can bring it out if I get it right and I can just sit there if I get it wrong.

Really, this business with the meatballs may be the single stupidest thing I've heard from wait staff at a restaurant in a very very long time.

To their credit, the meat balls did come out and they were damned good.  But the airhead waitress was slow as a slug - and the service sucked too.
author: Amy A.

description:
I was looking forward to dinner at Delfina for a while and had high expectation given the special place this restaurant holds for so many SF diners.  The atmosphere is certainly pleasant, although if you are sitting on the wooden benches along the walls, not very comfortable.  The service is accomplished and friendly, an air of contentment permeates the entire place.

The perfectly grilled Monterrey Bay sardines with caponata certainly lived up to the highest expectations - the sweetness of the impeccably fresh fish delightfully balanced by the slightly vinaigry eggplant and onion mixture.  Of the same high standard were the roasted chicken with mushrooms and very rich mashed potatoes and the saltimbocca with a wonderful polenta.  

Where things went (unexpectedly) awry was with the pasta dishes.  The spaghetti with tomato sauce were oddly gummy, as if cooked in water that was not hot enough - an unpleasant consistency that was almost shocking for a restaurant of this caliber.  While most versions of pasta fagioli are a heady mix of beans and pasta, Delfina's version was more a smooth bean puree soup, with a few errant little strips of (a bit overcooked) pasta floating forlornly in it.  As such it tasted very good, contrary to the spaghetti.
author: Thor T.

description:
OVERALL:3.3   FOOD:3   SERVICE:4   AMBIANCE:N/A   VALUE:3

To be fair, this is based only on their offerings at the SF Street Food Fest, and since they opted for some unknown reason to NOT serve pizza (wtf?!), I can't speak to that.  BRING PIZZA NEXT TIME!

That aside, the raves I heard about their meatball hero were still compelling enough for me to stand in line & shell out $8.  Totally maddening to stand for 10 minutes, less than 10 feet from the mother lode, smelling garlicky marinara and watching everyone ELSE walking & chomping away on steamy, toasty meat-on-bun action.

Finally made it to the front, greeted by quick, smiley service--laudably efficient given the overall chaos of the event.  Bread (ciabatta?) was nicely toasted though a tad charred, and the 2 meatballs were *just* the right level of bigness.  Goldilocks woulda been proud.  Marinara was the clear superstar, rounded out by a smattering of gooey mozzarella.  Meatball was decent but slightly dry and left me pining for more flavor & juicy satisfaction.

Good enough for me to want to check out the real restaurant version, especially to try some of that famous pizza!
author: Amy K.

description: Ate there last night for the first time in about 3 years. It's still amazing and delicious. I'm still a fan.
author: Shaz D.

description:
Scored a seat for 2 on a Sunday night without rezzies AND without a wait - woo!!

We ordered the following:
-Prosciutto with figs
-Spaghetti (larger portion)
-Broccoli Rabe side
-Chicken w mashed taters

All of it was amaazing!  The prosciutto knocked my socks off - it was sooo delish with a perfect balance of saltiness and meatiness.  Service was very prompt and friendly.  I would go back in a heartbeat!
author: Emily W.

description:
Had wanted to try Delfina for a long time, and the wait was well worth it. Absolutely delicious from start to finish. Started with delicious blood orange bellinis, a suggestion from our waitress - very delicious and a lovely way to start the meal. We had brought our own bottle of wine and with a corkage fee of only $18 we were very pleased. 

We then had the ibollita del delfina which was delicious (perhaps with too much salt, though). Really unusual. We then had a lovely salad which I can't remember what the name was. It was unique and fresh.

We enjoyed a mussel pasta dish was out of this world then dined on the duck which was stunning.

Service was fantastic. Out waitress was in training and did an amazing job.

All told it was a pricey but delicious meal and I can't wait to go back again, for another special occasion.
author: Fog N.

description:
Delfina is nice.

Good food..... especially for people trolling in the mission.

While, Delfina is a bit OVERATED, I can't fault it.....Defina is OK.

Pizza place next door w/ the lines & affectionate faces (maybe affected) is somthing to be missed.

Cheap n good / wholesome / value:

Valencia Pizza & Pasta
4 star ratingbased on 143 reviews Rating Details »Categories: Pizza, Italian  [Edit] 

Neighborhood: Mission
801 Valencia St
(between 19th St & Cunningham Pl)
San Francisco, CA 94110
(415) 642-1882
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Another Dinner night in the Mission, I strolled in with a girlfriend. I had called ahead hoping for a cancelled reservation to make room for a candlelit girlfriend dinner, but no budge. The hostess then recommended we sit at the bar. We got there around 9 at night and it was still fully packed. We were offered assistance and catering from a waitress while we waited for seat to become available. 
I ordered a glass of Syrah. A nice red. Very sweet and light. I think it was the 2008 from Sonoma. That I do recommend. 
We shortly found a seat at the bar. I recommended to my girlfriend the grilled fresh calamari over a white bean salad. Which again, was a delighter like last time. We ordered the Spaghetti, which the bartender Josh recommended. Basked in plum tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, peperoncini, the pasta made in house - my girlfriend soon found out why they were known for their pasta. Not overcooked, overdone, and by gone right perfect, the noodles were perfect.
The noodle dish with the pork had the right amount of sauce and again, the flat noodles were perfect. I've never had a noodle dish made as perfect as Delfina does.
author: Jacqueline L.

description:
Probably the most consistantly delicious food in San Francisco. Fresh ingredients, house made pastas, and amazing chicken. Wonderul Italian wines and great service. It is very reasonable for the quality of the food.  Whenever I splurge and hit up some very high end restaurarnt of the moment, I frequently wish I was eating here again instead.

 It is almost always crowded but you can usually walk in early and sit at the few tables and counters that are reserved for walk-ins. 

Yes it is loud but fun and SO VERY delcious!
author: N M.

description:
My friends and I originally scheduled dinner for Saturday at flour+water at 8pm... no reservations. Didn't matter anyways because we were all running late so we changed changed it to Beretta at 9pm... 2 and a half hour wait (on a side note: I've never heard of a restaurant telling anyone it's a 2 and a half hour wait. It sounded kind of ridiculous. You would think that they would say the next reservation is available at 11:30pm?). I didn't mind anyways because now it was my chance to suggest the one restaurant that I've been wanting to go to all along... Delfina!! We called them and made their earliest reservations... 10pm. Funny thing is, we didn't all arrive to the place until 9:30-9:45 anyways.

Delfina has been on top of my to-do list ever since Kelsey E.'s "rave" (pun-intended) reviews of this place. For a party of four, we ordered the calamari, burrata, sardines, tagliatelle, gnocchi, rabitt, lamb, pana cotta, a chocolate dessert, and two bottles of wine (this is not including the after meal digestives and dessert wine). Kelsey E. recommended the calamari, burrata, tagliatelle, and pana cotta. I wonder if these boys knew what they had cut out for themselves when they promised to treat us to this meal?

Anyways, everything was delicious, but my stand out favorites were the tagliatelle, sardines, and pana cotta... and the wine of course. The tagliatelle with mint was unbelievable. It was a combination of flavors that I wold have NEVER thought I'd enjoy. Hmmm cream and mint... delicious! The sardines were also a surprise. Sardines are used often in Korean stews, but I had never had them prepared like this before. I don't want to say they were breaded, but I'm not sure of the exact preparation of them. They came with a couple grilled limes to squeeze on top... mmm... mmm! I'm not a big orange girl, but I'm so glad I took Kelsey E's suggestion and ordered the pana cotta. Possibly one of the best dessert's I've ever had.

All in all... it was one of the best dinners EVER! Amazing wine, delicious food, and great company... what more can you ask for on a Saturday night in the greatest city in the world!
author: Crystal Y.

description: Best spaghetti ever. Have always walked in on the early side or got lucky to be able to sit at the bar. Great service and the food is fantastic. Great wine and cocktail selection.
author: Caroline P.

description: It's over priced & over rated. For the $, the portions are small & restaurant noise level high. For "fine" dining experience in the Mission, there is this and Foreign Cinema - but considering the neighborhood? They should knock the $ off the menu just a bit more.
author: Star B.

description:
Bottom line-- Great food. Great Service. 

I couldn't be happier every time I eat here. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, well trained, and accommodating. 

Just thinking about the Salmon wrapped in fig leaf makes me salivate.

It's truffle season and french fries with white truffles shaved on top= omg. 

The menu is limited for people with dietary restrictions, but they are happy to accommodate for whatever you need (ie. vegan, gluten free, whatever).

I just love this place.
author: Olivia C.

description:
Each visit to Tartine, I would pass by this restaurant, but never had a chance to try it till this last visit to SF.  Let me preface that I came to this restaurant with high expectations...heard oodles of great reviews.  Overall, I was a tad bit disappointed.  

Let me begin with the service.  I came on a Friday late dinner (9pm, to be exact) with a party of three.  Luckily, there were just two parties ahead of us, so the wait was simply 15 minutes.  For having no reservations, we were stoked!  The server was very friendly, but the wait to get their attention took FOREVER.    

The food was good, but nothing that leaves me speechless.  The bread was delicious!  Figures it was going to be good, since it was from Tartine....mmmm!!!  I never pass up on the complimentary starch platter to start off the meal. :)  We started off with two appetizers....the grilled calamari with white beans (that was AMAZING!!!) and the insalata di campo (good, but nothing to really write home about).  For the main course, I ordered the papardelle w/pork suigo & piquillo peppers.    The flavors were GOOD, but not exciting.  I was a tad bit disappointed with the portion of the dish.  I don't expect portions similar to cheap chain italian restaurants like Olive Garden and such, but I felt like I was skimped a bit.  

The ambiance was calm for the most part, but we sat close to the open kitchen where you can hear some of the commotion.     

Would I come back?  Perhaps, but I'll make sure the next time, I eat plenty of the Tartine bread or order more appetizers to help fill this large belly of mine!
author: Emily A.

description:
I was really excited to finally go to this place after a long time. I've been to the pizzeria next door several times and I liked it, so I was expecting a lot.....but, my experience here was really disappointing. It's just overrated and totally overpriced for what you get. 
They were out of lazagna that Saturday night and had pappardelle, egg pasta,  instead as a special. Pappardelle is big flat pastas so it might be heavy if having a lot but what we got there was only like 6-7 pastas on a plate. Yes, I'm talking about 6-7 SLICES of pasta! It looked like we were getting some leftover from someone's plate or something. 
Also, everything was too salty and not that good. 
Can't even be compared to other nice Italian restaurants in the city such as Perbacco.
author: Christa K.

description: 15 years ago we ate here nice!  Now a few days ago dinner again and was very good tasty food and service was fine. Had to ask for bread & butter.  My entree $19 pasta was more like a appetizer.
author: Ron M.

description:
I wasn't even hungry and I ate a shit load (based on their not so big portions). 

Kelly T. and I came in on a Friday night and got seated immediately at the bar. 

Our waiter was great, funny and attentive and gave us water right away which was good because I was dying of thirst, dying!

We ordered the spaghetti and roasted chicken.  The spaghetti was very good, it was a bit spicy and the noodles were al dente! The chicken was moist and tasty. (Definitely better than NOPA f.y.i.)

The only thumbs down was the iced tea, which was $3 and tasted like a vodka tonic, but didn't get me drunk.
author: Marisa R.

description: I want to have my last mean here.  For such a little place, the expeirence is always grand.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Deeeeelicous!  Friendly, tasty, and perfectly cozy.  Got the spaghetti and I was not disappointed.   Also got the tuna appetizer with fennel and orange.  Sat and talked for over 2 hours and we weren't bothered to move.

I don't quite know why someone else reviewed how you can make Delfina spaghetti at home, because then I would have to miss out on what an awesome experience this place is.
author: Ali L.

description:
I was more than excited to be having a group dinner here with my coworkers.  This area in the Mission is so cute and its right next to Dolores Park.  There is free parking on the street but get ready to look per usual its SF. 

Its right next to their casual pizza eatery so if you have reservations you are looking to go to Deflina.  Its hard to get into this restaurant as I've heard so make rezzys in advance. 

We had a couple of great red wines- one in particular was a sparkling that was so perfect for a celebration toast. Wish I had gotten the name of it.. 

The notable things that we ordered- may or may not be available anymore because their menu seems to change a lot. Which is great for variety and coming back but sad news if you really really liked something and want it again. 

- Proscuitto appetizer
- This meat appetizer that tastes like a soup but its in solid form- ah it was so good sorry I don't remember the name!
- Mint pasta- so refreshing with cream sauce
- Mahi Mahi- such a huge piece
- Chocolate molten cake with ice cream 
- sorbet

I'd love to come back to this place again and try other authentic Italian dishes. Seems to be a great place for any occasion.
author: Anya R.

description:
Superb hospitality on top of excellent food and great ambiance. 

Hospitality is when a restaurant does something unexpected to please its customers.  For a casual place, Delfina went out of its way to make us happy.  It is a busy restaurant, and they made us wait for half an hour for our reservation; however, the hostess and the manager each came and sincerely apologized to us.  What surprised us was they really tried to make up for the wait time by serving up an extra appetizer and an extra pasta for our meal.  That's when you know they care about you.  

The menu looks deceptively simple.  Each dish is tersely listed as just the principal ingredient with one or two accompaniments.  Yet the flavors are complex and well-developed.  

In particular, the Paccheri with Pacific true cod was the star.  What a creative pasta with unique flavor: cod pieces cooked to resemble bay scallops, and a tomato and fennel sauce that's tangy, savory and a little licoricey sweet all at the same time - nothing I've had anywhere else.

Grilled calamari, Involtini (cabbage-wrapped meat roll) and Spaghetti were all great.  However, the Berkshire pork fell flat, as the meat was dry from overcooking or from sitting around for too long.  

Desserts: the Rice Pudding and the Black Pepper Panna Cotta made a tasty finish to the meal.  Again, deceptively simple.  The Rice Pudding was actually made with rice stored with white truffles - delicious!  The Panna Cotta was creamy but well-balanced with the sweet and tart balsamic strawberry sauce.  The black pepper flavor didn't really come out, but I'm ok with that. 

Had a great time, and I really commend the excellent staff and service.
author: Thomas L.

description: We had diner a few weeks ago - a party of 5. The food was amazing - but the service was lacking to the point of making the experience uncomfortable for us as a group. When the dinner arrived - 4 out of 5 of us had hot food sitting in front of them - unfortunately my food came about ten minutes later. (and i was the only female) Very VERY awkward. The guys I was with were gentleman and would not start until my food arrived - and they all ended up eating cold dinners. On top of that - i had asked the waiter for the wine list - and wanted to order a glass of wine - and he did not show up at our table again until we were all done eating. A little late for that glass of wine to go with my meal. Big bummer. They should hire more wait staff - as i said the food was good but the service was horrible. We won't be back : (
author: L.M. W.

description:
I very much enjoyed my near-perfect evening at Delfina!  The dining area is warm and relaxed and the service is noticeably better trained, imperceptibly weaving in and out of tables and through the dining room in orchestrated efficiency.

More importantly, the food is delicious!!  The menu constantly changes so there's always something new to try. The dishes we had were flavorful, balanced, warm and comforting. I savored each as they arrived -  house-cured lardo, pasta e fagioli with pancetta and ditalini, roasted Liberty duck with kumquats. The wine selection is more than adequate and pairs nicely with the menu.

The only disappoint was the Meyer Ranch hangar steak with french fries - way to salty!  The fries were salted and had fried sage and rosemary mixed in so the salt level was off the charts.  Add a salty steak and a salty reduction and my taste buds became fried themselves!
author: Vicente G.

description: Just for the pizzeria side. Nothing extraordinary, despite the daily queue and comments in the various guides. Our pizza was good but a little dry with a paste of good taste but too much thin. The service and the waitresses (very pleasant smile) despite the rush were on the top. To be tested. We regret not having been tested the restaurant side.
author: YO L.

description: Best pasta ever, served in a relaxed style by waiters at the top of their game. Go late or very early and try for a walk-in table. Getting a reservation is near futile.
author: Kate R.

description:
It's pretty inconvenient that Delfina doesn't use Open Table, so it took my man and I three years to finally use a gift certificate he got as a present.

So, I finally planned a week ahead and was able to get a reservation... for a Sunday night (not Friday, not Saturday). A week ahead and there were only three available times: 5:30, 8:30 and 10pm. "Ooh. Eight, I'll take eight." I say quickly like it's going to be snatched away any minute.

Okay, so that's annoying but this is really about the food and the pricing. Our appetizers were great. I loved the mixed green salad with pancetta and my fiance was really happy with the squid salad. After that, it was all downhill.

My chicken was dry and the mushroom sauce was tasteless. My boyfriend swore his puny rabbit had Knorr sauce on it. I asked for beans instead of potatoes and the butter beans had zero seasoning. None of the entrees came with green vegetables so we had to order them separately, which seriously increases the price of the meal. Not everyone wants bread AND potatoes or beans. There is a serious lack of creativity on the menu. Find something else to pair with protein.

Some people would call Delfina's style of cuisine, simple. I would NOT be one of those people. I would call it ridiculously simple. I'm a modest cook, but could have cooked those entrees at home for 1/15 the $210 price tag.

Then - because we had a gift certificate - we ordered dessert. Disappointing dessert. What's wrong with all you pannecotta lovers? Zero texture and sweetest syrup *thing* ever. Ick (My favorite food is Skittles, so when something is too sweet for me, it is INEDIBLE to my fiance.) And then there was the pineapple upside-down cake. Ugh. Totally sour and hard to eat. It was like trying to eat a soggy croissant with a spoon. (I just threw up in my mouth thinking about the texture.) Our desserts went 80% uneaten.

And then the service. Our waiter made a lap through the dining room every four minutes, and was impossible to make eye-contact with since he only looked at tables and not at faces. He didn't even ask us how we liked the desserts. He circled by 4 times without clearing the plates even though we had our utensils in pick-up position.

At $70, this would have been a 3-star restaurant; at $210, it's a neighborhood rip-off.
author: Ana D.

description: Once again a fantastic meal and dining experience at Delfina!  We were packed in among exciting, vibrant people obviously enjoying themselves.  If you want quiet and pomp this isn't the place to go, but if creative zesty absolutely delicious food and a killer selection of Italian wines served in a hip Mission spot is what you are wanting, visit Delfina.  Visit Delfina over and over again!!!!!
author: C N.

description:
I'll add my two cents in an ocean of good reviews. Although I enjoyed not waiting for a table, I have to say I found the food very BLAND. I had a vegetarian cannelloni dish, the pasta was super doughy (sheet of pasta rolled several times instead of a one layer tube), the cheese filling looked and certainly tasted like wallpaper glue. My friend's prosciutto pizza was decent, but not worth waiting in line for. Finally, the baba au rhum (dessert) was just forgettable.

Much ado about nothing!
author: Laure b.

description:
Overrated.

Went here for dinner. The consensus among all of us was: unremarkable.

This is not a cheap restaurant and not terribly easy to get a table at. Not entirely sure why.

My pasta was just OK. My partner's hangar steak was, in his words, disgusting.

Pluses? The bread and the side of chard I had. Both were excellent. But you know you have a crap restaurant when the sides and bread are the only positive things you can point to.
author: Jason M.

description:
That fresh calamari over white beans with arugula had to be one of the best starters I ever tried. Though it was VERY busy, the food was still excellent which amazed me because a lot of times, cooks are struggling to make food delicious and sending it out quickly. 

Their split pastas are TO DIE FOR. Especially the one with bass. I forgot what it was called. So much depth in the broth. Amazing. Their roasted chicken was very good as well and the lamb shoulder was just a tiny notch under. We also ordered the braised tripe. Ten dollars? What a steal. Simply melted in my mouth. What a great idea. 

We passed on dessert. They seemed a bit boring. Delfina, you have beaten SPQR, foodwise.
author: Monica L.

description:
I have had their pizza on six occasions now.  I have had lot of great pizzas all over the world, and Delfina is right up there.

Salads are a bit too salty.

The service and the attitude to which it is attached leaves something to be desired. 

My rating is for pizza only.
author: Matt B.

description: Damn I enjoyed my meal here. My friend and I started with the calamari which was fresh and was in a delicious bean sauce. I am still dreaming about my spaghetti that I had, the pasta was perfection and the tomato sauce was perfect. I definitely need to come back soon! Make a reservation so you don't have to wait a long time!
author: Jennifer J.

description:
The calamari def didn't come out with tartar and marinara sauce. It came equiped with tentacles, ink and all, and was pretty good. I had the basic spaghetti with lots of shredded parmesan. I felt like I was in the scene of 'Eat Pray Love' (not a fan of the book). I had no idea spaghetti could taste better than when made from the jar with loads of fresh mushrooms and garlic and such. This meal was tomato, herbs, noodles pretty much and TO DIE FOR. I can't say this place was 4 or 5 stars because I didn't order enough to have an extensive overview. Stay posted.

I should make a separate review for Delfina Pizzeria...Nah. The place next door isn't bad if you like thin crust. You're gonna need one all to yourself. Both places get 3 stars each.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I hadn't been to Delfina's in years because it's so darn hard to get a reservation with influx of all these new comers into the Mission area.  so I choose it for my 66th birthday as I knew far in advance when I wanted to go there.   And I will say the quality of food and service is still great although they sat us in the bar area and so we were subjected to so noise coming from the bar and kitchen area.   In addition, I just could not believe that they charged us for extra butter!!!   What kind of fine restaurant does that, especially when they give you two pats of butter for all the bread when you order it?   My boyfriend had the pork but he wished there were more vegetables with the dish.   But I loved my squab although they did not serve it with chicory as it was described on the menu.   All in all, I enjoyed the food and the service was excellent.
author: Gina K.

description:
Went here for the last day of their white truffle dinners.  Since it was also their anniversary, we got a free "splash" of prosecco to start the dinner, though it was more like a half-glass...win!  

Since I was getting pasta, I wanted some meat for the appetizer, so I went for the Carne Crudo.  The meat was really good and I loved the celery root that went with it.  Celery root is officially one of my favorite vegetables ever.  Hubby got a dungeness crab salad which I didn't try.

For my main course, I got the Tajarin in Bianco, with a full serving (5 grams) of the shaved fresh white truffle.  How could I not?  The pasta was warm and eggy and cheesy and buttery...the perfect backdrop for the truffle to shine.  I kept ooh-ing and aah-ing so much while the chef was shaving the truffle (it smelled sooo damn good) I think he took pity on me and gave me a little extra.  Score!  It probably helped that we were there on a late reservation on the final night of their truffle dinners.  Hubby got some pasta with meat on it but I didn't even try it since I was all over the truffle.

For dessert, we shared a tasting of their cheeses, which included Robiola Due Latti, Brescianella, Caprioago, Red Cow Parmigiano Reggiano, and Point Reyes Farmstead Blue.  My favorite cheese was probably the parmigiano-reggiano...it was just so salty and nutty and flavorful...probably the best parmigiano I've ever had.  Where can I buy this stuff?  This was probably the best value in a cheese plate that I've seen, as we got 5 different cheeses for $16, and the portions were fairly huge that 4 people could have shared it.

Since the hubby was driving, he only got a glass of wine, but I got their "Boarding Pass" flight of 4 different wines.  They were all pretty good, but I have to admit I wasn't blown away by any of these wines, even the Barolos.  Service was excellent and I had no complaints there.

Not sure if this will be a regular destination for me, but I will definitely be back for their truffle dinner next year!
author: Arlene M.

description:
Most impressive atmosphere and hip knowledgeable staff! Great timing and service as well.

1/2 a caraf of wine, an Anchor and wine glass of champagne, couple of apps, spaghetti (which they so kindly split into 2 bowls for us), and the pork and 2 complimentary capps (possibly because homegirl next door shut the outside on us) = $100

Honestly, it was the service and apps that balanced out the taste of the spaghetti and main entree. Something about the non-bolognese spaghetti did not taste homemade, and the pork obviously wasn't unbearably salty but they certainly could have gone lighter on the salt. The chard app I do remember being done nicely.
author: eVa J.

description: Disappointing. For the prices, I expected a near Michelin experience. The Duck tasted like either a New York pretzel or Jimmy Dean sausage. The sauerkraut was extremely acidic to the point I had to say something. The chef insisted it was fine. Panna cotta did not set and ran off the spoon like wet yogurt.
author: Tim T.

description:
Delicious food, crowded but still romantic atmosphere. Came with a friend at 10pm on a Saturday and were seated without a wait.

Food - warm huge olives in light oil as appetizer. Wild nettle risotto was well-flavored, savory from the parmesan but not overwhelming. Spareribs were a touch oversalted, but could have been cut with a tannic wine or a crisp beer (which unfortunately we had not ordered). Black pepper panna cotta OMFG delicious, sweet and not peppery at all.

Bottom line - if the wait is not zoo-like, then the food is worth its price.
author: Mandy H.

description:
Delfina in 1 word: D-I-V-I-N-E!!! 

That pretty much sums up amazing dinner...have heard raves about Mission Italian eatery for years & glad it lived up to all the hype & MORE! 

Called to make reservations for a Saturday night at prime time & was disappointed table was not available but we walked in at 8pm & were promptly seated by very friendly host at perfect table by window. 
We had the delectable sardines on table within minutes & what a taste delight. 

Food was incredible & people watching was awesome from perfect perch with view of restaurant & street. 

Delfina is divine. divine. divine.
author: heather s.

description:
Came here for our wedding anniversary and had a good experience.  Food was unpretentious, interesting and tasty.  Service was spot on.  Atmostphere is on the casual side, and it felt a bit crowded.  We were lucky to snag a corner table and felt it made a big difference.

Grilled calamari and chicken liver skewers made for tasty and interesting starters.  Spaghetti and quail were both simple but delicious, and my wife rated the chocolate torta very highly. 

Service was attentive and there when needed but generally unobtrusive.  A couple of issues that came up during the meal (our first bottle of wine was corked, and a small error on the bill) were taken care of graciously and promptly.

All in all a good experience but probably better experienced with friends or family than as a date spot (or otherwise choose your table carefully).
author: Robert S.

description:
With so many great new places opening, it's easy to forget the wonderful places we already have.  And wonder of wonders, Delfina now accepts reservations on line.  And I got one.  

The insalata di campa is perfectly balanced, perfectly fresh, and wakens the taste buds.  What more is there to say?

Pasta with lamb sausage ragu was very good, although I wondered that the pasta stuck together so much.  It didn't seem to matter too much, because the taste was all there.

The roast pork was the star of the meal.  Now roast pork may not sound like much, but this was ethereal.  Tender moist slices of pork over what seemed like a risotto of farro that was absolutely fabulous.  And agrodolce, sort of sweet and sour, cipollini onions were remarkably different.  This was one of the most sensuous plates of food I have had in a long while.
author: David D.

description:
I don't think I have ever given just 2 stars, but I feel this is deserved, and I hope will help other diners. 
I made reservations weeks in advance, anticipating an excellent meal. We have enjoyed Locanda, but wanted to try someplace new. 
Two of the table's six dishes should not have been served. We were seated at 7 and told that there was one special, and only one left--roasted duck.
