 Insalata Campo - some fancy pants lettuce simply dressed but featuring huge hunks of pancetta.


 Pork Belly with Cockles - my entree, the saltiness of the pork played off the sweetness of the cockles to perfection. Mmm, salty pork.


 Chicken - I don't remember the fancy name but the chicken was well received by all. Honestly, I hardly ever order chicken in a restaurant but Delfina's version has me rethinking that policy.


 Broccoli Rabe - as a side, so damn tasty.


 Chocolate Budino - I'm not a huge chocolate fan but loved this dense, Italian cake.


 Cantucci - basically Italian for best damn biscotti ever.


 Ok, no evening could be this perfect. The mashed potatoes received an astounding 'eh' and I was a little surprised that they charged us corkage for the one bottle of wine that we brought considering we also bought a bottle + two glasses off their menu. But really, now I'm just nitpicking.


 I can see why Delfina is packed night after nightit doesn't just live up to the hype, it exceeds it. Go ahead and make a reservation six weeks out or walk in and wait two hours if you have to. Just do yourself a favor and get to Delfina asap.
author: tvham

description: What should have been a wonderful experience to celebrate my husband's birthday turned into a major disappointment. The food was fine but the service was poor. Our server took our drink and appetizer orders, both of which came quickly. But he seemed to have forgotten about taking the rest of our order. I had to flag him down after 20 minutes of waiting. Then it was another 45 minutes before receiving our entrees. Was the kitchen slammed? Did he forget to put our order in? Won't be going back.
author: Cynthia L.

description: one of the best italian joints in San Fran on 18th.  I've had so many good meals there it's hard to point out the best of the best... grilled calamari, dungeness crab salad, nettles risotto, and the gluten free pasta they make in house kicks flours' ass.  Seriously, great wine, great food, reso's required for the most part.  Don't miss it.
author: T B.

description:
Was not impressed.  I was really excited because of all the reviews.  

I expected to see simple dishes, and some were.  We were told about the special "sweet bread", I had no idea that meant brain.  I was discussed. 

It was also NOT romantic.  Everyone was crowed together and it was loud.   

I left there searching for something to take the veal brain taste out of my mouth.
author: Julie V.

description: Great pizzas, but also try the rest of the menu is equally strong. Try the meatballs!
author: Chad S.

description:
Overrated and expensive for what you get.

There were three of us and we tried quite a few dishes. Mostly their popular dishes and almost all of the dishes, with the exception of the polenta, were salty. Really salty. I eat salty, but this was unreasonably salty for this level of cooking. 

The service was a bit off, but not awful. For this kind of money, I expect better food.
author: Susan T.

description: We went there Saturday night for dinner and the food was delicious! My only complaint is that the hostess was full of attitude and rude to us.
author: R. M.

description:
Again, I forgot to review this place about a year a go when I had dinner there. 

But, I do remember it being tasty. I wish I remembered exactly what I had, my experience, and overall feeling. But, I do remember being very pleased and excited to go back sometime. 

I.will.be.back!
author: Art A.

description:
Dining here brought Tchaikovsky's Allegro con fuoco to my ears :) :) :) 

***Memorable***
*Excellent Food & Wine
*Attention to detail
*Divine Flavors
*Fresh 
*Great Ambiance (I would dress up a wee bit) 
*Excellent Waitstaff (Berry Berry Sneaky they are!)
*Recommendation:
Duck Giblet w/ Pasta, Grilled Calamari,  Quail, Rabbit "da Delfina  

Here you will find a diverse crowd of San Franciscan. The food is so good that hipsters, yuppies, locals, commoners (like me), & tourists don't mind closely dwelling among each other to savor a meal at Delfina.

You will also find Chef Craig Stoll meticulously orchestrating his band :) He comes in & out of the kitchen ensuring that everyone has a great experience.  Once he stopped to chat with us and as we complimented his great work, he mentioned that it took him 2 months in Italy to learn how to make one of his dishes. That's what I call passion :) 

Tip: Make a reservation 2-4 weeks in advance
       Parking is scarce (close to Bart/Bus)
author: Christina D.

description:
Third time will not be the charm as I am throwing the towel in after two.

Subpar service and bland/overpowered food led to a most uenjoyable and frankly uncomfortable night. The first seating on a Friday night and we were presented with one special... and it was an appetizer. So we ordered that (a tuni ahi carpaccio) then two orders of the spaghetti (which we were looking forward to as we had had it before) and on the suggestion of our server split the pork chop dish. No bread delivered. The citrus sauce for the tuna overpowered the entire dish and made it incredibly bitter. When we told one of the many people attending our table (between the runners, HOSTESS, actual waitress and others there were easily five) I was met with "I will go check and see if it was supposed to be like that" (needless to say I never heard back). Oooh the spaghetti comes....the server (not our waitress) "the cheese is right behind me". Neither she nor the cheese ever comes. (Time check - its about 6:30 and restaurant is maybe 3/4 full) Spagehetti is good but not as good as last time. Finally the main dish...by this point both us know that it will be sink or swim. The waitress informed us this would be a dish easy to split.. it wasn't. But what dissappointed us more was the BLAND taste of the pork. Throw in the mushy bed of beans (which were not bad) and I shook my head in disbelief. 
When the hostess (yes the hostess) came to clear the plates she asked how everything was and I told her not so great. No delving into specifics by her... just a uptick of the shoulders. The night was capped off as the bill arrived (after what seemed like an eternity) and the waitress tossed on our table a plate of penecotta. Was this a sign that they heard our unhappy tones? We will never know but the fact that it was flung with such anger and disregard for us spoke volumes.  Could not wait to leave. 

Where is Bauer when you need a restaurant to witness a reality check?


Subpar quality and service not worth my time or money.
author: C K.

description: With over 700 reviews at the time this is written, I don't think that my review will make much of a difference to anyone.  But, alas, I try.  This place is FREAKING AWESOME.  I spend a few hours this past Saturday relaxing at an outdoor table and enjoying this amazing place with top notch service, the best pizza I have had in a couple years, great wines, sunny friendly attentive and genuine service.  I could go on and on.   I can't believe it took me so long to come here.   A+
author: Scott H.

description:
Everytime I come here, they don't disappoint. 

Had the guinea hen bolognese and the bitter greens salad. Friends had the summer squash risotto and prosciutto ravioli. It's all delightful and the staff are super friendly. 

it gets packed quick so come right when it opens to get a table.
author: Esther S.

description:
Haven't written a review in a while so this will be short and sweet. Came here on a Wednesday night around 6 so we didn't have any problems finding parking or getting seated. Was planning on going to the pizza joint next door but stopped one door too early. Great ambiance, friendly servers and hostess. Delicious bread from tartine next door and acme bread. Montepulciano red and pinot grigio rose very tasty.

We ordered grilled calamari to start. Came with white beans and some greens on top. Veery tasty. Not rubbery or overcooked, but flavorful. Also ordered gnocchi with porcini ragu and short ribs, which came with polenta. Loved the gnocchi, even though I don't like mushrooms. Short ribs were tender, nice balance of sweet and savory. Only bad note was that the short ribs were lukewarm at best when they came out. Plate was cold.

Overall, food was tasty, but nothing special. A little overpriced (esp cold short ribs for $25) but maybe that's the norm in the neighborhood? Would rather try out other restaurants than come back as repeat. Service was great, would bump the rating to 3.5 if I could. Restaurant/service itself was 5 stars.

~$100 for 1 app, 2 entrees, 3 glasses of wine, tax + tip.

P.S. Make sure to stop by Bi-Rite Creamery down the street. Tastiest ice cream ever (plus no line like Mitchell's).
author: Joyce C.

description:
Between Delfina and Pizzeria Delfina, I am going to have to give 5 stars to BOTH! I have been to the pizzeria a few times, and they have always been consistently delicious. My husband and I were here for dinner a few nights ago, and were greeted very efficiently and warmly by our lovely waitress Georgia-what a sweetheart! We didnt see a single unsmiling face and the service from everyone was excellent- great vibes and good music-not to mention delicious meatballs and brussels sprouts- what more could you ask for?!? 


As for Delfina itself- yes, the prices are steep, but for housemade pasta that tastes like it came right out of your extremely loud (but loving)  Italian grandmothers soup pot--well, there isnt anything quite like it. The quality of the ingredients used are obvious as soon as you take the first bite-- fresh, crisp and clean--but savory at the same time. One thing Delfina is not shy about is adding a LOT of flavor to all of their dishes, and being able to piece together flavors you would never imagine (chestnut pappardelle, anyone?) If you are feeling adventurous, the tripe is definitely something to try while there--from what i was told by our waitress, this dish has been on the menu since Delfina first opened--and for good reason! I honestly have nothing negative to say about this restaurant, except for the fact that all of the waitresses are WAY too pretty to go here for a first date--which is along the same gripes the other yelpers had about this place, too. :P Everyone was super friendly, efficient, and very knowledgeable about the food. FIVE STARTS- THE BEST ITALIAN IN TOWN!
author: Catherine S.

description:
cozy little pizzeria in the mission. had the margherita pizza and sudwerk beer (brought back memories of davis, ca!). pizza was large enough for 2...possibly 3 if ur not too hungry.  Great flavor. 

place gets pretty crowded...literally a hole in the wall. 

i will definitely go back.
author: Roy N.

description: While the food was good, the service left a great deal to be desired.  We were seated and waited at least 15 minutes before anyone came to our table.  We then had to wait a very long time for our drinks to be delivered.  The wait staff that evening was far from what anyone would expect.  It was very disappointing.
author: Andrew C.

description: This place is superb! We ordered the special of the day, which was quail, & also this meat-filled pasta. They were sooo good. The beer was also good. Order the bread! They kept serving it without a repeated charge - yes!!! Even the weird pitcher of water was beautiful. We also ordered some kind of soda float with berries. Yum!! Savor every drip and drop of the sauces in the food; they drove me crazy. Crazy in love. Mmm.
author: Vannessa C.

description:
Excellent service! We came without a reservation and our hostess, Alice, took extra special care of us and got us a table within 15 minutes. She also checked on us during dinner.

We started off with the calamari salad, which consisted of grilled calamari with white beans and olives.  For dinner, we had the marscapone ravioli and the spaghetti.  Most of the yelp reviews I read mentioned the "al dente" quality of the spaghetti noodles, and I have to agree.  They were very chewy and delicious! (I'm very picky about my noodles).  The ravioli was presented very nicely and without a heavy sauce, which I like.  Each little bite burst with a lemon/butter flavor.

The dessert here was particularly good. The buttermilk panna cotta was PERFECT.   I haven't had panna cotta with that kind of texture at any place outside of Italy  The tangerines were also the perfect compliment to the panna cotta.  It was nice to try a different take on panna cotta.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Perfection is a tricky thing to master. And unlike the dead ringer for Anoop from American Idol who hit on me at the bar last night, it's pretty easy to spot an impostor. 

Delfina has, hands down, the best entree in the city. Pork belly with sepia, cockles, and chickpeas, all sitting in a savory tomato-white wine broth. It was the ideal mix of sweet and salty, crunchy and chewy, and the broth (which I usually see as a throwaway part of any dish) was worthy of me asking for a spoon so I could drink the rest. 

All things considered, it was a perfectly pleasant experience. While they did have an extensive wine list, they also had Peroni and Trumer Pilsner for $4/bottle. The waiter looked like James McAvoy, cute as can be, and was quite helpful, although a little hard to find at times. My vanity was appeased by the mirror on the wall facing us, which made it possible for me to a) make funny faces at my dining companion from across the room and b) scope out the potentially attractive gentlemen in the bar behind me. I'm all about the multitasking. 

None of that really matters when there's a dish like that pork belly on the menu, though. I understand entirely why it is on 7x7's 100 Things to Try Before You Die list. It completes me. And even when James McAvoy read my check incorrectly and charged me $57 for the meal instead of $51, I didn't let it faze me. But after a brief encounter with perfection, nothing would.
author: Devon S.

description:
YUM! Everything I ate here was delicious - haven't been to one of these uber quality restaurants in a long time...

Calamari appetizer - perfectly grilled whole calamari, served atop beans..awesome flavors, with a noticeable lemon/lime zing to it.

Chicken - how can chicken be this damn good? I didn't believe it, but after the first bite, knew it to be true. Rich buttery sauce, perfectly cooked juicy chicken, with a side plate of their olive oil mashed potatoes. The aroma of this dish is insane.

Panna cotta - delicious, very zesty. I like sour-ish things, so this was really good...

Solid restaurant, great service. Would definitely come here and perhaps try the beef carpaccio...everyone around us was ordering it...
author: Carol L.

description:
Unreal.   A last minute idea to go.  We got a 7:30pm table at 4 o'clock that day for one of SF's favs.

We were looking forward to this modern Bay Area modern Italian mecca for the Yuppies who slum it by coming to the Mission.

We had a nice table for two with one of us looking out and the other having a mirror to monitor the action behind.

We both skipped the healthy green stuff and went right to the pasta.

I had a tasty Italian Riviera thin twirl shaped pasta called Trofie with pesto, potato and green beans.  It was right out of Portofino.

The other dish was a home made pasta with a pig ragout. Also, yummy.

Then we both had the duck which was so thick, we couldn't eat it all!

And for desert.....nothing.  We were stuffed.

Go, enjoy, it's a new SF classic that should not be missed!
author: Fred G.

description:
When you're 682nd to review the place, it's pretty much just to let everyone know that it hasn't gone downhill since...this morning...due to some unforeseen calamity.

So...yes...hasn't gone downhill. Get a reservation.
author: Aaron C.

description: There's a great vibe at Defina and the food was exceptionally tasty. It's partnered with a good wine list, with something for everyone. Service was a little inattentive at times, but always friendly. Will return.
author: Jan M.

description:
We were wandering around Dolores park for a place to eat for my birthday, and I knew there were a few restaurants I hadn't victimized yet.  So as we passed by Delfina, I said, "Oh hey, this restaurant looks easy... err I mean delicious, wanna try?" 

My hot date ordered the Ahi, I the kumquat duck, and we shared the full body artichoke appetizer.  The Ahi looked dry, but when I had a bite I realized I was completely mistaken.  I've often had other tart fixings (ala raspberry) with duck, but the kumquats were a surprising change.  Aside from being slightly undercooked, I thought the duck faired pretty well compared to  the duck I've had at countless other places: sweet and tender with a crispy skin with nothing over powering but the slight tang of the kumquat.

I really like duck.  I once tried to hunt one with a six inch navy seal knife at a campsite.  I felt kind of stupid stalking it; but boy, I could only think about how good it would have been roasting over the camp fire.

We finished each other off with the dolci oranges and caramel.  Now that was quite the treat.  It was a real kind of nom-nom-nom-like creaminess.

Oh by the way, I never caught that duck.  It was way too fast for me.  And it had wings.  Sometimes I wish I could fly, so I could catch ducks flying.
author: Alfred Y.

description: Pretty good. Been here a couple times and both have been good experiences but nothing mind blowing. Its a good restaurant. Period.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Delfina 

You are "De Finest"!! Delish, devoursome, delightful!! 

This is what A16 hopes to be when it grows up. This is stand up new-age Italian food, the real thing! We had the grilled fresh calamari to start with, which is my fave! I love fresh (not deep fried) calamari and the white beans were the perfect compliment. I had the Insalata di Campo for my salad. Beautiful dish I must say, I love a salad that takes it to the next level and makes you forget you are eating a salad. 

The Tagliatelle was awesome! I believe it had boar ragut? I didn't order it but I mooched off my honey's plate. I ordered raviolis which were awesome. Honestly, nothing was not "awesome". Don't even get me started on the olive oil mashed that comes with the juicy chicken!!! Had major flashbacks of my Gmas Mashers and she is the "Queen" of mashed potatoes, and Delfina could certainly be her King. Finished off the meal with the Profiteroles, which is a must. Everyone had dessert envy :) 

GREAT GREAT restaurant!! A top 5 in my book
author: Heather S.

description:
Don(t know what all the hype is about.  Service was good, but the food was just "ok".  Not worth the time and trouble.  There are much better Italian restaurants out there.  

This place is popular - probably too much so.  The only time I could get a reservation was at 5:30.  

Food:
My wife ordered a pasta, and I had mixed grilled meats.  
My wife's pasta was a far cry from "al dente", so soft and soggy.  The sauce was ok, but nothing to rave about. 
My mixed grill was ok.  The sausage was raw inside, so had to have it re-cooked.  The polenta was gross.  

Service:
Very friendly, and attentive.  I like the service here a lot. 

Delfina Pizza (California and Fillmore) has great Pizza.  Better bet to just stick to the pizza, and away from the meats and pastas.
author: Koku Y.

description:
The service was excellent and the food was even better. 
This place is a gem. 
You do have to be patient b/c it is such a popular spot, but you can have a drink while you wait. Reservations are a good idea.
author: L T.

description:
Defiantly one of the best Italian experiences I have had in a long time!  Whoa, what a good meal!  I went with a couple of friends for a celebration and the place was perfect!  Our server was really knowledgeable about all of the food dishes.  

We got 3 appetizers- the heirloom tomatoes and house fresh pulled mozzarella, the little gem with parm and grilled calamari.  The heirloom tomatoes were unbelievable and the cheese was to die for.  I also loved the dressing of the the little gem salad.  Yummy!  I am not too much of a fan of calamari in general, so I wont comment on that.

For dinner I got the shrimp pasta dish.  I can't remember what the type of pasta was called, but it was fresh and delicious.  I would for sure order that.  My friends got the chicken tortellini like pasta as well as the roasted chicken.  That was to die for- the roasted chicken and the olive oil mashed potatoes.  Oh and the mushrooms.  One of the best chickens I can think of.

Lastly, dessert.  We ordered the chocolate torte with olive oil ice cream.  I loved the sea salt on the ice cream and the chocolate was so rich.  The lemon butter milk pannacotta was also to die for.  I have never had something quite like this.

All in all, a wonderful experience.  I cannot wait to go back.
author: Cara D.

description: Amazing place in the mission! I had to start out with the blood orange bellini and it was so delicious. Then we had the little gem salad with lemon vinaigrette with radishes and gorgonzola. This was the most simple and perfect salad ever. You really can't lose with a beautiful lemon vinaigrette. Then I had the spaghetti with plum tomatoes, garlic, evoo, and peperoncini. I loved the flavor of this spaghetti mostly because the peperoncini was relatively indistinguishable but flavorful enough to create a subtle spicy twist. 4 stars for the food, and 5 stars for the service because our server was amazing and kindly charged my phone for me when it was about to lose all battery. I'll definitely be back!
author: Sheeva G.

description: Went there last month.  The main entrees were amazing.  The night we were there the appetizers we ordered were little heavy on the sauces.  But we're big fans for a return visit
author: Mark S.

description:
I heart Delfina!  

I remember when this place first opened 10 years ago -- it was our new discovery that we kept insisting that our friends try. Now, several of them are freaking VIPs who can land 8 p.m. Friday night reservations at the drop of a hat, while I'm lucky if I can get a reservation at 5:30 pm on a Tuesday one month in advance!  Good thing we always come here with Delfina VIPs -- now we can get in during the Friday night rush with a day's notice and get comped all sorts of yummy stuff!  Woo hoo!

We've had so many great meals at Delfina.  This is where I chose to spend my last meal before going under the knife for my scheduled C-section, gorging 'til midnight on ribollita, pappardelle with pork sugo, french fries, and panna cotta.  After the kid was born, Delfina was the venue for our first nice meal out (with baby in tow).  Come to think of it, this is the place we always return to when we dine in the city sans rugrats.   At least once a week, I find myself checking out the menu on Delfina's website, dripping gobs of saliva on the keyboard and cursing the diners lucky enough to be eating at there that night.

Yes, parking could be better, but that's about it.  Delfina's food, service, and vibe is simply awesome.  This is one of the places that makes me miss moving from San Francisco to the sucky burbs!
author: Michelle T.

description:
I know it's a San Francisco favorite, but Delfina fails to hit the spot for me.  I've been to Delfina about 5 or 6 times, and I've tried many different appetizers, entrees, and desserts, but I always leave disappointed.

Last night was no exception. I had the insalata de campo, paccheri with blue-nosed bass all' amalfitana, and a side of chard.  The salad was fine, the pasta very extremely mediocre, and the chard was oversalted.  In the middle of my meal, I wished I could be at Farina instead!  If you are a pasta lover like me, the superiority of Farina's pasta is undeniable.  Their noodles taste much fresher and the texture is peerless.  Delfina's, while made in house, taste dried out and store-bought.  

My other complaint (I seem to have many today) is their scarcity of vegetarian items.  Even the items that appear to be vegetarian are not because they are made with things like chicken stock.  My fiancee is forced to order the plain spaghetti only on every visit.   If Delfina is committed to locally-sourced and sustainable food, a decreased use of meat will make their menu more environmentally-friendly.                    

Three stars nonetheless for excellent service, atmosphere, and decent - if not exceptional - food.
author: Sid D.

description: We were very lucky to get seated right away although the restaurant was full as usual. Since it was my first time, I asked the waitstaff for his recommendation, which relieved me from choosing something that I might not like. His was an excellent recommendation. Their wine list is kinda unique indeed: they don't serve Chardonnay, but they can recommend something quite similar. I liked the ambiance and the waitstaff were friendly and professional.
author: Thea T.

description:
Did I just eat Bugs Bunny?  

The Unforgettable:
- Strawberry Mountain Ranch Hanger Steak and French Fries
I cannot understate how perfect the steak was cooked.  This dish alone would make me want to come back.  

- Mixed Grill: pancetta-wrapped rabbit saddle, wild fennel sausage, and sweetbreads spiedino
Rabit! Wow, did I just eat Rabit!

The Good:
- Good Service
- Charming Ambiance
- Gnocchi al Ragu
- Linguine with double clam sauce
- Roasted Fulton Valley Chicken with olive oil mashed potatoes and king trumpet mushrooms

The Not So Good:
- Grilled Monterey Bay Sardines Scottaditto
author: Brent S.

description: What was so good about this place? Wasn't my type of Italian food, won't be returnig.
author: David L.

description: Good food, service and enough elbow room. The menu seems to change every day so it would misleading to recommend a dish. We ordered six different dishes and enjoyed all of them. We definitely recommend it.
author: Richard D.

description: Yum! Great food, hard to get a reservation though, plan in advance. Pricey, but you get a great portion of food for what you pay. We didn't leave hungry. The roast chicken is wonderful and the chicken liver spedini is delicious!
author: Esha B.

description: Amazing! I loved the ambiance and the food. Killer calamari and squid ink pasta.
author: Karin Z.

description:
I think this place is the ultimate dinner date venue, although I didn't come here on a date. Rather, I came here with my female roommate after critical mass - both of us were dressed like burning man bikers and both of us were sporting similar pixie-cuts, so I think the hostess thought we were lesbians on a date and put us in a nice corner table. We didn't mind, actually it was a really charming table and it gave us a good view of the entire room.

We had to wait a bit for our table, so in the meantime we went to the bar and got two bellinis (very delicious and just the right amount of alcohol, for me at least) and once we got seated, we ordered a salad with cheese and anchovies (I forget the name of the dish) which we split as an appetizer, and then we both a basic spaghetti marinara.  The total damage plus drinks came out to about $40 a person. We left very full and content with a nice buzz, and I think the price was well worth it.

The dining atmosphere is absolutely wonderful too. It's friendly and communal but still classy, and I think the dim lighting is perfect. I really recommend it!!!
author: ting b.

description: The food is always fantastic. Friday night was even better. Because they have a pork rib that was incredible. Great aroma, seasoned and beautifully cooked. We've been going there frequently for the past 14yrs, Delfina has maintained its consistency for perfection over and over throughout the years. Craig and Annie kudos to you and your staffs.
author: Tommy K.

description:
impeccable food each and every time.  Attentive service always.

The menu always have a lovely variety to cater to all diets.  I don't always like calamari, but the chef cooks his to the perfect consistency and it's seasoned so well.  All of their plates are full of fresh flavor.

Definitely make reservations in advance, the place is always full.
author: Kyra W.

description:
I've travelled to Italy and have yet to find better Italian food than at Delfina in San Francisco. This is one of those rare places that serves high quality food but with a welcoming feel - from outlay to service - so you don't feel out of place for not using the right fork with your entree or splitting a plate because you're not that hungry. The first time I came here with friends (no special occasion), the waitress gave us a complimentary trio of sorbets just because. 

The food is an interpretation of Italian food. I hear the spaghetti is fantastic but I haven't tried it because other entrees catch my eye. The calamari never fails to start the meal off on a good note. I had never had calamari that wasn't fried until I went to Delfina. Because it's not fried, you don't feel queasy (if you're coming on an empty stomach and have your first bite be drenched in oil) or stuffed from the first course. Definitely get the pasta. Any pasta. They cook the pasta in a broth so there's flavor in every bite. The pork shoulder is so tender that it falls apart with just the use of a fork. Don't skip dessert, even if you're full. The panna cotta and the profiteroles are my choices. I'd get both but that would make me look bad. 

It may be more on the expensive side but it's cheaper - and better - than going to Italy. Then again, if you get a parking ticket because you couldn't find a parking spot, it may start to even out.
author: Gwen L.

description:
This place won me over with its service, which is the best I've received at a restaurant so far. The hostess remembered me by name when I came to check on my wait time, and they treated my hungry guests like royalty. I ordered a dish that I didn't realize came with a meat sauce (I'm a vegetarian), and they took it upon themselves to make me something else pronto. Very professional, Delfina! I will return again.

As a warning, this place is packed even on Tuesday nights! Get a reservation if possible, or wait 30+ minutes.
author: Karl N.

description:
Rustic, yet refined, and the third leg of my Fat Foodie Trifecta, Delfina never fails to impress me.

The simple and perfect spaghetti can convert even the biggest, manliest meat-eater into a vegetarian. I could happily leave Delfina only indulging in this except that I'd miss out on all the other deliciousness found on their menu. 

This last visit included crisp-skinned white bass on a bed of carrots and a side order of 'farro-nata' -- farro and kale cooked risotto-style into a rich and fulfilling way to top off my meal. The spaghetti may have met its match.

The service never disappoints and they always have a way to make every experience feel special. There has yet to be a another that has dethroned Delfina as my favorite SF restaurant...

but I'm not really looking to replace a good thing, anyway.
author: Chelle Y.

description:
Yummmm Yummmm Yummmm! Soooo we decided to go all out and eat here first and then walk next door to the Pizzeria Delfina (Total Gluttons- I know) but I really wanted to experience both right away. I really enjoyed my meal here. The bread they start you with is really good and airy with a nice, crispy crust! I like the butter they give you too with the little salt flakes sprinkled on top. As for my menu items, the Short-Rib Cappelletti was soooooooooo good! The filling was rich and meaty and the pasta itself was cooked perfectly al-dente and tasted so fresh. The sauce/sugo it was served with was also rich and had a yummy, earthy truffle flavor to it. I savored each and every bite- especially because you only get like 5 bites total. But those few bites sure were heavenly.  I also ordered a side of brussel sprouts sauteed with some sort of honey glaze and hazelnuts that were very tasty, but not nearly on the same level as the pasta dish. Overall, this place was really good and I would definitely come back again!

*My review for the Pizzeria Delfina will be on that separate restaurant's yelp page*
author: Gaby C.

description:
4 1/5 Stars

Very good dishes. Very fresh and quality ingredients. Even I raved about the sweet pea used in a dish was so fresh, sweet, and flavorful. The mushroom risotto was done perfectly and was full of intense flavors.
author: S.K. Y.

description:
Loved everything about this place. The vibe, cozy atmosphere, uber-friendly service and knowledgeable staff, and of course the food. Definitely Italian, but with a twist I can't explain other than being very SF, (as in slow-food, sustainable, local, responsible, fresh, earthy.)

We sat at the bar for a drink beforehand, then scored a small 2-top table right by the window which was in my opinion, the best seat in the house. 

Here's the breakdown of our meal:

Apps
Asparagus with lemon creme frache and bread crumbs (surprisingly, my fav dish of the meal, seriously)

Calamari with white beans (a little salty, but different in a good way)

Pasta (split)
Spaghetti with plum tomatoes and olive oil (excellent sauce flavor with a nice little kick - my 2nd fav)

Main (split)
Roasted Chicken with creamy mash potatoes (cooked perfectly and juicy)

Side
Side of cheesy buttery polenta (decadent and rich - perhaps too much butter and cheese if that's even possible. Nonetheless I scraped the bowl not to miss any bites.)

Dessert
Profiteroles: Espresso gelato with chocolate sauce on puff pastries (again, decadent and rich but the way dessert should be, and a good sub to after-dinner coffee)

With cocktails beforehand and a reasonably price bottle of vino, dinner was still a huge splurge. But overall it was definitely worth it--especially over those stuffier 'fine-dining' spots that have a lot more attitude and a lot less soul to their food.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Summary: excellent food, but small portions

The pasta was cooked perfectly...so good
The chicken was really good, as were the mashed potatoes
Very nice staff
author: Captain B.

description:
Finally had a chance to check this place out, as I was back in SF for a quick trip.  Was more in the mood for an old-school, red booth Italian place, but Delfina has been recommended by friends AND strangers, so I decided to give it a shot.

My waitress (Shelly I think?)  was REALLY nice.  Made some great recommendations, and when I couldn't decide on which pasta to get, she let me have two half-orders of each.

The bread they brought out before my meal was kinda tough and stale.  But whatever. 

Started with the Insalata Di Campo.  Fantastic stuff.  Greens with pancetta, walnuts, balsamic vinegar and shaved Parmesan.  Get this salad.  For real.

I had the tagliatelle with artichoke, mint, and house-made mascarpone.  YUM!  The other half-order of pasta I had was the pappardele with pork sugo.  Wish there was more pork and sugo to go with my pappardele but tasty stuff nonetheless.

Had a glass of Syrah, and tried a Chianti as well - both good.  One of the best cappucinos at the end of my meal that I've ever had.

Overall - four stars.  I'd go again, and I definitely recommend it.
author: Vinnie B.

description:
The pasta dishes are the way to go. the noodles are perfectly cooked and the sauces are well done. we weren't as happy with our appetizers-the grilled calamari and the mozarrella.

we also thought the noise level was a bit too overwhelming at times.
author: j d.

description: Great place and great food! Hay and straw pasta was superb and I don't use that word lightly.  It was cooked to perfection. Normally, I don't order pasta at restaurants because 1. I'm Italian-American and 1b. pasta is pretty easy.  Their homemade pasta was so good that it's worth coming back for it.  Then you add the rich short ribs into the equation and you got a winner!
author: Don G.

description:
I love Italian food and did love the ambience of the restaurant, the presentation of the food, the service, blah, blah, blah.
I was a tad bit disappointed with the selection- so it would be a really good idea to look at the menu before going.  I wouldn't say anything was spectacular, but everything was good.

The pizzeria next door to the restaurant looked like the"happening" place to be. The wine pours looked generous and the pizza looked delishhhh.   I guess there should be separate reviews for the two eateries by the same name.
author: East B.

description:
Dont believe the hype! that's all I have to say about this place. 

Food is good but not amazing, I had much better pizza or salad in the city. 
I dont get all the buzz they get for their pizzas.
The crust is soooooooo thin, it's hard to feel anything. I mean it was like eating crispy flat bread not a pizza. 

Service was just ok. The waitress was nice but not profesional at all. 

Will I go back??? Meeehhhh not really 
nothing special about this place
author: Mina T.

description:
My friend and I have been wanting to come here for the longest time. Finally, we're both free one Friday night and call us crazy, but we decided to go to Delfina WITHOUT a reservation.

We were told that the wait was about 30 minutes and they'll call us when the table is ready. We were fine with that since we could just walk around the mission district since we both haven't been down this neck of town in a while. We ended up waiting a little over an hour because people wouldn't leave, boooo. 

Once we got seated, we offered some bread and water and the waitress went over the menu. 7x7 raves about their Pappardelle Sugo, so I was excited to try that, but they didn't have it the day I went. Boo. I tried their Blood Orange Bellini, pretty refreshing. We split the Insalata di Campo, which was still a decent portion for both of us and got an order of the Lardo. For our entree, I decided on the wild fennel risotto with snail and my friend got a pasta dish with ragu sauce that was what the waitress describe to be similar to their Pappardelle Sugo (which i wanted to order, but we ended up sharing everything anyway). The risotto turned out awesome, I think it's one of the best risotto's I've had thus far. I didn't really like snails, so I wasn't so sure about it, but now I do! It was awesome with the risotto and didn't overpower it. Finally, we had the Blood Orange Panna Cotta and the reviews are right, it was so creamy I could just let it melt in my mouth all day! 

Overall, I had a good experience here. Service was great, atmosphere was a little loud since it was a packed house even at 10:30pm, love the high ceilings and music. I'm happy to say I've had the pleasure of trying this place now! I'd definitely go back, but next time I'll make a reservation.
author: Helen Z.

description: OMG best pizza ever.  We had the Purgatorio and it was truly amazing with the spicy tomato sauce, pecorino romano, and two runny delicious eggs.  Best pizza I've ever had.
author: SHOU LIN C.

description: Delfina is dangerously close to my house and so I try to visit at odd times when the queues aren't too bad. Service is great, pizza is amongst the best in the city. If only they wood fired the pizza....
author: Ralph P.

description:
I've been on the pizza side and the fancier dining side. Both are fabulous! Depends what you're in the mood for. I had a pizza for the first time with an egg in the middle. I would do it all again.
On the dining side, we enjoyed the grilled  fresh calamari. The sauce is unbelievable and perfectly grilled. We must have had one of the pasta specials for the day because I can't seem to find it on the menu anymore. The pasta was a huge rigatoni type with really great sauce. I love everything about this place.
author: Kathleen T.

description:
Last year for my birthday (February 6th, mark your calendars bishes), the ___ made reservations here. Being the indecisive, bratty darling that I am, I decided its MY Birthday, and for MY birthday, I want a veggie quesadilla from El Castillo, thank-you-very-much. I decided this 30 minutes before our reservations. 'Cause that's how I roll.

So for our anniversary this month the ___ made reservations yet again at Delfina. Because it wasn't only MY day (every other day is though, FYI), I couldn't back out of the dinner plans. 

And I'm quite pleased I didn't. Delfina was *quite* remarkable.

I have to say, initially I was turned off by the vibe of the place, a certain something I couldn't quite place a finger on...a certain air pretentiousness. Yep, that's it. Delfina is pretentious as it gets. And what the hell, the menu is in English so why can't I understand what half the things are? What really cracked me up, though, was when our waitress pointed out a few things on the menu and told us "Don't even bother ordering these unless you are going to get truffles (at a cost of 40 extra dollars) along with them". What a surprise that all of the menu options she mentioned were the least pricey on the menu. Right.

All was forgotten, though, as soon as I had the first bite of our appetizer-grilled fresh calamari with warm white bean salad. Though a bit too lemony, it was delicious, and we ate every last bit from the plate.

For my main course, I ordered old faithful- Roasted Fulton Valley chicken with Yukon gold mashed potatoes and king trumpet mushrooms...OH.MY.GAWD. It was so delicious- the chicken was hands-down the absolute best I have every had. It was moist and flavorful, just amazing. And the potatoes? They MUST have been soaked in a vat of butter, I died with each forkful.

Though Delfina isn't at the top of my list, I will definitely return again.
author: S F.

description:
I truly do love this restaurant. I have lived in SF for 4 years now and each time i go back it proves it self to still be one of my favorites. The food is inc -readable, the wine list is decent, and the service is always awesome. 

THe desert is to die for! The olive oil ice  cream...Who would have thought?

Although getting a reservation before 9 pm can sometimes be a little difficult.... I can't complain when delfhina is on the menu for the night. 

Over all Best restaurant in SF!
author: erin D.

description:
Now here is a place I have no qualms giving a 4 star review to! I can imagine parking around here would be difficult...but we walked, so...can't attest to that. It wasn't the cheapest meal I've ever eaten, but it was worth every penny. 

After eating dessert at Bi-Rite Creamery (dessert before dinner = don't judge us), man-friend and I were strolling around searching for a place to eat. Delfina was packed on a Tuesday night, so we were curious what all the fuss was about. We were given the last two seats at the bar, everyone that came in after us was told there was an hour wait minimum. Yikes!

The atmosphere is so effortlessly classy, yet surprisingly I observed no snobbery. The staff was genuinely friendly, warm and unpretentious. Service was impeccable, suggestions on what to order did not disappoint in the least and each plate that was cleared was promptly picked up. 

I can't remember the name of the dish I ordered, but the waitress said the type of pasta means "rubbish" in Italian! Sure didn't look or taste like rubbish - It turned out to be flat, triangular pasta with buttery sauce and succulent, melt-in-your-mouth shrimp. 

Please, do yourself a favor and order the panna cotta for dessert. Flan-like, creamy goodness + blood orange tanginess heaven!

Will be coming back for more soon!
author: Michelle L.

description:
The place was nice and the people were nice but the food was expensive and not really good at all.  I hear the red sauce is great, but unfortunately I ordered a Carbonara pizza that was just plain gross and I did not eat more than a bite.  Luckily I was able to eat part of a Prosciutto  Arugula pizza that was better but still nothing special at all.

I would say it is pretty easy to find better pizza.  Save your money and find some pizza that both tastes good and fills you up a little more.

I have no axe to grind, and this is my first bad food review, the only reason they got 2 stars is because some at my table really liked their pizza, but the first time in a long time that I had no desire to eat mine even though I was starving.  Be careful, and lower your expectations!
author: Ken V.

description:
I've been to the Pizzeria Delfina plenty of times and was always just not in the mood for a fancy dinner, but finally went last night.  It's obviously a little pricey, but worth it in my opinion.  We had spiced almonds, asparagus, and calamari for appetizers.  They were all very good, especially the asparagus.  I don't eat seafood but the calamari was actually really good.  The best part is all the sauces, beans, and greens complimenting the appetizers which we ate up as well. 

For entrees we had the pork chop, free range chicken, tortellini with duck/quail, and the hanger steak.  All amazing, especially the tortellini.  The chicken was good and not too dry, and the pork chop was pretty big, a little dry but the taste made up for it.

Overall a nice dinner that won't totally empty your wallet and the service was great, but not forced like other places.  Enjoyed it a lot, although if you're debating between the restaurant and pizza place...nothing beats some comfort food.  But need to impress someone...take them here.
author: Isamarie P.

description:
A lot of bang for your buck? NOT HERE! 
But I will commend Delfina for a nice restaurant. The way its decorated is simple yet nice, lighting is good, but the place is a bit cramped. Good thing we had a window seat so I had a place to put my bag down! Service was good too. Not pushy at all. 

At anyrate, the bread that we started off with was a normal french bread and a sourdough bread with a chewy crust. I enjoyed them both. The butter comes in this square container that reminds me of a candle. It's good but I heart bread so any bread is good, I think.

We started off with the dungeness crab balls and this was DELICIOUS. It was served with crispy fried onions and fried orange slices! I didn't expect this but cut up a bite of your crab balls and eat it with a crispy fried orange slice and it's mildly orgasmic. 4 crab balls was $17 or something. Priceeeyy!

STEAK AND FRIES
My friend said it wasn't good. Borderline cardboard.

SPAGHETTI W/ PLUM TOMATOES
This was the only plate on the table that was decently sized. The spaghetti has a weird kick to it that I can't pinpoint, but I wouldn't order it again. I think my mom makes better spaghetti.

SCALLOPS W/ MASHED POTATOES
The bf ordered this and the mashed potatoes were good. But this dish for $27 only came with THREE scallops! How depressing. I knew he wasn't going to be full off this because I wouldn't be either! The scallops were cooked nicely, but for some reason the inside of the scallop didn't have any flavor. I found myself always having to cut it in small pieces then dip it in the sauce that it came with. This was just okay.

OXTAIL RAVIOLI
I counted. I only got 13 (yes, THIRTEEN) 1.5 inch in diameter sized raviolis. SAD! This was a mere appetizer to me. I could have scarfed it down in less than 3 minutes but I took my time to savour each bite. But the oxtail was really good. The sauce it came with wasn't that thick of a sauce but it was done right. Had Delfina given me double of what I had gotten (aka 26 raviolis), I would be more satisfied.

Overall, don't come to Delfina if you're really really hungry. I guess you can come here and order more, but in my opinion it's not really worth the money. With the $ I spent here for dinner, I could have gotten more food elsewhere.
author: Heidi C.

description:
Came here for dinner on a Saturday night with no reservation... just thought we'd take our chances.

We ended up being seated immediately by the nicest hostess ever and the rest of the service throughout the meal was great!

I had the fish entree which was delicious! I would definitely want to try their pasta next time.
I would pass on the salad though. Just really unimpressive and tasteless.

Otherwise, I was very pleased with the food and wish I were hungry enough for dessert. It sounded amazing.

Love this place and will be back!
author: Merrill S.

description: Excellent service. The pasta melts into your mouth. Great ambiance. Noisy. Not very good for large groups
author: Benjamin P.

description:
Warm Castelvetrano Olives
Grilled Fresh Calamari with warm white bean salad
Spaghettini in Nero with sepia and Mendocino uni

The food was fantastic, as was the service.
author: m t.

description:
Great food - the appetizers & salads were original with fresh ingredients and yummy. 
Tables are packed in there. I wanted to pick off some food from the table next to us, which wouldn't take much effort since they are right next to you. 
Service - awesome. Although, when my hubby ordered fries for his main dish, they gave him the weirdest look. He was man PMSing and cravin' some fries. His excuse is that we don't go out for fast food so when he gets a chance to order fries he likes to get it. Whatever. Man PMS. It was such a huge serving that's all he needed to order after an appetizer and salad. He thought he would get another look if he asked for ketchup so he ate it dry. Not good. They were dry like chips. Not my style. 
Dessert - panna cotta. Buttermilk panna cotta. Need I say more. It was amazing. I can still taste all it creaminess godliness goodness.
author: Wendy B.

description:
Pork shoulder. Yum, but needed more slices for the price.
Hen/chicken was yum as with the mash potato.
Hanger pasta was alright.
I left hungry.
author: qirk z.

description:
Ate here on my last night in San Francisco. 
The olive oil potatoes were heavenly. (Great conversation starter as well)
Felt very chic and classy while here. (Always lovely to feel like this while dining with good people in your presence)
author: Meggie M.

description: The only reason why I wouldn't give Delfina 5 stars is that it can be so difficult to get a decently timed reservation here (2 weeks ahead for a planned Tuesday evening, I was only able to book a 530pm spot!). But, it's easy to see why everyone's filling up reservation spots to eat here. It's located perfectly near some other nice places (Tartine Bakery, Bi-Rite market and creamery, Dolores park) that you can spend your wait time well occupied with. The food is great and flavors and portions do not disappoint. The spaghetti gets great reviews, but we went with some other pasta choices on the menu (pork rib pasta and gnocchi with bone marrow) and they were also excellent. I'm usually very blasé about a dish like calamari because I think it's often overdone and super uninteresting, but Delfina's take is different and tasty to boot. Grilled instead of breaded and fried, with accompanying sauce and flavor that's different from any other I've tried. Actually glad we went with that appetizer to start. For dessert, we had a delicious rice pudding that was also very, very good. Really no holes in our meal at all. Our server was knowledgeable and helpful with some menu choices and kept our water glasses full and the drinks flowing. The best part about sharing a delicious dessert here is not overstuffing yourself and having a bit of extra room for ice cream across the street!
author: Allie Y.

description:
This is Italian neighborhood restaurant done right.  Full to the brim and bustling with noise, the restaurant had a charm that immediately made you feel at ease and ready to nosh.  We had to wait a bit for a table and the entire staff apologized profusely from start to finish - no big deal for us, but a nice and unneeded touch from them.

The plates are small and good for sharing.  We did alot of fork reaching at my table.  The chicken was juicy, salty and down right delicious.  The fries were crisp and seasoned with fresh herbs.  I could have eaten an entire plate of the warm bean salad that accompanied the grilled calamari.  

The beauty of Delfina is that everything is stupidly simple, yet incredibly memorable.  Pastas leave you wanting more while fish are so fresh they need little other than salt and lemon.  

I can't wait to try the pizza place next door.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Yeah this place is pretty much the bomb.

Everything is simply prepared (ie real Italian food).

Can't be beat.

The squid was awesome.

Great wine list as well.
author: Matthew C.

description:
Swung by for wine and dessert with the Elf, to top off a date night. Wine selection is good, and the desserts had me reeling from the intensity of the chocolate fumes - deliciousness. The atmosphere had some Marina-esque elements to it, when I was hoping more North Beach, partially due to a cluster of painfully annoying former sorority girls clucking up a storm on a triple date with their striped-shirt douchebags - one of whom turned out to  be a junior high classmate of mine whose initials are, in fact, D.B. 

I wanted to give 3 stars, but penalizing the restaurant for the company seems unreasonable when the place is perfectly elegant the other 5 nights of the week. 

Call it: Good food, good wine, unforgivably high price, and high douche-factor on a Friday/Saturday night.
author: Mani F.

description:
The spaghetti here is the best.. The food tasted good even when we did take-out and couldn't eat till an hour later!

Make reservation in advance b/c it's impossible to get seating.
author: Milee M.

description:
Made a reservation here about a week in advance for my girlfriend and I. Two options for Friday, 9:30 and 10:30, three options for Saturday, 5:30, 8:30, 9:30. I thought to myself, this restaurant has been around for a while now, it shouldn't be this hard to get in to. Well it is, and for good reason. The food and service (from our waitress) was absolutely fantastic. 

We showed up on time for our reservation and I was told they were a few minutes behind but that a couple tables are finishing up. No big deal, I worked in a restaurant for 5 years, I can be very patient. Well, after about 15-20 minutes of waiting, I went in to inquire as to the status of our table. The hostess said they were really busy but something should be coming up soon. This is my only gripe, we showed up on time. Had we been 15 minutes late, our table would have been given away, when the restaurant is 20 minutes late, nothing. I had to ask for some complimentary glasses of wine. I think it's only fair, and it's good business practice. I explained to the hostess that we really were in no rush and had no problem waiting, but good business practice would be to offer us something to drink on the house while we wait. She said she understood, but in no way confirmed that she would actually do this.

I went back outside and continued to wait. To my surprise, about 5 minutes later, a woman came out with their wine-by-the-glass menu and offered us two glasses of wine. That made things a little better. My only complaint is that this is not something I should have had to ask for, this should have been offered.  5-10 minutes behind, no big deal, but 25 minutes late, that requires some sort of gesture of goodwill. 

Everything after that was fantastic. We were even given a complimentary olive appetizer. Not sure if this was because I said something or if this was their own initiative, but either way, it was appreciated. We weren't too hungry because we had stopped at Mission Cheese before and had a glass of wine and nice cheese platter. The waitress completely understood and in no way pushed us to order more food than we wanted. We shared two pasta dishes, some shrotrib type raviolis, and a wonderful mostacelli with ragu sauce, very much like a bolognese sauce but made up of beef, pork, veal, and possibly lamb, I can't quite remember. For a main entree we split a special that was not yet on the menu, it was a breaded, fontana cheese stuffed pork (loin?). I don't remember the exact cut but it was great nonetheless. We also shared a bottle of Chianti because it only made sense. 

For dessert, we shared the espresso gelato. I hate coffee, but the gelato was amazing. Not too strong on flavor which made it great for me. 

All in all, I would really love to go back. My only real complaint is that I should not have had to take the initiative to tell a restaurant that good customer service is to compensate patrons when they have been waiting 25 minutes for a table they had a reservation for. They came through in the end, but only after I pushed. The last restaurant I worked at it was policy that if you had a reservation, and you waited more than 10 minutes, you were offered a glass of house wine. That's what it's there for, it's cheap, the markup is ridiculous, and the goodwill goes much further than the $3 profit you're losing. And this was at a small family owned Italian restaurant that definitely was not making the kind of money Delfina is.
author: Alfredo A.

description:
My best friend and I walked in around 9pm on a Saturday night, and although we had to wait about 30 minutes or so, it was definitely worth it. We sat at the high table overlooking the rest of the restaurant which made for very good people and plate watching! 

The tomato and fresh mozz salad is not to be missed. The panna cotta and chocolate budino for dessert came highly recommended, and I have to endorse that recommendation! I personally LOVED the panna cotta, and my best friend practically licked her plate to finish the chocolate. 

The only thing I was disappointed with was the mint tagliatelle with mushrooms. I thought it would be an interesting combo, but in the end all i could taste was salt. My best friend's shrimp pasta was very good.

Atmosphere was awesome and the waitstaff was so friendly! At the end of our meal at least 3-4 people came over to say goodbye, and that they hoped we enjoyed the rest of our stay in SF. I would definitely recommend Delfina!
author: Stacey G.

description: Took my kids here for earlish dinner and they did great .  They were accommodating and make a simple cheese pasta for them.  It tasted great because they attacked my orders of the pork belly and roasted chicken and olive oil mashed potatoes which they picked at the skin and destroyed the mash leaving me with breast meat.  Its okay I've had it before so I forgave them.  We ordered two pana cottas with a lecture on property rights before dessert.  Good place.  Feels packed.  Mission so parking sucks but we used hotels transportation.
author: Jayk K.

description:
My boyfriend and I went to Delfina one night for a special occasion after having thoroughly enjoyed Delfina's pizza next door - if the pizza place was so good, the restaurant had to be even better!

Service: Poor. We didn't have a reservation and were more than happy to wait, and were told that we'd get a small table near the kitchen. 25 minutes later, we were given two seats at the bar, instead. We waited over 20 minutes for a waiter to come by to take our orders, another 20 for our drinks... I think almost an hour until we actually had our food. We felt like they had completely forgotten about us multiple times.

Food: average. I had fish and my boyfriend had steak. It was cooked well, but there wasn't much flavor in either dish. It wasn't bad, but it definitely felt overpriced to us.

We had high hopes for this place given how much we love Delfina's pizza - but were really disappointed. If you're looking for a medium-pricey meal with organic/local foods, I'd go to Nopa instead.
author: Alex G.

description: Overrated!  Heard so many good things about Delphina and was excited to try the food.  Very average compared to the hype.  Winter Squash Risotto was one dimensional. Chicken Agnolotti rated a 7 on a scale of 1-10.  Initial contact with the hostess and front staff was unfriendly and cold.  Waiter was excellent and should be commended for his excellent service and knowledge of the menu.
author: Armand M.

description:
In the early 90's there was this famous commercial where a young girl, chewing loads of gum, would respond "I don't get it" to just about every question or statement thrown at her. Her eyes were glued to something, dazed, similar to the way young children look when they watch too much TV (oops). But if I can gather any value out of TV and this commercial now I can say that it gave me a great one liner to describe my feelings about Delfina:

I Don't Get It. 

I do not. Why in the world do people wait for hours to eat here? Why do they pay so much? Why do people slam on Farina (across the street) but have the bad sense to come here? Frankly I find this a fucking mystery. While Delfina did make an impression on me, the impression was that it was one of the most unimpressionable meals I've ever had. I guess the huge price tag, and one really raunchy conversation that accidentally took place while sitting next to todlers made it memorable for me, but only enough to tell you today that you should not go here. 

And what's with all the glimmer? Fresh porcini mushrooms in the spring, oh my! THEY TASTE LIKE NOTHING! Geez, I'd go to Farina over this place any day. If you must have a Delfina experience, though, check out the pizza place next door. You'll be glad you did.
author: Alexandra M.

description: excellent food, pricey but every morsel a veritable party in your mouth. good service but a ratio of about 3 staff per patron, granted we had an early reservation so it wasn't too busy. atmosphere clean and modern but warm enough to create a more intimate feel. i would definitely recommend for an occasion unless you have money to blow any day of the week. enjoy!
author: Cara G.

description:
One of the best meals in recent memory, and just as great the second time round too! There was this artichoke appetizer which transcended time and space. Deep fried for just a few minutes, the outer leaves turned crispy, much more like potato chips. I couldn't believe how such a simple food turned so amazing. Everything I have eaten has been stellar.

I am all about classic venues in SF which have been around 10+ years, and Delfina falls squarely into this category. Get there for first seating before 6pm, cozy up to the bar, and you'll be taken away by how fantastic the food is. Effortless.
author: Steve K.

description:
Delfina is like that girl that you secretly admire. Attractive, clean cut w/ a little edge, warm and inclusive ....Delfina is the kind of place that you might go to be seen - but will never stick out in the crowd. 

A girlfriend and I decided to walk in to Delfina for a nice, Wed. night bite. This would be my 3rd or 4th visit and I'd definitely return. Like the girl, Delfina makes you feel welcome, the staff is ridiculously cool/calm/sweet and the food is quite tasty. I can't promise that the food is spectucular, but the casual-hip-warm atmosphere makes the dining experience memorable. 

What to munch on:

- The spaghetti is famous and pretty tasty. I'd go for something more unique though. If you get this, definitely have it as a 2nd course - not your meal.
- The calamari with white beans is a nice starter. Small portion but enough to share among 2 or 3 people.
- The insalata was pretty nice. They split it in two for my gf and I this time around and the portions were pretty nice - even in two.
- Pasta. I did like the Rosemary Tagliatelle with wild boar ragu and chestnuts. Small portion, though, for $18. Nice chewy pasta - not overboard on the carnivore content.
- The duck is pretty tasty.
- Brussel sprouts are as good as they come. Well, they are accompanied by some prosciutto :)

Overall, the food is solid but nothing to write home about. Add in some wine and you'll  give it an extra .5 stars. Ah the miracle of wine. Share plates and you'll be satisfied by the variety.
author: Deann M.

description: IMPECCABLE. Fantastic. Brilliant food and service. One of the few places where I've actually absolutely enjoyed dessert. And, knowing that I am a pastry chef, they treated us to their delicious buttermilk panna cotta in addition to the exceptional budino we've ordered. And, the French Country Bread from next door's Tartine is phenomenal. I can't wait to return! Wish I had gotten our waitress' name as she was courteous, attentive, and knowledgeable. Oh, and decor is very NYC, which is always a plus for me!
author: Marina S.

description:
Great place, high quality food, good service.

Had the roasted chicken, cooked perfectly. Fries were very good, huge portion. Mashed potatoes were creamy and buttery.

Girlfriend had the peach bellini, was a big fan.

Great place for a nice dinner, make sure to book reservations early in the week.
author: Eddy N.

description: I'd been attempting to go to Delfina for a while now, so when my sister got a reservation for my birthday (if you're a small party open table can get you in pretty easily!) I was ecstatic. Needless to say, after hearing friends rave about this place, expectations were high. Luckily, I found parking within 5 minutes (def leave enough time for parking or take public transportation) and we were seated right away. Some wine, roasted chicken, and risotto later, we left full and satisfied. The chicken was a dry, and the accompanying mashed potatoes didn't stand out, but my sister called the risotto, "the best I've had since my home stay in Florence," and I'd agree. I'll be back, but next time I'll go for pasta and try the calamari everyone raves about. Oh yeah, and you can't forget about trying the pizzeria next door.
author: mar m.

description: Had a great strawberry dessert 2 nights ago - was the highlight of the meal!
author: Lizzie R.

description:
I tried several different pizzas as each of us ordered a different one. Honestly, I liked it but it was not all that I had expected and I don't even remember what I ordered.  I only remember that it was very salty and I needed a lot of water afterwards.  For the price of a pizza, I was not entirely impressed.

I do have to admit that the zuppa was good, I would go back for that the next time around.
author: Carmen C.

description:
My wife and I finally got around to trying Delfina after recieving a gift certificate (3 years ago...lol). It was fantastic!!!
Must Eats 
Olive Oil Mash Potatoes (I swear they sprinkle Crack on top..its that good)
Great Eats
Deep Fried Soft Shell Crab
Short Ribs ( So tasty and fell right off the bone)
Good Eats
Halibut (perfectly cooked)
Prosciutto Ravioli 
Everything we had was good or great. You better make reservations because this place is always busy....you will not be dissappoointed.
author: Quang W.

description:
Finally, a good Italian place!!!  Not sure if the pastas are homemade but they def taste like it.  Everytime I go, I lick the plate clean.  The serving size is a little on the small side with the price a little on the high side, but with limited good Italian in the city, this is my now go to place when I'm craving comforting pastas.

The spagetti is good.  The linguini with sole better...altho the fish was a little on the salty side, but the sauce makes up for it.  The bread is soft and yummy.

I heard it's hard to get a table but I had no trouble,  Then again I went early.  Definitely recommend getting reservations and try their pizzeria next door too.
author: C A.

description:
Delicious!  My husband and I could only get 10:30pm rezzies, and it was worth the wait.
Starters: 
Monterey Bay sardines served w/ a caponata and a piece of toast topped w/ tomatoes sitting in fabulous wild fennel oil.
Mozzerella w/ heirloom tomatoes over some basil oil that covered the bottom of the plate.  If I tell you that one of the bites of tomatoes was the best tomato to pass my lips ever, I would not be lying.  I ate it and then I melted into my seat.  What?!  

Entrees:
Quail cooked perfectly in a rich amazing sauce and topped w/ crumbled fennel sausage and served over a creamy dreamy polenta.  Should have described this dish as, manna from heaven for how delicious it was.  We were fighting over who was the next to get a bite.  The other main dish was a pasta.  I can't even tell you what herb they put in to the pasta dough, except I remember being told that it was in the mint family.  This was served in a divine creme fraiche sauce w/ chanterelles (enough that each bite had some in there and not just dotted for show).  Almost put an eye out trying to get every delicious bite in my mouth before the hubs did.
Love this spot, one of the best in SF.  7:20am and I am still a drooling fool.
author: Heather S.

description:
We ate here about two weeks ago to celebrate my wife's birthday.  We had heard that the restaurant was pricey, noisy, and the seating arrangements were jammed together.  Our experience that night confirmed those rumors.  Additionally, the food quality is only so-so for the price, but you go there to be "seen", not necessarily for the food or ambiance.

We arrived on a Tuesday evening about 6 PM. It wasn't very crowded, but quickly filled up.  We sat on a table for two that was parked between other tables, way too crowded to be comfortable.  I had a difficult time having a relaxing conversation due to the intense noise level.  There were a lot of 20 and 30 year old or something crowd.  There were also plenty of staff, though many seem to be watching the crowd, while drying wine glasses.

We ordered the following: spaghetti (small plate to share, $8), chard ($7.75), roast chicken ($18), lamb ($24), and a few glasses of wine (~$10/per glass).  Delfina provided a generous portion of bread and refilled it when it got low.  The staff was attentive and pleasant.

The portions were a bit skimpy, though the chicken seemed adequate.  The lamb, which was a special for the day, was a complete disappointment. It was sliced from a leg and medium rare.  They provided a large serrated steak knife, which was barely adequate to cut the rather tough meat.  Certainly the quality did not reflect the price.

We decided to skip dessert as the noise level made it so uncomfortable that I just wanted to get out of there.  I've read many enjoyable reviews of this place, but it is not for us.  When I spend my hard earned $$$, I expect a relaxing place that I can enjoy my meal, not the high intensity noise compounded by the "thumping" and loud background music.
author: Robert J.

description:
I'd walked by this place a million times and I had heard great things so finally I decided to try this place yesterday with my sister. This is not the type of restaurant I'd want to go to by myself. It's too nice for that! It was a Saturday night around 6:00 and we were asked if we had made reservations (I never make reservations when I eat in the city) and were told there were no more open tables until 10:30 but we could sit at the bar right away. Without hesitation we chose the bar and although we were right by the door, it was a bit fun to sit at.
My sister ordered the Wild Nettle Tagliatelle and I ordered a large spaghetti. We got complimentary freshly baked bread that was delicious and I was accommodated with olive oil instead of butter.
We both ordered the Sweet Corn Soup (mine sans the cream) and we were both about ready to lick our bowls clean it was so good.

Both of us had no room for dessert after our meals and definitely felt like our food was worth every penny.

Service was great and I love it when you get to have a water pitcher at your table.

-1 star for not having more vegan options (especially those olive oil mashed potatoes that I was so excited to try because I thought they could be made vegan!!).

Definitely the place to go for top-notch Italian food. You just may want to make sure you place a reservation.
author: Amanda M.

description: Very solid Italian food. Real Brick oven pizza and fresh produce make this eatery worth a visit.
author: Joshua S.

description: What's left to say that 1027 other yelpers haven't already said?  Amazing food, delectable wine selection and knowledgeable service!!!!  Can't beat that!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I preface this by stating that I'm a vegetarian, so am not judging this meal based on its meets. I've been here once for dinner.

Location: This is an absolute great location; easily accessible both by vehicle and public transport. While the restaurant can be considered more on the classy side, the neighborhood is "hipsterish". Great place to grab a drink before or after and/or to catch a movie at the Roxie.

Space: The interior decor was whatever. Nothing I haven't seen before. The bathroom, however, was fabulous.

Ambiance: Classy restaurant with down to earth people is nice. The music they were playing was AWESOME. They were playing Belle and Sebastian's "Life Pursuit" which made me want to hug the servers. Fancy restaurant with hipster music is definitely a big + for me. Good crowd of people for the most part.

Service: It was a busy night, so the servers forgot to pour wine, replace bread and also forgot part of our order, but it's passable. Our server was extremely helpful, friendly and funny.

Food/Drink: We had a great white win, recommended by the server. The food was great. We had the asparagus, which were heavenly. Then we had spaghetti and the in nero, both were good, specially the latter. The bread is to die for, being made by Tartine bakery right next door. Now, for the reason it's not a 5 star restaurant (aside from the interior decor), the desserts. Both desserts, the profiteroles and the lemon pie, were too sweet and too mediocre; quite unappetizing after a lovely meal.

Overall: Great location for casual friends and dates. Good food, amazing bread, amazing music and friendly staff...just remember to check your glucose level before ordering any dessert...
author: SF N.

description:
I'm what some people might call a foodie.  I really hate that term but  I pretty much fit the mold.  I Yelp, I Chowhound, I Tablehop. I'm on pretty much every email list you can imagine, from Daily Candy to Thrillist. And as a self proclaimed foodie I'm ashamed to admit that I had never been to Delfina until last night. What the hell was I waiting for?

I had a fantastic dinner at Delfina last night with three friends.  First off, the room is loud but not unbearable.  One of the first things I noticed was the swarm of cute, hipster servers buzzing around the dining room. Our server was a sweet heart and totally on top of things from the get go.  

Here's a sample of what I tried:
Spaghetti, split as an appetizer - an excellent way for everyone at the table to try the pasta, since no one was going to order it as an entree.  Cooked perfectly al dente, in a light, fresh tomato sauce

Insalata Campo - some fancy pants lettuce simply dressed but featuring huge hunks of pancetta.

Pork Belly with Cockles - my entree, the saltiness of the pork played off the sweetness of the cockles to perfection. Mmm, salty pork.

Chicken - I don't remember the fancy name but the chicken was well received by all. Honestly, I hardly ever order chicken in a restaurant but Delfina's version has me rethinking that policy.

Broccoli Rabe - as a side, so damn tasty.

Chocolate Budino - I'm not a huge chocolate fan but loved this dense, Italian cake.

Cantucci - basically Italian for best damn biscotti ever.

Ok, no evening could be this perfect.  The mashed potatoes received an astounding 'eh' and I was a little surprised that they charged us corkage for the one bottle of wine that we brought considering we also bought a bottle + two glasses off their menu.  But really, now I'm just nitpicking.

I can see why Delfina is packed night after night...it doesn't just live up to the hype, it exceeds it. Go ahead and make a reservation six weeks out or walk in and wait two hours if you have to.   Just do yourself a favor and get to Delfina asap.
author: phil h.

description:
I have only eaten here once.  I got the chicken and have forgotten my app but it was also good.

Really cool how they slant the mirrors down so you can see around the restaurant.  Great ambiance.

Service was excellent.

I can't believe it doesn't have 5 stars on yelp.
author: Quags M.

description:
I used to overeat in private.  It all started when I was a 12 year-old girl scout and my mom found me passed out in my walk-in closet, surrounded by empty boxes of peanut butter patties, thin mints, and coconut samoas.  I had demolished 10 boxes.  

But that was THEN.. and NOW I choose to binge in public.  

Enter: Delfina.  

Warm quince & walnut budino w/ marscarpone.  (So many walnuts.  Must keep eating!) Gooey Scharffenberger cake with creme anglaise goodness (To die for.  Melty in the middle?  Must clean plate). 

Can't decide?  I'd like both, please.  Yes, for dinner.

Thankfully, the portions are smaller and I didn't eat too much. 

Plus, even with drinks, the bill was still less than my mom had to pay during my cookie binge of 1994.
author: Janney B.

description:
I'll preface this by saying that we didn't end up eating here, but our experience was bad enough to warrant a review. 

Walked in on Friday and was told there would be an hour wait for 4. No biggie and to be expected, so we happily went down the street and had a few drinks. Came back an hour and half later and was told that we'd have to wait another half hour for COUNTER seating, which was never communicated as what we were waiting for and a deal-breaker since the whole point is to be able to actually have a conversation. 

Food might be good, but I'll never know.
author: josh c.

description: This is a very nice italian restaurant. I had the steak and it was absolutely amazing. My date had the chicken and it was so tender and moist, one of the best ever. Their service is very attentive, friendly, fast, and remarkable. This place is very pricey but it is understandable for what you get. Great place.
author: Phan H.

description:
Had dinner reservations and was seated promptly by the friendly hostess.  A table for two was cozy, small and crammed in between the other tables. The space was so tight that when the waitress was serving the table next to us, her butt would nearly be resting on my plate. I could pretend to be offended, but she was quite the scrumptious waitress and I don't mind a little ass before dinner.

I was looking for the rabbit entree based on a friend's recommendation, but it was missing from the menu. We spent almost three hours at this Italian restaurant and I can't even tell you what I ate. I'm drawing a blank, partner. But it was all good and I'd recommend. Whatever it was.

The staff was on top of it, quick to refill my glass, serve the meal, clear the table, courtesy, smiles, you name it. They were SO on top of it, that I faked them out a couple of times with expressions that said " ooohh, I'm full, gonna stop eating...but...PSYCHE. I'm still eating, don't touch my plate you delectable waitress you".

Parking around Delfina could be a pain in the rear, so allow ample time for that. Don't leave valuables on display in your car, because getting back to your ride without any windows being broken will make for a happy evening.
author: Teddy B.

description:
Appetizer: 
-mashed potatoes ( very bland ). I had to add salt to it to give it any flavor.  
-olives: warm and nice tasting but they're just olives

Entree:  - spaghetti:  extremely bland and dry.  I made better pasta in my dorm room. It was very disappointing especially after the waitress strongly recommended it! 

Dessert:  - chocolate boudini:  to die for!  The mint ice cream that came with it was fresh, you could taste the mint leaves!   The cake was warm and moist.  Delish!
author: Cabride G.

description:
C took me to Delfina for Valentine's Day, and I fell in love immediately.
