Now the appetizers...Our favorite was the Grilled Fresh Calamari & Warm White Bean Salad.  We liked it so much that we ordered two!  It has this garlicky with a hint of lemon flavor.  Its sauce was not intimidating at all and most importantly, the calamari was fresh and not overcooked.  A must try!

We also tried the Snails with Celery.  I liked this appetizer.  Not as much as the calamari but it was good.  My husband wasn't as thrilled about it though.  Anyway, it has this gelatin-like taste, tender but not "rubbery" and the snails was fresh as well.

For our Entrees...
BBQ Pork Ribs with Beans- flavorful but not unique.  Meat was tender and perfectly cooked.   The downside was it tasted more like Texan BBQ dish than Italian.  Maybe let go of the beans and substitute it with risotto. 
Steak -Flavorful taste but the meat wasn't as tender.  Order it medium, it will taste better.   The fries that came with it were good.

Now the Desserts...
Cheese Plate (of course!) was just ok...nothing special.

Warm Chocolate Cake - portion was perfect.  The texture and sweetness were well-balanced.  Just yummy!

Hazelnut Cantucci (?) - Another nice dessert.  Perfect with the coffee!
author: Elaine C.

description: Delicious and exciting. Delfina is consistently good. After traveling to Sardegna  and tasting some of the best calamari, delfina has managed to be equally reminiscent to the best meals I've shared in italy. Their calamari is supreme as well as the Incampo salad and spaghetti, with great wine knowledge and selection! Bravo to an excellent staff!
author: s e.

description:
Finally got a reservation at Delfina for my birthday/farewell (moving to Hawaii) dinner.

It was everything I'd hoped for. Great food, nice table (although a little crowded/tight squeeze), good wine and good service.

This was my second time dining and both experiences were pleasantly memorable. Definitely one of my Bay Area favorites!
author: Christina W.

description: got the margherita pizza and beet salad. pizza was delicious. fresh ingredients. beet salad was very tasty too. comes with red beets and golden beets. i've never had golden beets before. yum!
author: Judy k.

description: I'm not a huge fan of italian so this place didn't stand out to me. They have limited vegetarian options so I didn't have much to eat. The staff is great, and the alcohol rocks.
author: Vivian W.

description: Fortunately, I was taken to dinner by a friend. i would have been angry if I had to pay for it. I live in the neighborhood, and every time I pass by Delfina the pizza crust is always burnt. there are black burn marks on it. If they served this in new York, they would be beaten up. So, dinner... the tricolore salad a good and so were the olives in oil; hard to mess up. Then came the meatballs, or should I say breadballs in a sauce that tasted like it was direct from the can. the hostess was snotty, maybe she eats there, yet the service was good. Don't waste your time .... go to North beach and get some real Italian food.
author: Jan N.

description:
Came here on V Day. Definitely a great place for a date. We did not have a reservation but were able to sit at their bar which my date didn't mind so neither did I. I had the Quail which left me licking my fingers and I even asked for the recipe! (which they e-mailed me later).
Amazing atmosphere, good service, even better food!
author: MARK J.

description: I loved Delfina!  Based on service, wine, pasta and calamari appet., I would say this place is 5 stars.  My favs were... Grilled Fresh Calamari, Insalada di Campo, and Boar Ragu pasta.  I'm sure all the pastas are amazing.  Some of the fam had the lamb, it was good, but not great.  I feel like this is a place where you stick w/ the fresh pastas, but I dont know...  I don't remember the name of the wine :( , but waitress recommended, was from northern Italy and it was excellent!
author: Kelli G.

description: OMG Amazing!  Fabulous dinner, wonderful service. The most delicious Calamari and Short Ribs I have ever had. My only issue was with the Spaghetti which was a tad bit al dente but even the service was over the top warm and inviting. Thanks for adding to a perfect vacation
author: Gail G.

description: Best pizza in San Fracisco - beats Little Star!
author: Matt W.

description:
If I'm ever mad, sad, or stressed, eating a good meal is just what the doctor ordered. Foods that challenge the tongue and fill the belly are just the kinda foods that I like and I am happy to report that Delfina is a great provider of such foods. 

Both the restaurant and the pizzeria always seem jam packed, so I was lucky to find a single bar seat on a Sunday evening. The waitstaff was pretty friendly for the most part, though almost too nice and seemingly fake at some points. Fortunately, Delfina's cuisine speaks for itself and is absolutely delicious! For the evening, I went with the house cured anchovies, stewed tripe in tomato sauce and the chocolate olive oil torte. The anchovies were seasoned perfectly with lemon, salt and olive oil and brought a briny goodness to the tongue. I loved the stewed tripe that was served in a hot ramekin and topped with bread crumbs. The meat was buttery and tender and literally, was just like what grandma used to make. When eaten with the AMAAAZING rustic slices of bread (made at Tartine next door), it was hearty, comforting, and down right delicious! The meal concluded with the torte which was moist and melted right in your mouth. The olive oil and coarse sea salt on top of the cake really made it special and memorable. It's deliciousness factor definitely could have been that much more by serving it a little bit hotter. 

My solo session at Delfina was quite enjoyable and brought much comfort to my uneasiness and stress. This great little neighborhood joint hit the spot and has me wishing that I lived closer to it, so I could eat there more often.
author: Christina N.

description: Something has gone wrong here. Attitude and mediocre food have taken over what once my favorite restaurant in SF.
author: Joey D.

description: I've gone here twice for lunch with friends and both times I've enjoyed the pizzas we ordered.  The crust is thin (which I like) and the sauce is light as well.  I especially enjoyed their margherita pizza.  Don't come here starving because it can be a really long wait before you get seated.  But they do have breadsticks to snack on in the mean time!
author: Tess E.

description: This is the most amazing Italian restaurant I have been to in the United States.  It has the most amazing eggplant parmesian on the planet.
author: Zinzi L.

description:
I am usually a fan of Delfina. It offers great food, amazing wine and not to mention their location is around the corner from my house. My recent experiences have been somewhat disappointing. I almost choked on a mouth full of bones after ordering the sole. I am not a complete degenerate, I do know how to avoid life ending food items, but after a few attempts gave up entirely. The service was good, not out of this world, satisfactory. I will say the profiteroles were AMAZING. 

Ultimately, Delfina will always be a gem. Sadly, recently it left me wanting more.
author: Courtney I.

description:
Delfina has to be one of my favorite restaurants in the city...I tell everyone to go there! I've heard it's hard to get a reservation at this place, but we went on a Sunday night and were seated early. 

What we had...the calamari and pork sugo are by far my favorites!  I usually don't clean my plate but it was hard to leave any of the tasty morsels behind!! The bread was some of the best, if you are on a low card diet this is not the restaurant for you. The wait staff was super knowledgeable about the food and full of great recommendations on what to order and what wine to pair it with. 

Noise...this place isn't noisy at all. On a Sunday night it was filled with couples and a few families out for a nice dinner.

Parking...street parking is an act of patience but there are a few pay lots just a few blocks away.
author: Angela M.

description:
Go here.  I've been here like twenty plus times.  

I like the Fulton Chicken:
  - It's real  tasty.  They brine it all day.
  - Plus you get to eat with your fingers in a nicer restaurant.  Priceless.

If you are two people - expect a wait, BUT you can wait inside, and I recently got seated with no wait for two @ 8:00 on a weekend.  You never know.

More than two people - expect a wait.  Slight chance you may be pleasantly suprised.  Slight.

Just get a drink and shut up a while.
author: RiCH K.

description:
My boyfriend took me here for my birthday dinner, and I have to say that it was really the perfect meal.  We ordered the grilled calamari for an appetizer and we both thought it was the best calamari we'd ever had.  Very tender and flavorful.  The gnocchi was perfect.  And the Fulton chicken dish with mashed potatoes and a mushroom sauce was excellent.  For dessert we ordered the Scharfenberger chocolate cake.  Also delicious.

Service was great, corkage very fair (only $18).  I'm sure it was an expensive meal, but if someone is taking you out I'd definitely recommend this place!
author: Gami G.

description:
SF has so many food options but when I come visit from the east coast, I always go to Delfina.  Get out of the tourist traps and come to the Mission District!

The food is unique and fantastic!  The servers are knowledgeable but not annoying (and not that this is as important, but quite good looking too!)

There is a wait but be patient, it's worth it.  I'd tell you what to get but I believe they change the menu frequently...at least for someone who goes probably once a year.
author: S C.

description:
I would say the food was good, maybe not as amazing as I had hoped given the really high expectations built up coming in.. Had a buddy visiting from the East Coast, who is used to eating good food (L'Espalier type in Boston) but simultaneously wanted to be able to wear a hoody out to dinner. I chose Delfina I think it was a good choice.

To start we ordered grilled calamari and ribbolita. The calamari was different because it was grilled not fried, and it was delicious but a little healthier than normal calamari. I have tried ribbolita in Tuscany, but this was a different take on it-instead of a soup more like a pancake.

For dinner he had the shortribs stracatto with polenta and I had a risotto that had mushrooms and nettles (still not exactly sure what a nettle is). Mine was delicious, although i wished there was a little more of it. His was also really good, but no veggies of any kind (which he could have known ordering it).

The desserts weren't what we were looking for, so we went to Bi-Rite for ice cream. All in all, the food was quite good but there could have been larger portions. Generally not groundbreaking, but a nice place with good food and friendly waitstaff.
author: Andrew D.

description: Winsome, friendly, and fresh.  Downside:  small food portions made up for by good service.   Upside:  artful takes on classic cuisine.
author: Patrick B.

description: It's about time we ate here, especially since it was one of the last meals for my boyfriend as a San Francisco resident.  I loved the cozy, intimate atmosphere of the restaurant and the service was friendly and efficient.  The food was pretty darn good, but there were a couple dishes I would not order again, such as the calamari.  Ours was a bit burnt and I have had much better, like at Piperade.  All in all, I would go here again to enjoy the cool vibe and good food.
author: Carolyn D.

description: Great spot for a intimate date on a special date or occasion. I their steak with cherry sauce was tender and delicious. Nice dark atmosphere, but it can get busy and loud at times. That just comes with the awesomeness of the restaurant. Great place and I would go again and again and again for many more years to come.
author: A L.

description:
walked in on a busy friday night at 7pm with no reservations.  we were expecting a long wait but lucked out and were immediately seated at the bar stools facing the dining hall.  brownie points for the awesome hostess. 

the ambiance was lively and poshy.  and the food was delish.  we started off with the calamari appetizer served with the white bean salad which was delightful. we shared the pork spareribs that fell off the bone and melted in your mouth. as well as the spaghetti alla carbonara which was served with a fresh raw egg. having the waiter mix in the egg at the table was the perfect touch.  we finished the evening with the panna cotta which was absolutely fabulous.

good food.  great service. loved the atmosphere. and to top off the night we had a celebrity sighting... jane lynch from glee was having din a couple tables down from us. love her!
author: Ava S.

description:
I went to Delfina for dinner last night with two girlfriends. My roommate and I make a habit of going out to new restaurants as often as we can, and Delfina, with the hype that it has, had to be tried! We had a reservation at 10pm, and they seated us within 5 minutes or so of arrival. Our server was very nice, accommodating, and friendly. The food was also extremely tasty in my opinion. We shared the olives as a starter (though we all agreed it should be a larger portion), and two of us had the scallop appetizer while my roommate had a small salad, all of which were delicious. One of my favorite parts about Delfina was that they give you the option to "half" any of the pasta orders- who really needs, or will eat, several pounds of pasta? The portions in some restaurants are just ridiculous, and upon receiving the half portion of spaghetti I ordered, I was pleased that it was just enough to fill me up without any leftovers. As someone who lived in Italy for several months, I have to say the spaghetti was more authentic than any other I have had in the city. It was simple, but rich in flavor. Molto molto bene :) 
I will definitely be going back!
author: Rachel G.

description: I had an enjoyable dinner here with friends last night. We shared the scallops and the radish salad for appetizers.  I had the pasta with crab  which was wonderful and my friends both got the pork chop special.That and a bottle of wine and we were good to go! We tried the 2 chocolate desserts. They were great. I will be coming back.
author: Sandra Q.

description: Love this one.  A little cramped.  Excellent food and service.  Pizzeria next door also very good.
author: Joe W.

description: I didn't think I would be in a good mood eating here because of the super crowded, claustrophobic ambience.  BUT the food was so delicious, I didn't give a care.  The service was great, food came quickly and we didn't feel rushed whatsoever for a Saturday night at this hotspot!
author: g m.

description:
i love love Delfina. I really can't think of any other Italian place around here that can beat the amazing food they have at Delfina.
I've tried most of their pastas, because it can be ordered half portion. Not because I eat less, but because I want to try another pasta. All of them are wonderful, but I love the sea urchin pasta and risotto best. 
The menu changes everyday which keeps Delfina interesting and I'm a devotee.
author: M S.

description:
Been eating here for months, and it clearly is the best place in town for Italian food.....oh hell....almost any food. Hard to explain how good the gnocchi is here. 

The hardest part about eating here is not filling up on the bread from Tartine!!! But that is a seperate review.....
author: Reid B.

description:
Oh! I crave! I crave! I crave!

If that doesn't do it for you. The duck pappardelle will change your mind. I've since only been thinking about going back. The hand-rolled pasta, the  tender strips of duck. The ravioli. The simple but elegant mozzarella salad to start. Everything about the intimate setting worked. 

The service was spot-on. Friendly and unobtrusive. The dessert wine. Not a huge fan usually but Delfina changed my perspective. It's the perfect way to end a meal here. Delicious.
author: Catsu H.

description:
I am a volunteer TA for an English class at SFSU, and my boss took me there for the compensation as my 3-month-belated birthday dinner. He said Delfina has been selected as one of 100 best restaurants in the city, and I was quite excited because I can't possibly eat at such a place while I'm in college. I survive with free food on campus every day.

They change their menu every day in order to maintain the standards of the freshness of the ingredients. I had no clue what I wanted and I wasn't very familiar with Italian, so I left it up to my boss. We started with calamari with beans and olives as an appetizer. It was the best way to enjoy the actual taste of calamari, and trust me, I'm from Japan, the seafood nation. We then set about spring salad with walnuts. Good taste, but I could have had more cheese...I love cheese.

We had pasta for the main dish; I ordered some flat triangle pasta with Louisiana shrimp. Oh I can still remember the flavorful sauce and the texture of the shrimp! My boss's ravioli was slightly better, though; once you put it in your mouth, the flavor of lemon (or lime?) spread all over your tongue generously. And when you start chewing, the whole new taste joins the harmony. Yes, every single bite is just rapturous.

Their service was flawless, too. They welcomed us in a very warm and friendly manner. We barely had an empty plates left without taken away in front of us. 

If you're not as frugal as I am, I'd definitely recommend this experience. Don't forget to grab some ice cream at Bi-Rite Creamery across the street toward Dolores Park!!
author: Haruki E.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in California. I am a huge fan of late night dining...the later, the better! (I'm from a small town...can you tell??) I eat here every time I am in the city...around 1030-11pm is when I like to go.  I usually order the sardines (seasonal) which are grilled and drizzled with olive oil and sprinkled with crunchy sea salt. My favorite meal there was with my mom...Wild Nettle Ravioli and 3 or 4 other small plates including the sardines, cheese, and a pasta dish that resembled spaghetti carbonara...my favorite pasta dish, and my specialty. If I could rate this restaurant more than 5 stars, well it sure deserves them. Simple Italian, low lighting, small, lots of laughter, great wine. Superb!!!!!!!!
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
Only the seating keeps this from being five stars. We went late and as a result were able to snag a table spontaneously on a Friday night.

Once there, we were packed in like sardines, with just inches between our table and the couples flanking us. Tyler Derden's question of etiquette in passing on airplanes comes to mind. (If you haven't seen Fight Club, watch, and you'll get it.) Worse, the gentleman next to my boyfriend smelled. Off-putting when you are about to eat. Since one can't make bathing a prerequisite for diners, give the patrons a little more room to breathe, literally.

Despite the seating arrangement, Delfina rates. Food and service saved the experience.

Our waitress was prompt, friendly, and knowledgeable. She gave great advice on their wines based on the foods we ordered.

They serve great bread. Yum!

We started with the insalata di campo. It tasted ordinary to me, but my boyfriend loved it. Certainly the cheese shavings were high quality. 

The primi, the lasagna vincisgrassi, was excellent. I looked up recipes before we went, curious about the dish after seeing it on the menu. My family has made something of a study of good lasagne. It turns out there are many different vincisgrassi sauces, most of them unbelievably rich, with ingredients you might not want to list in polite company. 

When I asked what was in Delfina's vincisgrassi sauce, our waitress shared some of the ingredients. It lived up to the expectations I'd built up after reading recipes online. I think the tomato puree painted around the lasagna was unnecessary and might have detracted from the flavors of the sauce. The pasta had great texture.

The secondi, while good, was almost anticlimactic. That lasagna was a tough act to follow! However, the filet was perfectly cooked and the potatoes tender and tasty. 

Their desserts looked amazing, but with those three courses, we had no need of dolci.

We'll definitely go back to Delfina.
author: Simone E.

description:
First night out without the child in MONTHS.  Someone gave us a giftcard and we were so excited to be able to treat ourselves and even decided to come to the restaurant over the pizza next door.  Wrong choice!

I have to say, the service was great.  Really great.  Attentive, kind and available.  I appreciate that.

The food, however, was not so great.  We started with a butternut squash sformatino, which was actually amazing and delicious.  Just tiny tiny tiny!

We split the steak and some broccoli rabe.  Also, tiny tiny tiny, except for a generous portion of fries.  The meat was good, but totally oversauced.  And the sauce, broccoli and fries were extremely salty, so much so that we couldn't even finish!  

We did end with profiteroles.  Mostly yummy but the pastry was a bit too hard and crunchy and not buttery and pastry-ish.

Anyhow, a disappointing experience, actually, considering our bill came to $70!  We could have gone next door for great pizza for half the price.  So I guess 6 months from now, when we have a chance to go on our next date, we'll go elsewhere.
author: J E.

description: Took my parents here and it was outstanding. Staff were so thoughtful and friendly and provided us with excellent recommendations for appetizers and pasta dishes. The pastas were out of this world.
author: E K.

description: 3.5 to 4 stars...  LOVED the prosciutto/parmesan/nectarine appetizer, definitely 5 stars for that one. I wasn't impressed with our entrees, however. The spaghetti was very good and at $13 the tiny portion wasn't too troubling, but the tiny portion for the $20 Rosemary Tagliatelle (the flavor is good, but honestly, a bit reminiscent of Hamburger Helper) was a little silly. We had to fill up on another bread bowl after the meal and the server seemed used to offering more bread after the meal. Maybe it is intended that you would order from each course. I'd be happy to spend the money for multiple courses if the quality was the same as the appetizer, but based on the pasta dishes, I'm not sure. Service and atmosphere were lovely though. Doing it again, I'd put our name in at the busy Delfina Pizzeria next door, then pop over to the restaurant only for the prosciutto appetizer and a drink while I wait.
author: Melanie G.

description:
Generally I love this place. However, last night I had an experience that a good restaurant shouldn't provide.

My rabbit dish was cold in the center. I pointed it out to the server and was gracious about it. Too gracious, in fact, because they charged me full price ($24) for a dish I obviously couldn't eat, as I sent it away, with some of the outsides eaten (where it was warm) but most of it uneaten.

I don't like to be a jerk to restaurants. I know they have a hard business. But this time, they dropped the ball.

Since posting this, I got an email from a Yelper asking why I didn't complain. If it was a sandwich shop, I would have. I had a lengthy conversation with the server at the time I sent it back, but I don't like to haggle over the check at a nice restaurant. 

I don't need to tell you Delfina makes good pastas and appetizers -- there are, today, 760 Yelp reviews, many making those points. My hope is that someone at Delfina cares enough about the dining experience to read this post, so the next time a similar thing happens, that customer won't have to either pay and resent it, as I did, or stand and argue and ruin his companions' dining experience.
author: Blake G.

description:
I cant complain about the food.  It was good, though a tad expensive.  I want to mention, though, that they accept reserbvations for no more than 6 people and our 2 babes in arms were included in that number.  It made it difficult for a family birthday event. By the way it was 5:30 on a thursday evening.

My main problem with them was my wine order.  I asked for a glass of chardonnay.  Granted, I should have asked how much is a glass of white wine, but I left it to the waitress to decide.  The bill for 2 glasses was 32 dollars.  Now, am I wrong in thinking that they should have told me the price, asked me if that was OK?, presented me with the wine list (It was given to my husband when he ordered his red wine)?  It just left me with a ripped off feeling.  A restaurant of that caliber with good food and good service didnt need to sneak in an expensive wine.
author: karin m.

description: We had dinner here after hearing our friends rave about it. We walked in around 6pm with no reservations on a Saturday and got seated right away. Great! We ordered the hanger steak and the spaghetti. Both dishes were delicious and tasty! And the service was great too. My only complaint was that I don't think they have any AC and it was kind of warm. It's not enough to deter me from returning here though in the future! I can't wait to try the other entrees on the menu.
author: Jennifer H.

description: I've been coming here for years and I ate here a few nights and it was wonderful as always. The food was amazing as well as the service.
author: Milly C.

description:
This review is a bit of a mix as the food tends to be good and the service needs plenty of attention. 

The meat dishes have been a hit with us and many of the people we have gone with to Delphina. The pasta dishes for the most part have been delicious with a few exceptions. Of more than dozen visits, we have only sent one plate back. 

Maybe we went on an off night the last two visits. Our waitress was clearly upset by something that happened at some other table, but seemed to take it out on everyone else. The last time the waiter came back smelling like an ashtray. We said something and got attitude the rest of the evening. The wait staff needs attention. Not sure if the management will ever notice as the lines are long and money is being made. 

In restaurant terms, the back-house hits the mark while the front-house seriously lags. Just lose the attitude and the obvious playing of favorites at other tables. 

Like the restaurant's food. Yum! Good to go again!
author: Martha G.

description: Came here for my birthday once. Food was great but my boyfriend was horrible company. It was the place that I teared up and almost broke up with him. Hopefully, next time, it will be a better experience. I will try this spot again, but with better company.
author: Helen L.

description:
I cannot get a bad meal or experience at Delfins's.
I love it, love it, love it. The waiters are great, the wine is great, and the food is authentic ( you couldn't guess this wasn't Italy) and fantastic.  There is nothing cynical here. You are not getting ripped off by gimmicky food, or hyped up coked up waiters. ( it is a problem).
author: Norman H.

description: Had dinner there tonight with wife and college daughter. We got in right away, but only because we accepted a makeshift table they set up in the aisle by the kitchen, on the way to the toilets.   The waiter was friendly and somewhat helpful, although he said the best thing on the menu was the spaghetti, which my daughter ordered. We found out that it was in fact ....spaghetti. Long noodles with a dollop of tomato sauce on top. My wife ordered the duck and I had the roast pork. We started with some Brussels sprouts and French fries as appetizers, which was good because the entree portions were modest, and my pork dish had no sides. Food quality and taste were quite good on all fronts, so no complaints there. Service, however, was unimpressive. We ordered coffee and dessert at the same time, and the dessert was served and eaten well before the coffee came out. Also, while I realize our table was set up in an aisle-way, we were bumped and kicked by passing servers several times, none of whom bothered to apologize or even acknowledge that they had made contact.  Overall, I left feeling like this was one of those trendy San Francisco places where we were supposed to feel honored that we had been able to be there. I wouldn't make any effort to return, as there are so many great restaurants in San Francisco, where, for $150 for 3 people, you can have a great all around casual dining experience.
author: Fred E.

description: We had just about everything on the menu and there was not one thing I could complain about. Excellent service and all the pork dishes were to die for!
author: Jerry G.

description: Fun, fun, fun!  Loved the energy and the food was delicious!  I had the Insalata di Campo, which was zestful and fresh; the Roasted Fulton Valley Chicken, which was super moist and tasted like goodness; and the Tcho Chocolate Budio, which my friend, who is Belgian, also enjoyed and he won't even eat chocolate in America.  ;-)
author: S W.

description:
OOOOhhhhhhhh we love this restaurant! Every morsel of food that we have tried has been amazing!  The place is consistent and terrific....love the hand pulled mozzarella. The more casual atmosphere makes it feel like you could eat there any time.
I was blown away  to read a post about the owners because we have always found them to be extraordinarily conscientous and kind.  They seem to be committed to great service and always give great service themselves......plus their kid is precious.
author: colleen d.

description: I really don't understand what the hype is about this place.  The portions are small and overpriced.  The food isn't all that great?!?  Its a good place for the scene...
author: Rupa P.

description:
I want to start by saying that Delfina is a place where I have enjoyed going many times over the years.

Recently however, I was walking by and desperately needed to use the restroom because I am 9 months pregnant. I asked the hostess if I could use theirs, even though I wasn't eating there that evening. Much to my surprise, she gave me a wilting look and said that the bathroom was only for paying customers, even though it was clear that I was not a) homeless or b) crazy.

After I said "even for a pregnant woman?" she finally acquiesced, but told me not to tell anybody. Well I guess I'm telling somebody...

I was seriously disappointed as I have previously enjoyed Delfina on a number of occasions, but now I don't know if I'll be coming back.
author: Rachel B.

description: simple excellence...the hosts got us seated in 15 minutes on a busy Saturday(as walk-ins)and the food was excellent and prepared w/real skill.Thanks to our wonderful waitress Rosemary who was just great.In fact,the whole staff seems just dialed in and on top of their game despite the noise and confusion around them! Very impressive.
author: james m.

description:
AMAZING~!!!! the short ribs were fantastic! and so was the salmon... we had grilled calamari and the cheese platter also... delicious!
the Bartender (i wish i remembered her name was SO helpful pairing wine with the meal and local spots that we could visit on our trip)

Service was GREAT! love love love this place.. currently dreaming and drooling over the thoughts of the short ribs....  

if you don't have reservations you'll probably end up eating in the bar~! reservations were booked solid until 10PM!
author: esther l.

description: I went to Delfina last week for my anniversary and had a lovely time!  We got parking right out front which was cool.  We made our reservations only a day in advance which is unusual for this place!  They are usually booked at least 2 weeks in advance.  If you are flexible with time and have a small party you can usually get in the next day though.  We got a great table and the food was exquisite at usual.  Great service and good music playing not too loudly so you can have good conversation made for a great time!
author: Connie L.

description:
roasted chicken with olive oil mashed spuds rocked! this is tasty place except for the fact that we happened to go there on a sunny Sunday when all the Mission hipsters were slumming it at Dolores Park, made for a difficult parking sitch.  

Service is impeccable, they really train their wait staff thoroughly.  This is the 2nd time I've been here and the food/wine is outstanding, service really makes it.
author: Sfgpgirl G.

description: Can't go to Napoli for the real pizza? Go to Delfina, the best pizza I have tried in SF so far (and the only place my Italian hubby goes for pizza in the Bay Area). Do I need to say more?
author: Fê O.

description: Wish they offered different size of portion for their pasta. The "Mint tagliatelle" is really not that much for $17 even for someone who doesn't eat too mcuh.
author: Ile F.

description: Best dessert I've ever had. Moist, melon, deliciousness. Telling all my friends to come before the mad rush....it was a perfect end to an unfortunately heavy entree.
author: A. F.

description: Amazing food, one of the best dinners I've had , ever,. Have the flank streak, lamb, anchovies appetizer and shrimp,   The best!!!
author: Melissa S.

description: Whenever BF and I want to eat at a place that'd guarantee great food, we'd always think of Delfina. Even their simple side dish of plain spaghetti is perfection. An added bonus is that the bread they serve is from Tartine Bakery. We had to ask for more bread, which won us over from the start.
author: Jackie L.

description:
quality food in a hip, well designed atmosphere.      but, 

"meh. I've experienced better," may not be as accurate as "i've had equal, or better for half the cost, or wait. " 

as with a lot of places that top charts... its hype. just hype. not impressed
author: heath m.

description:
menu is always changing but i'm always happy with whatever i order
they get their bread from tartine around the corner and acme (the bread from tartine is soo much better - i can eat that every day) 
if you can't get reservations, you can try just walking in when they open at 5:30pm and usually they can sit you at the bar
author: Annie c.

description: The perfect pizza from Delfina, their slightly citrus insalata tricolore, and a glass of Italian wine is ideal for a celebratory evening.
author: Rose M.

description:
Delfina...you broke my heart like a first love would. I thought you were going to be like your more low-key counterpart, Pizzaria Delifina. But no, you left me thirsty as hell, not thirsty for more. 

The service, I can't complain about. Our hostess asked to take our coats and was super sweet. But let's not kid ourselves. Who walks into a restaurant just for the service? 

We started off with the Grilled Fresh Calamari with warm white bean salad. That was probably my favorite part of my meal. The calamari was perfectly cooked, not too chewy. My only gripe about it was that it was too salty, so my recommendation is to eat it with the salad, to take away from the saltiness. But I soon learned that salt was going to be the theme for the rest of the night. 

Next up, we got the Spaghetti with plum tomatoes, garlic, extra virgin olive oil and peperoncini. To be honest, and I hate to say it, but I think I've made better spaghetti using Barilla Mushroom and Garlic Sauce. 

For my main entrée, I got the Meyer Ranch Hanger Steak. Our waitress recommended that I have it medium rare, so I got just that. Usually when I order my steaks, I expect to see a huge slab of mean, oozing in juicy happiness, ready for me to dig in like a cardiologist performing a triple bypass. But nope, I didn't get the joy of doing that because my steak came pre-cut. WHAT THE HELL IS THAT ABOUT??? I can cut my own steak, thank you very much. Anyways, the thing with hanger steaks is that they are usually very tough, so they need to be properly marinated in order to break down some of the proteins, in effort to tenderize the meat. This is where Delifina succeeds. The steak itself was quite juicy, and was very flavorful. Maybe too flavorful, to a fault, because at some point, it was just...marinade...and SALT that I was chewing into. Nonetheless, it was still a quality steak that didn't require additional assistance in the whole pre-cut department. I thoroughly enjoyed the fries - I believe they used Yukon gold potatoes, because it tasted nothing like Russets. They were done right and tasted delicious! 

I also had a bite of the artic char (special for the night). That was also pretty darn salty as well. 

So all in all, I think it was a quality meal, but I'm sure they could have laid off on the salt overload. I think I consumed enough salt to cover the yearly recommended sodium intake for a small, third-world country that night.
author: Blenda L.

description:
Everyone sit down, Mama has some news.  I went on a date tonight.  That's right...I'm not sure if you are ready to let your little Laura fly away into coupledom during which time Yelp will become the red-headed step child I am ashamed of and lock in the basement and occassionally beat.  This time, next week, I'll most likely be engaged to be married.  Unless I'm really not.  Which brings me the actual date.  Here is how the big D went down and I can be 100% honest because I'm like 90% sure this fool is way too cool for school/Yelp.  We met through a mutual friend and he emailed me to ask me to have coffee (GAY) and talk about how the world is fucked.  I, of course, am amenable on the world being fucked front and so I said, how about you buy me dinner (as i am poor AND fat!  some might call me a double threat!) and you have yourself a deal, sir!  and by deal, i of course mean, easy lay.    

Delfina is the ultimate first date place, according to yelpers, zagats, chowhound, my parents and that homeless dude who soft shoe(lesse)s in front of Tartine.  So, I didn't make the plans but when he suggested Delfina I was like, "PREDICTABLE.  SNOOZE."  but again, beggars can't be choosers and I've always had a delicious time at Delfina so Delfina it is!  Now, the food was great and the conversation so-so-meh but I have one huge problem with this place and that is this:  the waitresses are freaking Goddesses.  I'm not trying to have a first date at some place where I look like I have down's syndrome in comparison to these beautiful sirens.  I felt like fucking Beauty and The Beast up in that bitch.  Not cool.  Seriously, first date place, Yelp?  First date if you want your prospective husband to go home and jerk it to the chick who served you Pasta Putanesca!  I mean, for realz. I cry, "uncle" to Delfina.  I cannot win in a situation like this.  You know what a perfect first date place is?  McDonald's.  And here's why: They employ actual retards.  It's part of the leg up program or whatever it's called which is just darling and I love it AND you can't help but seem attractive and semi-sane in comparison with the differently abled.  It's win/win, people!  Man, fools at McDonald's are having awesome dates and I'm over here at Delfina's trying to feign interest in what this jackass across from me is blathering on about and it's damn hard when i want to beat a bitch down based solely on her unholy good looks.  i want to beat her and then make out with her, GOD HELP ME.  When I decided I wanted to make out with the waitress more than i wanted to make out with hipster mc useless start-up across the table, I knew this was not MTB (look it up, people.  we were all teenage girl's once.  for some of the women on this site, it was mere weeks ago.)  The other clue that this was not the man for me was at this moment in our conversation:

Date Boy:  God, it's such a beautiful day today, don't you think?  And you know what day it is, right?  The first day of spring!

Laura B.: GAY!

Anyway, Delfina.  Delicious and a few vegan options (and the kitchen is very accommodating...upon learning i am vegan, the chef made me spaghetti with all sorts of delightful vegetables in it including my favorite, artichoke hearts! i love those little suckers!  the fries are always amazing...thin and crispy with herbs and salt...POIFECT!) but awful, terrible first date place.  Actually, I'm sure it would be fine if you had a healthy self esteem and sense of your own worth.  Which i'm assuming you don't as you are a woman.  Even if you are a man who reads my reviews, you are a woman and this world can often be hard on the thinking, feeling lady.  Now, come tell Mama your problems, it looks like she might not be going anywhere for a long, long time.  

I really hope this dude doesn't read Yelp.
author: Laura B.

description: Mmmm....the spaghetti is amazing.  I've been on a pasta craze and this satisfies and makes you want more.  Perfect tang/acid, seasoning, and heat in the sauce with al dente pasta.
author: Miss H.

description:
ever have those moments with a friend when suddenly you're awash in this glow that illuminates beautifully *why* you are friends with that person?  a moment where the intensity of your friendship just makes you happy to be alive and want to celebrate the very essence of friendship?  well, delfina was the stage for one of these moments for me.

one of my best friends, whom i hadn't seen for months, had a less than 24hr trip planned to sf and since delfina's right around the corner from my new place, we ended up there for dinner.  (here i'd like to note that on a saturday night at 8pm, the place was packed and yet somehow we had wine glasses in hand within minutes and a table within 15).

anyway, i'd had a shitty couple of days and even though i tried not to, i could feel my gloominess spilling over onto my buddy despite his best efforts to cheer me up.  we had so much to catch up on in terms of each others' lives, but i just didn't feel like thinking about my side of things let alone talking about them, and so--head in a fog--i just kept drifting in and out of the conversation, observing in the mean time, that pretty much all of the waitresses were remakably pretty.

a couple glasses of wine later, our food arrived (he had the lamb and i had the tuna).  the food was just fantastic.  my tuna was grilled to perfection, so juicy and tender and just dripping with flavor.  his lamb was savory and unusually spiced.  unable to keep up a smile, i just sank into my tuna, and we exchanged pleasantries about the fabulous cuisine, the candlit ambience romantic yet jovial--a spot where you can feel equally comfortable dressed to the nines or in jeans and sneakers.  

fast forward 45minutes or so, and suddenly i had a revelation!  the conversation about the food had miraculously diverted course.    lo and behold i had spent the last half hour talking about the anthropological evolution of the arts:  music versus dance versus visual in the human species, the nature of political and economic thought in the modern day, and neurological models of consciousness without for a moment drifting back into my bleary eyed lull.  my buddy hadn't tried to coax me into conversation...it just happened.  oh friend of friends!  how i've missed intense company like this!!!

at this point, the dessert arrived.  we had the chocolate cake, and let me just say, that cake had a soundtrack:  "heaven, i'm in heaven, and my heart beats so that i can hardly breathe..." (and for the record, in the case of this cake, it's ella singing, not louis).

delfina, thank you for possibly one of the best dining experiences of my life.  i would come back and eat with you every day except that a) i don't make nearly enough money to afford you that often and b) i want to make sure that every other experience i have here has as much magic as this first one.  i love you.  sincerely, roshni.
author: Roshni R.

description: I've been here 4 times, but this is my first post. Simple food, done extremely well. I had no idea that roasted chicken could be such a big deal! Absolutely sublime! On my last visit, I had the hanger steak. So good that I ate the entire thing. The have a good wine list, great service, cool space, and just fantastic food. This place is ALWAYS packed, so getting here early (or having reservations) is a must.
author: Eme L.

description:
since there are already 230+ reviews on delfina, i won't bore you with another delfina review. instead, i will make a simple statement:

tell her she's special. take her to delfina........she won't be disappointed.

.
* reservation is a definite must.
author: frisco j.

description: I went to Delfina as it was recommended by a close friend from San Francisco-I was in town from New York to visit.  It was a very cozy place-the perfect place for an intimate gathering of friends.  In addition, my friend brought some good bottles of wine and they allowed for the BYOB (although charged a minimal bottle-opening fee).  The food was excellent-very fresh and really enjoyed it.  There is one complaint that I had-the place is not good for large parties as each party is supposed to be no more than six people.  After speaking with the GM, he mentioned that I could bring seven people-but one I arrived at the restaurant they continuously scolded me for bring seven people.  When I told them that the GM told me I could I was admonished one last time and told the next time I came to make sure I was six or less as we were escorted to a larger table that easily fit eight.  I thought the way this was handled was poor-but all in all really enjoyed Delfina and as importantly think my friends and wife had a good time as well.
author: Anand R.

description:
I have always loved Delfina restaurant and Pizzeria. The food is always delicious, and I really love the bustling and warm atmosphere. The last time I went, however, our server was so amazing that I wanted to write a Yelp review specifically to commend her as well as the extra tasty lamb ravioli and always delicious panna cotta we had that night.

To start off with, our server was very knowledgeable about the menu as well as friendly and warm. These attributes, however, are to be expected of a Delfina server. This next bit is what sets her apart: For one of our plates that evening, we ordered the wild nettle soup with creme fraiche and trumpet mushrooms. I have a thing for nettles, so I sort of forced ordering this dish on my dinning partners. The soup was good--the mushrooms added an interesting texture and the creme fraiche cut the chlorophyll filled pure nicely--but the soup wasn't great, like the rest of the meal. About half way through eating the soup, we all got a little bored of eating it and so stopped. Our server asked us if we liked it, and we replied that it was good, but not great, and that we sort of thought maybe a bit more creme faiche would have been good. Truthfully, the reason we stopped eating the soup is because we wanted panna cotta and if we had kept eating, we would have burst at the seems. (This brings me to the lamb ravioli--it was AMAZING!!!!! the pasta was delicate, the lamb inside was tender, and the reduction sauce complimented the dish wonderfully).

Anyways, the rest of the meal went as planned. The panna cotta was amazing and our server continued to be lovely. When the bill came, however, she told us that she took the soup off the bill as we didn't love it. Um, she really didn't need to do that....like really. But, I guess, that the type of service that gives Delfina over 600 yelp reviews and people like me clamoring to put their two cents in. 

Brava Delfina. YUMZ to the max.
author: Jacky H.

description: You ever have something close to you that was totally incredible and yet you let it pass you by? An unexpected friend? An old shirt you've always loved in the back of your closet? A girl that you realize now melts your heart? Delfina is all of these. I have lived two doors down from this restaurant and in five years, have never ventured in. I finally did this weekend. It was warm, inviting and made you feel like you've been inside a million times. They greet you like a regular and make you feel at home recommending you try unique tasting wines and equally unique entrees, like the spicy cauliflower pasta I had. Delfina has its own style and grace and makes you wonder why you didn't pay more attention to it before. You instantly regret taking it for granted and only hope you will learn next time...
author: Michael E.

description:
i like.  i like.

loud and bustling on a friday night...this place had great friendly service.  
the wine list was not very impressive and had a bit of a mark up but there were plenty of single glasses to choose from as well.  

however, after eating here for the first time, i realized what all the fuss has been about.  solid italian comfort food.  like my mama, well ok maybe not mine but some italian's mama used to make.

apps:
1. the salt cod was not overly salty nor fishy.  a perfect balance to the crisp flatbread.
2. the gem lettuce had a yummy lemon dressing which was a nice acidic compliment to the aged gorgonzola 
3. the insalata di campo's bitter lettuce was nicely paired with the balsamic dressing.  really excellent.
4. the pappa al pomodoro (tomato soup with bread) was wonderfully hearty and slightly sour.  i highly recommend it.

1st course:
5. the gnocchi was one of the best i have had in a long time
6. the risotto was perfectly cooked with fresh summer squash
7. the 'pasgetti was spicy and deelish.

2nd course:
hmmm never got there.  too full...but never too full for dessert!
8. we finished the meal off with a creamy buttermilk panna cotta sprinkled with tart berries.

i was in heaven.
author: Anh V.

description: Always wanted to go to the Restaurant part of Delfina. The Pizza part was great and will go back. Sad to say, I probably won't make an effort to go to the restaurant. Reservation is a must. Parking is at a premium, so I highly recommend getting there as early as possible before your reservations, There were four of us and were quickly sat by nice window seat. Had plenty of time to order. Waiter was very pleasant and helpful. We ordered two appetizers. Calamari and the warm Olives. Both were very delicious. All four of us ordered separate items. I was the only one happy with my pick. I had the Pork Shoulder on Risotto. Meat was very tender and the Risotto prepared perfectly. I ate it all. My wife ordered Sea Bass and it was well overcooked. My daughter ordered the Hanger Steak, also well over done and chewy. Definitely not prime and my son order Raviolli stuffed with Prosciutto. Not tender at all. As for dessert, we had the Pear Torte with I think it was a Sorbet and a Chocolate Cake. Anyway, they were both fabulous. We gobbled them down. As for the tab, I think it was way over on price for what we ordered, Csme close to $300.00, including tip. BTW, we did order three glasses of wine. If the price was $100.00 cheaper, maybe will go back. Very disappointed with main courses. Have had similar dishes that were well prepared and tasted better. Maybe, it was a off night...??? Oh, well.
author: J G.

description:
the menu understates the deliciousness of the half roasted chicken entree.

current description:  "Roasted Fulton Valley chicken with Yukon gold mashed potatoes and royal trumpet mushrooms"

appropriate description:  "Succulent, half roasted chicken from Heaven.  Favorite dish of GOD."

ok, i'm not a religious person, but if there is a heaven, this chicken is from there....as are the accompanying mashed potatoes.  WOW.
author: Tabatha Y.

description:
I cannot believe that this place has garnered such postiive reviews.  I have rarely had such a horrible dining experience as I had on Saturday night at Delfina.  From the nauseating mirrors, to the hypocritical owners, to the offensive waitress, to the mediocre food, and finally to overpriced wine list, I was pissed off for the entire time I was here.

Let's start out with why I was even here.  I had heard great things about Delfina, and my girlfriend, sweetheart that she is, decided to surprise me for my birthday with reservations.  Delfina almost ruined my birthday.  It was saved by Bourbon and Branch, but that's for another review.  

As soon as we sat down, I picked up a small pamphlet on the table.  It was from the owners, and it explained that they supported universal health care.  It went on to explain that rather than raise prices to pay for their employees' health care, they were adding $1.25 to every bill PER PERSON!  This means you are raising prices!  You don't want your profits cut into.  You tried to seem all San Franciso touchy feely by stating you support such a great cause, but you are really a hypocritical bastard because you are forcing me to pay for it because you cannot manage your finances and costs.  Most San Francisco people hate the corporate demon, but I'll take the corporate wags over the hypocrites from Delfina anyday because at least they're honest.

Next up on the Delfina's crap parade was our waitress.  I don't like to be touched by strangers.  She spent the entire night rubbing, touching, and feeling.  I should have had the balls to tell her to stop and that her behavior was totally inappropriate.  I did not.  My girlfriend offered several times to switch seats with me, but I decided to play the martyr instead.  Probably so I could complain later.  I had already made up my mind to never return to Delfina because of her, but that was before my food ever arrived.  You would think that my very noticeable flinches would have given her a clue that I WANTED HER TO STOP, but she was as stupid as she was inappropriate.

Now to the food.  Mediocre...at best.  I say mediocre because of the bread.  The bread was good.  Nothing else came close.  The portions were pathetically small considering the prices.  The calamari appetizer came with three pieces of squid.  Boo hiss.  The chicory salad was just bad.  There were very limited choices for someone like me who does not eat meat.  In fact the entire menu was limited.  I like some choices when I go out to eat.  Pasta Pomodoro has more options than Delfina.  I guess the chef does not have much imagination or ability.  The bucatini with Monterey sardines lacked something...actually several things.  When a menu states sardines in the plural, I expect several sardines.  There was a small portion of maybe half a sardine ground up in the bucatini.  I don't like menus that outright lie.  As for the bucatini, could you spare a little?  If I am going to be served a child's portion, please let me know and charge me for a child's portion.  I was not satisfied in the least.  By the time we got home, I was hungry again.  This should never happen at an Italian restaurant.  Although I am hard pressed to call Delfina an Italian restaurant.  It is more in line with the fraud that is A-16.

The wine list was horrendously overpriced.  There were very few selections in a reasonable price range.  Most bottles were well into the $75 and over category.  We sampled a couple of the less expensive bottles, and they sucked!  For the ridiculous mark up the hypocritical owners were charging, they could have easily erased the $1.25 they were adding to the bill.

Back in Jersey we have a word for the owners and proprietors for Delfina.  We call them gavones.  This translates as loser and fake Italian.  It is rare that I encounter a restaurant that makes me want to actively campaign against it.  Delfina is such a place.  Totally ruined my birthday.  My girlfriend deserves her money back.
author: Chris I.

description: Yum.  Too dang expensive for me to go as much as I would like, but yum.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
I'm really upset by my experience here, there was so much potential for an amazing meal, but our waiter ruined it.

Let me start off by saying the food was, hands down, 5 stars. I had the duck sugo, and let me tell you, I didn't know duck could taste like that! It was incredible. My dad and I also shared the gulf shrimp, which were amazing as well. 

Sadly, the service here was worth less than 1 star. I took my dad here for fathers day, and though we had a reservation and arrived right on time, we had to wait for 15 minutes. Completely understandable, considering its an extremely popular and tiny restaurant. We sit, the waiter takes our order about 10 minutes later, and the meal is off to a good start! We get our appetizers and enjoy them, the buss boy takes them away, and then we wait. We waited for literally an hour between when our appetizers were taken and our entrees came out. In the meantime, two tables sit on either side of us, and they not only get their food before us, though they arrived 15 minutes later, but they ordered the same thing as us! Our waiter during this whole thing is nowhere to be seen. At one point, the hostess or manager came over and apologized for the wait, which was nice, though the waiter should have taken care of that himself. If it had stopped there, I would have given this place 4 stars because the food really was spectacular. But WHILE we are waiting for our food, and the table next to us is enjoying theirs, the waiter comes by with a few side dishes for them that were "a gift from the kitchen". WTF?!?! We wait an hour for our food, and yet the people next to us who enjoyed prompt and attentive service get a gift from the kitchen??

We got our food, scarfed it down since we were starving by this point, and then the waiter finally reappears to take our dessert order. I politely told him we'd pass (come on, bi-rite is across the street!) and he had the nerve to try and hock some dessert that I already told him we didn't want. That was the last time I saw our waiter, the buss boy gave us our check and change. 

I was so disappointed in my experience here. I would come back because the food was so darn good had the waiter/manager been more apologetic or tried to rectify the situation. Obviously they knew they had fucked up but don't care enough about their customers to make it right.
author: Em G.

description: This place was really disappointing. I really don't understand why this ever got a good review, and I've had this same conversation with several people. The portions are stingy and overpriced. The chicken is far too salty, and the service is mediocre.  There are so many better restaurants to spend your money and get way more.
author: hafsa m.

description: The food at Delfina's is delicious.  Their daily menus always intrigues me and never disappoints...actually I have left wanting bigger portions.  For their price it wouldn't hurt to give a bigger portion vs. a presentation portion but from a taste scale, they're the hottest Italian restaurant in the SF area.
author: LIVE to E.

description: Really, I'd give this place 3.5 stars but because of their excellent service, they get an extra star. So last weekend we came here for my dad's bday. I didnt know that they changed menus everyday? So the day I came it was actually very difficult to find something i actually enjoyed. I ordered some type of linguine pasta and it wasn't that good. On the other hand my mom ordered the cod (i think, or maybe some other type of fish) and it was delicious! She was nice enough to trade so I ended up eating the fish instead. I brought cake and they told me they'd keep it in the back for me, on top of that they brought it out with candles and sliced the cake for us! Excellent service....the food was just okay, but maybe I'd come again some other time and try their pizzas next door. Ended up with a $200 tab, which is pretty cheap for a party of 5. Oh and my mother was allergic to their salads bc they weren't aware of her allergies and gave us a free salad. Very good management.
author: Colette P.

description:
i almost feel like giving delfina 5 stars is practically redundant, but i had such a phenomenal experience and meal there last night that i had to sing my praises. i'd dined at delfina twice prior to this experience, and had already deemed it one of my favorite restaurants in sf. my experience last night was just a confirmation of that!

i met a friend there around 8:15 thursday night and he'd already put our name down on the list, so we decided to have a drink at the bar while we were waiting. i tried a white from the friulli region of italy, but the name is escaping me! it was light and not too sweet, but still with some fruit undertones (almost like melon or tropical fruit). the overall effect of the flavor was like a sauvignon blanc but it had the smoothness of a chardonnay.

after waiting about 20 minutes, a spot opened up at the counter (the one that bisects the restaurant, in the main room). we decided to take it and immediately after sitting down, we were furnished with delicious rustic bread, sweet butter, and some cured olives.

as we peered into the menu, i wanted to order each and every thing on it! after much debate and deliberation, we decided to start with the "little gem lettuce with parmigiano frico and lemon-anchovy vinaigrette." it was kind of a take on flavors from a ceasar salad, but far more sophisticated. the parmigiano frico is a parmesean crisp, and the sweetness and nuttiness of the fresh parmesean exploded in my mouth.

the waitress asked if we wanted to split everything, so she had each and every dish brought out into two mini-sized portions. great touch, i have to say.

next, we had the pappardelle and lamb sugo with black-eyed peas. this dish was excellent. it perfectly complemented the barbera i was drinking. the sauce (sugo) was perfect: not too thick, not too rich, full of morsels of lamb, and tasted beautiful with the acids in my wine.

next was a huge surprise: our waitress brought out 2 half portions of their other pastas --the pasta alla chitarra with fresh fava beans and house-cured guanciale, and wild nettle ravioli with bellwether ricotta and walnuts. at first i was like, oh sorry, we didn't order these, and the waitress just said "it's a gift from the kitchen!"

how awesome is that?!?!?!?! the ravioli was to-die-for. the flavors were all fantastic. they were lightly dressed in a brown butter and sage sauce, which went beautifully with the flavors of nettle, ricotta, and walnuts. the ricotta filling was also redolent of fresh lemon, so this dish had almost an ethereal light quality to it. very heavenly, indeed!

the pasta alla chitarra was an interesting dish. in italian, a chitarra is a guitar, but also describes a special machine for cutting pasta. the pasta had a fantastic texture, almost square shaped on the sides rather than round. for my tastes, i found this dish too salty, probably because of the guanciale. guanciale, for those of you that don't know, is a cured (not smoked) bacon used similarly to pancetta. it's actually taken from the pork cheeks/jowls rather than the belly. it has a lovely, light flavor but provides a significant amount of salt to the dish. the fava beans paired beautifully with the surrounding flavors.

we were bordering on stuffed at this point, but then our california white sea bass with artichokes and potatoes sott'olio arrived with a contorni (side) of broccoli rabe with garlic and chiles ... and we immediately forgot how full we were! everything was delectable. it was like the food kept getting better and better! the fish was sweet and tender, perfectly cooked -- not overdone at all. the artichokes were crisp and fresh, just lightly cooked to complement the fish. the broccoli rabe, which i usually don't care for, was fantastic. it's amazing how a vegetable prepared well is amazingly delicious. broccoli rabe, which is the in cruciferous family, tends to share that same bitterness with broccoli, brussels sprouts, cauliflower, etc. it was just perfectly sauteed with garlic, olive oil, and pepperoncini (pepper flakes) and had a sweet, fresh taste to it. no soggy greens here!

for dessert, we indulged in the bittersweet scharffen berger chocolate cake with crme anglais. i'm one of those people that i when i see that kind of dessert on the menu, i absolutely cannot resist. it was very good, simple but delicious. the warm bittersweet chocolate and the cool creme anglais are like heaven on the tongue.

the wait staff here is fantastic; down-to-earth but extremely knowledgeable and professional. you feel well taken care of -- every whim and desire will be met and surpassed!

delfina, you have done it again... i am a slave to your incredible food! thank you for such a wonderful meal!!!!
author: Jill M.

description: Couldn't have had a better night than the one I just had at Delfina! A bustling and nicely lit dining room with great music and a friendly staff = one great place to spend a few hours drinking great wine and eating scrumptious food with someone you enjoy. The food was fantastic -- the Roasted Fulton Valley Chicken was simply prepared, yet amazingly flavorful. Our desserts were happily devoured despite our being completely stuffed from the delicious warm olives, escarole salads and bread we started with. Don't miss the Scharffen Berger Chocolate Torta or the Lemon Verbena-Buttermilk Panna Cotta -- they were absolutely amazing!  The lovely Sarah Herring is an absolutely delightful and knowledgeable server who knows her menu and wine list.  Her suggestions were well paired and suited our vastly different palates perfectly. Yup, nothing about this place sucks!
author: Loretta G.

description: Very nice ambiente, a little bit more stylish and expensive than SF Italian average. Food is great!
author: Stephan M.

description: Took an old friend here.  We made reservations for 630 but we were running a bit late but they were A-OK with us coming in at 645.  The service was superb as many other described.  Our waiter kept checking in on us to make sure everything was going great and it was!  We ordered: spaghetti,short ribs, ahi, and cauliflower soup and all ranged from being good to excellent.  My personal favorite was the spaghetti.  All in all it cost about $92 after tip.  The staff was excellent and getting to catch up with a good friend was definitely worth the $92 :]
author: Daniel J.

description:
I am upgrading my review because this is a heavenly place for food.  Seriously.  Not sure where Cyn was.......Read my other reviews if you don't believe that I am a (self indulgent) foodie and know my stuff!

There were four of us and we started with the Grilled calamari (still the best ever---I take back what I said about the beans in my first review), fresh-cured anchovies (not over-pickled; we were told they only spend 8 minutes in vinegar), and the sardines.  The sardines had a strong flavor for me, but my companions who actually enjoy oily fish loved them.  The anchovies were out of this world for me...perfect in flavor with just a mild vinegar bite.  We all had the porcini  mushroom salad next...oh my gosh these fresh local mushrooms simply melted like butter in our mouths and the dandelion greens were perfect...not bitter.  I can't say too much.  Then we had trofie with pesto, prosciutto-mascarpone ravioli, a risotto special with fresh summer squash, and the chicken, which came with the olive oil mashed potatoes.  These potatoes are just delicious, as was the chicken itself...very moist.  The ravioli was as perfect a pasta dish as you could ever hope for....pure ambrosia.  Nothing less--perfect 10.  The risotto was pronounced magnificent (I am not a squash fan).  The pesto dish was fresh and delicious but could have used a touch of salt (hey, SOMETHING had to be wrong!).

The profiteroles with coffee gelato and the chocolate cake with olive oil ice cream were just fabulous and shared easily.  Normally we would forgo dessert but as everything was so darn perfect we just had to see if they had the whole game.  And they do.  

Don't ever let anyone ever tell you this isn't a delicious restaurant.  And the service?  So friendly and down to earth when they have so much to be snooty about!
author: Thelma Lee G.

description: We were lucky to get a reservation on the same day we called. I live in Tokyo now, but came back to the Bay Area to check on our house. This restaurant reminded me of why we settled in the Bay Area. Everything we ordered in this restaurant was top notch. The price was also reasonable for this level of quality. I had the steak. My wife had the chicken. They were soooo good. It's a lively place, so even if your significant other is shy and quiet, there won't be any silent awkward moments. Go early to find parking!
author: Pachirisu P.

description:
Nom-tastic!

This is really a 4.5 rating. After years of hearing all the hype surrounding Delfina, Sergio (bf) and I finally experienced it tonight. Loved the decor, chill but attentive wait staff & delicious, earthy food. We had:
Sardines - damn good! Seasoned & grilled to perfection. And they even grilled the lemon! 'Nuff said.
Spaghetti - wonderful kick to the sauce. Be sure to dip the bread. 
Roasted chicken - OMFG!!! Best roasted chicken I've ever had. Ever. Crispy, flavorful skin wrapped around moist, tender goodness.  Sergio kept taking bites of my chicken. He was blown away by the flavor as well. The mashed potatoes were good. Then again, when have you ever had bad mashed potatoes? I'm a sucker for trumpet mushrooms so they were thoroughly enjoyed. The serving was so generous that I had leftovers for the next day. Yay!
Pork spareribs - I was too zoned into my chicken that I never snagged a bite of Sergio's dish. Thankfully he spared one for my dogie bag. :) He seemed to really like the ribs.

Taking into account our overall experience at Delfina, I felt the price was quite reasonable.

Will surely come back for the formaggi tasting. Five cheeses for $16. I'm down.
author: Michelle G.

description:
I thought I would add my glowing review to the chorus of glowing reviews of this place, they just so deserve it (plus, so many reviews I've posted lately were negative, just needed to balance them out).  

Anyone who runs a restaurant in this town (or any town) should visit here often to pick up tips on how to do it so very well.  They are friendly without being too familiar, every person who works there greets you with a smile.  The entire staff seems like they are enjoying their jobs, without socializing with each other (as you see so often at the "trendy/casual" restaurants here).  The food is just top notch, not a bad bite in the place.  They are willing to bend over backwards for you if they happen to run out of something (they were out of two of their fish dishes by the time we were ordering the night of the truffle meal, and they offered us a side of fries with an extra order of truffle on the house because of it).  I've been here a handful of times and have never had an even remotely bad experience.  The restaurant is spotless, well-managed (obviously) and incredibly tasty.  I would go here much more often, if it wasn't so popular that you have to plan ahead to get a table.  

Thanks for doing what you do, Delfina.  Please keep it up.
author: Cami B.

description: My dad took me here while I was in town, which is awesome cause my broke self could never afford some of the crazy prices on my own.  The sardines were super salty but good; just wish I had known they were going to be breaded and pan fried (I believe the menu said grilled).  I had a salad which was just a salad and we split the pasta with bass, which was pretty darn tasty though it was hard to find any fish on the plate.  The real star, however, the one that made the check worth its weight, was the chicken.  I know, I was skeptical that chicken would be anything special, but it was swimming in the most delicious broth that has ever gone in my mouth and was so tender it practically melted upon impact with my tongue.  Servers on the ball and super helpful as well!
author: Alicia B.

description: We went here to celebrate a birthday and were VERY happy we did.  Every dish we ordered was "blow your mind" amazing using authentic Italian ingredients.  The service was good and they offer a great selection of Italian wines, which was refreshing since a lot of restaurants only carry California wines.  Ever since we visited Delfina, we've been making their perfect spaghetti at home and loving it.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Ben R.

description:
best mashed potatoes i've ever had IN MY LIFE.

i kid u not.
author: Josie M.

description:
Delfina is the place to go for a wonderful dinner in an simple but elegant setting.  A great place to take anyone you want to impress with your city savvy.  
The only down side is the service.  It can cross over the line from crisp and professional to snooty.  The servers, mostly young hipsters, know their craft but have been known to play favorites (with tables/types of customers, that is).
Still, the food is soooo good.  The pastas are every bit as good as you expect but the surprise is how wonderful the red meats are.  I had a short rib entree that was the best I have ever tasted.
Plan to spend some and enjoy a lot.
author: Anna C.

description: Was so looking forward to eating here for my bday after finally getting a res that wasn't at 5:30pm or 9:30pm.  The food's good in general and service great but a couple of things really disappointed me.  The first was the spaghetti that I read so many great things about.  It was undercooked!  I was expecting al dente but  it was beyond al dente.  Second disappointment was the skatewing which was way too salty.  But b/f's roasted chicken was dee-lish.  I'll give Delfina another shot but won't go out of my way for it.
author: Jeannie C.

description: Great atmosphere for a night out with the gals or a place tucked away for a nice romantic dinner.  The french fries are to die for!  Rosemary and Basil...ooooh wee I would go back for just that!  The pasta and chicken were good too!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
This is more of a 3.5 star place.  Who should go here:   Anyone looking for a fun/popular place to dine with very good atmosphere and good food.  California Cuisine meets Italy.  Delfina is worth visiting if you live in the city and for you out of towners a great place if you want to tread off the beaten path from your normally Little Italy/Union Square spots.
 
1 Star - Lacking/Turn Off
2 Stars - Needs Work, But fixable
3 Stars - Adequate
4 Stars - Near perfect, rough edge here or there
5 Stars - Can't get much Better
 
Atmosphere/Ambience:  3.5 to 4 stars.  If hip and fun were all that matters here Delfina would get 4 to 5 stars in this category.  The vibe is always great, you will likely never have a dead or boring dinner here.  However, to me the place lacks a little bit of elegance/sophistication that I find at some  4/5 star places.  It is a little cramped and tables are tight, so be prepared to share with the table next to you (actually not really that bad).  Noise level is high but acceptable.
 
Service: 3 stars.  I really liked our waitress here, but I feel the service is lacking the innovative extras you get at some restaurants.  I did expect a bit more from Delfina, which is why I am knocking them a star here.  I wanted them to know more about the food and wines on the menu.  Their comment when I asked about a dish was always "Oh, its really good".  Well thanks that helps.  Wine knowledge goes even less deep.  Luckily the food is good enough that you will like most dishes.  Service is NOT bad, nor were they rude, in fact they were super nice and didn't let anything slip.  I just found there to be tiny holes, that could make the experience here more enjoyable. 
 
Food: 4 stars.  Delfina has been turning out awesome fare for several years now.  I am happy to say they have not slipped an inch here.  There is some good innovation in several of their dishes, and I love how they take traditional Italian cuisine and merry it with the best of California cuisine (fresh local ingredients, lighter cooking styles, etc).  Last time I dined there I had the beef crudo (steak Tartar) and the mint pasta with chanterelles.  The app was OK, I have had much better Italian versions of this dish.  I would recommend maybe choosing a different option from the starters.  The mint pasta with mushrooms was delicious, and highly recommend it if you are a vegetarian pasta eater, for you meat lovers this might not completely satisfy you.  Also tried the quail, which was very good, and probably the best of the dishes that night.  This night at Delfina didn't really match my tastes but I could still really appreciate the quality, fresh ingredients, innovation/style, and flavors.
 
Wine: 2 stars.  For a restaurant that focuses on Italian and is very well known and is considered by many to be a classic restaurant in the city, it just blows me away how sub par the wine list is.  One page?  No focus on regions?  Give me a break.  I was hoping to get a brunello and was blown away they only had 2 options and one year, 2000, the worst in about a decade.  Come on guys.  Please call A16, Incanto, or Acquerello for some help with your Italian list.  If you want some exciting Italian wine, bring your own.  Btw, nothing really exciting on the by the glass list either.  This really puts me in a downer about this place.  They can fix though, and I look forward to this positive development.
 
Overall:  3.5 stars.  A fun, hip place that serves up some of the freshest Italian food in the city.  Always exciting and always a good time.  A must visit for residents of the city and visitors alike.  Ciao
author: Scott P.

description:
wow.... after all these years, delfina is still on top!
recent visit items of mention:  salt cod manteca (sp?) & tripe florentine!  skip the japanese turnips... bleah.  other than that, everything here is solid!
author: lulu p.

description:
after trying to come here for ages, i finally made it here last night!  my friend and i booked reservations weeks ago and were only able to get a monday night reservation.  we each got there early and were seated before our 8 pm reservation, which was nice.

we shared the spaghetti w/ plum tomatoes, the dungeness crab salad, the whole wheat pasta w/ cauliflower, breadcrumbs, and parmessan, and the brussel sprouts w/ pancetta.  this was the perfect portion, b/c we were left full but not stuffed.  the pasta was very al dente, which i like.  i thought the cauliflower pasta was actually a bit too salty, but other than that, everything was pretty good.
author: Helen T.

description:
sweet lord, have you been here?

fantastic. wonderful. incredible. and thats just the service. never had a more relaxingly knowledgable server than here. she simply whisked through everything as if she had grown up in little delfina's kitchen, but was in no way condescending. loved it. also, love a back porch. also, love the wine list.

the food, of course, is heavenly. elegant, simple, and filling. mind-blowing combinations that seem so effortless and yet so thoughtful, which is really the whole feeling of this wonderful place. as if being fabulous was what they were always meant for.

well go on girl.
author: shaine h.

description: Running a close second to my auntie Nora's Pork Chops - Delfina quite simply has a tasty Pork cut.  The fresh pasta my best friend ordered was pretty damn good too.  Judging by the previous reviews here...I guess I'm not reporting any shockers.  Something that did stand out though was the wait staff.  Everyone there seemed to really enjoy interacting with the diners...even the ones that were waiting patiently in line OUTSIDE the door on this cold night.  Good quirky fun I guess.  That's always a welcomed experience.
author: Derik P.
