author: David F.

description: I recently attempted to make reservations at this highly reccommended restaurant for 7 people.  Answer=we only take reservations for 6.  Okay, well we will make reservations for a party of 5 and a party of 2.  Reservations done.  Next, we show up, "oh yeah you can't sit near each other, you might disturb the other customers by talking over the isle," is what we were told by the hostess.  Does this person know us, uhhh no.  She has no idea that we are a group of professionals that frequent nicer places to dine than this establishment, and we know how to act at the dinner table. The waitress, Beth, who actually deserves 5 stars for her beyond excellent service, was willing to accommodate all 7 of us at the table with plenty of room for 7 guests.  However, the snooty hostess had to intervene and continued to quickly fill all of the smaller tables around us so that our party was literally as far apart as we could be in the place.  Okay, deep breath time.  Now for the food.  I would give this around 4 stars.  Not stellar, but definately good.  They forgot one of our main entrees so we had to wait for a while for everyone to get their food. They did fess up and comp the forgotten entree and threw in one free pana cotta for all 5 us to share. Whooo,hooo.
author: Sara H.

description: Dinner was quality, the price reasonable.  Somehow, they made tripe stew taste good, which is a possibility my narrow, Menudo-fearing mind hadn't previously considered.
author: James N.

description: I absolutely love Delfina! I first went to Delfina with my friend Celeste for Valentine's Day a few years ago, and we both were instantly enamored. All the food I've ever had has been fantastic (seriously, it's wonderful!), and the venue (including the patio) is very nice, even though it is always super-crowded. Also, remember to make reservations--especially for weekends--at least a week in advance because the restaurant fills up quickly!
author: Sherri H.

description: tasty food, very good service but menu is limited ( esp. dessert!)
author: aj s.

description: Favorite place, worth getting the reservation for a month in advance.  They do it right here, very professional, they don't over book, and timing is usually perfect.  If not, they know when they screw up, and will make amends without you saying anything.  BTW they do have highchairs . . . so it does work for some kids.
author: B C.

description: Ok I thought I give this place a second chance.  I went again 8/20/08 Wednesday evening and had the Tuna.  Why do people rave about this place?  It was mediocre Wednesday night just like my last visit about 3 weeks ago.  I can't see paying high prices for over-rated, mediocre "Italian" (yeah Italian my but).  I don't think people who go and drop $$$ at places like this would know good Italian if it hit them in the face.  But then I guess if you are dropping $150 bucks you are not going to admit the food is BAD or just "OK"
author: Unemployed A.

description: Book a reservation about 5 weeks in advance (if you want to dine at a decent time- not like 10PM), arrive about an hour before to find parking, glide past the mob waiting outside the adjacent Pizzeria Delfina, and you're in for a real treat.  Very true to the authentic Italian roots, but garnished with a taste of California.  Everything is hearty yet refreshingly light.  No overpowering garlic or olive oil, like some touristy spot in North Beach.  You can feel the heart the chefs put into the dishes, and although executed in a subtle manner, there is also intricate sophistication as if every ingredient and cooking process was calculated with fine craftsmanship.  Service was nice (but not super- professional like you'd receive at giants like Chez Panisse), wine list is considerate of people drinking by- the-glass, dessert was superb, but the decor was more in the lines of Burlingame- not Mission-ish hip.
author: Passdatanqueray M.

description:
For years I've been trying to get into Delfina, but reservations were always unavailable. One upside of the down economy?  Call, and they have a reservation for you just about anytime you want.  

But first the pet peeve, which I'm going to put into every Yelp review of a SF restaurant that does this.  Delfina, like a number of other places, puts a service charge of $1.50 per person.  I am all for their employees receiving health care, and support the law that made it mandatory.  I do not support politcal statements on my bill, and I cannot understand why they don't just raise the price of an entry by a buck (or better yet, just accept it, after all, entrees are at the $25-$35 range there, and our meal for 2 was $200).  It is insulting to have  a $200 bill for a meal and to be told that it wasn't enough..that an extra $3 is required for health care.  The only reason I can see for the management to put this on the bill separately is to try to make the customer think the law should be changed.  Hey, it doesn't work...just makes me angry at the management.  I hope other Yelpers will join in on expressing our displeasure at this, and hopefully restaurants will notice and stop doing this.

Now, about the food.  It was worth the wait.  We went for a celebration dinner (27th anniversary), and the food is very very good. We shared an appetizer of grilled fresh Monterey bay sardines...perfectly salty and seasoned, grilled just right...a bit fishy, but exactly the right kind of fishiness for this dish.  I followed with the chicken with trumpet mushrooms, with a side of mashed potatoes (which I'd guess were mashed with olive oil and were terrific), and my partner got the quail, with a polenta accompaniment that was perfectly matched, and also perfect prepared as well.  The food was abundant, there was no room for dessert.  

I liked the decor generally, though I had thought it was more sedate and romantic that it was. It is noisy and crowded, and I wouldn't recommend it if your goal is to whisper sweet nothings to your dining partner, which after all these years I still like to do.

Definitely go for the food, if not the conversation.
author: b f.

description: Sooo not impressed last night.  Service - bad.  Sat at bar in main dining room, small space, plates needed to be cleared quickly and they'd sit there forever.  food was average.  dessert was good.  this was my third and last time at delfina.  first time was about 8-10 months ago.  great service, great food.  second time was about 4 months ago - it was ok but i gave it another chance last night and was not impressed!
author: my two cents x.

description: Very, very expensive, but very, very good.  You'rll have to wait a while without a reservation, but this was the best meal I've had all year.  I had spaghetti and an endive salad which were both excellent.  They have an Italian rouche wine that is to die for--not sure what it's called, but it has a picture of a man with grapes on his head.
author: Donna F.

description: this is a great restaurant to take your special someone. food are extraordinary combine with a great atmosphere. i only been in here once, i sat at the patio at the back end of the restaurant it was very cozy. excellent service from a knowledgeable staff. i will come here again....can't wait!!!!
author: romel n.

description: Best non-white-tablecloth (think Gary Danko, etc.) restaurant in the city.
author: kate h.

description: Delfina is one of my all time favorite restaurants anywhere!  I love the owners and the staff, they're all fantastic.  The worst thing I ever had at Delfina was simply very good.  I'm bummed when I order something at Delfina that is simply very good, because most everything there is conversation stopping oooh-ahhh de-licious!!!!  I love you Delfina!!!!!!!!!
author: eiming j.

description: I've been to Delfina a few times now and each time it was absolutely fantastic. I can remember the steak most vividly... juicy, tender, and absolutely tasty! The restaurant itself is a little bit loud, but more than makes up for it in the food.
author: Avid E.

description: Been coming here for seven years or so. They were always friendly when I picked up takeout in my pajamas. Always liked the girl power vibe. The food is great and the wine list is fantastic. Hard to find a good Italian wine list anywhere, much less a staff that knows how to guide you through it. Delfina always delivers.
author: Jonathan B.

description: I made the mistake of going during the Gay Pride parade. Be sure to check the San Francisco newspaper for disturbances going on in the area. Who would have thought this could happen in a district called "Mission." Be sure to not bring your family then unless you don't mind getting flashed while you're eating. I was so disgusted that I wanted to vomit. The food was Meh. I've had better much better. I don't even remember what I ordered. Won't be going back.
author: Cheryl N.

description: Just had dinner here and it was excellent!  The mint tagliatelle with porcini mushrooms was great.  The broccoli rabe with garlic was good.  The chocolate budino with cherries was especially delicious!  Nice wine list.  Next I want to try the duck.  I wonder if they ever do any rabbit specials...?
author: Jan N.

description: Went on a Monday night -- absolutely packed, that says it's still living up to its hype after all these years. Our group of four started with the warm olives -- we liked them so much, we asked for more. My husband opted for the heirloom tomatoes with pane bucato -- it was divine. Just as good and fresh, I had the Insalata di campo. My entree -- the hanger steak and french fries was tasty, but not earth shattering. The desserts were mmmm, great -- the peach sbriciolato with housemade mascarpone and warm Scharffen Berger chocolate torta. Staff very friendly and unpretentious. Yes, it's loud and cramped -- but it's a SF neighborhood joint, it's part of the ambiance!
author: kelly m.

description: One of my all time favorites.  Unbeatable combination of elegant food, great decor and casual, but yet, high level service.  In my opinion, this is the type of restaurant that makes SF the special place it is.
author: sfnewyorker Y.

description: We were able to get a seat at the counter as a walk-in last night.  It was a great way to end a rainy day.  Everything is always great at Delfina, but I especially enjoy the fresh pasta.  Last night was no exception.  I had the pappardelle with duck sugo -- simply fantastic.
author: Brad W.

description: I just don't see it, why people rave about this place. It has a nice ambiance but it's way overpriced for the food you are getting.
author: Sebastian I.

description: was recommended to go here by many people and was disappointed with the pizza. Not worth the cab ride from the marina.....little star is better.
author: seth k.

description:
I have to take issue with the super lame commentary about "well paid americans"  working front of the house while the kitchen is 100% latino. As a former employee and current patron ( as often as I can get there), I know for a fact that that is a misrepresentation of Delfina. The implication in the last review is that the kitchen is composed of Latino immigrants without culinary skill. #1 A job in the kitchen at Delfina is a highly coveted job. Only extremely competent, educated, and experienced workers survive in that kitchen. #2 If there were  latinos perhaps one could see past their own ignorance and think that perhaps someone other than a white person could be competent and educated. You see a latino  person and immediately assume immigrant. Not just immigrant but victimized immigrant. How lame and self-righteous-San Francisco-transplant-ish of you. 
P.S. Delfina line cooks are some of the best taken care of in the biz. Benefits, a decent wage ( by line cooks standards) and the front of the house tips the kitchen out every night. 
Delfina Rocks. I've been to some of the best restaurants in the Bay and I still think its one of the best bangs for your buck out there.
author: s b.

description: Just ok. Food was kinda bland, not bad but not great and somewhat salty as mentioned by another reviewer. Service was ok, for some reason the mashed potatoes were brought out separate from the chicken about 5 minutes later, the same thing happened to the group next to us as well. Why? Who knows... The setting is nice, but it is extremely loud and can be quite difficult to hear the person sitting across from you, due to the fact that you are sitting table to table (at least when you are against the wall like us). The main problem with this place, is it filled with yuppies who have come to the mission. You just know things are off when you eat in the mission and the place is almost comletely white.
author: k b.

description: First time, shame on them, second time, shame on me.  I have tried Delfina twice, with the second experience being even more insulting than the first.  The first experience was as a walk-in, counter-sitting, customer.  I attributed our lack of service to our placement in the restaurant.  The food was good enough, so I thought I would give it a second try sitting at a "proper" table.  I booked our reservations over three weeks in advance, so we wouldn't have to eat at 10pm.  We were seated quite promptly upon our arrival, but then waited 25 TIMED MINUTES before anyone approached us for ANYTHING.  No water, or any other beverages, for that matter, bread, or even a head nod as acknowledgement from our server.  As we sat there deciding if we were going to stay, we realized the  popular couple seated next to us were the owners of the place!  We have so many other options for excellent food in SF, why spend too much money on a place where the OWNERS don't even care about their customer service?
author: Stefanie C.

description: i've been to delfina a few times and most of the time i love the food.   it really is comparable to the food i had in florence.  once we ordered olives and they were really really salty.  really salty.  another time we had pork shoulder or pork butt or something but it was amazing.  a couple of nights ago i had some type of pasta that starts with an f- and it was really tasty.
author: Mary R.

description: after all these years, delfina is still one of the top restaurants in san francisco. the casual atmosphere, reasonable prices, and delectable fare keep the seats filled night after night. the steak and french fries are truly top shelf.
author: Stephen D.

description: What happened Delphina?!  This was my second time to the restaurant; the first was magical and the roasted chicken delicious.  My husband and his out of town friend went again and had a fantastic meal.  However, the third time was the true test.  We went on an early Sunday night and were given a small table next to the bar.  No complaints there, but then the problems started.  The starter olives didn't arrive until the appetizers came.  When the main courses (roasted chicken and hawaiian ahi tuna) arrived, the sides to both the chicken and tuna were cold.  When my husband send the tuna back and asked if the sides could be made hot, it returned luke warm, but with less of the pan sauce.  (Needless to say, my meal got cold waiting for his to arrive the second time so we could eat together.) The manager/owner told him he could have more sauce, but what she brought was COLD sauce.  The chicken was a bit rubbery this time and the garlic mashed potatoes were also cold.  The manager never came back to ask if things were better.  When the waiter came to ask how we were enjoying our meal, we told him the problems, but he obviously didn't want to hear it and that was the last we saw of him until he practically threw the check at us.  In the meantime I could hear the head chef screaming for "runners" as the food wasn't being picked up.  At $85 for two with no wine or liquor, this restaurant could do much better on all counts.
author: Nicholette M.

description: came here on a sunday night w/ the bf for our REALLY belated valentine's day dinner.  we had been given a pretty hefty gift certificate a few years back to come here, but just was never able to find the time to come since it's not really in our neck of the woods.  so silly me, i tried to make reservations for v-day like a week in advance and they were booked like 3 weeks away for a reasonable time for dinner.  made our reservation for 7:30 on a sunday night.  didn't expect the place to be so packed even on a sunday.  we arrived at around 7:00 and were promptly seated.  i was pleasantly surprised that we didn't have to wait to be seated.  the hostess was very nice (she even said "welcome to delfina" when we arrived).  our server was very friendly.  we ordered the calamari and carpaccio salad for our appetizers.  for our main dishes i ordered the lamb while the bf had the steak.  the calamari was really tasty but it was a little on the salty side.  i liked the carpaccio salad, but the bf didn't like it so much since he kept saying that the slices of beef were really tendon-y.  i was actually a little disappointed with my lamb dish b/c it was made with what looked like black beans and when i went to taste it, it tasted like a chinese dish that was made with black beans.  =( bf didn't really like his steak, so he ended up eating most of my lamb, although he did finish the pommes frites that came w/ his steak.  since the bf didn't like his steak, i ended up eating that for my main course and didn't bother to finish my lamb.  for dessert we decided to share the profiteroles w/ coffee ice cream, chocolate sauce, and toasted almonds.  i'm really big on desserts, so this definitely made me feel a little better about the meal.  overall, the meal wasn't bad, but i've had better at other places.  the service was good, but somehow, i was left a little disappointed even after we had our dessert.
author: Jeannie W.
